Summary: We stayed for 2 nights. The hotel is very nice and in a great location. Very easy to walk around the marina and all the lovely little shops. It‚Äôs also close to some good restaurants and take away food shops and a good bottle shop. The breakfast was very good with lots of variety and the staff very helpful. Our room was at the back and it was very quiet and we slept well. We didn‚Äôt have to pay for parking as we are BW members so that was great.

Very curtious staff at the front desk and in the breakfast room. Hotel was clean and located within walking distance to the beach & DP Trolley stop. We were also able to easily walk to places to eat. Plenty of parking, which was appreciated. Looking forward to our next stay.

We were two couples staying there and needed a little meeting area that evening. I asked if they had a public are that would work and they bent over backwards to accommodate us by setting up a little area in the breakfast room, which was perfect for our needs. Everyone that works there is SOOOO nice! Reminds me of the old days when people in the hospitality industry were actually hospitable. We will return , for sure.

Cute little hotel with a convenient location. Close to a few restaurants and the harbor. Older hotel with a view of the ocean. We chose this hotel because it had 2 beds plus a pull out couch. We needed the space for 5. It was exactly what we needed.

Summary Heading: nice location...enjoy everything except NO WiFi
Summary: ok just checked in today. Overall enjoying facility. Will update on breakfast after tomorrow. Our ONE COMPLAINT, the internet is not working. We cannot login to the hotel WiFi with the password we were giving on either one of our iPhones or my MacBook Pro. I brought my iphone to the lady at front desk and she finally got my iphone to log in. But for rest of the afternoon and evening my wife's iphone and my laptop would not log in. Not really a big deal for us but if having reliable WiFi is a big deal for you then this is not the place to stay. It's just a little irritating. We usually like to watch a movie in the evening using my laptop and HDMI cable connected to the hotel TV but that won't be possible here. We like the location and front desk was friendly and our room (large
Room tip: We might stay here again as long as we don't need wifi. They need to fix that so you can easily...

Summary: This was my first time traveling with my dog and staying in a hotel. The check-in clerks were very helpful and kind. I was impressed with the positive attitude the staff has towards pets. My room was clean and the bed was comfortable. This hotel is located on PCH and is within walking distance to the beach and several nice restaurants.

This is a wonderful location and rooms were alright.Refrigerator had a freezer section which was fabulous! Bathroom is a little tight but adequate. Staff are excellent and very accommodating. The best part for me is the pet friendly policy. There is Lantern Bay Park nearby for walks.  Only thing that was lacking was the ability to charge devices near the bed so one can charge and use at the same time.

Summary Heading: Great hotel Great location Great staff
Summary: Very excellent service as a BW rewards member. Staff was helpful, friendly and had a great sense of humor. Rooms were in great shape, clean and comfortable. Hotel in great location near the beach.   Small breakfast room may be crowded if busy. No smoking on the balconies.

I had a great stay at the Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel. The front desk personnel exceeded expectations. The bed and pillows were comfortable and the room was clean. You also cant beat a free breakfast! Highly recommend.

This hotel is in a great location off of Pacific Coast Highway. The hotel is very clean and the room I was in was large and upgraded. The staff was friendly from check-in to check-out. The bed was really comfortable and had 6 pillows. Staying at this hotel in Dana Point is a great value for your money and the rooms are nicer than many other hotels in the area.

Summary Heading: Spacious rooms, great location, and delicious breakfast service!
Summary: Stayed for 3 nights! Had a positive experience, cannot thank the staff enough for everything they do! The breakfast spread included vegan and gluten free options which is rare to see in hotel breakfasts.

Christina and Erin were the best!!! All the staff were pleasant and helpful. They were very good at engaging when I asked them questions and they all put me right ease! I would definitely stay here again.

The hotel is very clean and beautiful. It is walking distance to Dana Point and the beach. The rooms are updated and clean, with the bathroom having a jacuzzi tub and tv.  The staff is very courteous and helpful. The breakfast crew is friendly, the room spotless and food is typical food along with a hands free pancake maker.  We had one small issue with booking online, arriving at the incorrect hotel and giving a bit of wrong information.  Once we were on the phone with BW Marina Shores, they worked quickly to resolve the issue by always looking for the solution.

Summary Heading: A reasonable place to stay in Dana Point
Summary: There are a lot of options in Dana Point, but this is a reasonable place to stay.  Clean room, nice parking, nice breakfast, five minutes driving from the Harbour (not easy walking)  Useful coin laundry but expensive (well is... is California)

Summary Heading: Amazingly good quality for reasonable cost
Summary: We were visiting family in Laguna Beach and of course could not find lodging (even for HIGH pricing). Dana Point had the best choices nearby, I'm sure glad we chose this. Super friendly staff, GREAT breakfast, clean, well take care of. Less than $1000 for 4 days in a busy time of year. Glad we found it.

Summary Heading: Escape the Heat Wave-traveling with a dog
Summary: So Cal was hit with a major heat wave. To escape the heat a couple of days we decided to go to a beach City.  This hotel had great air conditioning (not all hotels in the area did). They also had an elevator for our elderly dog that can't climb stairs well (not all hotels in the area did). They had free charging for our electric car! Rooms were clean and comfortable.  The pool felt good.  Walking distance to the beach, a park with great views, restaurants and ice cream.  This hotel worked great for our escape

This hotel is very clean, from the lobby, to the hallways, right into our room!  My boyfriend and I went for a few days for my birthday over Labor Day weekend.  From the start, I was dealing with Christine at the front desk, she is awesome and so friendly.  She was helpful with all my questions.  I had asked her advice to a nice restaurant in the area, she recommended the Chart House up on the hill over looking Dana Point Harbor, she even made the reservations for us.  When we got seated and handed our menus, I noticed both our menus said "Happy Birthday Michelle" I knew se had let the restaurant know it was my birthday, such a nice surprise!  The dining area was clean, the breakfast was wonderful.  The kitchen staff was also so friendly and they too went out of their way to say

Summary Heading: One of the most fantastic places I have ever stayed it is clean the staff is helpful they‚Äôre friendly breakfast great
Summary: I highly recommend staying here if you‚Äôre anywhere near Dana point it is very clean and the staff are very helpful breakfast was great!!! I am planning another trip next month and I literally go to Southern California at least once a month because my daughter lives near there I have stayed many places in that area this is my best experience all year I will definitely be back even if I‚Äôm going somewhere else anywhere near there I‚Äôm staying at this hotel if at all possible
Manager Response: Hi Chaun!  Thank you so much for the absolutely stellar review and you have no idea how inspiring something like this for the staff of the hotel.  Our crew works so hard to take care of the property AND our guests.  It's comments like yours that reminds us all that what we do is much more than just a job.  Welcome to the Marina Shores family and we look forward to serving you on your return trips!

Summary: Hotel is in a good location, close to harbor, food and drinks. Breakfast was good with plenty of choices, staff was friendly and accommodating. Room was not ready at check in time but we were compensated for the delay. All in all a good hotel experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words and your understanding for the short delay at check-in.

Summary: Just got married and checked in for one night. Thank god just one. Staff wouldn‚Äôt give us a late checkout even though we were EXHAUSTED beyond compare. They gave us 30 extra minutes and as we pulled our bags into the hallway after rushed showers and frantic packing, we heard the room phone ring. My husband answered and it was them kicking us out. Poorly run and managed. Elevator barely works, if you have bags you can‚Äôt carry up 3 flights of stairs you have to go upstairs first to check in to get a key to use their elevator from ground level. Ridiculous service and staff couldn‚Äôt have cared less that we just got married and were exhausted. Not one congrats and not any sympathy for the state we were in. My voice was hoarse and we were kind to staff. Disappointed. You can stay
Manager Response: Please accept my deepest apologies if anyone on our staff came across as uncaring.  I urge you to contact me directly at the hotel so I can apologize to you personally.  The issue of the late check-out was completely out of our control.  We are sold out almost every day during the summer so early check-in and late check-out requests can rarely be honored.  For the other issues, I would again like to speak to you personally so please call when you are back from your honeymoon.  I do offer my sincerest congratulations on your getting married and am truly sorry that your time here put a scar on that memory.

Summary: A super place to visit with several places to dine within walking distance. The breakfast staff was fun and welcoming. We enjoy walking over to the beach and picking up litter before it washes out to sea. Everyone needs a hobby!

The location of the hotel is great since it is close to the beach and we were there for a family reunion at the beach. Upon checking in they didn't have our rooms ready and once we did check in they had a pipe burst so there was no running water for the first few hours of our stay.

We live outside of Vegas and both work in casinos. Normally when we want to get away we head down to one of the major casinos in Vegas.  The end of May was Electric Daisy Carnival which is an insane time in our area.   When my husband got home from work at 10 PM, he asked where I wanted to go. I said I wanted water and either to a lake in Utah or a beach in California. He said let's go to California.   I hoped on bringfido.com to figure out who was pet friendly and also had pet rooms available that night.  I then called and talked to Maddie and asked a few questions. All rooms are pet friendly.   Because I work in  reservations,  I know that you often have to pay the night before to be guaranteed the room before the guaranteed check in time.   We knew we wouldn't be arriving

I was attending a conference at the Marriott and the rooms there were out of my price range. I found this place right around the corner. It's actually fine. Very clean, excellent staff, super friendly, every morning there's a hot breakfast with lots of changing fresh options.   My room was a suite with a jetted tub that I enjoyed. It's a really nice spot. My only two complaints are that they put me in a room waaaaaaaaaay at the end of a long outdoor hallway. Very, very far. I don't think the place was filled to capacity as I barely saw any guests. So I'm not sure why I was in this remote room. Also, as a single woman traveling alone, I did not appreciate having to take this very long walk down an empty hallway. Nothing ever happened but I didn't feel completely at ease with the

The Hotel is right next to PCH 1 Hwy can be loud with vehicles constantly passing by early in the evening. But overall it was a good experience. Hotel is Nearby fast food restaurant. Clean Hotel & Friendly staff!

We wanted to celebrate my son being promoted to high school.  We always enjoy going to the beach but have never stayed at a hotel.  Your hotel was pet friendly and had all the amenities we were looking for.

Summary Heading: Totally worth it and enjoyed to the max
Summary: Pleasantly surprised at the roominess of the guest room and plentiful of towels. (Some hotels are getting very cheap, although we are careful about use of towels anyway.)  As well as the breakfast service, the room amenities showed ‚Äúcare‚Äù.  Enjoyed the whirlpool very much. Thank you for having those nice rooms and for the affordable prices!  Made us feel ‚Äúrich‚Äù - hahaha!  Breakfast bar choices and quality were very decent. Egg white patties and gluten free cereals were among the standard items also.  Apples wrapped in plastic wrap, and paper bags provided showed care. The breakfast staff were very attentive and hard working!   Definitely recommend to our friends and definitely coming back to stay again!

I have stayed in hotels around Dana Point my whole life and my mom and I think this is a hidden gem! Affordable, clean and great location! Kind staff and easy access to everything we love, it was a great Mother‚Äôs Day weekend!

Always like having the extra room with a living area and separate bedroom, but this was far from a good nights sleep.  The balcony faces the road which is very loud if you are a light sleeper and the walls are thin enough you can hear your neighbors.  Looks like they are in the process of a remodel, which might be a good thing if some things are addressed such as room comfort.  However, the sofa in the living area and the bed were both too soft and worn.  The bedroom has an extremely small amount of counter space.  Lighting in both rooms is not sufficient for reading.    On the positive, the room was clean and all outdoor area spaces were also well maintained.  The breakfast was sufficient and the lone employee assigned to that area was very pleasant and hard working.  All front

Super close to tons of restaurants and even a grocery store. Pretty good size fridge in the room. Super clean bed was comfortable. Great size room. Breakfast was good lots of good options to choose from.

Really pleasant and nice place to stay.   Close to the California Wine Festival Dana Point.    The overall friendliness and welcoming atmosphere was very comfortable.  The cleanliness of all the areas was nice.  The gym was a bit shabby, but ok to work with.   Over-all great location and reasonably priced, especially for members of the rewards club.
Manager Response: We appreciate your kind words and hope you had a wonderful time the Wine Festival.  Remember us next year!

Summary Heading: Outstanding bedside manor and condition of property
Summary: My entire experience was excellent and all began with my encounter with  Najely. She went out of her way to accomodate me by making sure that my upcoming stay would be rememorable and seemless. My wife always says, that "it's not what you say but rather, how you say it" and let me tell you Najely sold this property to me over the phone. Najely was courteous, professional, and very intuitive when it comes to feeling a person out. I've had many travel and hotel experiences (more good than bad); however, this one tops them all. in that, it sets a presidence for all upcoming stays. Thank you Najely and Marina Shores Hotel. Best always, Dr. Luke
Manager Response: Hi Dr. Luke!  You made Najely's day with this review ... we printed out a big copy and put it in the back office for everyone to see!  While it's always our goal to make everyone's stay memorable, there is nothing like having a guest take the time out from their busy day to recognize our efforts - whether it's the whole team or one, very special employee.  We are thrilled you enjoyed your experience and hope you come see us again soon.

Summary: Good location, but that does not make up for the shortcomings. Lousy, poor breakfast with no outside sitting area. Rude and unhelpful staff at the front desk. However, cleaning and maintenance staff were friendly. Hotel completely without charm and character, would never stay here again and do not recommend.
Manager Response: I'm truly sorry that you were not satisfied with the hotel, the breakfast and the staff.  The free breakfast will always be a challenge for hotels like ours that don't have a restaurant on site.  We do rotate the menu every day so guests don't have to eat the same thing every day, but I understand that the variety and quality are still limited.  If you would like to contact me directly at the hotel to let me know what happened with our front desk staff, I would welcome the opportunity to speak with you.  If you read through the reviews, one of the comments that always comes up is how friendly and helpful we are, so to read about your experience is very distressing.  Please feel free to contact me at your convenience.  In the meantime, please accept my sincerest apologies if you were slighted in any way.

Summary: Had the most wonderful stay! Eva at the front desk was fantastic. She was informative, professional, and courteous. Eva called to let me know when I could check-in to the room and I got a little goodie bag for being a rewards member! She also checked in to ensure we‚Äôre enjoying our stay - so thoughtful. When we requested more towels, Eva made sure we had fresh towels when we returned from the beach. The king suite was very nice and the beds were the most comfortable we have ever slept in at a hotel. Great location in Dana Point with restaurants across the street. The breakfast at the hotel was a huge bonus. There was hot options that changed every morning. The staff was constantly restocking the items and very welcoming. Highly recommend!

The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly, but I felt like $200 a night was high for what was an average hotel room - nothing wrong with it, but nothing special about it. Would likely have chosen a cheaper option elsewhere if we weren‚Äôt staying with a wedding group. If we had paid closer to the $120 - $150 range I‚Äôd have 0 complaints!

Super welcoming and helpful staff. Great location and Fairmont level service at a Best Western.   As a returning customer I was not disappointed in the least during my 8 night stay and I will definitely be returning again this year.

I have not stayed at a Best Western in years. Pleasantly surprised, would stay again. Excellent value for this area of California. Clean hotel, professional staff. Would recommend to others. I‚Äôm a business traveler

Great staff! Clean facility! Great value! Definitely, would stay again! The reason I gave a 4 star on sleep quality was due to the mattress being too soft and the room due to the water in the shower was not very hot.

We live close by in South Orange County and ended up staying in Dana Point for the weekend. We stayed at a nearby hotel in the marina on the first night that wasn‚Äôt very high quality but had an amazing view. Picked this hotel because of the jacuzzi tub knowing full well our view would be of the street below.   Check in was a bit annoying. Although the mask mandate has ended in California, this particular hotel has decided to still enforce mask wearing in common areas. When I asked why masks were still required, an employee didn‚Äôt seem to know although she was handing me a mask while wearing hers below her nose and at times below her chin. Which I don‚Äôt blame her at all. The employee next to her said it was the owners preference and seemed annoyed that I asked. So that was the

This is an older hotel that still has older furnishings.  The bed was comfortable, but it sloped to one side.  The room was well lit, with a large mini-fridge with freezer.  The bathroom was tiny, with a low toilet and almost no counter space, but good lighting.  The showerhead was good.  The sink backed up.  Breakfast was decent but uninspiring with processed hot items.  This hotel did not meet the usual standards of a Best Western Plus.

My husband & I will definitely stay here again for our weekend visit. Great location: it's close to restaurants & a walk to the beach. Balcony withh a small view. Friendly staff. Clean & tidy room!!!!

The Jacuzzi tub is amazing big enough for a tall athletic couple 6‚Äô3& 5‚Äô10. It‚Äôs  definitely the perfect get away for a couple for the cost . It‚Äôs located near the heart of Dana point with many local restaurants around. I recommend Lupes, great drinks and food.

Spent one night here but wished we could stay longer. The rooms are clean and modern, the hotel staff very pleasant and the location is very walkable. I know it's not on the harbor but its so very close and it's certainly a quick stroll to the harbor or to restaurants. I highly recommend this lovely property when staying in Dana Point. And the prices were reasonable and they accept dogs!!

Summary Heading: Great Experience in South Orange County
Summary: This hotel is perfect for the person who plans to explore South Orange county.  It is near the Dana Point harbor and 10 minutes from Old town San Juan Capistrano. It isn't fancy, but it is clean and very well maintained.  We like it so much that this was our 3rd visit in a 6-month period.  We were convenient to Mission Viejo, Laguna Beach, Irvine and San Clemente.  We consider this Best Western a wonderful discovery.

Summary Heading: Rude front desk and breakfast crews.
Summary: The hotel is OK the staff is horrible Clean ladies were fine but everybody else was extremely rude. They tried to charge me for a mask even though it stated they had free masks available.  My daughter only forgot her mask not as if we dint wear then and the front desk treated her like she forgot her mask just to upset them . Will never stay here again if any Bestwestern.
Manager Response: Mr. Cotrell,  Since you were unwilling to accept my apology when I responded to your Best Western survey, I don't expect to fare any better here.  Yes, we do offer one free mask to each guest who doesn't have one.  We do this as a courtesy because many travelers are from out of state and are unaware of California's indoor masking mandate.  Once we give them the mask, it is the  guest's responsibility to remember to wear it.  Again, if any staff member came across as rude, I am sincerely sorry.  While we need to be firm in supporting the mandate, I understand that enforcement can sometimes come across as heavy handed and I regret that we gave you that impression.

Summary: I have stayed here once before and find it is an excellent location close to restaurants, stores and the marina. Staff is always friendly and welcoming and they have a nice variety of food at breakfast.

We stayed for 2 days in this hotel and it was really nice! The staff was so friendly and the room was very clean. And recently remodeled. The view of the ocean was amazing! No need for the balcony room for the ocean view. The breakfast was delightful üòã

The room was amazing the Jacuzzi tub has a tv of its own so you can relax to your favorite movie the bed was extremely comfortable once your in it your going to fall straight to sleep highly recommend

Location is perfect for getting around Dana Point. The parking situation was fantastic. Easy in and out.  Check in was easy. The staff was a little indifferent but maybe the nature of the day.  They did give. Me a welcome pack of goodies and water.   Room size is nice. There is a cold refrigerator waiting for beverages . The beds were made - clean and tight. Mattress was 7 out of 10. This is where the good part of the review ends.   The room was moldy smelling. The bathroom was 1 out of 10 as far as being new. The jetted tub had rings ‚Äúuse‚Äù around the tub. A temp fix cover on the pump jet cover. There were holes in the drywall by the vanity countertop. Yuck.   I called down to find out why my room was not cleaned - not beds redone, just trash and towels - ‚ÄúsomeTimes they miss

Nice, clean , large rooms, comfortable bed,Great soaking Jacuzzi tub.  Overall fantastic location with walking proximity to Beach. Hot breakfast .The hotel is situated off a main road so some road traffic can be heard.

Great area to hang out and enjoy the marina sights. Hotel is clean and staff are great. Wife loves the Jacuzzi tub in our room. Lots of restaurants to choose from and all serve delicious food. Walking along the Marina is really nice.

This was the only hotel that would accommodate me and my four small dogs as we traveled in California. So happy to have found this place. Everyone was so amazing. Manager and staff is just wonderful and super friendly. Room was clean and spacious and the breakfast was so pleasant including their breakfast attendants! Loved the tub, bed was a little rough on my back though. Other than that, it was a great trip and so happy to have stayed. :-)

Summary Heading: Wonderful Staff and Location, Dated Property
Summary: The staff at this hotel are amazing! Friendly, helpful, kind...just the best! The property is located walking distance to Dana Point Harbor, and across the street from some great restaurants (Try Stacks for breakfast, and VIBE for juices/smoothies and Carmelitas for authentic tacos!). There is self parking for $10/night, and a modest breakfast included in your stay. Unfortunately, the rooms needs some upgrades. They have jacuzzi tubs/shower combos, which require using steps in and out of the tub. Difficult and dangerous/slippery. Beds are very comfortable, but the rooms need updating.

Our hotel stay was very enjoyable. All the employees were very courteous, friendly and helpful. Walking distance to beach and restaurants. We stayed in a suite and it was clean and beds were comfortable.

A great location, reasonable rates, and excellent service across the board -- employees at the front desk, housekeeping, and in food service said hi, asked how they could help, and thanked me,  Parking also was very convenient and reasonably priced.  The rooms are a little dated, but the bed was comfortable.

Manager yelled every time to put mask on as every guest walked throughout the hotel.  Even followed me to my room.  When I took my mask off and said I‚Äôm going in my room, the manager pushed the door open as I was closing it to tell me he would kick me out if I continued to not put my mask up after every drink of coffee.  Worst experience ever at a hotel!   Other guests were also complaining about how rude the manager was about masks.  Keep in mind the entire city, restaurants across the street etc and the festival we were at didn‚Äôt require masks. Most of us were vaccinated and in a crowd of 1000 people without masks daily for the same event. Just 4 days prior I stayed at the best western inn by the sea and it was great and not one guest had a mask on.  The manager was super nice
Manager Response: As I previously stated to you, I am sorry that you didn't agree with our policy that masks have to be worn in the public areas of the hotel.  We arrived at this decision in order to protect ALL our guests and staff members.  Had you not repeatedly ignored our requests to put a mask on and not created a scene in front of other customers who respected our efforts and concern, your dealings with management would not have been as unpleasant.  The majority of the folks who stay at the Marina Shores appreciate everything we do to protect their health and safety with regards to Covid-19 and the variants that have been developing.  I'm glad you found another hotel that was more to your liking.

Summary: Myself and two friends booked the hotel site unseen. I had passed through Dana Point on the Amtrak a few years ago but other than that none of us had been there or knew anything about it. We initially had booked 4 nights but called in advance with questions and after being helped by Zack on the front desk, who was very helpful, we booked a 5th night and made a new booking for another future visit.  Upon arrival check in was a breeze, our suite was nice, and included a jacuzzi tub and a balcony with a great view. The hotel itself is super conveniently located with the beach, harbor, restaurants, shops and bars all within a short walking distance.  Our most pleasant surprise was at breakfast when we were greeted by Barbi  our Breakfast Hostess. Barbi was an absolute ROCKSTAR who

Our rooms were nice and clean. Check in was quick and easy. Breakfast was the highlight of the stay. They had an awesome variety. I had eggs, potatoes, ham, cinnamon toast crunch, apple juice, water, coffee and grabbed a chocolate muffin to go for later. The staff was very friendly. Everything was great!

My friend and I needed a dog friendly hotel to stay in while in town on a whale watching excursion.  This hotel was very nice for both people and pets.  The staff was friendly and efficient and quickly answered all our questions.  The breakfast and coffee was really good,  We would stay here again.

Very comfortable, and clean establishment.  Safety protocols were in place and we felt very safe in this hotel.  The employees were friendly and professional.  The breakfast was good and the lady working in the breakfast area was a kind and friendly as one could ever hope for.  She went out of her way to make sure everyone was comfortable and got what they wanted.  She wanted us to have a good experience.  The location was right on the Pacific Coast Hiway so there was a little road noise, but not bade enough to affect our stay.  The parking is a little tricky due to the poles in the parking lot, but nothing to cause problems if one is careful.  We had a great stay.

The conference was at another hotel, I was concerned about the parking it did not seem enough. I never had a problem with parking. Loved the black out curtains! Jacuzzi tub was the best, water got hot quickly, never had to wait for the water to get to temperature.

Summary Heading: Great Value in a Beautiful Area
Summary: The Best Western Plus Marina Shores is an excellent option when staying in Dana Point. You‚Äôre close to everything, and the rooms are fantastic. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The whole place is clean and well managed. There‚Äôs really nothing I can complain about. The balconies off many of the rooms provide a decent place to relax and take in a view. They even had a tower fan for use in the bedroom, which I appreciated. I like the white noise it provides in addition to the greater temperature control power. You can tell the people who manage this particular Best Western take pride in their property and they (and their staff) really care that you have a good experience. We will be staying again when we travel to the area.

Incredible value for such an enjoyable stay. It's obvious all the staff and management have made it a point to make every guest feel welcomed and appreciated! From the time I made my reservations via phone and spoke to "Clayton" to our quick and easy check out, I was so impressed by the staff's friendly and professional service! Our rooms were so clean and comfortable, so my compliments to the cleaning staff as well.  I also want to compliment the manager of this hotel because it isnt easy to make guests adhere to Covid-19 protocol, but the care that they took to make all guests feel safe and comfortable during our stay, was very, very appreciated. I highly recommend this hotel for a family stay, and would love to return for a visit in the future!

The price was right for a great stay in Dana Point.  The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the spa tub was fantastic. Due to COVID, I wasn't thrilled with the scheduling of maid services, but I understand the necessity of the contactless cleaning.  I'd definitely stay at this location again!

Great location for Dana Point.  We even made use of the pool - not exactly heated but good on a warm day. Delicious breakfast - I expected packaged goods but lots to choose from including little cheese omelets and sausages!

Summary Heading: One of the few establishments in the OC actually following CDC guidelines, thank goodness.
Summary: We aren‚Äôt sure why so many establishments and people in the OC choose to ignore CDC guidelines when it comes to slowing the spread of Covid‚Ä¶ not sure if they‚Äôre just stupid, overly entitled, or trying to make some sort of a political statement‚Ä¶ But, it is extremely hard to find any place that is actually looking out for their customers and employees safety. Thankfully, this hotel was one of those few establishments that actually took it to guests and employees safety seriously. They were quick to enforce mask wearing in public areas, and they were steadfast when it came to sanitizing rooms and common touch point surfaces. We felt much safer in this establishment then we did going out pretty much anywhere else in the OC. The hotel itself is pretty old, and looks like it‚Äôs in need

Summary Heading: Do not book this hotel. Zach ruined a good stay
Summary: This imbecile threatened to call the police when I asked why the rate was triple the reservation rate I selected when I reserved online. 314 instead of the 172 shown on the site. Do not approach Zach about this bait and switch. He is a garrulous person who should not be working with the public.
Manager Response: Dear "Fishgrip":  We apologize for your discontent with your visit to the Marina Shores Hotel.  The entire negative experience revolved around your misunderstanding of the room rates for your visit.  Your original reservation was a Sunday arrival for one night.  You then contacted the hotel to change the arrival date to the preceding Thursday for three nights, which brought in the seasonal weekend rates for Friday and Saturday.  The revised confirmation we emailed to you for your extended reservation included the price breakdown for each day; and finally, the registration documents you signed upon check in showed the daily rates for the room.  We encourage all guests to carefully review these documents when they book a room.  We believe that had you read any of these documents, the entire confrontation between you and our front desk associate probably never would have happened.  There was absolutely no ‚Äúbait and switch‚Äù as you claim.  Our front desk clerk, Zach, tried to explain all this to you, but you were not interested in hearing.  We regret that you responded inappropriately towards Zach with slurs and threats of physical violence, leaving the hotel staff with no alternative than to offer to call the police for resolution.  Multiple witnesses saw and heard the exchange.  We do not tolerate slurs or threats by any guest against any staff member.  In spite of your inappropriate behavior, and to Zach‚Äôs credit, he allowed you to get breakfast for yourself and your wife and we're happy that the situation resolved without actually requiring intervention by the police.  I suggest that you would be happier staying at some other hotel in town the next time you visit Dana Point.

Summary Heading: Can't go wrong at this Best Western
Summary: This is a lovely hotel in a wonderful location.  Close to the Dana Point marina and a quick drive to San Juan Capistrano and San Clemente.  A perfect spot to be centrally located to all the delights of southern Ornage County.

The hotel room was clean and the staff was friendly. The free breakfast was decent! I would stay again. It's close to Doheny State Beach. My AC worked great. Parking was easy. The room was spacious. No traffic sounds to bother us!

Didn't have a very good experience, but Peter (GM) made things right in the end.  He was pleasant to deal with and made sure I was happy in the long run.   Location was great - just around the block from the marina with tons of good food in the area.

This hotel is less then a mile from Doheny State beach. The hotel staff are very nice and professional.  They just started serving hot breakfast and the hotel is Covid compliant.  My room was clean and the bed very comfortable.  I did request a room away from PCH, based on previous reviews, and my room was quiet.

We enjoyed our stay. The hotel and room were clean. Check- in was not the smoothest, but I'm thinking some of the housekeeping help were out sick? We had to wait until 7pm to check in. Close to the beach and parks and Carmelita's Taqueria across the street was delicious.

My husband and I had just stayed at a well known hotel just down the street for a work retreat and we decided to stay one more night on our own. We weren't completely satisfied with the hotel we stayed in for work but checked out there rates anyways and the room we had was $150 more than the room we had at the Best Western. At the Best Western we had a cleaner room, with breakfast, and a better rate still right in the middle of city not to mention walking distance from the beach. I would defiantly stay there again.

Hotel is in a good location. It's close to the harbor and restaurants and the hotel is kept clean. The staff from the front desk, house cleaning and maintenance when they see you walking down the hallway they say  Hi how are you. They all get a thumbs üëçup especially Amanda. You guys are great.

Easy walking to a variety of eateries (Thai food was yummy) and Doheny Beach Park. Don't be afraid to walk up the steep residential street to see a spectacular view from the trail starting at the park on top.

We were very satisfied with the entire experience here. Many restaurants within walking distance. Bev-Mo down the street and the harbor minutes away. Room was large with whirlpool bath. Friendly and helpful staff who knew the area.

Summary Heading: I would never stay here again
Summary: A real dungeon, terrible lobby,parking so tight like a shoebox,unfriendly check in,lots of traffic noise,bathroom has a step up into tub/shower(dangerous) rooms are dark,breakfast a joke -did not partake-had to ask for clean towels on and on  Location is good but sits on PCH lots of traffic.
Manager Response: Thank you for your open and honest comments at the Marina Shores and I am truly sorry if you felt slighted by our staff in anyway.  We are still under the breakfast restrictions implemented by the State of California which is why the menu is so limited.  Because we normally offer a self-serve buffet style, the restrictions are more strict that what you are seeing in regular restaurants.

Summary: Dated hotel.  Hotel is for people with dogs.  Our room smelled like DOG.  They change our room but it still had an odor.  Thank God we could open the balcony door for air.  They did not have any rooms where pets were not allowed.  We have stayed at hotels that had separate rooms where pets were not allowed. If you have allergies and don't like pet smells than find another place.  If you have a handicapped there are only very high bathtubs with showers.  My husband could not use the shower.   They use the excuse they must let service animals in rooms so they can't keep rooms without pets.  Staff was friendly.  They should take out carpeting if they are going to just have pet rooms.  Area was convenient.

Summary Heading: Manager Discriminates Against Female Rape Victims. Not Safe For Women.
Summary: The manager of this property made sure to treat me with the worst amount of respect.  When I pleaded with him to be kind, because I was a rape victim and he was causing me anxiety, he proceeded to treat me worse. It was absolutely appalling. When I reported it to Best Western, the manager.. who is short and male, lied about the situation entirely, and assumed NO blame. The owner decided to take his word for it, and did not even reach out to see what happened.  This manager makes this hotel UNSAFE FOR WOMEN AND GIRLS.
Manager Response: Dear Katherine,  You are entitled to your opinion, but for the sake of the other readers, we simply told you that you needed to wear a mask while in the public areas of the hotel, in accordance with the current Covid laws for the State of California.  There was no "blame" to be assumed, no one from the staff raised there voice to you - which was confirmed with other guests as well as staff members.  While we are very sympathetic to your past traumas and had no wish to add to them, nothing on our part was disrespectful or injurious to you.  The safety of our guests is of utmost importance to us and the accusations that you have made here - and on other websites - are completely unfounded.

Summary: This was the worst experience.  The staff is not friendly, the rooms are old and out dated, no safe in the room so carry your valuables everywhere and do not try the breakfast burrito.  It's a microwaved frozen kind and it's soggy.  We went to McDonald's across the street.
Manager Response: Dear Mary,  As I stated in our other correspondence, we did everything in our power to meet the demands of the group, even those that we were unaware of until the guests arrived.  Not everyone can check in early because we need time for the check-out guests to vacate and for our housekeeping staff to clean and disinfect the rooms.  I understand that some of your guests became agitated because they were expecting considerations that we simply do not offer.  Sometimes "I'm sorry, but that isn't available here" is the honest answer and not the result of a staff not caring or being rude.  While we don't offer a high end amenity like in room safes, we do have safe deposit boxes for our guests to use.  It's my understanding that you wanted to lock up an iPad, which was too big for the box.

Summary: Nice room with jetted tub, 2nd tv by tub, 10-15 minute walk to beach, great price and kind staff. Parking was good, breakfast was the only thing not all that great, but it's because of covid! We had a good experience!
Manager Response: Hi Grecy!  Thank you for the wonderful review and I'm glad we gave you an experience to remember.  I apologize for the limited offerings of our Covid-mandated Grab & Go breakfast, but hopefully the State restrictions will be lifted next month and we can get back to the full, hot breakfast buffet that everyone enjoys.

Summary Heading: Best Western Plus Marina Shores Inn-Dana Point Ca
Summary: This is a nice hotel to stay in if you are in the area.  The pros: easy to get to, the staff is very accommodating and friendly.  It is pet friendly, they offer a continental breakfast, the rooms are clean, and the King Suite with the wet bar is nice. The balcony that we had was ok, only one chair, there was a partial view of the ocean, close to multiple eating venues and the beach.  The cons: $10.00 a day for parking, the bed was a little too soft for us.   Overall for the price other than paying for parking, I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.
Manager Response: Hi Cyndi!  Thank you for the review ... and just a reminder to all readers, if you are Best Western Rewards Diamond or Platinum member, parking is free!

Summary: BW + Marina Shores was a perfect location for my needs. Near friends. Just a few minutes from the harbor and baby beach. Staff was nice. Bed was comfy. Room was clean. Breakfast was very average. They were booked solid so room wasn't ready at check in time, but they upgraded and had me in a room in a short time. All and all a good stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and rating.  Glad we were able to take exceptional care of you to get you into the upgraded room.

Summary: Hotel is clean and staff fabulous. The room was very nice, the only oddity was the shower. It was up a high step to step into the jacuzzi tub. I was so happy to find this hotel that was so affordable to celebrate our anniversary. Small charge for parking.  Across the street from Dana Point Beach and several restaurants.  Great location!
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review and the high rating.  It's wonderful to know that even while we're all dealing with the restrictions and stresses associated with the pandemic, our staff can still deliver the service you come to expect.  Yes, there is a bit of a "step up" to get into our jetted tubs.  As you may have noticed, they're deeper than the standard bathtub and since we couldn't drop them below the floor, the only way to go was up (smiling)!  Come see us again soon!

Summary: The staff at this hotel were exceptional. It was a close walk to the beach but located in a very busy street where the was some traffic noise. There was several places to eat within waking distance. Beds were comfortable and it had free breakfast.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your experience at the Marina Shores.  While there are quite a few restaurants within walking distance, there are actually over 50 restaurants within a mile of the hotel.  We're glad you enjoyed your stay.  Come back again so we can earn that fifth star!

Summary Heading: $150 assurance charge and being charged Double.
Summary: When I reserved a night, the total that was said was $141. I arrived at the hotel and they had a $150 holding fee that I was not told of. Now, my card has been charged double and I am out $430. I was told by the hotel I wouldn‚Äôt get anything back till Monday and I stayed at the hotel on a Wednesday night.
Manager Response: Please accept my apologies for the inconvenience of having the extra funds on your credit card being withheld.  It is unfortunate that almost all hotels have had to adopt the policy of pre-authorizing credit cards for anywhere from $100 - $200 extra to try and protect themselves from damages, theft or in room smoking violations caused by guests.  Although these issues are infrequent, they are very costly to hotels.  As far as when the authorization hold is put back in your account - that all depends on the bank or credit card company.  We release the hold as soon as you check out.  It seems that most of the time, cardholders see the funds back in their account within 72 hours, but we advise people that it could be up to five days, just to be safe.    Car rental companies have used this security authorization policy for years.  Hotels usually only placed an additional hold of $20 - $50 for incidentals, but as the industry has seen the trend to more damage from guests, we had to increase the amount.  I am truly sorry that a few inconsiderate customers has created this headache for the rest.  Peter Callan, General Manager

Summary: My dog loved the balcony and being able to look out. Close to a nice walking path that my dog and I enjoyed. Clean and comfortable, with close proximity to the harbor. I will definitely stay here in the future.
Manager Response: Hi Nika!  Sorry for the late response but I wanted to let you know how much we appreciated your kind review and we're glad you and your dog enjoyed your time with us.  The staff of the Marina Shores is proud to be one of the few pet friendly hotels in the Dana Point area and we are thrilled that we will be your hotel of choice on any return trips!  Peter Callan, General Manager

Summary Heading: Best Western was there for us
Summary: Due to plumbing issues we had to find a place to spend two nights, close to home and we have a dog.  How wonderful to find the Best Western in Dana Point.  Just what we needed and got a good nights sleep both nights.
Manager Response: Hi Jeb,  Please accept my apologies for the delay in responding to your review.  I hope all the plumbing problems at home got taken care of quickly and am glad we were able to provide you with all the accommodations you needed while the work was being done.  Maybe you can come visit us again under less stressful circumstances.  Peter Callan, General Manager

Summary: We were looking for just a nice local little break from the usual. Staff was very friendly and helpful, and the room was nice, and a great deal! Enjoyed our stay, and would stay again the next time we wanna a break from the norm

I booked the hotel thinking it was right across from the beach.  So I was disappointed when I arrived.  The view was McDonalds, Del Taco, and a new Starbucks.  I could see the ocean between two trees in the distance. The street was very close to the hotel as well. However, I didn't hear it much.  Ok, with my disappointment aside.  As I said, it was my fault, not theirs.  I should have done my research more. The rooms were very spacious and the beds were very nice as well.  The jetted tub was a surprise and great to use after a day of beaching.  The staff was very kind and helpful.  They are doing all they can with the Covid situation and Newson's orders.  If you do stay here, make sure you go to the Rib restaurant next to the hotel.  It was great.  Would I stay again?  Probably

Fort he price of this hotel, it was so worth it! Every room has a jetted tub, I got a room with a balcony, the living room is separate from the bedroom. We were able to walk 12 minutes to Dana Point harbor. The only things that could have been better were the beds, they were very very soft. And the check in time of 5pm wasn't that great but still worth all the amenities.
Manager Response: Hi Crystal!  Thank you for taking the time to post your review and share your opinions with other travelers.  We're happy you enjoyed all the little touches that go along with a stay at the Marina Shores although I'm sorry you found the beds too soft for your comfort.  This will always be a tough point for any hotel because personal preferences vary ... some travelers like the soft, pillow-top mattresses that you can just sink into after a long day, while others want the firm support in order to be comfortable.  I would also like to add that the odd check-in time of 5:00pm only came about because of the Coronavirus and all the extra cleaning protocols that were put in place to guarantee our guests' health and safety.  We are taking almost twice as long to service our rooms now, just to make certain that every nook and cranny is disinfected before renting to another guest.  We realize this can be a huge inconvenience, but we assure you that it is all because we want all our guests to check in feeling comfortable and safe during these difficult times.  Stay Safe and Stay Healthy!  Peter Callan, General Manager

Summary Heading: Best Western Marina Shores is Fabulous
Summary: Everything was fantastic, from the check in, to the size and cleanliness of our room, to the breakfast in the mornings.  Even with a pandemic, Best Western handled to breakfast wonderfully and Gabi, the breakfast assistant was awesome.
Manager Response: "Fabulous" and "Fantastic," all in the same review!  Who could ask for more?  We're happy you were so impressed with our service and cleanliness ... and I will be sure to pass your praises on to Gabi.  She IS an incredible member of our team!  Stay Safe and Stay Helathy!  Peter Callan, General Manager

Summary: Everything at this Best Western is clean and well run-I stayed for work, and it was easy to access and located near a decent shopping mall with restaurants, and grocery story nearby. And its location is ideal for the traveling tourist as well, with all of the popular tourist sightseeing beaches etc. as it sits right on the Pacific Coast Highway.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review and the five-star rating.  We're thrilled that you thought so much of your experience at the Marina Shores and hope you will have to chance to return ... maybe next time for a nice getaway instead of traveling for work.  Stay Safe and Stay Healthy!  Peter Callan, General Manager

Summary: This hotel is a convenient place to stay. It's pretty old and has a musty smell to it. The breakfast isn't worth the time to go pick it up. Gross packaged muffins and a granola bar. The hotel really should refund part of the price back to the customer. The staff is nice.
Manager Response: I appreciate the directness and candor in your review and can certainly understand your opinions.  Yes, the Marina Shores is not one of the newer buildings in Dana Point, but we like to think that's part of our charm and history.  Each time the hotel undergoes a renovation, the design people work hard to preserve our older period look with new furniture and fixtures.  The musty smell we get from time to time during the off season like this comes primarily from some of the rooms not being used as often as they are during the summer, but one of the other things we've noticed is that the special Covid-19 disinfectant we're using after guests check out seems to hang in the air longer with the doors and windows being closed ... if we left everything open, the rooms might smell fresher, but it would defeat the purpose of the disinfectant.  No excuses ... a noticeable odor is a noticeable odor.  We HAVE updated our housekeeping processes a bit to address this.  If a room sits vacant for more than two days after spraying, we are opening the windows and balcony doors to let some of the fresh air in.  Hopefully that will remedy the problem once and for all.  The breakfast too has been a victim of all the pandemic protocols.  We were forced to shut down our hot breakfast buffet months ago to be in compliance with the Board of Health directives - only food that comes in prepackaged containers can be served.  That's why we have such a limited menu.  I assure that we HAVE taken this into account with our room pricing ... our rates are much lower than they were last year at this time, mainly because we understand that any "savings" we experience due to the limits the CDC, the State of California and local ordinances place on the hotels needs to be passed on to our guests.   I appreciate all your comments and observations.  Hopefully, this reply has addressed some of them for you.  We hope you will continue to be our guest the next time you return to Dana Point.  In the meantime, Stay Safe and Stay Healthy!  Peter Callan, General Manager

Summary: Exceptional Hotel allow dogs first time travelling with ours.  Extremely clean and beautiful hotel.  Usually dog friendly do not look good in pictures this hotel was extremely clean, friendly wonderful shape .  5 stars
Manager Response: Hi Marnie!  We hope your four-legged family member enjoyed himself (herself?) too.  At the Marina Shores, we go the extra mile for all our guests traveling with pets, before they arrive and even after they leave.  We have special cleaning processes when a pet room guest checks out so the next guest is never even aware that a pet was the previous occupant.  That says alot about our housekeeping staff and the meticulous care they take with each and every room.  Stay Safe and Stay Healthy!  Peter Callan, General Manager

Summary: We had a suite room with two double beds and a pull out couch in a separate room. There were 5 of us so we all fit, though a little snug. The hotel did its best to provide the free breakfast through the COVID restrictions, everything was individually wrapped and handed out by a staff person. Our balcony overlooked the Pacific Coast Highway and you could see the ocean through the tree that were across the street. Overall very good value.
Manager Response: Hi Heather!  We are so happy that you enjoyed your time with us.  I also appreciate the graciousness you showed in understanding all the restrictions hotels are under due to the pandemic.  With the constantly evolving and changing rules put out by the CDC as well as the State and Local governments, it's sometimes difficult to keep up, but we're doing our best.  Stay Safe and Stay Healthy!  Peter Callan, General Manager

Summary: Best Western Marina Shores is in a great location in Dana Point; within walking distance to the beach and great restaurants.  More importantly, since it's Southern California you expect friendly people but the staff at Marina Shores go above and beyond.  They could not be more accommodating and will see to your every need.I highly recommend Marina Shores if you're traveling to the Dana Point area.
Manager Response: Thank you for the glowing review and I hope other travelers will take your advice if their journey brings them to our beautiful slice of the California coast.  As you saw, the staff of the Marina Shores lives and breathes our mantra of "may all who come as guests leave as friends."

Summary: We love this place and have stayed here numerous times. It's not a luxury hotel, but it is very clean, has a great staff, and is very close to the beach, great dining, and the freeway. The rooms are actually quite large and comfortable. looking forward to our next visit!
Manager Response: Hi Rob!  I think the greatest reward a hotel can receive is the loyalty of guests who come back time after time.  With so many options out there, just knowing that someone doesn't need to shop around for the next best deal speaks volumes about our efforts to provide the best in service and comfort.  Thank you for your kind words and we hope we continue to earn your high praises.

Summary: This place is great. Within walking distance to the beach, the staff is so friendly, breakfast is great even only being a minimum right now. The pool is open which is a plus considering most places are closed. The room was cute and very clean! They even have stickers on doors to let you know which rooms have been sanitized. Would def stay again!
Manager Response: Hi Bridgette!  We appreciate your recognizing all the extra things we're doing to help our guests feel a sense of normalcy in these trying times.  We have put many new protocols in place to help combat the virus, including the use of electrostatic disinfecting sprayers which kills any trace of Covid-19 in under four minutes.  We also seal the room doors (the stickers that you mentioned) once this treatment is completed to make sure no one on staff enters the room prior to renting.  I know alot of hotels have eliminated almost every service beyond renting rooms in order to save money, but we are constantly looking for a balance between intelligent precautions and providing our guests with the best value and experience possible.

Summary: Hotel could definitely use a facelift but the location, free breakfast and friendly staff made up for it. We especially appreciated having a frig and microwave in our room.  Finding a place where we could  bring our dog was important and the daily fee was much less than other hotels we researched. Not too many grassy areas though. Balcony was something we really wanted but barely used it. Too noisy with super busy traffic directly in front of hotel. Couldn‚Äôt sit and enjoy the view because the balcony wall was too high to see over when sitting. Walking distance to Doheny Beach was a big plus. Lots of places to eat close by.   Overall we enjoyed our 3 nights and would definitely go back.
Manager Response: Hi Debbie!  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at the Marina Shores with other travelers.  While the hotel maybe showing a few nicks and bruises, we go all out to keep her as clean as possible and I'm sure you noticed the over-the-top friendly service we show to everyone who passes through our doors.  Glad you plan on being a return guest.  We will work extra hard to earn a five-star rating from you the next time you come by.  Peter Callan, General Manager

Summary: My stay at this property was due to my free night that I earned through a Best Western promotion. I was very impressed, for not only did they honor the free night on a Friday night, but I was given a spa room. Great customer service and a great room for a romantic getaway. Property was very clean and seemed very safe.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review.  Best Western Rewards members are often our toughest critics (and rightfully so!) so when we get glowing comments like this, we KNOW we've done our best.  Glad you enjoyed your romantic getaway.  Come back and see us again!  Peter Callan, General Manager

Summary: This hotel has a perfect location to walk to the beach, walking trails, stores and many dining options.   The rooms are fresh, clean, and large.  The beds are comfortable.  Bathrooms are OK with a jetted tub, however you have NO counter space.   Be careful when booking your room and read the room details as all rooms seem to have a mini fridge but NOT all rooms have a microwave.   There is a small pool at the hotel, however there are only 2 chaise lounges and a couple of chairs so access is very limited.  All the days we were there the same couple always had the chaises so we did not use the pool area.  This was fine as the beach is walking distance.  Be aware however that because of social distancing you are not allowed to have any chairs or umbrellas or coolers on the beach.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing such an in depth review - good or bad it really helps other travelers in making decisions about where to stay.  I regret that I was never able to figure out how your reservation came in for the wrong room type ... all I can do is assure you again, that we didn't change it on our end AND thank you for being understanding about the whole mess.  I'm glad that adding the microwave to your room and discounting the rate to make up for the inconvenience was satisfactory.   I regret that with the Covid-19 virus still disrupting our lives many of the services we offer have been limited.  Most hotels have just stopped serving the breakfast entirely, but we are doing our best to keep everything as close to "normal" as the law allows.  This is truly been a difficult time for everyone, but your cooperation and understanding made all our efforts much easier.  Peter Callan, General Manager

Summary: We were displaced from our home because of industrial cleaning of our downstairs d/t water damage so I figured- if we had to go to a hotel- why not try this one by the Surf Break?  I was initially hesitant because we've stayed in Best Westerns before and NOT impreseed.  I'm more a Hilton or Marriott Girl.  BUT HOLY SMOKE this was AWESOME!  OK, so I start with Grown up because I'm 45 with two teens and a hubbie.  We stay in everything from Campers to hostels (when it was just my husband and I).  This is literally less than a 0.5mile easy walk to Doheny Surf break (my favorite break in pretty much the world).  It was QUIET and CLEAN and even a free breakfast!  The motif is totally surf related and you look out your balcony to see the Iconic Dana Point bridge and can people watch
Manager Response: Dear Eve,  Thank you so much for the heartfelt words.  Although the Coronavirus pandemic has decimated the lodging industry, at the Marina Shores we are striving to provide what guests we have with some feeling of "normalcy" during their stay.  Most all of the major hotel brands have stopped serving the free breakfast as a way to cut costs during these leaner times.  At the Marina Shores we are still serving our hot breakfast five days a week (Grab & Go bags on Mondays and Tuesdays) albeit with a less expanded menu.  While the County's preference is that all hotels close their pools during the pandemic, we opted to turn off the heater to "discourage" people from using it and posted a sign that asks that no more than six people be in the pool area at any time.  That way, they can adhere to the six-foot social distancing guidelines, but still soak up some sun if the ocean isn't to their liking.  At the forefront of everything, we are concerned and vigilant about the health and safety of both our guests and our staff.  We appreciate that our guests have been respectful of the rules and restrictions we've had to put in place .  I am thrilled beyond words that you enjoyed your time with us so much and I hope the clean-up and repairs from the water damage to your home have been completed so that you and your family can settle back in to life as it should be.  I regret that those were the circumstances that brought you here, but if we were able to impress you more than the "Hilton or Marriott," then we have done our job (winking!)  Peter Callan General Manager

Summary: A very nice hotel at a great location, walking distane to ocean, park, etc, and view of ocean with short distances to several attractions. Setting is a understandable cramped situation but well worth it. Great friendly staff with usual amenties. Will gladly stay here again.
Manager Response: ... and we will gladly welcome you back (laughing!)  Thank you for the review and we're happy you appreciated our close proximity to everything in Dana Point.  Peter Callan General Manager

Summary: We came down for a family trip. And got one of the double queen room suites. So 3 total beds. Rooms were roomy plenty of space for bigger family. Balcony is nice. no hot tub and the pool is not really inviting.  Staff we encountered was very friendly. And we were very grateful for the early check in. Did not experience any issues with noise. My one real complaint is parts of hotel. Such as hall ways and the parking lot were dirty. Lots of trash around parking lot. Room was clean but could still use a little more tlc. Overall a good choice and we would recommend it to families going to the beach.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and I promise we will take all your comments to heart.  Although we police our parking garage several times a day for trash, it seems that so many people would rather just drop their garbage outside their car door than walk it over to one of the many receptacles we have placed throughout.  Humanity lingers on ... imperfectly.  Please accept my apologies.  Peter Callan General Manager

Summary: Hotel is close to beach and marina area.  Parking was covered.  I stayed here last year for another family event.  Property is in nice neighborhood and I felt comfortable walking around area.  Centrally located to other tourist areas.  Staff very friendly and always greeted guests in morning or when we came in/went out.
Manager Response: We LOVE our repeat customers!  Thank you for the review and may you receive a "Marina Shores Welcome" no matter where your travels take you!  Peter Callan General Manager

Summary: This is a real gem of a hotel!!! Located so close to the ocean and with a not too distant view is one of its features!! The staff there is wonderfully dedicated to helping their guests enjoy the time spent there. The morning breakfast is delicious and is quite the smorgasboard and it would appeal to all appetites. Everything is super clean. The people there are what really make it so enjoyable !! Trinity the sales director was very helpful prior to and during our stay; also Janice and Sierra and Dana at the desk were always ready to greet and offer as much advice or suggestions as needed. I thought everyone was adept at being  helpful or leaving guests to their own . Great job by all!!
Manager Response: Hi Daniel!  We appreciate all your kind words and I will make sure to pass your praises along to the rest of our staff.  You seem to be in tune with the service atmosphere we try to create for all our guests and I'm proud that everyone here was able to make your stay a memorable one.  Come back soon!  Peter Callan General Manager

Summary: We had a king size room and were upgraded to a jacuzzi tub room. The jacuzzi tub was relaxing. It was quiet and breakfast had variety of options including gluten free bagels and almond milk. Parking was easy and close to lobby and the was an elevator and carts for your luggage. We enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: You said it all, Wendy and we certainly appreciate the praise.  Those whirlpool rooms with the huge tubs are one of the most popular features of the Marina Shores and we're happy we were able to give you the extra treat.  Come back soon!

Summary: The location of this motel is excellent for access to the marina.  It does sit on busy Hwy 1 but honestly we were not bothered by that.  There is pizza, ice cream and an pancake house right up the block.  We walked to the marina for seafood and a walk along the beach.  The bed was VERY comfortable.  Lots of space.  The hot breakfast was very good and the staff is super friendly.
Manager Response: Hi Betty!  Sounds like we scored on every round with you - which, of course, is always our goal.  Glad to hear that we made such a fantastic impression and appreciate your sharing the experience with your fellow travelers.

Summary Heading: perfect except for the traffic noise
Summary: I would love to be a regular at this hotel. The room and staff was great. Lots of good restaurants nearby. Parking is a little difficult between pillars.The only thing that might keep me away is the traffic noise.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful comments and we would LOVE to have you as a member of our family.  If your travels bring you to Dana Point on business, we have a great discount program for business travelers that is only available through the hotel - it's not available online anywhere, so give us a call the next time you're staying and ask about our corporate rate discount.  It's very true that Dana Point is experiencing some growing pains regarding the traffic as more and more people discover our little jewel by the sea.  We do have a quite a few standard rooms on the back side (residential side) of the building and all you need to do is request one of those when making your reservations.  We appreciate your input and hope to see you as a Marina Shores regular!

Summary: I booked this based on all the other great reviews, but wish I had stayed somewhere else.   Pros: Price Nice staff Free (average) breakfast  Good location   Cons: -LOUD constant noise from PCH road - noise from upstairs and outside motel style hallways in the back where people walk by and you can hear cars in the garage below -Old, rusty vents and paint over damaged walls, black mold in shower -Poor housekeeping- they made our beds, did not vaccum, change towels, or take out trash... makes me wonder how thoroughly other things are cleaned -Musty smell in the rooms, even after we tried to air out. I assume this is from all the pets we saw when people were checking in  -Very small tight parking  -Pool was closed for maintenance   It was fine, not great and not horrible, but would
Manager Response: I am truly sorry that we did not live up to the great reputation we hold based on all the positive reviews you read.  Normally our housekeeping service is one of our stellar features so I am sincerely humbled by the fact that we missed the mark so severely during your stay.  The issues you listed fall far short of the service level we strive to reach each day and I promise all your concerns with the room will be corrected quickly.  The pool closing was for an unforeseen emergency repair, but it is supposed to be reopened by this weekend.  Peter C, General Manager

Summary: There are several details about this hotel, really a motel, that weren‚Äôt clear to us before we booked. 1. This hotel has outdoor corridors that lead to your room. It is more a motel set up. 2. The parking is extremely tight, small parking spaces and a long and skinny parking lot. The outdoor corridors with the room doors are actually over the parking lot so you have noise from people walking/talking by your room and also cars parking down below. 3. The entire property is long and skinny, our door/front room window was facing a mural-painted concrete wall and the other side of our room was facing the PCH (more noise).. so noise no matter which room you slept in. THOSE are just factors that can‚Äôt be changed about this property.   THINGS they could change: 1. The breakfast was very
Manager Response: Please accept my deepest apologies, not only for the specific deficiencies you noted with your room, but for your overall dissatisfaction with the Marina Shores.  We fully realize that our hotel is an older building, so we have always gone the extra mile to make sure everything is as clean and sparkling as possible.  Obviously, there were some serious items in your room that we missed - no excuses made, we simply failed to deliver the service we are known for.  The good news is that, with this being the off season for our vacation community, we are in the middle of our preventative maintenance program so issues like the discolored floor grouting can be addressed properly.  Our free breakfast will always be a "work in progress," while trying to find a balance between nutrition, taste and value.  We only started offering the fresh cut fruit within the past few weeks and are trying to get a feel for the demand.  Items like this are best when purchased locally at grocers or farmer's markets to insure freshness and I know we have run short a couple of days.  Our goal is to not let any of the fruit sit more than a day - we want it absolutely fresh, but truthfully, we are still learning how much to buy each day.  Normally our potatoes are seasoned with red and green peppers and onion, but on weekends, when we know there are a lot of families staying, we tend to scale back on the added items because most kids don't like them.  I appreciate all your comments and regret that we failed to meet your expectations.  Peter C, General Manager

Summary: My wife and I go to Dana Point at least 7 times a year. We always stay at the Best western Marina shores . People at the front desk are fantastic especially Amanda who works the night shift. We frequent Best western marina shores so much we got to know Amanda pretty well. She always takes care of any problems we may have with our room. Amanda my wife and I (Kathy and Nob) we say to you thank you you are the best. And the rest of the team members we know we will get to know you guys too as we visit Dana point. Keep up the good work.
Manager Response: On behalf of Amanda and the rest of the crew, let me express our deepest appreciation, not only for the wonderful review, but for your consistent loyalty to the Marina Shores Hotel.  The greatest reward a hotel can receive is to have guests like you who return time and time again ... this shows us that we're doing our jobs to the best of our ability and  the thrill of knowing that we've made your stay NEVER gets old.  See you next time.  Peter C, General Manager

Summary: I spent Christmas Eve at this hotel for the first time. A nice place. It was a pleasant surprise having a tv in the bathroom and the whirlpool tub was great. Customer service was pleasant and professional, and it didn‚Äôt take long for my requests to be attended to. I was also happy that a bible was in my room as well as Christian TV programming; I‚Äôve lodged at some Best Western hotels that didn‚Äôt offer either amenity. The gym was ok.   It would be good to install a sign to instruct how to turn on the room‚Äôs lamps, because a wall switch is used for that purpose. But everything else was fine.   Breakfast was delicious and discovering an auto-pancake machine was interesting. I would suggest making sugar-free oatmeal and other grains available for those wanting to avoid presweetened
Manager Response: Hi Betty!  A belated Merry Christmas and Happy New Year to you.  It was our pleasure to provide you with exemplary service and we are all so happy that we helped make for a memorable holiday.  You'll be happy to know that we are updating our cereal selections in the breakfast room to provide for healthier options and less sugar.  Oh ... and regarding that wall switch ... we are supposed to leave the switch in the on position all the time and let the guests use the switches on the individual lamps, just to cut down on the very confusion you experienced.  I'm sorry that we missed that before you checked in.  Peter C, General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Best Western over the Christmas holidays since our daughter and son-in-law's home is undergoing construction. We were pleased with the service and rates, and enjoyed our stay. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating.
Manager Response: Hi Sharon!  First and foremost, a belated Merry Christmas to you and your entire family!  We are all so happy that you enjoyed your time with us and that we helped make your holiday just a little bit more special.  While we would love to welcome you back next year, we hope all the construction will be long since completed and that you can spend Christmas with your daughter her husband all under one roof!  Peter C, General Manager

Summary: This BW is definitely the best of its class. It is managed and runs super well. We stayed here 6 nights, felt like we moved in, and we had a wonderful experience!  Great location. A lot of restaurants within 1-2 blocks. Rib joint, Thai, pizza, Australia coffee, organic juice, McDonald‚Äôs, Denny‚Äôs....  it‚Äôs 0.8 mile to beautiful Dana Point Harbor. There are tens of seafood restaurants, cafes, ice cream, souvenir, clothing stores.... it‚Äôs a fun place to hang out.  We were there during Christmas holidays, the lights are just magnificent!  Every employee is very friendly and helpful, always smiling. Whatever we asked for, more hangers, towels... we got it in a few minutes.  Complimentary breakfast is the best you can get, hot eggs, ham, sausage, oatmeal, cereal, yogurt, pastries,
Manager Response: Happy New Year, Frances and we're glad we were able to blow you away with our service and hospitality ... that's what it's all about, no?  The staff of the Marina Shores LIVES to put smiles on people's faces ... whether you're here for a night or a month, you're welcomed like part of the family and treated like the special guest that you are.  Look forward to seeing you again!  Peter C, General Manager

Summary: We enjoy our time at the Best Western plus hotels.  Been with this company for about fifteen years.  Great value, great breakfast very nice amenities, friendly staff.  Everyone including the customers were very friendly.
Manager Response: Hi Greg!  We hope 2020 has started out well for you and we're happy we helped close out 2019 in fine fashion.  Thank you for the review and your devout loyalty to the Best Western brand as well.  If you don't mind my saying so ... you have excellent taste! (smiling!)  Peter C, General Manager

Summary: Love this hotel still.  Quality remains top notch.  This hotel is centrally located (from the airport, from the freeway,close to the beach, Pacific Coast Highway).  Lots to do and see in Dana Point.  Hotel and staff do an outstanding job of being pleasant and helpful.  Everyone here is .  The rooms are clean and tidy, good internet, refrigerator.  It seems they've thought of everything.  Parking is onsite, close and easy.  Stairs or elevator.  Nice breakfast options included.  Computers in lobby, printer if you need it.  Laundry.  They will sell you quarters.  Laundry products also available.  Surprisingly quiet for being so close to the highway.  If your windows/slider are closed, you really don't hear the traffic.  You can tell how good it is when you do open the window or
Manager Response: Hi Terry!  It's always a pleasure to welcome you back and I'm happy we gave you a glorious experience once again.  We look forward to every one of your visits!

Summary: Very satisfied with my stay at the best Western in Laguna Beach California. Front desk had excellent service personal touch and they were very pleasant. Room was exceptionally nice everything worked in the room even had a TV in the bathroom. Had a whirlpool bathtub which worked fantastic.
