Manager Response: We're so happy you enjoyed your stay.  The whirlpool tubs are a fantastic amenity that you'd expect to find in much more expensive hotels and we love surprising our guests with features like that.  Come back and see us soon!

Summary: I just wanted to give a shoutout to the staff at this Best Western location. From start to finish they were helpful, exceptionally friendly and kind. I noted it was my birthday in my online reservation, and the first thing Amanda at the front desk said was "Happy Birthday!". My husband and I couldn't get over how nice the staff were, including the front desk, the cleaning staff, and the employees in the breakfast area. We would go back just because everyone there was so nice. And the whirlpool rooms are totally worth the tiny bit of extra money - relaxing in your own personal jacuzzi in your room is fantastic!! Thanks for the nice birthday stay, Best Western!
Manager Response: We are all so happy that you enjoyed your birthday stay with us.  Amanda and the rest of the crew appreciate the recognition for their efforts and we hope you will come back and see us soon, even if you're NOT celebrating anything special (laughing).  You probably noticed the signs all around the hotel that read "May all who come as guests, leave as friends."  That is our mantra!  You can't say something like that and then not back it up.  We truly DO have a wonderful team here ... review after review always says something about how great and friendly the staff is ... and I am so proud of every one of them for keeping the true spirit of hospitality alive.  Thank you again ... and a belated happy birthday to you!

Summary: Very nice stay. Loved having a private whirlpool in our room especially in the cold weather. Located close to the harbor and restaurants, coffee houses and bars.  Nice staff. They do charge $10.00 for parking even if you have a handicap car or AAA.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and high rating.  Regarding the parking ... hopefully there is some consolation in knowing that most of the hotels in the beach area charge for parking and they are more than double our fee.  Alot of them also tack on the mysterious "resort fees" that no one really knows what they're for.

Summary Heading: A pleasant surprise at a great price
Summary: I stay at many hotels but rarely review.  This one was great enough to merit a few kind words.  We loved our King Balcony Suite that was a REAL suite with a dividing door and a real view of the ocean.  Great choices at breakfast with really kind, helpful staff.  Plenty of covered parking merited the $10 charge per night.  Amazing price considering how close to the ocean it is.
Manager Response: Hi Andrew!  We are so happy your experience at the Marina Shores inspired you to write one of those "rare reviews."  That speaks volumes about our staff and the service they provide.  Three star pricing with five star service goes a long way.  Come back and see us during the SUMMER months when Dana Point is in full swing and I think you'll be just as impressed.

Summary Heading: Good value, very clean, great customer service, good location
Summary: We highly recommend this hotel.  We were pleasantly surprised at how nice the facility was, how polite and helpful the staff were and the cleanliness of the rooms and overall facility.  The rooms are reasonably priced especially considering neighboring hotels costs and parking is only $10 / night with sufficient parking.
Manager Response: Hi Kathy!  Thank you for the wonderful review and we are all glad you enjoyed your time with us.  We honestly try to put our best foot forward every day, combining the best value and the best staff in the city ... we truly believe that the Marina Shores offers an exceptional experience for the cost conscious traveler and it looks like you're on board too.  Come see us again soon!

Summary: We found this property to be clean, comfortable, well-maintained and located in beautiful Dana Point close to the harbor, beach and shops and restaurants.  We were pleased to have our dog welcomed as a guest. And we thought it was very reasonably priced for the location.
Manager Response: As one of the few pet-friendly hotels in Dana Point, we take great pride in welcoming your furry fellow travelers - after all, they're part of the family too, right?  We appreciate the recognition and we're glad you all enjoyed your time with us.  Whenever someone mentions our pet-friendly policy in a review, I like to make a special note to other travelers who may be reading.  Always remember that when you bring your pet to a hotel, they are in a strange environment with all kinds of unfamiliar sights and smells.  Even though your pet may be perfectly behaved at home, you can't assume they will be just as peaceful and content when you stay at a hotel.  They get scared - especially if you leave them alone in the room.  We always encourage our guests to take their pets with them whenever they leave the hotel.  These animals love you and you are the one constant in their life when you're all traveling together.

Summary Heading: BW Marina Shores in Dana Point
Summary: We have been staying at the BW Marina Shores at least 6 times a year for the last 4 years and can honestly say that have continued to meet our high standards. Every employee that we come in contact are completely professional, and always find a way to meet many of our request with a very pleasing attitude. If we felt there was anything sub-standard with Marina Shores we would not hesitate for a moment to list it here.
Manager Response: It's always great to welcome back old friends and who better to share real honest feedback about the Marina Shores experience than someone who stays here regularly ;-)  All kidding aside, we are truly humbled by your words and so grateful that you have found a real home away from home here in Dana Point.  Thank you for the review and we will always try to make your next visit even better than your last.

Summary: Really nice property close to the harbor and Doheny State Beach and is pet friendly!  Lovely room decor and comfortable bed.  Surprised to see a standard room with a jacuzzi bathtub and a TV in the bathroom! Close to shopping and restaurants...I loved this place and very reasonably priced.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to post this review and are glad you took notice of all the little things that make the Marina Shores someplace special. The jetted spa tubs are a wonderful feature and folks are always pleasantly surprised. Come see us again soon!

Summary: This property was very clean and full of amenities. All of the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful, and our room was beautifully appointed. The location can't be beat- an easy walk to Doheny State Beacb and Dana Point Harbor. We will definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful review and for taking the time to share your experience with other travelers.  We take tremendous pride in offering clean, comfortable accommodations to all our guests, but the fantastic staff at the Marina Shores is probably our greatest amenity.  Come back and see us soon!

Summary: Thanks y‚Äôall for being amazing. Such a cleaning hotel. Nice breakfast. Close to everything. Friendly staff. Seriously, Dana Point is a pretty boring town. Little beach. Lotsa boats and a few shops and restaurants. This hotel was my favorite part of the town.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful review and we are thrilled that the Marina Shores was the highlight of your visit.  Dana Point DOES have its moments ... for example, the music festivals throughout the year are a huge draw.  I'm trying to come to terms with "boring" ... and I am writing this with a huge smile on my face so please don't take this as anything personal, my reply is meant in fun ... Dana Point, CA has not become a tourist trap yet unlike Laguna Beach and many of the other resort communities along the coast.  We have the Marina, with all the shops, the restaurants and the yachts, but for the most part, along PCH the restaurants and the nightlife still center on the residents and you can find many hole-in-the-wall places that are full of the local color and flavor, without any of the pretense or commercialism that most destination towns throw at the tourists.  I don't know how long you were here, but given a week, there are many surprises in Dana Point ... there may not be any flashing, neon arrows pointing the way, but just strike up a conversation with a couple of the locals and you'd be amazed at the places they could point you.  Come back and give our town another try someday!

Summary: This was the best experience ever. Carolina has great customer service and was so sweet and very helpful  She is friendly and welcoming. The continental breakfast was delicious. What a wonderful way to start the morning. Thank you.
Manager Response: Hi Rosita and thank you so much for the wonderful words about Carolina.  She is the newest member of our great breakfast team so she will be thrilled to find out she made such a great impression on you.

Summary: The hotel is in immaculate shape, very clean, neat and organized. The staff all went above and beyond making our stay a pleasant one. The breakfast are is well organized, the food was all prepared that morning,everything was very good and if you are a gluten free person there are several options to choose from, which was a plus for my wife!! Bob and Tara A...
Manager Response: Bob & Tara,  We are very happy that we helped make your California vacation so memorable and are extremely grateful you took the time to share your experience with the TripAdvisor world.  We hope you can come back for another visit soon ... you can never have too many vacations!

Summary: Love this hotel! Everyone is so friendly and helpful with always delivering excellent customer service! Close to beach, restaurants,  and easy access to everything you might need. Highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again soon!
Manager Response: Hey Brenda!  We took a vote and we love you too!  Thank you for the great rating and review ... your fellow travelers need to know what an outstanding value we are.

Summary Heading: Friendly and helpful place to stay
Summary: We stayed two  nights , Sunday and Monday,  in late September and found it to be a restful and pleasant place to stay. The staff was friendly and seemed to enjoy their work. Dana Point is conveniently near San Juan Capistrano and also to beaches.  The room was a generous size and there was a large bathtub fitted with water jets. There was some noise from the Pacific Coast Highway, but they supply earplugs! The breakfast offerings were good and all in all it was a place we would return to.
Manager Response: Well, if you're a "CA traveler" then your opinion should mean alot to all the folks who explore the Southern California coast.  We're thrilled you found a comfortable home with us, even for just a couple of days, and we're happy you enjoyed your time, not only at the Marina Shores but in Dana Point and SJC too.  Come back soon!

Summary Heading: Wonderful Experience ~ Nice rooms & Great Staff!
Summary: We really enjoyed our weekend visit. Nice, clean attractive and comfortable rooms. The staff is friendly and efficient. The complimentary breakfast was convenient and well managed. The room rates are surprisingly affordable, Great experience ~ we will return.
Manager Response: A pox on anyone who says "soulmates" don't exist!  I love it!  Thank you so much for the great rating and for sharing your comments with your fellow travelers.  At the Marina Shores we really DO go the extra mile to make everyone feel welcomed and hearing how well we've served you never gets old.  See you next time!

Summary: The Best Western plus hotels are a very good bang for the buck.  This is a great Best Western Plus, love the ocean views great.  We usually stay at the Best Western Plus in Redondo Beach, another wonderful hotel!
Manager Response: Hi Greg!  We appreciate that you are loyal to the Best Western family of hotels and were happy that the Marina Shores made such a great impression.  Hopefully you've added us to your Make-Sure-We-Return-To-It list!

Summary: Great location, every morning the breakfast was good and had plenty of options, even a pancake maker. the rooms were spacious, we had a small suite but it still was great we had a balcony. The pulll out sofa was pretty squeaky, but the mattress itself was very comfortable and soft. Quiet little town, about an hour each way to both LA and San Diego.
Manager Response: Hi Heather!  Since you stayed with us for a few nights, you got to see that we rotate our breakfast menu every day - something that alot of hotels that offer this free breakfast don't do!  We're glad you liked the variety in our breakfast room and that you found the suite accommodations comfortable.  Please remember us if you plan a return trip to Dana Point ... we'd love to see you again!

Summary: I visited this hotel and found the staff to be amazing. They worked hard to make my visit better than average. They were very accommodating and wonderful to deal with. I would recommend this as a hotel.
Manager Response: We really appreciate your wonderful review, Debbie and we're thrilled that we were able to make your stay "amazing."

Summary: This was honestly one of the best hotel stays I have ever had, the staff went above and beyond to do everything in their power to make sure I was taken care of. I would recommend to all my friends and family!
Manager Response: Hey Dani!  Our mantra is "May all who come as guests leave as friends" and it sounds like we worked our magic for you.  The staff is thrilled that you enjoyed your experience - pass the word!

Summary: Cute place to stay. Close to the beach. Nice rooms. Small pool but is relaxing. There is no Jacuzzi. You can walk to the harbor or pay $6 for a ride. Free trolly. You can see the beach if you are on the far end.
Manager Response: Hi Irving!  We're so happy you enjoyed your time with us.  We truly believe that the Marina Shores is the best value in our area - priced comfortably, convenient to just about everything and a staff that will move mountains to make your stay a memorable one.  Thank you for the wonderful review.

Summary Heading: Have Reviewed before and Great review still stands
Summary: We stay here a lot. Every single person on the staff is smiling, friendly, greets you and is available for assistance or answers. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The amenities at this hotel are pretty much everything you need. Internet in the rooms, computers downstairs, printer, good breakfast options, gym, pool, washer/dryer, close parking, pet-friendly and great staff. I just cannot say enough about their staff! I've reviewed before and updating to commend this hotel and staff on a job well done again and still!
Manager Response: Hi Terry!  As always, it's such a pleasure to have you as our guest.  As a travel industry professional yourself, the input I get from our conversations is priceless and lets me know that we're really onto something special with our staff and service philosophy.  Thank you for the wonderful review and rating .. as always, we are humbled by your praises.

Summary: Good location 5 min walk to the beach and had a great free breakfast in the morning. I was a little disappointed that this was a pet friendly hotel but did not have a designated spot for the dog to go to the bathroom. Also elevator was small and slow and ice machine was only on the second floor.
Manager Response: Hi Melanie!  Thank you for the kind review and rating.  I apologize for the lack of a grassy area on the property for walking your dog, but once you exit the building or parking garage, it's all pretty much city property.  There is a beautiful park up the hill behind the hotel - a bit too steep to walk, but only a two minute drive.  Even though we lack the outdoor facilities, we feel it's important to be pet friendly because there are so few hotels in Dana Point that allow them.

Summary Heading: Wonderful service and room saved our night in Dana Point!
Summary: For the night before my 13-year-old daughter and I were to go on a whale watching trip out Dana Point in early August, I had booked a hotel that turned out to be a huge disappointment. I canceled our stay there and we left to search for something better.  Both my daughter and I were pretty upset, but fortunately I decided to check out the Best Western Plus Marina Shores. I explained our situation to the women at the front desk. They were both very sympathetic. One of them checked their availability then gave me a key to a room so I could look at it before checking in. It was a suite, with a separate living room, two beds, a balcony with a peek view of the ocean, and a whirlpool tub in the bathroom. It was much larger than the room at the other hotel, plus it was extremely clean,
Manager Response: Thank you for this absolutely WONDERFUL review and assessment of your experience with us!  I'm sorry for the circumstances that brought you here - while it's great to know that we exceeded the competition, the hassle of changing reservations at the last minute must have been stressful.  It's great to know the staff of the Marina Shores was able to save your vacation and I hope you got to see some whales while you were on the cruise ... it's breath taking!

Summary: We usually prefer Best Western hotels and this is our favorite one in Orange County and Southern California. It‚Äôs very convenient to park and check in, The rooms are big and super clean, and it‚Äôs located near lots of great dining and Doheny State Beach is only a block away. Great hotel choice if you‚Äôre visiting Dana Point.
Manager Response: Hey Rob!  Thanks for putting in a good word for us with all the TripAdvisor travelers.  We'll see you the next time you're in town!

Summary Heading: Once you park DO NOT for any reason go somewhere in your car!!!!
Summary: Still completely livid about my experience here.  The parking pass states that it does not give you permission to park on the street.  Okay, one of those cities where you need like a city parking pass.  Went to an early breakfast, came back to no parking avail.  I .had to check out of this place at 7.15 in the morning.  Was looking forward to using the whirlpool tub after coming back.  So I had to hurry and park up all my stuff hoping my car would not get towed.  At the front desk, after mentioning that had to check out because there was no parking, the person just responded with "ok".  Really, you can even say sorry!!!  So when I had come back the evening before and had there not been parking, I would have had to check out then.  Would they have refunded my money?  Probably
Manager Response: Dear Wendy,  Words cannot express how deeply sorry I am for the horrible miscommunication you experienced from our front desk.  We actually have ample parking at the hotel ... if you drive all the way to the end of the garage on the main level, there is a large sign that directs you to additional parking on the lower level - you just go around the curve in and it brings you to the lower level garage.  In the outside chance that the lower level is full as well, on the weekends our guests are allowed to use the parking garage at the office building across from our main entrance and the clerk you spoke with should have let you know both those options.  Since you are a Best Western Rewards member, I have assigned a substantial number of bonus points to your account that you can use toward free stays at any Best Western hotel.  While we would love the opportunity to serve you again - this time without any mistakes - we especially don't want Best Western to lose a loyal customer due to our transgressions.

Summary: Nice 2 queen suite with balcony, microwave and frig at a good price. Our 5th time here and always have fun. Peak a boo ocean view. Walk to Doheny beach and Dana pt. Harbour with many resturants,beautiful boats and great people watching. Desk staff were all very professional and friendly. Free breakfast could be a bit better, but it is Free. Plenty of parking and close to LG Beach and Balboa Island.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review, Gene and we're always happy with your return.  I appreciate your candor about the breakfast and we're always tweaking the menu to try and improve the selections.  We just added a chorizo and potato skillet option to spice things up a bit.  See you next time!

Summary Heading: Is this really a Best Western? Or a Five Star Hotel?
Summary: Is this really a Best Western-or a 5 Star Hotel hiding as one? I am a professional, have visited a number of hotels and motels throughout the USA and this place impressed me as much as the best of them.  Special kudos to Halia at the front desk for taking such good care of my arrangements and making sure I got the best rates available. The staff in the breakfast dining room (an automatic pancake making machine? Outstanding!) could not have gone out of their way more to serve and be friendly. Very impressive. The room was clean and well appointed, a comfortable bed and small sitting nook with an oversized chair. The bathroom had its own TV and a large spa-jet step up tub! If you desire quiet, ask for a room away from the relatively busy street.  There is even a small reading
Manager Response: Okay ... I am totally blushing on this one.  All of us appreciate the incredibly kind words, but in all honesty, in order to qualify as a "Five Star Hotel" we would have to have a full service restaurant, spa facilities and a whole host of other amenities.  That doesn't mean we still can't provide Five Star SERVICE, which we try to do every day ... and that is obviously where we impressed you the most.  All of us at the Marina Shores are proud to have made your stay so special and so memorable.  It is a culmination of all the little things we do and the recognition you offered is what makes our job such a joy.  Thank you again and we look forward to your next visit to Dana Point.

Summary: Hotel was a good option in Dana . The rooms are a good size with comfortable beds and are very clean. The breakfast is typical USA fare , but little choice for vegetarians or vegans. It is well placed and would stay again when in Dana Point
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review and I regret that we did not have enough vegan options in our free breakfast.  This is something we can look into to make our breakfast more inclusive.  We appreciate the suggestion.

Summary: Best hotel I've stayed at in many years in SoCal. We would definitely stay here again if back in Dana Point. Loved the pool, shaded parking balconies and huge delicious breakfast. Staff very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: We thank you for this absolutely incredible review.  With so many lodging options available we are truly humbled that you found the Marina Shores to be at the top of your list.

Summary: This hotel has nice staff and a good breakfast. The room was small but in decent condition. It is on PCH, so there is a lot of road noise. Even if you are on the back side of the hotel, it is so loud. We would not stay here again
Manager Response: Hi Wendy!  Yes, as Dana Point has grown from a sleepy little beach community into a vacation destination, the traffic and sounds of the outside world have grown with it.  About 10 years ago we installed double-paned sound dampening glass in all the windows and balcony doors throughout the hotel in an effort to keep these symptoms of progress at bay.  While some guests enjoy the convenience of our location and being in the heart of the hustle and bustle, others, like yourself, don't like the trade-off.  We're sincerely sorry to lose you as a customer, but appreciate that you still recognized all the positives that go along with the Marina Shores experience.

Summary Heading: The best place for a get a way
Summary: This is by far the best hotel on the PCH in Dana Point. Clean Rooms, excellent service, very nice staff. There wasn't a time I walked into the lobby that I wasn't greeted with a warm hello by all staff that were present. There is an ocean view from the front of the hotel/rooms on the PCH side. It's an easy walk to Doheny State Park, Dana Point Harbor and all the things you can do on the ocean. Easy Trolly ride to many beaches along the PCH. Restaurants, shops, homemade ice cream all within a 5 minute walk. Great value; very comfy beds.  Every time I come to Dana Point, I stay at this hotel, it hasn't disappointed me at all. I've been here several times and it's always a pleasure
Manager Response: Hi Teri!  Thank you for the kind words and incredible recognition of our staff and, of course, the Marina Shores itself.  We do truly have a wonderful team here and we love making everyone feel welcomed.  Great traveler tips too ... Dana Point is still an undiscovered treasure along the California coast ... but people like you are getting the word out - Thanks!

Summary: It was a wonderful stay no complaints breakfest was good room was good and staff was friendly. The parking was good and it was right next to the beach.  I would recommend this to all of my friends. Best hotel ever!
Manager Response: We appreciate your letting other travelers know how much you enjoyed your stay at the Marina Shores ... the "friendly staff" seems to be a recurring theme in so many reviews and our team relishes the recognition.  Thanks for spreading the word.

Summary: Our family had our vacation at this hotel because it was in the right spot for all the activities we were going to do.  The staff were very nice and even let us check in early because they had a room available.  The beach was within walking distance which was nice so we did not have to go far to enjoy it.
Manager Response: "Yes" is one of our favorite words at the Marina Shores ... this goes for early check-ins or most any kind of special requests our guests might have.  In a world where the personal touch seems to be giving way to technology, it's nice to know that we can still bring a smile (or a sigh of relief) to folks seeking something that many other hotels might say "no" to, just because they can.  We're so glad you and your family enjoyed your vacation and the we were able to play even a small part in it's success.  You're exactly right when you said we are "the right spot" ... centrally located to all there is to see and do in the beach area and just minutes from the interstate the brings the rest of Southern California right to you.

Summary: Shout out to Ali and Amanda at the front desk. These two gals welcome you and do everything to make your stay the best it can be. How lovely to come back in the evening with a hello _ , how was your day. Let us know if there is anything you need :) The rest of the staff - helpful and friendly. The room (1st floor) & location great! Will be back.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review and for sharing your great experience with your fellow travelers.  Ali, Amanda and the rest of our staff are always available for a warm greeting, helpful service and the greatest smiles west of the Rockies!  Come back and see us soon.

Summary: Location is great!  Nice, clean rooms and seating areas throughout the hotel.  Great hot breakfast!  Best part is the Staff at BW Marina Shores.  Every staff member we interacted with during our 3 night stay made us feel welcomed. Especially, Halia and Amanda at the front desk.  They made us feel valued as a hotel guest and helped us with whatever we needed.  The breakfast staff are so nice and they always made sure there is plenty of food.
Manager Response: As we tell all our new hires in training ... a clean room and a comfortable bed should be the minimum expectation of any hotel guest - it's the attitude of the staff, the warm friendly greeting, the offer of assistance and a sincere smile whenever a customer passes by - that makes an average stay an outstanding stay.  Ali and Amanda are shining examples of this philosophy, as are ALL the staff members, both on the front lines and behind the scenes, at the Marina Shores.  We all thank you for the wonderful review and are thrilled for the impression we made.  Come back soon!

Summary: I was impressed. It's an older property well worn but well cared for and appointed. I travel a lot for business. I stayed 11 nights. Not a single ball was dropped. Check in was amazing. Ali at the front desk is one of the most helpful and impressive hotel staff members I've ever seen. She made me feel like a part of the family. Amanda was also great. Housekeeping was done properly each time. The breakfast was a treat tons of options. Gluten free friendly. I really liked seeing Colton each morning such a helpful and friendly guy. Just a perfect experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review and I will make sure to pass on your praises to Colton, Ali and Amada.  They are core members of our "May all who come as guests, leave as friends" team and really enjoy the surprise people feel with our brand of welcome.  Glad you enjoyed the hotel, the breakfast and all the little features that truly make the Marina Shores experience something special.

Summary Heading: Great hotel excellent location to Dana Point Harbor
Summary: My wife and I go there 4 times a year the staff is amazing the rooms are great and the hot breakfast is very filling we live in Henderson Nevada so its a 5 hour trip and being so close to Dana Point Harbor is a plus the shops and restaurants are amazing you can actually walk to the Harbor in 10 minutes we have been Best Western members for years and this is one of the best.
Manager Response: We are thrilled to welcome you back time and time again!  Thank you for the high praises and we will continue to provide you with the best experience possible every time you return.

Summary: Clean hotel located within easy walking distance to the beach, food and shops. Heated pool with nice rooms, some with balconies with a water view. The staff was the icing on the cake. They were friendly, fun and easy going and very knowledgeable about the area. The hotel is pet friendly and both upon booking and check in they took extra time to find us the right room at a great rate that fit the needs of our family. The breakfast had tons of choices such as eggs, meat, breads, yogurts, cereal, pancakes, fruit, oatmeal, etc. I would highly recommend this hotel and we will stay here every time we come back.
Manager Response: We so appreciate your wonderful review and are super grateful that you took the time to share your impressions with other travelers.  We truly believe that the Marina Shores is the best value in Dana Point and our goal is to make every visitor's stay as memorable as yours.  Thank you again for the kind words and we'll see you next time!

Summary Heading: Thank you Bobby!  I appreciate you tons....  Will not forget about your kindness.
Summary: I usually do not write review, but leaving my token of appreciation is the least I can do for one individual who made my stay so pleasant.  After I checked out on the 4th of June, I realized I left my hanger that go with my garment bag, so I went back the property and asked if it was reported as lost and found.  I was advised that the housekeeper threw it away and cannot retrieve, so I was unhappy at that moment.  However, front desk staff provided me a substitute, so as least I could pack my suite alright even it did not fit with my garment bag.  I just gave up and left, took the situation as it was.  30 minutes later, I got a call from a front desk staff and advised me they found my hanger so I went back again.  The gesture was good, even I was not happy that I needed to go
Manager Response: For true hospitality professionals like Bobby, this was all in a day's work, but on the guest's side it is truly something special.  Bobby told me all about it the day it happened and he was really excited that he was able to turn a disappointing situation for you into something amazing.  He will be thrilled to see you took the time to recognize him on Trip Advisor and we all appreciate your sharing the story with other travelers.  Glad we were able to save the day for you!

Summary: Rooms were super clean.  Service was AMAZING!  Employees EXCELLENT!  Locations was spectacular.  We can't wait to go back! Close to highways, the beach, beach activities, great good.  Area was great and would definately recommend
Manager Response: Sounds like we hit a home run for you, which is always super to hear.  Thank you for the wonderful review and 5 bullet rating.  We're glad that the team at the Marina Shores made your Dana Point stay something spectacular and hope you come back to see us soon!

Summary Heading: Sad to give 2/5 but not deserved for the value that we pay
Summary: I‚Äôm not really the type to give a low rating but I feel like for the price we paid for a night it did not reflect the service we have gotten. We get it, it was around Southern Cali area, Orange County area, but we thought it was way over priced. One is that it is not near a walking distance beach, nowalkable shores around the area. We are giving a 2 instead of a 1 because most of the staff are relatively nice at the front desk and breakfast area. Parking is not free even though you are a guest and you have checked in. Was surprised by that as other and most hotels gives free parking for all guest. The extremely downside we had was we checked in around 6-7pm only to find out some fecal matter on the toilet, and to say that check in time is at 3pm we expected that everything
Manager Response: Please accept my deepest apologies for the cleanliness issues you discovered at check-in. I assure you that this in no way reflects the standards we set for our housekeeping and room inspection processes.  I am so sorry that you didn't report this to the front desk immediately so that we could clean the toilet and compensate you for our service failure, but understand that it was late and you were tired.  The fact that any traveler felt that they might be discredited for voicing a complaint is a sad reflection of what industry service has become.  At the Marina Shores, we take all guest concerns to heart as is shown by the high ratings and the overall positive comments we receive in social media, so on the rare occasion that something goes wrong, we do everything in our power to correct that matter as fast as possible.  Our parking fee is not unusual for the hotels in our area and our $10.00 per night fee is actually the lowest for all that do charge.  We also waive the fee for all Best Western Rewards Diamond and Platinum level members.  In closing, I again can only express my deepest apologies for your experience and hope you will give us another chance to serve you and show you what the staff of the Marina Shores is truly capable of.

Summary: We are long time customers of the Best Western brand and have very high expectations. There is absolutely no doubt that the " Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel " always meets ours, having stayed with them for 3 separate  visits of 4 nights each time in the last 2 months. Each visit was met with employee's that performed exceptionally, making us feel like part of the Family & VIP's ! We are already planning our next trip to Dana Point and our usual comfort zone at Best Western
Manager Response: Words cannot express how moved we all are for your kindness and generosity of praise.  It is because of guests like you that we, as "hospitality professionals" can look at our work as a calling instead of a job.  It is an honor serving you and we hope, with each successive visit, we continue to make your experience as pleasant as the last!

Summary: This was our first time staying at this hotel and by far this was the best hotel we have ever stayed at! We will definitely return. The customer service was spectacular the room was very spacious and nice and the breakfast was delicious!
Manager Response: If you were this impressed on your first visit, just imagine what the experience is like for the folks who stay here on a regular basis :-)  We look forward to your return - in the meantime, spread the word to your friends ... if you want to vacation on the coast of Southern Calfiornia, Dana Point and specifically, the Marina Shores Hotel is the best central location for everything there is to see and do!  Thank you for the wonderful review and we're glad we left you with such good memories.

Summary: Great location, very quiet, modern and convenient....love staying at this hotel...beds are comfortable, Tv service has HBO, room is spacious with both a fridge and microwave.  Also there was an in room coffee pot.  Towels were fluffy and plentiful...
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review and for rating us so highly.  It is always our goal to provide the best accommodations and service possible, but when a guest takes the time to share their experience with other travelers, it is such a rewarding feeling.  Come back and see us again soon!

Summary: Best Western Plus has really stepped up their game.  Very clean hotel. Staff is always friendly and accommodating.  I would not hesitate on staying at a BW+. In fact we often look for them when we are travelling.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review.  I look forward to the day when the service and value at Best Western Plus hotels is not considered a surprise (laughing).  At the Marina Shores, we are doing our best to set the example.

Summary Heading: Free Breakfast - Taste Just Like Home!
Summary: We had one of our best stays at the Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel. The reason we put the full name is there is another Best Western in town, which I'm sure if nice but the free breakfast here was delicious, and with five (5) kiddos, it sure helped financially :)  The rooms were clean, and the beds so comfortable.  The staff was amazing, made us feel like family every day and told us the best beaches nearby so we enjoyed having our toes in the sand, and not rocks, or where there were dangerous rip currents, etc. We had a bad experience booking online as we wound up at a run down timeshare nearby, so the staff, shared with us some secrets so that won't happen to us again.   The only negative is the bathtubs, weren't geared for young children, but, most are not. I'd stay
Manager Response: We are so thrilled you enjoyed your time with us and we're glad we helped make your family's vacation a super success.  As I've said in many of my review responses, our mantra at the Marina Shores is "May all who come as guests, leave as friends" and I can't tell you how great your words made our staff feel, knowing we made it happen for you.  Come see us again soon!

Summary: My wife and I stay at th BW marina shore every time we go to dana point. Here's why. All the staff member from the front counter to maintenance are excellent friendly and efficient. Hotel is close to the harbour and eating establishment. We will return for our anniversary in July.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words and we are humbled by your praises.  We all so enjoy bringing the spirit of hospitality back to everyday encounters.  See you in July!

Summary: Hotel had beautiful views and was in an excellent location. Within walking distance of stores and eateries. A lot of choices for breakfast and coffee available all day long. Environmentally conscious. Service was consistent and friendly from front desk reception to service positions.
Manager Response: We appreciate the great review and we're glad you recognized the friendly service provided by everyone on the staff.  We see ourselves as one big family, welcoming people into our home ...  comfort isn't just limited to a bed, it's the people who truly make a hotel stay comfortable!

Summary: We enjoy stay at this hotel! It's close to everthing, safe parking, friendly,  helpful staff and clean, well cared for rooms! The hotel is centrally located and close to the beach and many restaurants.
Manager Response: Well, you certainly hit every bullet point on what makes the Marina Shores the best place to stay in Dana Point!  Thank you for the great review and we're glad you enjoyed your time with us.

Summary: I would say this hotel actually gave me more for the price we paid, great accomodations, spacious room, great service, tasty breakfast, great location near the beach and Dana Point Harbor. We really enjoyed our time there I would definetely come back
Manager Response: WOW!  In this day and age, how many times can we leave someplace feeling like we got MORE than our money's worth?  That was so wonderful to see and I hope that other travelers reading your review take note.  Yes, in a resort area like Dana Point, hotels will charge a premium simply because they can.  At the Marina Shores, we want you to come back because you saw the value in what we offered - from the accommodations all the way to the friendly staff welcome.

Summary: Located off of PCH parking in the rear is good but challenging. We thought we might be able to check in a little early, but the lady at the desk was a little rude. When we came back at the correct time all the folks were really nice. Our room was on the third floor, but there was an elevator. Not the fastest elevator in the world, but adequate for our needs. The room was very clean and we were given a little bag of goodies. I really liked the selection of channels on the flat screen TV. The items at breakfast were really good with a nice selection. It was sad to note that Gideon Bibles are no longer placed in the rooms (at least, I could not find one)
Manager Response: Hi Rene!  Please accept my apologies if the clerk on duty came across as rude ... that certainly doesn't reflect the service spirit we strive for here.  I'm also sorry that Bible was missing from your nightstand.  The previous guest must have needed a little spiritual support when they continued their travels, but we have double-checked all the rooms and Bibles are all in place.  Thank you for the kind review and we hope you will return soon.

Summary Heading: Convenient location, helpful staff, but property feels like a motel.
Summary: Convenient location, and pleasant, helpful staff, but rooms are worn.  Jacuzzi was dirty and cracked.  Hall carpet was worn.  Room relatively clean, but chair arm was broken, and tv had no cable signal (but was fixed by staff). Bed was uncomfortable and sheets had ink spots.  Hotel has the ambience of a motel.

Summary Heading: Great hotel over-looking Dana Point Harbor
Summary: This hotel is one of our all-time favorite Best Westerns. The staff were wonderful and did everything to make us feel welcome. We had a great room in a wonderful location, close to whale watching trips and good restaurants. There were also extra amenities which pleased us. We hope we can come again.

Great location, value, and experience. Hotel and room were nice and clean friendly staff, no noise issues were noticed. Walking distance to the beach, lots of food options within walking distance as well. Everything was great!

We stayed at this hotel, and we were very pleased.  Bobby and Amanda were the greatest staff  to have on board.  They made sure all of our reservations, request, and accommodation was just perfect.  We appreciate all that they did to accommodate us and our stay was very pleasant.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful review and I will be sure to pass on your praises to Bobby and Amanda.  They are such great representatives of the Marina Shores hospitality pledge, don't you think?  Glad you enjoyed your time with us ... perfection is always our goal.

Summary Heading: Good Service But Feels like a Motel Not Hotel
Summary: This hotel had a fairly high ranking on TA and was reasonably priced.  The staff and service were great.  The breakfast was also very good for a hotel.  However, we were sorely disappointed in the condition of the hotel.  The outdoor walk to our room with some concrete in disrepair made it feel like we were staying at a motel.  Then our room was dark and quite smelly.  The area had had a lot of rain so it was likely mold or mildew.  Nonetheless it was problematic and caused us to go out to look for air fresheners.  We were just staying one night but we would have sought other accommodations if it had been longer.  Again, the staff and breakfast were great so they are doing the best they can with a hotel that is in need of renovation.

The hotel is located right on Pacific Coast Highway #1 so it is conveniently accessed, but subject to some road noise in every room.  Parking is off the highway in the back which is actually the front in so far as the entrance and pickup place for Uber/ Lyft rides. Rooms are of varied sizes. We had a King balcony suite which translates into a small walled balcony with one chair off the bedroom on the highway side with a limited view of the Pacific through the trees. The carpets were worn and the rooms decently appointed, but somewhat outdated. There's plenty of restaurants nearby within walking distance. The front desk is extremely y cordial and helpful. The elevator is SLOW. Breakfast is included, but it is really not very nutritious and looked even less so.

Living in Dana Point my wife and I and our cat needed to stay at a hotel for a few days while our house was being fumigated for termites.The staff was extremely nice and accommodating. We stayed in the King deluxe with a extra room with a couch and chair and second TV. The room was clean and comfortable.They have a small breakfast in the morning included in your stay but being literally only minutes walking distance from the Dana Point Harbor there are numerous restaurants to choose from. I would highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Hi Bernie!  I'm sure that having to leave your home for the extermination work had to be pretty stressful so I'm glad the staff of the Marina Shores made you feel comfortable and welcome.  Hopefully everything back at your house is taken care of and your family has settled back in to life as it should be.  In the future, if you ever have friends or family come to visit, please remember the service spirit you experienced with us and refer them to the Marina Shores Hotel with full confidence that we will take excellent care of them.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel in a beautiful area!!!
Summary: We stayed the night before taking a day trip to Catalina Island.  This is a very clean, well kept facility, conveniently located on Pacific Coast Hwy, very close to Dana Point Harbor.  We would highly recommend it, if you‚Äôre looking to stay in the area!!!!
Manager Response: Hi Ken!  Thank you for the great review and we hope your excursion to Catalina was fun and exciting.  There are tons of things to see and do along the our stretch of the California coast too and Dana Point makes a great central location for anyone's vacation.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Experience
Summary: Checked in on Saturday 1/26/19; Checked out on Sunday 1/27/19. Quick overnight get-away to visit Dana Point, get to the Beach and do some reading and relaxation.  This hotel is conveniently located on PCH 1 and walking distance to the Dana Point Harbor where there is great food, entertainment, activities for all.  Interacted with the front office at Check-in and Check-out and on both occasions the interactions were very pleasant. I had a standard room with 2 queens and the room was spacious, well decorated with tasteful beach decor. Not to mention the room was very clean and well appointed. The room attendants that serviced the 3rd floor on both Saturday and Sunday always greeted/acknowledged me as I walked down the hallway which was very nice and welcoming. Complimentary
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful review, both of the Marina Shores Hotel and our fantastic little beach community.  Isn't it amazing that, in this day and age, it is still the simplest human interactions - pleasant greetings and friendly conversation - that we notice the most?  We are thrilled that you enjoyed your brief stopover and hope your next trip allows you to be our guest a little longer!

Summary: Check in staff was courteous and helpful. Everyone was friendly. Breakfast was satisfying. They thought of little details like cheese to put on the eggs and chocolate chips to add on the pancakes. There were gluten free, low fat and keto options. Get there early. Breakfast ended at 10 sharp, but they ran out of hot food around 9:30. This is an older hotel, but they've done a good job keeping up with maintenance. The beds were comfy with duvet covers. Bring your own shampoo and body wash. The ones provided were too small to wash a barbie doll and it was difficult getting anything out. Our room had a balcony with a view of the ocean. I enjoyed the sea breeze, but had to close the windows at night due to heavy traffic right outside.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review of your time at the Marina Shores and we are so happy that you enjoyed your time with us and in Dana Point.  I LOVE it when people comment that "this is an older hotel, but ..."  Modern, pre-fab, steel and glass construction may have it's place, but cookie-cutter hotels are so impersonal and boring.  Our area of the beach community is very historic and it's an honor to be a part of that design and feeling that keeps Dan Point from turning into a tourist trap.  Awesome observation and thank you again.

Summary: Loved this place.  Quiet, clean and check in easy.  Great full breakfast.  Bobby on the desk so friendly and helpful.  Good price.  Gave us inside recommendations from locals for dinner.  Comfortable bed. Good parking.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review and Bobby sends his best.  I'm so glad you mentioned the "locals" aspect because that's something often missed in reviews.  Hotels everywhere are inundated with promotional offers from local restaurants and shops - recommend us to your guests and we'll give your staff great discounts - kind of a "you scratch our back and we'll scratch yours" thing.  At the Marina Shores, we'd rather make the best referrals we can so we simply ask "what are you in the mood for?" and go from there.  We know the dives with the best barbecue, we know where the locals go when they want the best seafood, steaks or foreign cuisines and we would rather send you someplace where you'll come back happy (and full!) than someplace that will give us 50% off because we dropped their name.  I'll take this opportunity to remind all travelers that a hotel is not just a place to stay while you're in town.  It is literally a base of operations while you plan out your activities, so knowing that the staff has your best interests and comfort at heart is a big plus.  Referrals for dining and sightseeing can make or break a vacation.  Business travelers looking for a brief respite from work need to know they can count on the recommendations made by the staff - your time is valuable and we will always do our best to make sure you enjoy ALL aspects of your stay, even the ones that take place away from the Marina Shores Hotel!

Summary: Great little hotel in a nice areaNice free breakfast and friendly staff. Sleeping experience good, as mattresses are very comfortable. Hotel is always very clean and well kept. Rooms well appointed with a refrigerator in each room
Manager Response: We appreciate your review and are happy you enjoyed all aspects of your time with us.  Come back soon!

Summary Heading: Best of SoCal -Staff Awesome, Location - Beach in sight, Price is right.
Summary: Call during the week and ask for Diane Reynolds.  She will book you at the best rate, make you feel like your her friend instantly  -  She cares!!!She grew up here and don‚Äôt be afraid to ask her where to eat shop , swim  etc.  She is Right on. Breakfast and Coffee was pretty good.Entire staff are so friendly.  I mean all thisI‚Äôm a tough customer and I have no complaints.  Staff greatGive you 4 star Concierge attention!
Manager Response: Diane asked me to pass along her gratitude for the recognition you gave her.  She has been a front desk attendant at the Marina Shores longer than anyone else and for an obvious reason.  We are proud of her and appreciate that you not only felt the warmth and welcoming spirit she provides, but that same spirit throughout the staff.  We're glad that you enjoyed your time with us and look forward to the next time you "come home."

Summary: This was a good place to stay, given its proximity to the Doheny State beach. I did not bring a car along with me. Uber is quite easily accessible and the prices of uber is quite competitive. There are couple of good restaurants/fast food available just outside the hotel. The rooms were quite spacious for us and I had no hassles anytime. The staff are polite and quite responsive for your needs. On the flip I feel the breakfast is quite functional and elementary. I would have preferred that they do provide some variety , especially when you are around for more than 3-4 days. Even though we had green tea during our initial stays, getting this later was difficult, probably they ran out of supply. The room which were allocated to us had a corridor which was exposed and it could get
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice review and we are happy you enjoyed most aspects of your stay at the Marina Shores Hotel.  The free breakfast will always be a challenge for hotels like ours that doesn't have a full service restaurant.  We do rotate our menu every day to try and provide some variety and frequently try new products so we can offer the best that is available.  Breakfast will always be a "work in progress."

Summary Heading: Very Nice and has everything you need
Summary: This has become our "Go-To" hotel in Dana Point.  We are in town approximately every 2-3 months.  They usually have a good rate too.  Friendliest staff.  Everything you need is included: Daily Breakfast, in-room internet, computers in the lobby along with a printer if you need it, coffee, mini-fridge, easy parking (extra $).  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  The location is central to everything. They even have 2 coin-operated washers/dryers along with the soap/bleach/dryer sheets (for purchase) if you need to do wash.  Requires quarters.  Front desk is very accommodating in order to give you change. They even allow pets.  I've never noticed anything negative about pets being here.  I can't say enough.  It's very clean and nice.  Everything seems to always be kept up.  Stay
Manager Response: So sorry for the delay in responding to your review ... even hotel managers get to go on vacation sometimes!  (laughing)  We're so glad that you recognize the atmosphere we promote at the Marina Shores.  Our mantra of "May all who come as guests, leave as friends" is a service philosophy we try to promote in every aspect of your stay.  Even when someone is travelling on business, there's no reason why they can't feel like they're on vacation, right?  Thank you for the kind words and we hope that the Trip Advisor readers will make us their "go-to" hotel in Dana Point as well.

Summary: At least 7-10 rooms with dogs in them Do not want to stay on a room that has had dogs in it !!! Do any of the dogs have fleas??... pretty ALL dogs !!Do they clean the rooms well enough to mitigate germs , fleas ticks !!??I don‚Äôt think so!!!Plus you can smell them And they Bark at 4 am!!! Seems they are as pet friendly as they are marijuana friendly !!...Wow!! NOT the standard I wish to purchase anymore at this location!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review of your stay at the Marina Shores Hotel ... while we strive to offer everyone a positive experience and when that doesn't occur, we need to be held accountable.  Yes, we are a pet friendly hotel (one of the few in Dana Point) and we deep clean every pet room when the guest checks out, whether they were here for one night or ten.  Some hotels designate particular rooms as "pet rooms" but what ends up happening is that these rooms end up taking a tremendous beating and when the hotels are full, guests without pets are forced to use them.  Since none of our rooms end up with pets in them stay after stay, we can remain on top of any deep cleaning issues.  Since we are a pet friendly hotel, we have had many guests with allergies express concern over the possibility of dander or other traces left behind, but have never ended up experiencing anything unpleasant once they arrived.  That is a credit to our housekeeping and maintenance staff.  The barking and marijuana smell is a completely separate issue and I am reviewing this with our overnight staff to find out how this went unchecked.  We have a zero tolerance rule for people who leave unattended animals in their rooms who end up disturbing other guests and, as a 100% smoke free hotel, we don't allow ANY substances like tobacco or marijuana to be smoked within the building.  I give you my assurance that this is being looked into and our night staff and security will not allow this to happen again.

Summary: This best western was one of the best I have ever stayed at and I have stayed at a bunch over the past couple of years - it was the staff that made this hotel - they checked our group in quickly - they made great recommendations for food - the rooms were spacious - it was nicer than the hotel I am staying in on Catalina Island now - and at a much better price. The hotel was close to the marina and beach - had a great bbq joint right next door- I would definitely stay at this hotel again !
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review and we are so happy that you enjoyed your time at the Marina Shores and we hope your trip to beautiful Catalina Island provided you and your family with some great memories of your vacation on the southern coast of California.  We are very proud of our awesome staff and the spirit of hospitality they share and I will pass on your recognition to them all.  Come back and see us soon!

Summary: Thank you to the staff here for being so nice and helpful. Rooms were very clean and check in/out was very convenient.Morning breakfast had great choices. Great location,easy access to the freeway.We really enjoyed our stay.

Local to Marina, Beach and Dining! In the morning, Barie made us feel like family.  Great location and service. Took our christmas photos by the beach, walking distance. Living room space fantasic! Enjoy

This hotel is decent, with polite and attentive staff, good location, and a good breakfast.  However, the room (a "king suite") is way too small. It had the least counter space of any hotel I have stayed in for the last 20 years. There was barely a place to put a toiletries bag. The sink is tiny. The tub is tiny. The bathroom is tiny.  There are no free-standing tables . . . the dressers are covered by lamps and big TV's. The desk is OK, but only usable by one person for a writing table.  The parking lot is very difficult . . . very long, lots of pillars, about 55 spaces for 100+ rooms. And they charge extra for parking.  Bottom line is that the things that are subject to easy modification -- breakfast, internet, staff -- are pretty good. The things that are hard to change --
Manager Response: Dear Jeffrey,  Thank you for taking the time to review and rate your experience at the Marina Shores and I sincerely regret that the layout and design of the hotel did not meet with your needs.  The bathrooms in our two-room suites do have very limited counter space and the oval design of the jetted tubs may make them appear to be smaller - a few inches shorter than a standard tub, but a few inches wider as well.  I have a feeling you didn't see the signs at the far end of the main parking garage that indicates additional parking on the lower level.  The spaces down there are much wider and provides an ample amount of parking for our guests.  In spite of your overall dissatisfaction, you did point out that the staff of the hotel was good, and your objectivity is greatly appreciated.

Summary Heading: Not the best, but not the worst...
Summary: The rooms could use a remodel...smelled musty.  Very dark as well, not a lot of light.  The carpets needed either a good cleaning or to be replaced!  Unless you drive a compact car, parking is very, very tight.  They need to have ice machines on every floor - we were on the 3rd floor and had to go down to the second floor for any ice.  The one and only elevator in the lobby moved at a snails pace.    Good thing, it's close to the beach - less than a mile.
Manager Response: Not the worst, but pushing very hard to get better!  Now that the majority of the tourist season in over, all the hotels in the area are gearing up for their off-season, deep cleaning projects and the Marina Shores is no exception.  We will be systematically breaking down each guest room, steam cleaning all the carpets, painting walls and trim - anything that needs to be done that we couldn't address when running at full capacity.  Please accept my apologies that we weren't looking our best while you stayed with us.  It was a long and very busy summer at the beach.

Summary: The staff was excellent! The amenities were great! I was with a wedding party on a weekend where two were booked into the hotel. The service was impeccable from housekeeping, front desk, and management.
Manager Response: We're so glad you enjoyed your time with us and it is always so uplifting to hear that we've hit one out of the park.  You're 100% correct ... the staff here is awesome and I am so honored to have such a wonderful team.  Thank you again!

Summary: Ok. So I stayed at this hotel because my college roommate was getting married at a venue in Dana Point. I love this hotel. It is very clean, very quiet, and very close to everything. Doheny beach is about 5 minutes away. Plus, it is close to some great restaurants. I took a Lyft to Laguna Beach, which was about a 20 minute ride. Staff was soooo awesome. They are very nice. They have sausage, eggs, pancakes, yogurt, cereal for breakfast, but again,  there are some great restaurants around if you want some other options. I definitely recommend this hotel for your stay. Also, if you are visiting this area, I recommend flying into John Wayne Airport, not LAX. LAX is further away and the LA traffic is not pretty.
Manager Response: Thank you for this absolutely awesome review, not only of the Marina Shores, but of the Dana Point area as well.  I hope your friend's wedding was a smashing success and that ALL the guests had a wonderful time no matter where they stayed!

Summary: The staff at this location was phenominal. They were so incredibly friendly and made it feel like we were friends for a long time! The cleanliness of the hotel was top notch and I noticed it instantly. The bed was pretty comfortable but just a tad stiff for what we like. The location was great and not far from our friends who were staying in other counties. Parking was never an issue and they were extremely booked so it was super to always have close parking to the building. Room service was quick and effcient. I would definetly stay at this location again if I am ever in the area!
Manager Response: Hi Kellie!  We're glad we were able to make you a part of our family for a few days.  We do our best to make sure everyone feels truly welcome and comfortable ... and we hope you will be making that return trip sometime soon!

Summary Heading: No way u should stay here
Summary: Dated dark dismal hotel. Rate us only because it is in Dana point. Check in wasn‚Äôt ready at 3pm. Room was dark, shower was dangerous to get in. Funny smell, dated decor, old paint. Only reason they are charging $200 is that it is in OC.
Manager Response: We are sincerely sorry for your disappointment with the Marina Shores Hotel.  When the hotel was renovated just six years ago, the idea was to stay true to the older, historic design that represents Dana Point so the dark woods and the rustic colors were part of the overall plan.  I fully understand that tastes vary ... some think our hotel is beautiful and others don't.  The important thing is that travelers know what they like so I encourage everyone to compare online photos and descriptions of any hotels they are considering before making a choice.

Summary Heading: Memorable for All the Wrong Reasons
Summary: Our stay here was peculiar at best and appalling in parts. It was also our first (and definitely last) stay at a Best Western property. Here's a quick recap of the pros and cons. I try hard to be objective in my reviews and this is no different. The negatives outweigh the positives by more than enough to justify the overall rating.   PROS:   1. The location is good. It's not too far from Laguna Beach, and its proximity to other beaches is a big advantage and the biggest reason one would stay here.  2. The staff are welcoming, although they can only do so much. 3. The rooms (we had a third-floor suite) are decently-appointed and clean on the inside.   CONS:  1. Let me get right to the biggest issue. The rooms' balconies are separated by dividers that are off the ground, and the
Manager Response: On behalf of your inconsiderate neighbor, I apologize for them not attending to their pet and allowing their dog to not only urinate on the balcony, but to crawl through the small space underneath the partition.  While we are proud of the fact that we are one of the few pet friendly hotels in town, we fully realize that we are the ones who are ultimately responsible for the negligence of any pet owners who stay here ... and for that, I am truly sorry.  That small space below the partition is just the building design to assist with drainage in the event of a heavy rain.  To clarify with the power outage - an automobile had hit a pole several blocks north of the hotel and a large section of Dana Point was without electricity while the repairs were being made.  All of the restaurants and businesses along our section of PCH were without power, so it had nothing to do with us.  We do our best to make our guests as comfortable as possible when things like this happen ... we provide flashlights or heavy duty glow sticks so they can get around, but a backup generator large enough to power the entire hotel would have to be huge and would simply be impractical.  I've checked with most of the hotels in town and one of the five-star resorts has a generator to power lights in the public areas, but none have the facilities to keep their entire hotel supplied with electricity.  Just like at home, we are dependent on the fast and efficient service of our local power company.  Fortunately, the repair crews from SDGE do an excellent job, so when our area does lose power due to accidents or other causes, they generally restore service very quickly.  We're sorry for your discomfort and hope you understand that this had nothing to do with our being negligent.

Summary: Our family had a wonderful stay at the best western Marina Shores hotel.  Great customer service awesome rates comfortable beds and one of the best breakfasts! We look forward to visiting and staying again soon.
Manager Response: Hey Monique!  Thank you for the GREAT review and we're thrilled that you had such a wonderful time while with us.  You are welcome back ANY time!

Summary: We stayed for 3 nites and had a 2 room suite w 2 queens. the extra space made our stay more enjoyable than a single room. Location great across from the beach and marina and walkable to grocery shopping and food. Dana Point is awesome and Laguna Beach is a short drive. The staff was attentive and spot on. We look forward to our next visit
Manager Response: Hi Jim!  Glad you had such a wonderful time and enjoyed exploring Dana Point and the neighboring beach communities.  It goes without saying the we're especially pleased that you were so happy with our role in your stay!  Welcome to the Marina Shores family and we look forward to your return.

Summary: I have stayed here twice for an annual conference. It is clean, quiet and the staff are friendly.  Breakfast is a plus! My room did not have a safe, which would have made it a little more convenient in which to store my ipad, watch etc. But overall  I highly recommend a stay.
Manager Response: So glad that you enjoyed your time with us and hope the conference was a huge success.  If you return to the Marina Shores, we do have safe deposit boxes at the front desk for our guests to use.  There is no charge for them.

Summary: Stayed at this best western for the tall ship festival in Dana Point, ca. Stayed in room 286. Nice, clean, quiet room. Overlooks some homes on st of crystal latern. Breakfast included. Staff is friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Hi Sandra!  The annual Tall Ships Festival in a great event in Dana Point and we are so happy that you chose the Marina Shores Hotel for your stay while attending.  Thank you for recognizing our friendly staff ... we all go the extra mile to make sure our guests feel welcomed and comfortable.  Hope you return for the festival next year and remember us when you book your next stay!

Summary Heading: SLEEP OVER TO CATCH FISHING BOAT EARLY!
Summary: The hotel was clean and well maintained. The rooms were updated, clean and TV was easy to work. We stayed there to be close to the marina, in order to catch the 6am boat---so we didn't get the breakfast that started at 6:30. The staff was a little resistant to give a late check out but later resolved with the manager. The price was a little high for this type of hotel with no bellmen or valet. A fine hotel overall for families with a fridge and microwave .

Nice ocean view but the room is too dirty and stinky, it is also too expensive, I won't come back to this hotel ever again. I will not recommend this place, if you like a place closer to the beach access and you don't mind over pricing and the smell, then it's all up to you.
Manager Response: Words cannot express my sorrow over the conditions you described during your stay.  If you look over other reviews of the Marina Shores Hotel, the two most consistent compliments we receive is for our friendly service and exceptionally clean rooms ... this is why I find your comments so concerning.  I invite you to contact me directly at the hotel so I can get more information and take it up with our head of housekeeping.  All of our rooms are inspected prior to being released for occupancy by a new guest.  Sometimes the outside ocean air leaves a stale odor behind, but we have products and equipment we can use to clean and purify the air in our guest rooms and utilize them frequently.  If we someone managed to miss this, I would at least like the opportunity to apologize to you in person.  The conditions you describe in no way reflect the standards we set and strive to meet every day.

Summary: The location of this hotel is really good, easily walkable from Doheny Beach and Dana Point Harbour. The rooms are a little darker and smaller than the photos on the internet and the air conditioning sounds like a plane taking off! There is a balcony, and you can see the ocean from it (sideways) but it is on a really busy road and so I don‚Äôt imagine you would sit on it for long. All was going well until about 2.00 am when a party started down the hall that continued on until 5.30 am at least. We were thankful of the loud air conditioning then as it drowned a bit of the noise out! It was really bad at the front of the room near the corridor where my son was sleeping on the sofa bed and he ended up in the two smallish double beds with us and his two sisters. Not a very comfortable
Manager Response: Please accept my deepest apologies for your stay being disrupted by the noise and I hope you will have a few moments to contact me directly at the hotel so I can get more information on the incident.  We DO have a 24 desk staff and security that patrols the property overnight just to make certain that issues like this don't occur, so I find this whole report most concerning.  I assure you, if I happened to walk out to the desk while you were checking out, I was completely unaware that anything was wrong or I would have stepped in immediately.  Again, please call me directly at the hotel so I can get the full details from you and take appropriate action to ensure that nothing like this ever happens again.

Summary: We go down almost yearly for our son's summer camp at Ocean Institute and stay at BW Plus Marina Shores. It is close to the beach and convenient restaurants. The staff for the most part is friendly and helpful.

The rooms are clean, the location is good (walkable to the Lantern district and close enough to highway 5), and the staff is friendly.  Our favourite feature is the walkability to local restaurants, CVS and even a pricey grocery store.  The hotel and surrounding businesses are on a hill so most of the walking is up and down the hill.  Overall the rooms and floors seemed a bit dated but it was clean and well maintained.  Note: on-site parking is split into 2 levels and some spaces require backing in and around the building's pillars.

3.5* Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel Dana Point Tricky finding the parking lot (bottom floors) Renovated motel; furnishing look good, but some of the basic services are antiquated e.g., plumbing The complimentary breakfast gets mixed reviews. Real eggs okay; egg white patties are tasteless. Good sausages. An assortment of breads and cereals. Toaster available. The gluten-free bagels are also tasteless. Coffee is good. Non-fat and 2% milk. Make-own-pancake machine. Have Chobani yogurt which is GMO! Cupcakes. Juices from the machine taste acidy or watery.  Staff is very helpful and friendly

Very nice staff and great room set up.  Don't be alarmed by busy road, noise was not an issue.  Great space in the room and the bathroom is between the living area and bedroom, which makes it ideal for a party of 5 and multi generations.

There were several positives:  super great variety of breakfast items,  and a very helpful,  friendly male employee who greeted the guests every morning.  We stayed in a 2 room suite,  which had plenty of plugins,  2 TVs,  and was very clean and spacious.  Also,  you could not hear the a/c come on,  but it was efficient.  There was a jetted bath tub. Now the cons (at least for me):  our room had an outdoor corridor,  which was loud as others would wheel their suitcase over the concrete.  The elevator was extremely slow,  so I took the stairs often.  This is so pet friendly hotel,  which usually isn't a concern,  but bringing a large,  furry dog into the breakfast room,  isn't sanitary.  Also,  the hotel allows 2 dogs up to 90 lbs each.  My husband was a little anxious when he

Summary Heading: My mother n laws 80 Birthday party
Summary: My wife and I and my Service dog Max stayed here in late July and the staff and establishment was over the top accommodating. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and everything was magnificent. The breakfast was more than adequate. Pool is nice and the hotel is very centrally located to Dana Point! The price was right! Thank you and see y‚Äôall in November for thanksgiving.

This hotel is really more of a motel.  While the people are really nice, I won‚Äôt be staying there again.  The first night, our bathroom had a faulty lock and locked itself.  Not good at 2:30 am when you have to go.  To make things worse, I had to walk outside to get to the front desk. A little creepy!  The guy at the front gave me a dime and said it would unlock but it didn‚Äôt so I had to go back down.  He came up, still didn‚Äôt work so he gave me a key to a room 2 doors down to use.  They sent a handy man to switch out the door knob/lock at 8 am.  Lastly, I left my favorite linen shirt in the closet and called 2 days later and it was missing.  That was the biggest bummer of all.    I feel like I should have gotten free parking or a discount or at the very least an apology of some
Manager Response: Dear Denise,  Please accept my apologies again for the issues with your bathroom door.  I'm actually the one who came up to try and fix it for you in the middle of the night.  Although I did apologize to you several times while I worked on the door, you seemed to take it all well and also appeared satisfied when I gave you use of the closest room for your bathroom needs.  Apparently I misjudged your good nature about the incident as satisfaction, so I have also processed a partial refund to your bill as compensation for the inconvenience.

Summary: The hotel was average, not the greatest but because of the location and price we weren't expecting much.  Great location to walk to the marina though but a little far to have to walk to the lamplight district.  It was clean and quiet.

Summary Heading: Very conmfortable but slightly dated hotel in the central marina area.
Summary: This medium size hotel with an adequate lobby and good restaurant.  The complementary breakfast was very good.  The front desk personnel were helpful, friendly and courteous.  The hotel room was large, comfortable and clean.  Self-parking beneath the hotel.  Good value: $$.

We stayed 5 nights here, and we had 2 comfortable queen beds, a set off room that had a sleeper sofa, and a patio. A laundry room is outside, accessible by room key card. Salt Creek Beach was nearby and had cheap parking. This was a great location if you want a hotel south of L.A. Breakfast was great...lots of choices and the staff went out of their way to be friendly and clear extra dishes. Would definitely recommend!
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your weeklong stay with us and that our staff really made you feel welcome.  That is the exact experience we strive for with every guest of the Marina Shores.

Summary: Stayed here for two nights with family and overall it was a wonderful place to stay with almost no downside, I would recommend to anyone.  Rooms are recently updated and in excellent condition.  Despite being on the PCH, we found our room to be very quiet and private.  Breakfast in the morning is above average and hotel staff is extremely pleasant and helpful.  Close walk to Doheny beach just right across the street basically, and several decent restaurants just a short walk up the street.    Only real downside is that it would be nice to have beach views and be ON the water, but that's pretty hard to come by and certainly can't knock them for an excellent location.

Summary Heading: Clean room, decent  breakfast, friendly and helpful staff
Summary: The title of my review says it all. I might add that it was quiet and the beds were comfortable. The only negative is that they charged $10.00 to park in their private lot at the back of the building....where else were we going to park???

Don‚Äôt let the ‚ÄúBest Western‚Äù name scare you away. This is a great place to stay in Dana Point. It is very clean and the rooms are nice. Numerous places to eat are right across the street. Every staff person that I came in contact with was really friendly. Will surely stay here again!
Manager Response: We're thrilled that you were so happy with your stay at the Marina Shores, but I'll admit that the "don't let the Best Western name scare you away" item kinda threw me.  Once upon a time, there was a new hotel brand that pioneered the idea of networking hotels rather than franchising them.
