Unlike franchises that are mostly cookie-cutter, no personality properties, this network of hotels formed a membership where they all referred guests to one and other, but each hotel was unique ... combining the best qualities of independent hotels with the marketing and purchasing power of the big franchises.  This was the concept that created Best Western.  As the years passed and the family of hotels grew, there became a huge inconsistency from one hotel to the next ... one could be a budget, no frills property along the highway and another could be a luxury, full service hotel in the heart of metropolitan America.  Travelers became confused because they didn't know what to expect from one Best Western to the next.  In 2011, Best Western created three separate tiers - Best Western, Best Western Plus and Best Western Premier - in an attempt to clarify for all travelers the level of service, quality and amenities they could expect during their stay.  I promise you, "Best Western" is not a name to be scared of (smiling).  We're glad you were pleasantly surprised by the Marina Shores in Dana Point and hope you will remember your experience here and book with our brand, wherever your travels may take you.

Summary: Very clean.  Staff was very friendly.  Only complaint is the mattress sagged and was uncomfortable. Location was great.  Right next to Dana Point Harbor and Doheny  State Beach.   Lots of restaurants near by.

Summary Heading: Great place, great value, nice staff!
Summary: This is my second time at the BW Dana Point. I had 2 days of work in Dana Point and the BW is conveniently located. Clean property, easy parking, really friendly and helpful front-desk staff. The rooms are perfectly clean, wifi solid, breakfast has enough options for everyone. I even forgot my toothbrush and they gave me one and some travel sized toothpaste. I got a good rate by becoming a BW member and was welcomed with a goody-bag. Nice touch. This place feels like a mom and pop run place, not corporate. I would def come back.

Summary Heading: Great location. Walk to marina and beach. Good parking.
Summary: We stayed for 5 nights and everything was perfect except the room smelled a bit funky, like dog or musty or something but it appeared very clean. I can't say enough about how nice the staff treats their guests. The breakfast and breakfast room is very nice with flowers on the table and a full breakfast. The attendants keep everything perfect and are very nice. We had a car but walked to the marina and caught the boat to Catalina Island and went to the restaurants on the marina. The beach is a 5 minute walk where you can enjoy the beach or walk or swim. Lots of surfers to watch too. The shuttle bus which took us to the Doheny Blues Festival was no more than a 10 minute walk. There is a Rib joint next door to the hotel and couple more restaurants a little further up the road. I

Great staff amenities were lacking. Would give the hotel another chance because of the staff. The pool wasn't available during our stay which was a letdown. Every question I had was answered by the staff.

Extremely satisfied with our stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great. The room was clean and nice. Overall great place to stay. We will definitely come back and stay here again..

I spent two nights here while visiting family. The bed was comfortable enough and the room reasonably clean. The parking spaces were a bit tight. The breakfast spread was generous and ample. The main reason to stay here, though, is the close proximity to Dana Point Harbor, just a few short blocks away. "I shall never forget the impression which our first landing on the beach of California make upon me," wrote Richard Henry Dana, Jr. in Two Years Before the Mast, published in 1840. Words that have stood the test of time, to say the least. Check it out!

walking distance from the harbor and beach, quiet, central air in the rooms, view of the harbor......heaven in dana point. the breakfast isnt bad and several options to eat out surround youn all within walking distance

The staff was great the cleanliness was great the breakfast was great the service was just phenomenal really appreciated you guys already made three more reservations for this year. Located in an awesome spot right down the street from Doheny beach

We stayed at the BW Marina Shores for one night. I booked an executive suite king room with a balcony and to be honest I did not expect much because of the low rate the hotel charged. We arrived about an hour before check in time and the hotel got us into our room.  The room was not large but it has some features that you find in upscale hotels. There was a separate living area with a sofa bed and chair and tv.  Then the bedroom had its own tv with a desk and balcony.  I like having my own television because my wife and I can never agree on what to watch. And even though the hotel is about a mile from the ocean, our room still had a sea view. I could actually see all the way up the coastline towards San Clemente. The hotel also provides free breakfast which was decent with good

We stayed here as part of a honeymoon road trip.  The hotel is situated on the side of a very busy main road so you can't really miss it, although it is slight difficult to find the entrance.  Check in was easy and the room and the bed was massive. Much bigger than other similar hotels.  The breakfast was fantastic lots of choice and the staff were very attentive and always looked to clear your plates.  Across the road there is a number of fast food restaurants including subway, tacos and more. Location wise it is only a few minute drive from the harbour where you can go whale watching and walk along the beach.

This was a fantastic property for me while I moved from San Clemente to Laguna.  I had one night where I was in between properties.  This BW+ has the friendliest staff, offered the most competitive rate along with a AAA discount.  The property was fully booked, but you would never know.  Extremely quiet and a great experience.

Have driven by this property a number of times. Wanted to use some of my points for a free night and paid for the second. To do that you have to make the reservation through the rewards program which is very helpful. Upon arriving at the check in I was followed by a man with a large labrador dog, beautiful animal. It was funny when he stood up and looked over the counter at the young man checking in his master and him.  The host made a comment about a signature or paw print needed. My host mentioned that he had upgraded our room to one with a balcony. It was a king suite. Little more than a balcony and  a jetted tub. There was a little bit of remodeling going on so the parking was a bit tricky, the pool was closed. Very helpful staff from the front desk to the house keepers.

Summary Heading: Intimate mini vacation before the big family shindig
Summary: We weren't expecting much more than a place to lay our heads ( ahem...the pillows could have been better), but were astounded by the hospitality by EVERY SINGLE EMPLOYEE. Foster helped this cranky couple as we arrived with a multitude of problems and idiosyncracies. He was so happy to be our solution hero and threw in some extras that showed us the love! The food service department bent over backwards to accommodate our whiny selves and made a pot of extra strong coffee just for us, hot and ready when we dragged our selves down to breakfast in the morning. Tamara, you are the best! Thanks to all, we really did come as guests and leave as family. We'll be back!

Summary Heading: Basic, Aging Property in Good Location
Summary: This is an older motel situated directly on the Pacific Coast Highway. Our room had a balcony overlooking that highway and an exterior corridor. We had brought a fan to reduce noise from the balcony side, and there was another fan in the room to further assist in noise management. So we were OK in avoiding significant road noise that would have interfered with sleep. The exterior corridor faced north, which made for a chilly walk in the morning to exit and/or obtain breakfast. Not fun.  The in-room coffee is superior to that of the breakfast bar. Breakfast is very basic but there are a variety of hot and cold choices. Seemed to be frozen then defrosted fare, nothing fancy. Coffee and tea were very generic and inexpensive stuff.   Our room did have features requested, including a

We walked to the hotel from the Catalina Express.  We had booked a larger room with spa bath.  The room was very spacious with good amenities.  The breakfast was as expected.  The staff were helpful.  The view from the room is only of the road, but great views can be seen if you walk a bit.  The pool wasn't in use.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, parking not so great
Summary: Parking at this hotel is not good and there‚Äôs no way to change it. Parking spaces are small. If the car next to you parks crooked or over too much you can‚Äôt get in the next spot. Support beams for the building are every 2 spaces so you have to contend with that while parking also. The parking is under the building and second floor rooms. So, if your room is there (like mine) you can hear all late night/early morning car starts in your room.

Good location - walking distance from beautiful park and marina and ocean - and a multitude of dining spots of all type.  Good (and real) breakfast included (eggs, sausages, hash-browns, rolls, fruit and pancakes, etc.)  I'd stay here again.

Summary Heading: The gem of our California road trip
Summary: We stayed 3 nights at Best Western Marina Shores Hotel in August 2017. This was our last stop in the 11 nights California road trip and by far was the best location, accommodation and service that we have experienced. The employees at the reception, at the breakfast serving and room services were very professional, courteous and friendly. The location is on a busy highway, but is very safe and convenient doesn‚Äôt matter if you are walking to the beach or marina, taking a free trolley or driving. The reception area and the hallways are very tastefully decorated. Our room was very big, clean and very well equipped. The king size bed and a sofa bed were very comfortable and the bedding was very high quality. The sitting area and the balcony added that homey feeling to a hotel room.

Wife and I started coming here about 3 years ago. We love this best western. It's walking/driving distance to the beach and to the harbour. Probably better to drive. The front desk people are the best. They are friendly and very helpful.

Summary Heading: We Never Get Tired in Returning to a Great Location!
Summary: Our last visit at Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel was April 25, 2017 with my wife.  It was excellent as usual.  With traveling and and other situations that came up, we celebrated our 43rd Anniversary there.  Peter C. - General Manager and Diane R - Front Desk was exceptional and gracious.  Even though we celebrated our anniversary late they made us feel like that day April 25, 2017 was our special day since it is in January. My wife loved it.  Speaking from experience that has to be part of the key to happiness.  They provided to us wine and flowers. The staff is always nice, kind and will go out of their way to make you feel at home.  Also what I like is the excellent customer service from Peter, Diane and the other employees. A commitment they have for customer service

A great value for people traveling with their dogs. It is very dog-friendly and the area around the hotel is perfect for walks. This hotel is in a great location, too, it is close to most everything in Southern coastal Orange County.

We liked this place a lot. It started poorly as our Check-In time was supposed to be 3 PM and our room wasn't ready until 5:45. Nevertheless, the manager - Steve - was very friendly and aware of our concerns. When we did get into room, we immediately found drug paraphernalia in the bathroom. It was a poor start for this stay. Nevertheless, the room was very big, and nice. And the location is excellent - near the beach and restaurants. We think that this place could use improve it's service quality a little, but overall we were very happy and will stay there again.

Everything was good except for the parking fee... The guy that works at night Frazer I think that is his name was a fun guy, he is awesome, he made me feel like home The rest of the states were friendly too

This was my first time staying here and it was great. They were constantly cleaning the already meticulous facity. The room was great and the employees are super friendly. I will be back in April to see family again and will be staying g here again.

Nice hotel. No wonder why it was a great hotel.  There was a heated pool and it was close to the beach. Nearby attractions included Laguna Beach and Dana Point. Not far from theme parks like Disneyland and Disney California Adventure.

This is a very nice hotel, with friendly, helpful staff. It is close to hotels, beach and major highways. Great place to stay! Spacious rooms with whirlpool tubs, suites and secure onsite parking. I highly recommend staying here.

Friend recommended this hotel. We were going to a company Christmas party at a nearby resort that was highly overpriced for what you were getting.  We decided to take my friends suggestion.  Was not disappointed. in fact, it was even better than we expected. If you ever have the opportunity to  stay at this hotel.  You should you would definitely enjoy it.

Good value for a hotel close to the ocean.  Free complementary breakfast is good with enough selection to satisfy most people. Parking spaces are small and not a good choice for full size pu's with 4 doors.  Room/bathroom were both clean and the bed was comfortable.

We really enjoyed our stay here. Check-in was easy and fast. Our room was perfect. Jacuzzi tub was a nice surprise. TV was HD and had free movie channels. Wi-Fi worked excellent and was free! We will definitely be back. Restaurants were easy walking distance as well as the beach.

Summary Heading: This is how a hotel should be operated.
Summary: First of all the prices are so reasonable.  Second of all, the staff is very friendly and accomodating, no matter what time of day.  Third, the room was delightful.  I had a sitting room and a bedroom, both with tvs and had the luxury of a jacuzzi to enjoy.  I also had a little porch off the bedroom but it is pretty noisy to sit outside.  Everything was clean and comfortable.  Fourth - they serve a full breakfast complete with a pancake machine!  I was really pleased.

Walking distance to beautiful beach and beautiful area. Ocean view from hotel. Fast food restaurants right across the street. Marina with nice restaurants close by. Walking trails. Hotel is nice too. Friendly staff.

Clean room. Nice stay. The staff was very helpful and went out of their way to help when locked out of my room.  Parking was easy, and the hotel was very close to the places that I needed to get to.  Good stay.

Summary Heading: Not what it should have been
Summary: Stayed there one night while visiting the California Mission‚Äôs. Needed a place and found this on Trip Adviser. Checked in when OK. Now the not so good things. TV remote didn‚Äôt work, called front desk. He came to the room, found that only one of the two remotes worked properly on both TV. So he left us with the one remote. Next the bottom sheet had stuff on it. Not sure what it was but not nice. Called front desk again and told them we wanted new sheet. Showed up at the door with new sheet, when to hand it to me and I told him I wanted it changed. Showed him the problems and her was very apologetic. Next came the shower. The on/off knob was so stiff that the whole shower moved but not the knob. Finally it did move. The rod holding the hand held shower head was about to fall off

Great location, close to freeway, ocean very close, good restaurants nearby, ribs and Thai food, great and friendly staff, clean, great value, breakfast needs an upgrade, very comfortable, two tv, balcony and view

Summary Heading: Clean comfortable hotel. Close proximity to Dana Point Harbor, restaurants and nightlife.
Summary: Staff were incredibly helpful and friendly, truly enhanced our vacation experience.  Hotel location provided quick access to Dana Point harbor, ocean views.  Walking distance to restaurants and harbor amenities.  Short drive to Laguna Beach and San Clemente.

Wow. What a great place to take vacation. If you want the So.Cal. experience. This is the place. Walking distance to everything. State beach, marina, shopping and good food. I'm from So. Cal. and I've stayed at many places on the beach. This is one of my favorite.

Summary Heading: Excellent stay and great location for a festival!
Summary: I was there for the Dwiftwood country music festival and it was a 5 min walk to the venue on the beach. Everyone at the hotel was so nice and helpful. They even offered at check in to deliver our bags when the room was ready because we had to go over to the festival. The breakfast was amazing!! Also the room was amazing for three young women!! Thank you!!

I have not stayed at a Best Western for a long time, and I was impressed with the Marina Shores Hotel.  It was clean and well kept up.  The staff was friendly and service oriented.  The location was excellent or walking to the Harbor nearby or ubering to nearby sites to see.  Definitely would consider staying at this hotel for a pleasurable trip.

Summary Heading: walking distance to beach and park
Summary: Close to beach and shopping. beautiful sunsets. lots of great restaurants (especially Thai)  We parked the car for a few days and walked to everything. very pretty and safe location.I would go back anytime.

Summary Heading: Top notch, especially for EV drivers
Summary: Very pleasant hotel, great location in a scenic area. As of this writing, four EV chargers (two J-1772, two Tesla HPWC), available at no extra cost to guests. Also, extremely helpful staff in the breakfast area (one of our party was in a wheelchair).

The location of this hotel was magnificent.  It was right in the middle of amenities, shopping, and recreation.  The staff was caring, efficient and professional while still maintaining the the level of authentic friendliness I expect from Best Western.  The rooms were well appointed and comfortable.  The housekeeping staff kept the rooms spotless.  Great Stay!

My husband and I stopped here for two nights of our cross country road trip from VA to CA for our honeymoon. I don‚Äôt ever write reviews to be honest but I felt compelled to write this one since we had such an amazing experience. Dana Point was DEFINITELY our favorite stop out of the whole trip! We loved it so much we hope to live there one day. Our experience at this hotel was amazing from the moment we walked in the door thanks to Tom at the front desk! He made it obvious that he truly cared about our stay and wanted to make it unforgettable. He was very busy when we got there as he was the only person working the desk. We didn‚Äôt have a reservation yet and he let us view two different rooms before we chose our room on the third floor with a king bed, a separate living room and

We stayed one night for a wedding in San Juan Capistrano. The hotel was great! Large room, king size bed in ours, fold out couch worked well for our daughter. Staff was friendly, location was great, could see the ocean (a little) from our room. No surrounding noise. Would stay again! Picture is view from the room.

Summary Heading: The best place to stay in Orange County
Summary: The staff is second to none, rooms are large, clean and newly remodeled. The breakfast and wonderful. This is the best deal in Orange County. The property is in like new conditions. The staff is better than any other hotel I've ever stayed . I say that as a travel that spend over 90 days a year in hotel.

nice & comfortable breakfast offerings were good close to all we wanted a lot of road noise very low water pressure room was nicely laid out and quite comfortable, except only 1 sink would come back again if in the area

Great staff. Clean. New building construction in 2012. The place is very noisy. I could hear when my neighbors were taking showers and there were 2 dogs across the hall that kept barking. It sounded like they were right in front of me. I opted to be cheap and stay here versus the Marriott across the street for a wedding. Definitely understand why this place was a lot cheaper. You get what you pay for.

A little loud being so close to PCH. All good though have stayed at worse hotels. The breakfast needs some major overhaul. Staff was very helpful . Parking lot very tight spaces. Other than that had a great time at the beach for our 25th wedding anniversary.

A amazing hotel  with a A Team as the employees are  wonderful and so helpful. Manager  and Diane at the front desk were excellent. Great job keep up the great work.... We will return and let everyone know what a amazing place to stay.

Summary Heading: Well run but basic, parking extra
Summary: Typical best Western on main  drag in Dana Point.  No good views.  Parking $10/day extra.  Typical breakfast buffet, with an egg dish, a meat, make-you-own waffle/pancake. Staff couteous and place well kept.

This Best Western has the best staff that we have ever experienced. The breakfast staff was always welcoming and they remembered our names. The cleaning staff was great as well. They made sure we had what we needed. The front desk staff helped us with directions and finding the best places to eat.

Summary Heading: Just What we were looking for
Summary: Big room with comfortable king sized bed. Very large bathroom, door did not close completely, though. We were in room #237, which was on the end of the second floor, had a slight view of the Pacific, and overlooked the pool. Good room location. I was a little concerned that they had earplugs on the bedside table, but we found the room to be very quiet. Easy walk to the Marina and very close to our family, whom we were visiting in Laguna Beach. Also very easy drive to John Wayne airport.

Our booking experience with Diane was wonderful. We didn‚Äôt see or  interact with other staff particularly. Diane was there at check out and she is delightful and so helpful. She made this trip wonderful.  We kept the do not disturb sign on our room so we didn‚Äôt interact or have any comments about the room service.

I've stayed here several times and each and every time the service is better than before. They've updated and remodeled the breakfast area and it's beautiful. The breakfast hosts/hostesses are very accommodating and go out of their way to give you the friendliest service they can. There isn't a time when you can pass a hotel employee and not get a hello, good morning, or some sort of pleasant salutation along with are you enjoying your stay?  Rooms are clean and comfortable and housekeeping staff is excellent.   I can't say enough, this is my all time favorite place to stay and some of the rooms have the most beautiful ocean view. I highly recommend the Best Western Marina Shores to anyone visiting the area.

My daughter and I just took a trip to California.   We started in San Diego and headed north to the Las Angeles area.  I picked a hotel that was halfway between the two so I was not stuck driving at night to our next adventure in the L.A. area.  I found this Best Western just off the freeway.  I have to say that, generally Best Westerns are a "safe bet".  Well, this Best Western was better than that.  We were greeted by a very helpful receptionist who provided a "spot-on" place for dinner, they had a huge jacuzzi tub in the bathroom and a t.v. in the bathroom which my daughter took full advantage of.  We had a king size bed with all of the other normal accommodations of a hairdryer, iron and ironing board, etc.   The rooms stayed very dark and we slept a little longer than usual

This hotel was clean enough, and okay for a quick stay, but I probably would not stay there again. Didn't care for the location (right along the very busy Pacific Coast Highway, not near a marina), minimal parking (that costs $10/night), with a lower parking area that felt very isolated, especially at night. Entrance to rooms are accessed from an outdoor corridor. Pillows were small and lumpy, breakfast was typical and unappetizing, and business services were pretty lame.

My husband and I stayed here last week and had a wonderful experience. We were very impressed. The hotel is very clean with great amenities (comfortable beds, great towels, etc.). The staff are friendly and helpful and the complimentary breakfast is really good. A wide variety of items, scrambled eggs, has browns, ham, muffins, bagels, cereal, etc.  We definitely plan on staying here again when we come to Dana Point.

Nothing wrong with this hotel, but expect worn furniture and room fittings and basic facilities. Our room also had a very weird smell throughout.  Only upside is the price and the generally friendly staff.

Summary Heading: Noisy AC, smelly room and lame breakfast
Summary: Title sums it up. For the price we paid, it should have been much better. Location was good and I was glad we were not assigned a room on the main road. I usually don't complain but with the price charged plus had to pay to park your car I was disappointed.

We were impressed with the friendliness of the hotel staff from checkout to the breakfast room to checkout.  The rooms were quiet and comfortable.  Nice Bath and Body Works amenities in the bathroom. Good location in Dana Point.  Highly recommended!

Summary Heading: The ONLY place to stay in Dana Point!!!
Summary: The BW Marina Shores suites are great for families....The quality and value are both excellent...location is great and next to the harbor....Why pay an extra 125.00 per night to have a view of the harbor since your next to everything and the room is better and larger ....and includes breakfast.....The Dana Point...Laguna Beach/San clement area is designed to explore ....This is the hotel to stay at....Spend your extra $$$ on memories.....

We were pleasantly surprised by the amenities and location of this hotel. Everything was fresh and well kept and was easy to locate. The parking was a bit tight but otherwise an easy pleasant experience.

Comfortable hotel located right across from the beach - so if you are beach bound, this is the place to stay. Rooms have nice upgrades/amenities - but pillows could be more comfortable (we were only there to sleep, so that counted!). This is right on PCH so it can get noisy if you open your windows and the walls and doors are think so if there are a bunch of revelers roaming the halls, it can get a little loud. We thought it was pricey for a BW, but it's probably the location that made it so.

Came for the Ohana music festival.  The room was close, clean, comfortable.  The breakfasts were decent, The price was good.  The housekeeping staff was a little overly enthusiastic - but that's good if your room is a mess.  Staff was friendly and warm.

The hotel is located on the major high way and easy access to the beach, harbor,  good restaurant and St. Edward The Confessor Church in Dana Point. All in a walking distance.  The harbor and beach has limited parking so, many people just walk over instead of driving over.

Summary Heading: Best Western Marina Shores, Great Stay
Summary: Best Western Marina Shores Hotel is a great stay, clean rooms, great pool, great location. Service is excellent, check in & out is a breeze. I would highly recommend staying here if you can get a room, its popular.

We stayed here for one night for the Ohana festival. Great location if you're going to the beach or any music festival that's at Doheny state beach. The rooms were nice size and spacious with a normal sized bathroom. The service was really great here! Front desk manager (forgot his name) was really nice and got us checked in early. Wifi great and free. Breakfast was a large selection but nothing great. Your typical American feed the masses breakfast. We barely touched it but the room was packed.  We will definitely stay here every year for Ohana.

We enjoyed our stay in this scenic area.  Our room was clean and comfortable and the staff were all very helpful and welcoming.  We drove here after spending the day at the Nixon Presidential Museum in Yorba Linda. We explored the coastal area here including Laguna Beach before driving down the coast to San Diego.

We found a bug in our room.  We reported it and they said they would send someone to come treat the room.  We aren't sure if they ever did because we were gone most of the day.  Otherwise the staff was nice. They also sent a bottle of champagne up for my birthday.  There is no view of the beach.  We didn't have any problem finding parking.

Summary Heading: Great family hotel for a low price
Summary: Very nice hotel for the price. Clean and well kept for my family. The breakfast was fantastic! Very good food and selection. My family was impressed by the dedication and professionalism of the breakfast staff. Well done!

hotel staff were friendly and helpful to my needs during my stay. beach , shops, and lots of restaurants all walking distance from this hotel. my room was very nice thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this location. breakfast was delicious.

We enjoyed our stay and liked the proximity to the beach.  The room was a little smaller than we expected for the price and because it was a suite so not good for 6 people.  We loved the breakfast and the morning staff was amazing.

Lovely hotel for the price point, excellent staff and great location! Enjoyed the pool with my grandson, walked across the street to McDonalds, approximately 1 mile to Baby Beach and less to Doheny State Beach.

This was just right for our anniversary getaway. We were able to walk to the beach and the rooms were so comfortable and nice for relaxation and function as well. Carefully located close to everything but still a fairly quiet part of town

Overall great experience.   Very nice breakfast.  Comfy beds.  They had one employee there , Bobby, who went out of his way to make our stay great. Excellent climate control ability in the rooms.  We had an unexpected very late arrival and Bobby helped us get settled in

My husband and I went for our 4th year anniversary and it was such a pleasant stay! They gave us complimentary champagne and a card with such a warm greeting. The staff are easy to talk to and very pleasant. Overall wonderful time!

Loved the location, staff & room! Great breakfasts too! The staff at check in were extremely helpful. The location is perfect with quick access to the marina & the beach. We will plan to stay at this hotel again when we are in town.

We stayed here on a family vacation.  The hotel is within walking distance easily of the beach.  And there are many food options within walking distance.  The parking is a nightmare and the pool was nothing special.  But all-in-all it was a good stay.

Hotel seems to be a little older. Rooms were clean and Beds were comfortable. Our kids loved the jacuzzi tub. Really close to the beach and many restaurants. Breakfast was subpar but free. The staff was very kind and happy to help with anything you needed.

I have used this property every year for the past 4/5 years when arrending an event in Lagune Beach . I will always stay here when in the Laguna Beach / Dana Point. area . Great location , wonderful staff , nice/clean room . Room rate excellent for services/amenities . One of the best Best Western I have ever stayed in . Looking forward to my next stay in August 2018....

We have been staying here every summer for years now, and it just keeps getting better.Mty Grandkids love the pool, walking to the beach and especially the pancake breakfast.Thanks again to our two favorite Steves for their excellent customer service.We look forward to seeing them every time we visit.
Manager Response: Hi Elaine!  It was great having you back again this year and it's so cool to have your grandkids "growing up" at the Marina Shores.  Your praises have been passed on the two Steve's.  Hope we see you again next summer!

Summary: We stayed here three nights. The location is fantastic, easy walking distance to beach and marina, restaurants etc. We had a room with two queens and a separate room with pull out couch. The mattress on the pull out is incredibly uncomfortable even for my skinny teen, but overall the space in the room was fantastic for a family of four. Mini kitchen area was really great. Balcony was fantastic. Breakfast not so great. Our balcony faced towards the beach. Possibly a bit noisy because it faces the main road, but we had a fan which drowned out the noise perfectly. We'd stay here again based on the friendliness of the front desk staff and the value for a room that size in that area.
Manager Response: We're so glad you enjoyed your time with us.  We're in the process of replacing the last of the original fold out couch mattresses with memory foam mattresses ... granted a fold out will never be as comfortable as a real bed, but we will always give our guests the best that we can.  More improvements to the breakfast too.  New products are being added as we survey our customers to see what they like best.  As you can imagine, when the breakfast is free we're somewhat limited in the choices we can offer, but we are always looking for reasonable and healthy options.

Summary: The room was big for our group of 5. The balcony was great. We could see the ocean and smell the air. The service was great and friendly staff. Not enough parking. More room in the breakfast area. It was really crowded to get food. Breakfast was ok.
Manager Response: Hi Heather and thank you for the great review.  I apologize for the parking challenges.  IT seems that lately, we have been getting alot of guests with multiple cars for each room.  Parking is at a premium throughout our beach community ... hotel, restaurants, stores and even the marina faces the same difficulty.  I guess that is the "downside" of so many people discovering that Dana Point is one of the best kept secrets on the Orange County coast.  You mentioned the crowding in our breakfast room.  Ironically we actually expanded the room several months ago, almost doubling the seating.  For other readers ... when you stay at a hotel that serves a free breakfast like ours, please remember that the design is not like a full service restaurant.  The idea is for us to serve you a quick hot meal to start your day and then you head out to the beach or the attractions or whatever business brought you to town.  If you see people waiting to be seated, please be considerate and let others enjoy.

Summary: We would like to especially thank Steve Wolters and Tom for helping to make our stay a wonderful one. They did an absolutely fabulous job getting us a great room at the last minute. This was a special 25th Anniversary getaway for us. We were booked at Quality Inn down PCH in Capistrano Beach and when we checked in we found that this hotel was an absolute nightmare. We immediately checked out being very upset with the lies and misinformation we were given earlier. The pool was green with algae and the room was filthy as well as the property. I remembered visiting Best Western Marina Shores before and when we called, Tom was so gracious to inform us that by the time we arrived he would find us something we would enjoy. He and Steve worked together to find us a nice room with a
Manager Response: Congratulations to Rick & Gloria on 25 wonderful years together!  Steve, Tom and Diane had a great time working with you and we are all glad we could help make this an anniversary to remember.  Hope to see you for the big 5 OH!

Summary: I loved the room 224, the view was not fantastic but I loved the balcony because we could walk outside. My little one could also run around on it as the wall is almost 5 feet tall. The beds I have to say must have been doubles, they looked way too small to be queens, but I felt like I could hear the springs and was worried about sleep, but I passed out. I had no back issues when I woke up. So the bed is good. I also wanted to mention I know some people have complained of the noise from the road and they do give you ear plugs, but I never once heard the cars driving by.  Breakfast was not good, pancake maker did not work. The food took forever to be replenished which was disappointing. If they had just one more attendant it would have made a huge difference. 2 was just not enough
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review Christina, even though there were a few hiccups with your stay.  We are actively looking to add staff to our breakfast team and the problems with the pancake machine have been fixed.

Summary: good hotel close to beach, fast food. room good, noisy if on street side. when checking make sure you have or better yet they have the correct payment info it took several tries on their side to get it straighten out. the pool is small for the amount of rooms but with space at a premium this is not a deal breaker. 5 min walk across the street to the beaches. the breakfast could use an upgrade very small area guests are on top of each other to get food items, not much of a selection choice. would stay again if in the area
Manager Response: Hi Vince.  It's always best to confirm your form of payment when checking into a hotel rather than when checking out.  Credit cards are always pre-authorized when the guest checks in so switching cards or splitting payments at the end can needlessly tie up funds with your bank until they release the authorizations - something that is completely out of our hands.  If you want special arrangements made on your billing, we're happy to comply, but it works out alot better for the guests if we know to set it up that way when you arrive.  As with many of the other reviewers, I will again apologize for the crowds in our breakfast room.  We expanded the room and nearly doubled the seating earlier this year, but it seems that even with the added capacity many of our guests don't see that others are coming in and linger at their tables for one more cup of coffee or to sit and talk.  There is so much to see and do in Dana Point, you'd think that everyone would want to get out of the hotel and start experiencing the beach life right outside our door.

Summary: This was our first time staying at this hotel for our anniversary. We usually stay in Laguna Beach. The manager was so gracious knowing it was our anniversary and being a diamond member he had a bottle champagne on ice waiting for us in our room.  He also at check in congratulated us on our anniversary. The room was lovely with a large whirlpool bathtub and we could see a little bit of the ocean from our room.  We could walk to Dana Point Harbor from the hotel. Very nice stay and we will definitely be back.
Manager Response: Hi Cathy ... and congratulations again!  I'm glad we were able to make your anniversary stay even more memorable.  Please know that it is a concerted effort on the part of our staff to review every reservation and look for mention of requests or events that we can honor or make note of in hopes of creating a stay that will be extra special.  My signature may appear on the card, but it is a team effort to make sure that "all who enter as guests, leave as friends."

Summary: Didn't receive 2 queens as reserved bed was bad comforter dirty with makeup bathtub dirty. Understand it is about location but I have stayed at a better Motel 6. Breakfast wasn't good no room to sit at pool to watch kids. Only 4 chairs available.
Manager Response: Please accept my deepest apologies for the conditions and experiences you reported.  The comforter with a makeup stain is inexcusable.  We make every effort to thoroughly examine every piece of bathroom terry and all the bed linens after laundering them, just to make certain things like this don't happen.  I also went to the room immediately after reading your review and I did notice an edge of the tub where the finish was worn and not as white as the rest.  If this is what you noticed, I hope you will take comfort in knowing that is was not dirty and I will have our maintenance team address the finish on the tub right away.  Lastly, I assure you that other than the two room suites with couches in the living room fold out to a double bed, there is not one double bed in this hotel.  The smallest bed we offer is a queen.  The complementary breakfast is something that all hotels like ours will constantly be working on.  The trend in our industry is for all hotels to offer some type of breakfast and for those like ours that have no restaurant, the concept has to be quick, simple and free.  I fully admit that we don't offer a restaurant quality sit down meal, but for those looking for that added extra, there are plenty of restaurants nearby where you can get a cooked-to-order full breakfast.  As noted in my reply to the Best Western survey you completed after your stay, you know that we provided compensation for your dissatisfaction.  I'm assuming you wrote this review before you read my reply and that's why you didn't mention it here.  Again, I am extremely sorry we didn't meet your expectations and we will continue to take these reviews to heart and strive for improvement.

Summary: Great staff, wonderful room, superb location, real breakfast included.  We opted for a suite - and it was well equipped, roomy, clean.  Folks couldn't do enough for us!  Convenient to restaurants and beach.  We'll definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: We are thrilled that you enjoyed your time at the Marina Shores and visiting Dana Point.  Our two room suites are great for families, offering added privacy and a little extra space.  Glad you enjoyed and we look forward to your return!

Summary: This was in a great location, the rooms were clean and large enough for 3 adults to share, there is a refrigerator and a microwave, breakfast was good.  There is a good Rib place right next door and it's in close walking distance to Doheny beach.
Manager Response: We're glad you enjoyed your time with us and thank you for taking the time to post this review.  I need to clarify for any readers - while all our rooms have refrigerators, only the two room wet bar suites come with a microwave, extra sink and cabinet space.  The wet bar suite needs to be requested when your reservation is made in order to receive these extra amenities.  While we do have a limited number of extra microwaves we can bring to a standard room or suite, it's always best to reserve the wet bar suite if you know you'll be needing them.  Thanks again!

Summary: Considering this is a Best Western Plus, the hotel seems dated. Parts of the room were nice but some of the bathroom fixtures need to be replaced and updated. The housekeeping staff needs to learn when to use the elevator.... It is not when guests are waiting. Normally, hotels have housekeeping stations on each floor..... Best Western needs to re-think this policy/procedure.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to submit your review and I'm sorry that the Marina Shores didn't quite measure up to your expectations.  The hotel is over 30 years old - perhaps ancient by Southern California standards - but with each renovation, we are careful to preserve the history of the building while updating all our features and amenities.  I apologize for any delays in waiting for the elevator; the housekeeping staff is always supposed to defer to customers who are waiting to use it.  We are looking into other locations to store the carts on each floor, but the space limitations have made this a challenge.

Summary: I picked this hotel based on the good ratings on TripAdvisor. It was very clean, the person who checked us in, the maids, hotel security and especially the lady who took care of the breakfast area were all very friendly! The breakfast actually tasted good and there was a variety of food to eat. There were a few people who complained about the noise of the highway, we didn't hear anything. I don't think you will find a better deal in Dana Point. We will be staying here again in the future!
Manager Response: Hi Jennifer!  We certainly appreciate your awesome review and we're all extremely happy you enjoyed your stay with us.  The friendliness of our staff is no accident.  We have built our reputation on being as welcoming and accommodating as possible.  Our slogan, "May all who come as guests, leave as friends" is not just some marketing tag - we live and breathe this at the Marina Shores.  Glad to hear you will be coming back ... that's the highest praise a hotel can receive!

Summary: I lived in Laguna Beach for many years. Recently travel back and forth weekly to Orange County. I have stayed in a hotel for this purpose at least 125 days in the last year in addition to luxury travel. The location of this hotel is ideal for a vacation. The staff is fantastic, and the price is right! Go have fun!
Manager Response: When a hotel receives a review from a "professional traveler" it is always something to make note of.  These folks know what to look for and are usually alot harder to please.  It's wonderful to know that you have given us such high marks and praises.  I am extremely proud of our staff and honored that you appreciated their efforts.

Summary: Highly recommend! The right location. Between Laguna Beach and San Clemente. The trolley experience makes it wonderful to get around. Staff is very friendly, place is clean, beds are very comfortable.
Manager Response: Hey Letticia!  Thank you for the wonderful review and for mentioning the Dana Point Trolley service.  The free trolley not only transports folks around our little beach community, but also connects us with the Laguna Beach trolley, which opens up almost 10 miles of the Orange County coastline ... no worries about where to park or interrupting your sightseeing to go feed a meter ... it's all about relaxation and spending a carefree day.

Summary: I have made a 2 rooms reservation for 5 nights each when I realized that I need to add another room.  I called the hotel and spoke to the front desk attendant who was so polite and so accommodating.  I then realized that I needed to add one extra night to one of the rooms, I called back and again, the front desk staff was extremely friendly and kind and very happy to help.  I was also told that all our rooms are already assigned and we already have the room numbers....wow, I was totally impressed!!!  The staff, Anna, was kind enough to take my information and called me back after she finished helping the guest she was with.  She gave me information about the beach, restaurants in the area and even advised me to bring umbrellas for our beach visits.  I have also spoken to Diane,
Manager Response: Awwee, don't make me blush!  Yes, we have a truly wonderful staff, but your review is EXTRA special because it's all about your experience before you even arrived.  Superior service is not limited to between when you check in and when you check out.  People's travel plans change and a hotel should never look at requests to modify a reservation as chore ... guests are anxious enough about travelling - it can be very stressful, I know.  The least a hotel can do is make sure that after all the hustle of making plane connections, getting the right shuttle or navigating the infamous SoCal traffic in an unfamiliar rental car, the guest can relax in the accommodations they wanted and let the craziness of their day drain away.  Thank you for the high praises.

Summary: nice stay. only problem was that  the electricity went out at night. for about 20 minutes, i would stay again,very clean, nice location across the street from the beach ( Doheny ). Close to restaurants.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review and please accept my apologies for the brief power failure.  SDGE does a fantastic job responding to the occasional summertime blackouts in our area.

Summary Heading: A few nice touches, but had issues -- overall, it was just average
Summary: We reserved two rooms for a four night stay with both rooms charged at the same rate.  A few of the nice touches included a USB charging tower for charging multiple devices and a pancake machine at breakfast.  But that was about it.  The pillows were horrible and should've been replaced at least 6 months ago.  Our room also had a musty smell when we first arrived.  I also take issue with hotels charging an extra parking fee.  Given the distance to the airport and the fact that nearly everyone will have a car, parking should be included.    However, if you are going to charge for parking, you better be sure to not charge those who don't have a car.  We specifically told the staff that our second room did not have a car and did not include car information on the check-in sheet.

This was absolutely the nicest BW I've ever stayed at.  It was exceptionally clean and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  The price for the location was outstanding.  To the owner of this hotel, "Keep up the good work!"
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review Joann and we're thrilled you enjoyed your stay.  I will make sure to pass along your praises to the owner and the rest of the staff as well.

Summary: Smelly sewer gasses leak into the room through the drain;  WiFi didn't work at all; the loud refrigerator woke us up at night; the eggs at breakfast were way too salty; and the front desk staff usually ignored us when we returned to the hotel. On the other hand, the room was clean; the bed was comfortable; and our dog was welcome.
Manager Response: Hi Collene.  I'm sincerely sorry for the issues you experienced. I wish you had reported the refrigerator so we could have replaced it for you. The earplugs are there because some people are disturbed by the traffic noise from Pacific Coast Highway. I promise you, they weren't there because of the refrigerator.  The room we initially assigned to you was supposed to be out of service because of a plumbing leak from the floor above. Even though the leak had been repaired, that room was supposed to be closed down so the carpet could be thoroughly steam cleaned and dried and the room aired out. We were completely remiss by having that room in service and I can only offer my apologies for the clerical error on our part. We would never knowingly place a guest in a room in that type of condition.  I will advise the breakfast attendants about the salt in the eggs. Obviously, since we don't have a restaurant, we can't serve restaurant quality food, but seasoning should be left to the customer's taste. The only thing we add is a butter spray to give them a little more flavor, but I will definitely advise the breakfast attendants not to add salt at all.  Again, please accept my apologies for your disappointment. Your experience fell far short of the standards we set.

Summary Heading: At least the coffee was good!
Summary: This was an interesting stay starting before we even arrived.   On May 15th I received a call asking if I really needed a handicap accessible room that they had someone else that had MS that was wheelchair bound that needed it. I told the lady that we did as my brother has CP and is also wheelchair bound and needed the extra room.  Upon check in I verified that we still had an accessible room to which I was told no, it was being aired out and are going to be in a standard room. After explaining our situation we were given the accessible room that was being aired out. The room smelled, but it was accessible.  The next morning we received a call stating that house cleaning saw our dog peeing on the carpet in the hallway. I told the guy that there is no way that anyone saw our dog
Manager Response: Please accept my deepest apologies for all the issues you experienced during your stay.  When we contact a guest regarding a reported incident we owe it to them to be polite and inquire rather than openly accuse. I am extremely sorry if you felt you were shown any lack of respect.    I'd also like to apologize for the issues with your accessible room. We had a pipe burst two days before your arrival which flooded your room, the room next door and the one below. Once the plumbing repair was made, our maintenance staff worked tirelessly to get the carpets dried out and fumigate the rooms to get rid of the wet carpet smell. I take personal responsibility for the room type being changed - this was my error. While I did pre-assign the accessible room to you, I didn't put an alert on the reservation stating that you HAD to have that room type. Usually, our accessible rooms are booked last and are selected by guests because there are no standard rooms available. If we know that the guest DOES in fact need the accessible room, we are supposed to note it on the reservation so there is no last minute switching of room types. I neglected to make the notation and am extremely sorry for the confusion I created. Please also accept my heartfelt appreciation that you were able to tolerate the remaining odor from the wet carpeting.  Lastly, we are trying to get a service company in to take care of the treadmill and the elliptical machine. There are very few service techs in our area and trying to get one scheduled has been a challenge. I know this is no excuse, but I wanted you to know we were aware of the problem and are doing our best to get them repaired.  Also, we have replaced the pillows in the room so the next guest will not experience the same discomfort and I appreciate your bringing it to my attention.

Summary Heading: If you want to sleep don't stay here
Summary: The people next door partied all through Thursday night not stopping until 5:30 am of Friday morning. Of course that's the time I had to get up. Between all the talking, playing the guitar and the dog barking there was no way to get any sleep. The requests to keep it down were ignored. BW staff said they couldn't do anything nor did they offer anything to me.
Manager Response: Dear Lynda,  I am extremely sorry to hear of your displeasure.  I understand that you went to the guest's room yourself to ask them to quiet down rather than reporting it to the hotel.  It is never recommended that a hotel guest confront another.  We have 24 hour staffing at the front desk and overnight security just for this reason.  I confirmed through the surveillance videos that our guard made frequent rounds that night, but as luck would have it, whenever he passed through your floor, apparently there was no noise carrying out to the hallway.  I give you my assurances that had you reported it that night, we would have insisted that they quiet down immediately or leave.  A peaceful night's sleep is the minimum expectation a guest should have at any hotel and we have zero tolerance for guests who have no consideration for others.  I also understand that you let the desk staff know about the disturbance when you were checking out.  We apologized, but also asked you why you didn't report it when it happened and were told (not a direct quote) what difference would it make, you wouldn't have done anything anyway ... I am so sorry that this is what the perception of service is in our society.  People seem to surrender to the idea that businesses don't care - it doesn't make the problems any more tolerable, if anything, it just magnifies the issue.  I give you my every assurance that if you had reported your noisy neighbors to us, we would have dealt with them quickly.  If you don't report a problem, we can't fix it.

Summary: This was our first time to Dana Point, we selected the Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel for the price. We were overall impressed by the quality of the hotel, amenities and wonderful staff for the value price we paid. Lisa  and Bobby at the front desk were professional, friendly and very helpful. "May all who enter as guests, leave as friends!"  Thank you for a wonderful stay ! See you soon !
Manager Response: It's always great to hear from first time visitors to our little beach community!  I'm glad you were impressed by our staff and the quality of the Marina Shores overall.  Just goes to show ... cleanliness, comfort, quality and service don't have to be things that cost a fortune.  Thanks for the great review and we look forward to having you back.

Summary Heading: Came as a guest, left as a friend!
Summary: We stayed at Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel for two nights - coming in late in the evening we were very happy to find our rooms, that worked miracles to wipe away the fatigue from many hours of travel. It is not always easy to find sensible accommodation for our family of six, but with the help of the staff we found the option of connected rooms with two queen beds each, which was just fantastic. The staff at the hotel were super friendly and welcoming, and rooms spotlessly clean and comfortable. Adults and kids both enjoyed the breakfast immensely and due to the excellent location of the hotel, we were able to go and explore what Dana Point has to offer. Dana Point Harbor and Baby beach recommended especially for families with small kids are just a few minutes away.
Manager Response: Jason,  It was an absolute honor to be able to serve you and your family.  I can't even begin to imagine how exhausted you all were after flying halfway around the world, so anything we could do to make your time with us more comfortable was simply our privilege.  Glad the kids had a good time - VERY well behaved, by the way.  You have a beautiful family and we all hope you all took some great memories of Southern California back to Finland with you!

Summary: I would recommend staying at this hotel if you are wanting to stay near the beach at Dana Point. It was centrally located and had electric car charging stations for our vehicle. Also the room had a partial view of the ocean. The noise from the road wasn't to bad and the air conditioner worked great. I would not recommend eating the breakfast there it was sub par but right across the street is McDonalds, Jack in the Box and Del Taco.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review and we're happy you enjoyed your stay at the Marina Shores.  We also appreciate your mentioning the EV chargers we provide for free to guests of the hotel.  In this day and age where hotels seem to find a reason to charge extra for amenities, it's nice to be able to offer this service at no cost.  You mentioned the "partial view of the ocean" and I want to clarify for ALL readers, we are a block and a half away from the ocean.  From our top floor rooms you can see the ocean through the palm trees across the street, but it's not like you can throw open your curtains and take in the majesty of the Pacific Ocean ... different booking sites online have very vague descriptors of our hotel and sometimes the wording can be a little misleading, so we always try to clarify the view whenever someone mentions it here.  I'm also glad that you mentioned the air conditioning and LACK of road noise.  Our proximity to the Pacific Coast Highway and the noise from the traffic that goes with it has been one of the most common complaints we've heard from our guests.  We've just finished installing central air conditioning in all of our two room suites.  This eliminated the old fashioned wall units that let in most of the noise from the outside world - not to mention the intended benefit of keeping these two room units uniformly cooled.  We are all very excited about this latest improvement and so far, most of the feedback has been exactly like yours - much quieter and much cooler!  Lastly, I am sorry that our free breakfast was not up to your expectations and I completely agree that a hotel without a full service restaurant simply cannot offer the same type of quality as regular food service establishment.  In addition to the restaurants you mentioned, there is also Stacks Pancake House across the street and the Harbor House Cafe about half a mile up PCH.  Anyway, we're glad you enjoyed your stay with us even though everything wasn't perfect.

Summary: BEST hotel on the coast you will ever find.....they acted like we were family. we were on our honeymoon and they made it pleasant and problem free. the complimentary champagne was local and very good...
Manager Response: Congratulations again and we are all glad that the staff of the Marina Shores was able to play a part in building these memories for you.  Please accept our wishes for a beautiful lifetime together and an invitation to return - maybe to celebrate your anniversary? ;-)

Summary: Location and price were good but couple of problems made the complete stay not entirely great. Stay on the second or third floors, tons of construction noise. Would stay again but need to know about the construction before hand.
Manager Response: Please accept my deepest apologies for the construction noise during your stay.  We tried to limit the work to hours when most of our guests were out and about on business or vacationing.  The good news is that the project is now complete and all of our two room suites have been fitted with powerful central air conditioning units.  Improvements like this are necessary to keep the Marina Shores as a premier lodging option - the noise was only temporary, but the benefits to our guests are here to stay!

Summary: We had stayed here before and it was much better last time. This time we were in a room on the 2nd floor that was accessed from the outside. There were 5 rooms leading up to our room under construction & we were right above the pool so the noise was disturbing. The food options for breakfast are terrible and the food is gross as well. Even though the breakfast is free we went across the street to Stacks and paid to eat. We will try out another hotel on our next visit.
Manager Response: We are saddened to hear of your decision to choose another hotel the next time you visit Dana Point. In fairness, renovations are necessary to keep the hotel current and the disturbance renovations create are temporary.  We're sorry you were inconvenienced by the construction, but we sincerely believe our guest will appreciate the new central A/C units being installed in the suites.  As for your breakfast at Stacks, we're glad you enjoyed it and we know Stacks is a highly regarded full service restaurant (which our hotel is not.).  Thanks for your feedback.

Summary: The hotel is great over all. We have stayed at this hotel once before with a great experience. Clean comfortable rooms and nice views. Nice breakfast with lots of options. I look forward to staying here again.
Manager Response: Hi Steve!  Thanks for the great review.  It's always nice to hear from repeat visitors.  Testimonials from returning guests mean a great deal because they show that we consistently meet their expectations and set an excellent measure of our service and quality.  See you on your next trip!

Summary: I chose this hotel because of it's proximity to family living in the area and functions that I had to attend.  The location was fabulous, I would love to return to this location and take advantage of some of the tourist activites.  The hotel was clean, breakfast was pretty good and the bed was very comfortable.
Manager Response: We're thrilled that you found the Marina Shores to be such a great value and we hope you get the opportunity to return and explore all the tourism options.  Our location halfway between LA and San Diego makes us the perfect launching point for all the great attractions in Southern California.

Summary: We've stayed here 5 times over the years have never had bad experience. When there was a glitch they made it right! They make the festival goers at home with Blues Bros. paraphernalia. There are rooms without a view so you pay less, but pop for a view. We've reserved for next year !
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review Scott and we're glad you choose the Marina Shores, year after year, as your base camp for the Doheny Blues Festival.  For those unfamiliar, the Blues Fest is just about the biggest annual event in Dana Point.  Most of the hotels in the area mark the event by raising their rates into the stratosphere, but we get into the spirit by dressing up like the Blues Brothers, playing blues music in our lobby the entire weekend and handing out some really cool gifts to all our guests.  That's why customers like Scott consistently book with us a year ahead of time.  Jake and Elwood send their best and we all look forward to seeing you next May!

Summary: If your looking for great place to visit, Dana Point is the best location to take your family for either a long weekend or extended stay.  Both the value, and friendliness of the staff are an added bonus.
Manager Response: Hi Olivia!  We appreciate the great rating and we're glad the Marina Shores Hotel exceeded all your expectations while you were in Dana Point.  Cleanliness, comfort, value and a warm welcome are all the things our reputation is built on and it's wonderful that you recognized all of them.  Thank you again!

Summary: Bobby walked in on 2 guests changing (nearly nude) and just stood there staring before he walked out. Our fridge made the LOUDEST ticking noise & we were told they all make that noise, our sink backed up the entire stay, even after maintanance came to fix it. We called to speak to a manager and were given Bobby & then found out he was pretending to be the manager. Absolutely horrible service. Would NOT reccomend this location.
Manager Response: It's truly sad that you opted to post a review like this even though we corresponded about all your issues and you also neglected to include what we did to rectify the problems. For any readers, this guest's bathroom sink got clogged up late at night, after our maintenance team left for the day. We offered to move them to a different room, which they declined due to the late hour so we gave them a second room at no charge and that way they could use the facilities with minimal inconvenience.  Bobby never pretended to be "the manager' ... when you called the front desk early on Saturday morning, the two people on duty were Bobby and a new clerk who had only been with us about two weeks. When you asked for the manager, she gave the call to Bobby because there was no one else here.  Also, Bobby wasn't the one who walked in on you. It was one of our housemen who entered the room to strip the linen because you had checked out with the front desk and never told them that there were still people IN the room. When a guest checks out, they are releasing the room to us to be serviced for the next incoming guest. Had you let us know that there were still people in the room, we wouldn't have entered. I've also spoken with the houseman who said that the door was propped open with the security bar and that everyone was completely dressed. I understand that you were upset, but there is no need to exaggerate the extent of the intrusion.  I am also sorry that you failed to mention that we comped your entire stay. As you stated in your email to me, even that wasn't enough to satisfy you. Were there issues with the room? Of course there were and everyone on the staff you came in contact with did their best to help rectify the situation or compensate you for your discomfort.  At the Marina Shores we do our best to make sure we provide our guests with clean, comfortable accommodations and friendly service at a fair price. On the rare occasion that something goes wrong we do whatever we can to make it right. If you can't accept that, I am sincerely sorry.

Summary Heading: Nice choice for a short stay
Summary: Stayed here for one night as part of a 3 week road trip. We had a spacious room with a separate living area. The sleeping area with a balcony is right over highway 1 but with the door closed we could not hear the traffic. The king bed was comfy and we slept great. The breakfast room was clean and had enough seating for everyone. The food was the standard hotel breakfast. Service was helpful and friendly. I would choose to stay here again if in this are

There is absolutely nothing remarkable about this BW. Typical BW with typical BW accommodations and breakfast. Do I need to describe it? I don't think so. My advice, ask for a room on the opposite side of PCH unless you are a heavy sleeper because you are RIGHT ON PCH! They charge $10/night for parking which is typical of most hotels in beach areas. Reasonably easy walking distance to the marina, beaches and restaurants.

Extremely pleasant desk staff. We were on mid floor and the noise above us was deafening. It was either construction or housekeepers, uncertain, but prevented us from sleeping in. Breakfast was good, hot and plentiful. Nice to have a balcony even on the PCH. It was worth the lower price but 2 days was plenty then we switched to a pricier hotel just for ambiance.

Though this hotel has a 2 star rating, it is clean and comfortable with an excellent speedy breakfast. The decor is mid scale and feels more like a 3 star hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful but not in the way.

It is close to the beach and a great full breakfast is included! Is it an easy walk to the beach, and  it is where I always stay! This hotel is the closes to the beach and I love that! And the fabulous Rib Joint is right next door!

We normally stay at a nearby hotel when visiting family in Dana Point, but chose Marina Shores this time as they had rooms at a reasonable price that accommodated our family of 5.  They have a good hot breakfast, location is close to the beach, harbor and restaurants. Beds were a little on the hard side, but I find most hotel beds are.

We stayed at this hotel for 1 night after an even in the area.    We booked the 1st floor suite.  Room was basic & small but clean. View was nice.  Since the hotel is pet friendly it smelled a bit in the hallways & the room.  We brought room spray to neutralize the smell so that helped.   Since the hotel is right on PCH it was a bit noisy & room walls are thin so you could hear people talking & walking by.   Hotel location was perfect, close to the beach, restaurants & area attractions.  Front desk staff was very friendly.  Parking was convenient but a bit tight.  Will stay here again when in the area.

Great hotel, the breakfast is a real breakfast. Beautiful location on PCH. Close to everything in Dana Point and surrounding cities like San Clemente. The rooms are clean and the staff does a great job! Thank you!

Stayed at this hotel for a special occasion with the boyfriend and felt like the stay made the experience together more romantic. Location was great but the jacuzzi really made it exceptional. They provided bath salts and there was a tv near the jacuzzi which was great because After fully zen-ing out I didn't want to get out so it was great to be able to watch a show/part of a movie without having to get out. Also the boyfriend even got to watch the epic basketball game that night. (You probably might be wondering how long were we in there?! But it was just that good!) Overall the stay was great, no complaints with the staff or the amenities. But really recommend the jacuzzi suite with jetted tub if u want the full experience.

Checkout staff, horrible. I was forced out... NO LATE CHECK OUT??!!  Also the condition of the room, not up to par with prior Hotels.  The noise @ 8 am was a huge issue not allowing any sleeping in during my vacation from work.
Manager Response: Please allow me to extend my deepest apologies for the issues and room conditions you experienced during your stay.  We are aware of the condition of some of the balconies and are in the midst of making all the repairs.  I'm sure you heard the construction noise during your stay.  We are installing central air conditioning in all the rooms where you stayed and that was the sound of the contractors building the unit platforms on the roof.  This week they are starting the work in the rooms themselves and we have a crew going in to make the balcony repairs at the same time.  I know this does nothing to change the discomfort you experienced while you were here, but I did want you to know that these issues were not being ignored.  The heavy rains we endured from December through March slowed the whole project down, but we are now in full swing and everything should be in beautiful shape in a few weeks.  Regarding the late check out ... it sounds like there was some kind of misunderstanding over our regular check-out time.  Check-out is at 11:00am, so if the desk extended you an hour to 12:00pm, that's why they were calling you at 12:30.  On the weekends, it is very difficult to extend our check-out time later than that because we have so many new guests coming in and our housekeepers need time to get their rooms ready, not to mention servicing the rooms for our stayover guests as well.  If this was not communicated to you in a polite and professional manner, I apologize for that as well

Summary: My experience here at this hotel with staff  wearing  burgundy scrubs felt like I was staying at an assistant living facility.  One girl in particular seemed so miserable working there never smiled once or even looked up.  It will state that you will get a full breakfast more like a Continental breakfast.  Beds are very comfortable room is comfortable.  Walking distance to the beach.  Lots of places to eat nearby.

A most pleasant stay and wonderful location. If you are a light sleeper, you need to know that the bedroom portion of your suite will likely be on the street side. The hotel does have fresh earplugs in all rooms for anyone who wants them. The traffic noise did not both any of the three (3) of us, however.   Parking is under a carport, which is a nice feature. Staff was amazing in every way. We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review and we are thrilled that you enjoyed your time with us.

Summary Heading: Marina Shores should be NEAR a Shore
Summary: Booked Hotel b/c Trip Advisor had 4Star gGest rating-  Rooms with a view- View is Hwy 1 & Mc Donald's- A/C SO close to Bed it cooled the bed & kept turning off! Parking is UNDER rooms-Ear Plugs by Bed!
Manager Response: Hi George!  I'm sorry that the Marina Shores was not what you were expecting.  Our 4 1/2 star rating is mostly because of our friendly staff, the cleanliness of our rooms and the tremendous value we offer compared to most of the competition in town.  We never bill ourselves as having a great view of the Pacific Ocean .. we are a block and a half off the beach so the best we can offer is a peek of the ocean from our top floor suites.  I regret if you read something on line that sounded different from that .. on our website and on Best Western's website, our location is stated pretty clearly.  If you booked through a third party site, while we provide them with the same detailed information, we have no control over how they describe us or how they display the information.  Most hotels in Dana Point have parking in or below their buildings.  Real estate in a resort area is at a premium so it only makes sense to make the most out of the land available.  Occasionally we will have a guest with a loud motorcycle or car that echos through the garage and can be heard in the rooms, but most of our guests are considerate of that ... if only the folks cruising the Pacific Coast Highway were as nice.  From what you described about the air conditioner, it sounds like you had one of our two room suites.  We are in the process of installing central air and heat in all of the suites so by mid or late June, this should not be a concern for anyone.  I know this doesn't do anything to make up for the issues during your stay, but I mention it only to assure you that the issues experienced by our guests are what motivates us toward constant improvement ... we're not satisfied having a 4 1/2 star rating.  If we didn't look to improve our service and facilities, that high a rating wouldn't last very long.

Summary: We needed a convenient place to stay locally while visiting extended family.  It's right on Pacific Coast Hwy in the middle of town.  I was a bit apprehensive about the comments on traffic noise but it turned out not to be an issue (we stayed on the second floor facing the back away from the street).  The rooms are clean, spacious and the beds comfortable.  It's clean and the staff is warm and welcoming.  The breakfast is good, pretty typical of the kind that you get at these places.  Parking for $10/day in back is quite reasonable.  Very fast free wifi, I clocked it at 50 Mbps download.  Lots of food options within walking distance and a nice Ralph's market about ten min walk.  A few min drive to the beaches, it's near the center of all the local action.  This area has been
Manager Response: Hi "Dad" and thank you for the wonderful review of the Marina Shores.  I'm glad you mentioned the street noise (or in your case, the lack of ...)  We get so many people commenting on the traffic from the Pacific Coast Highway.  This is a tourist road, like historic Route 66, many travelers would rather follow the coast highway for the view than take the Interstate highway that runs further inland.  While the noise from the traffic can be annoying at times, this is "life" passing in front of our hotel ... an endless stream of travelers from all over the country, touring the coast and seeing all the sights of South Orange County.  As I've mentioned in many of my replies to reviewers, we replaced all our windows and doors with double-paned, sound dampening glass many years ago, but to expect no sound from the outside world - especially when we are located right on this historic roadway - is pretty unrealistic.  Other than the 5 Star resorts which have acres of real estate to set them off from the community, you would have to travel at least 10 miles inland to isolate yourself from the traffic noise.  We appreciate your comments and understanding and hope you have the opportunity to stay with us again.

Summary: I was very happy with my recent stay. Room with a king bed, very spacious with separate sitting area. Everything was clean and had everything i needed! The manager Peter went above and beyond to help me. He is very professional and knows how to treat his guests. Thank you for a great experience!

It was on a very busy street with tons of noise and the curtains didn't close to block out the light. Rooms were clean and staff was good. Not sure I would stay there again if I did I would recommend staying on other side of the building and bring a extra blanket to block the light from window.
Manager Response: Dear Michelle,  I know I already responded to your review on another site, but I wanted to share the same words with your readers here.  All of our rooms have drapery sheers and a full blackout curtain.  My only guess is that you didn't see the blackout behind the sheer, so it was never closed.  I'm sorry that you didn't notify the front desk because we could have taken care of it for you immediately.

Summary: Enjoyed our stay. Very nice hotel. Everything we did was in walking distance. We had a blast and can't wait to our next trip.  This location was perfect for all our needs and was very clean with wonderful staff.
Manager Response: Lisa - you are WELCOME!  Moreover, we thank YOU for the kind words and we hope to see you back with us soon.
