Summary: We attended a wedding in the area. Very nice hotel. Good location. Noisy room, right on Pacific Coast Hwy. very clean and comfortable room. Breakfast was disappointing. Food was cold. The kitchen personnel were unfriendly.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review of your stay and I'd like to apologize for the issues with our breakfast.  As you know, while the renovations and expansion of our regular breakfast room were going on, we were using our meeting room as a temporary location for our daily free breakfast.  Although this posed some logistics challenges for the staff - like getting the hot food from the kitchen to the meeting room before it had a chance to cool - there was no reason for the breakfast staff to be unfriendly ... if anything, we should have all kicked our service attitude into high gear to make up for the limitations on the buffet line.  In any event, now that the renovations are complete, the expanded breakfast room is reopening this week so all issues should be eliminated for future travelers.  Again, I am sorry that we let you down during your stay, but also hope you will have the opportunity to give us another try someday.

Summary: Beds comfortable, queen room included 2 queen bed, fridge, desk and large TV.  Continental breakfast offered which included eggs and pancakes plus cold cereal, yogurt etc.  They also included a bottle and wine opener and ear plugs (which all were not needed)  This was neat.  The desk was helpful, especially since I made an error with the reservation system and they worked with me to accommodate.     Parking is $5-10 per night  It's not a resort but a good accommodation in the area especially since the state part and harbor are not accessible from may hotels anyway, thus driving is needed to get around to the many sites
Manager Response: Thank you for the review on your recent stay.  Even though you only rated us three stars, it certainly sounds like you more than satisfied with our accommodations and service - which is the most important thing.  You're right when you said we're "not a resort" ... check out their prices and you'll see why (smiling!)  Our philosophy at the Marina Shores is to provide clean and comfortable rooms coupled with over the top friendly service ... these are benefits money can't buy and allows travelers to spend their hard earned dollars on the events and entertainment in the area, rather than their hotel.  Thanks again!

Summary: This is an amazing location with a friendly staff. All the shops, restaurants you could want are walking distance and the rooms have all the amenities , including a comfy bed. I would stay here again and again. A very unique and beautiful part of OC.
Manager Response: Short, sweet and (we're proud to say) right on the money!  We all thank you for the great review and look forward to your next visit with us.

Summary: I had booked 3 rooms in this hotel without seeing it.  The occasion was a anniversary celebration with my family (3 adults, 2 seniors and 4 children). A few weeks before the booked date we decided to have look and discovered that this hotel is located on a very noisy PCH  and furthermore that the swimming pool is too small . We decided to try our luck elsewhere. This hotel is probably OK for business travelers
Manager Response: I am so glad you had the opportunity to come see the Marina Shores before your stay.  While we publish many photos of the property on our websites, it's never the same as walking through the hotel and getting a feel for the experience.  While our pool is certainly not Olympic sized, it IS heated year-round, which many consider a plus when staying in March.  Also, with the beautiful Pacific Ocean only a block and a half away, our pool doesn't see a lot of activity during the summer months.  While we always hope to be the hotel of choice for all travelers coming to the south coast region, we fully understand that different people have different requirements when they stay.  The Marina Shores may not be for everyone, but if you're looking for clean, comfortable accommodations with friendly service at an affordable price, we believe we are the best option in Dana Point.

Summary: The treatment is Awesome, from the time you check in to check out. My husband & I have stayed at the hotel number of times & we are treated with Awesomeness every time. If you have a chance to stay at this hotel you won't want to leave.
Manager Response: Hi Joanne!  It was great to have you back and we appreciate all your kind praises for the service we provide.  As repeat customers you see first hand that the wonderful treatment from the staff isn't a fluke ... this is what we live for and we try to bring it to every guest, every day, every stay.

Summary: Location, price, hotel and staff all were fantastic. We had a 3 rooms but queen with balcony was best! Next time will book the one with wet bar though. Tons of stuff nearby to walk to. All staff were nice and helpful. There was no designated area for dogs so keep in mind if you're bringing your dog.

Summary Heading: Thank you Management for a great Anniversary stay!
Summary: Management really went above and beyond a normal hotel stay to make it special for us. Very clean and accommodating place and would highly recommend. Breakfast was good and how about that pancake maker!

We stayed here for 2 nights, friendly and helpful staff. Covered parking, walking distance to downtown and several restaurants.The rooms were clean and spacious with a small refrigerator. Do not get room next to ice machine in the hall way. People getting ice at all hours.  Did not use pool or gym due to time crunch.

the location is perfect some rooms even have ocean view  the suites offer a xtra room with roll out bed and great for conference as what we used it for breakfast above par from most had keish with ham and all thge other goods like pancakes  the hotel itself is clean upscale far from most The staff is top notch as well as well informed with area and needs for guests I highly recommend this if you want a hi class stay in dana point

Summary Heading: Fabulous stay at The Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel, Dana Point, CA
Summary: Nice hotel! Our room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We had a free full breakfast with many choices. Nice location, close to the Dana Point Harbor, shopping and restaurants. We would love to stay at this hotel again in the future.

Very clean, great value. Continental breakfast included. Very close to the harbor without the price tag of other places. About 15 minutes walking distance from the harbor and all the activities. Only downside is no views.

Cute little hotel. Rooms were average size (even the suites) on a busy road though if that bothers you will hear cars driving by all night. Hotel is pet friendly and our suite smelled like a dog. We have dogs so it didn't bother me too bad but I was surprised that I could smell it. Pool was heated and looked clean, jacuzzi tub in our room was great. Bed was very firm. Service was okay, we only interacted with 2 employees during our stay. It is right near a beach which was nice to get up in the morning and go walking. There were a lot of homeless/druggies out first thing in the morning on the sidewalk right outside of the hotel which kind of surprised me in this area. We walked from the hotel to Carlos Mexican food resteraunt and that was great.

Summary Heading: Good option for a night or two
Summary: The hotel has a great location, and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. Rooms are clean and quite large. As others have said, the walls are thin, so definitely go for a room on the third floor. It's a typical Best Western - a serviceable room but nothing special. The balconies are laughably small, and since ours faced the PCH, it wasn't anything we wanted to spend any time on. Also, the traffic noise can be quite loud (we knew we were in trouble when the hotel provided ear plugs). This is an expensive part of California, and the Best Western is a decent alternative to the ultra-expensive resorts nearby.

This location is convenient, has reasonable rates, is clean, and has a super friendly staff. I would suggest 3rd floor rooms for a decent view of bay.  The suites are large. Furniture is a little dated if those are things you need. Our son just moved to Dana Point so this is affordable for our visits. See you again.

This seemed like a very overpriced hotel. The service was fine and I have no complaints regarding this, but the walls seem very thin, I could hear my neighbor watching TV at 2am. It was not a loud volume, but I could still hear every single word next door which makes for a miserable night's sleep.  The sheets were paper thin and just about as comfortable. The bed was like sleeping on a rock while wrapped in a sandpaper blanket. Thankfully this was just a one night stay on Christmas Eve on our way to visit family, but I'll be sure to make a note never to visit again, it was like a $250 a night motel 6.
Manager Response: Dear Wyndie,  I'm sincerely sorry you found your stay with us so unpleasant.  It is our goal that every guest of the Marina Shores finds their accommodations to be clean, comfortable and an excellent value.  Bed comfort, as I have said in other reviews, is a very subjective opinion ... some people prefer the softest mattresses that they can just sink into after a long day, while others prefer some firmness for better support.  We replaced every bed in the hotel less than five years ago will pillowtop mattresses and foundations from Simmons.  I wanted to check the beds in the room you occupied, but there was another guest in it so I asked him and he felt they were extremely comfortable.  I assure you, this is not to challenge your opinion in any way ... it is just to show that everyone has different expectations when it comes to beds.  No guest should ever have to tolerate noise or discomfort - at our hotel or any other.  You are all paying for an experience.  One call to the front desk with a complaint or concern and the staff should leap to assist.  I am truly sorry you didn't report any of this when you were here.  We would have gladly moved you to a different room and offered you a free upgrade for your trouble if we had something available.  Lastly, I urge you to review your receipt or contact me directly if you don't have one.  Your room was nowhere near $250.00.  The rate was only $185, plus taxes, one night's parking charge and the $20.00 pet fee for your dog.  Over the holidays, hotel rates in town were extremely high, but we always keep ours at the low end of the market pricing so that our guests don't feel taken advantage of.  I closing, I want to stress to you and anyone else who may read this review ... don't ever settle for less than you expect from ANY hotel you stay at.  If you have a concern, let management know and give them the opportunity to fix it for you.  It is a sad fact about our society ... we have gotten so used to poor customer service that we almost accept it as the norm.  It doesn't matter if you're at a "Motel 6" or a 5-star resort ... cleanliness, comfort and a peaceful night's sleep are the minimum expectations any guest should have ... and any good hotel will go out of their way to meet those expectations ... and THEN some!

Summary Heading: Great Dana Point hotel right on PCH
Summary: Really enjoyed our weeklong stay at the BWP Marina Shores Dana Point this week. Our Suite was quite spacious and comfortable for 3 adults (1 on sofa sleeper) and we even had an ocean view from the small balcony!  Hotel is not as modern or deluxe as the many upscale resorts in the area, but a really good location with friendly, helpful staff, quite a decent complimentary breakfast and a GREAT overall value!  We're doing business in Dana Point for the next several months, so we'll definitely be back again next month and each month onward thru the Summer.
Manager Response: Misael,  Thank you for the wonderful review and we are thrilled that you will be coming back repeatedly over the coming year.  I tried to reach out to you in an email to let you know about our fantastic rate program for business people who will be staying with us multiple times.  We promise a MINIMUM discount of 18% off our regular rates.  There is no cost to participate, no minimum # of nights you need to stay.  You can register for the rate plan with me over the phone and it only takes about two minutes to complete the company profile information.  If you happen to read this response, please contact me directly at the hotel and we will get you set up.  I know you have future reservations already on the books and I'll be happy to apply the discount to all of those, plus any more you make in the future.

Summary: All the way from Diana checking us in to Diana checking us out it was a good 3 nt stay throughout. We stayed here due to proximity to the marina for the whale watching (which unfortunately we didn't see any but plenty of dolphins) and the Dana Point ferry to Catalina Island. The parking was good for $5/nt with AARP or $10/nt otherwise. The breakfast was very good with hot sausage, pancakes, eggs and potatoes plus cold cereals fruits etc. the balcony room with suite had two rooms one which I was able to work out of with good wifi. The road did not bother us with noise.
Manager Response: Hi Terry!  Thank you for the awesome review and hitting on just about every touch point that makes the Marina Shores such a standout value.  I agree that those ferry trips to Catalina Island are wonderful ... you just can't get the full enjoyment on a one-day excursion though.  I hope you got to stay there at least overnight.

Summary: This is the place to stay that is convenient to shopping, Doheny State Beach, and all the surrounding attractions of Orange County! Nice to have convenient on premise parking available. Ample offerings for the breakfasts make for a great start to each day.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review and sharing your opinions with the Trip Advisor family.  We're glad you enjoyed your stay, as well as the offerings of our beautiful little community.

Summary: Compared to other hotels in the area, this was an excellent deal. Beds are a little lumpy/worn. Street noise may be aproblem for some people. Overall the staff was great. Parking is very tight. Watch out with large truck or SUV.
Manager Response: Tricia,  Thank you for the review and I'm sorry for any issues you may have had.  If you read this response and have a minute to contact me directly, I'd like to find out what room you were in so I can have the mattress looked at and replaced if necessary.

Summary: This hotel offers free WIFI, breakfast, and a nice location near the harbor and beach areas of Dana Point. Not a spectacular view of the ocean, but minutes walk or drive. Rooms are modern and the service is excellent.

The hotel is a wonderful place to stay when in Dana Point. We have stayed there many times great staff, very kind and professional always making sure your stay was enjoyable and if you had a problem they took care of it right away.  The rooms were  clean and comfortable.

Summary Heading: Very pleasant stay. Very helpful staff.
Summary: LVery easy check-in and very accommodating staff. Helpful with cabs, restaurant suggestions and information about the area. We stayed one night, were gone one night and returned for a second night. The hotel kept our luggage safe while we were on Catalina Island. They helped us arrange a cab when we needed one; going to the boat and so forth.  The breakfast was very good and there was plenty of it. They offered cereal, fruit, pancakes, bagels and rolls, eggs and sausages.  This is a non-smoking hotel.

Summary Heading: Nice and straight forward.  Great staff
Summary: Check in was a breeze.  Parking is a bit tight.  Room was comfortable, clean and quiet.  I liked the fact it was bigger than I thought it would be. Quite simply a nice place for the price with an amazing staff.

I stay at this hotel every time I come to Orange County.  Love the location and the complete area.   There is everything in the area from great sea food restaurants to your local McDonalds.  The staff is great.
Manager Response: Hello again, Margaret!  It's always great to have you here and I'm glad to know that the Marina Shores is still your hotel of choice whenever you come to Dana Point.  Until we see you again, have a great holiday season and a wonderful new year!

Summary: First thing to point out is the parking is $10 a night but if you have AARP  or some other groups you belong to it's only $5 a night. Call ahead to see what qualifies. Hotel is pet friendly. Friendly people at front desk and also knowledgeable about surrounding areas of interest. Room was great and wife was thrilled that bathroom tub was a Jacuzzi. Great breakfast and is so popular that they have a separate room on the 2nd floor ( we were in room 282) for overflow to sit and have your breakfast. When I went at 8:45 in main area, there were no seats available. Great location ! right down the street  and turning right at light is the marina. . Best place to stay.
Manager Response: Hi Charlie and thanks from the staff and myself for the great review.  Sounds like you enjoyed your entire experience, not only at the hotel but in our wonderful little beach community.  Hope you get the opportunity to come back and visit us again!

Summary: I would absolutely stay here again! The breakfast is the best out of anywhere else I've stayed.  Location is great! Could see the ocean from our room. Close to all kinds of fast food, restaurants abs bars.
Manager Response: Thank you for the fantastic review, Megan and we're super happy you "loved everything" about the Marina Shores.  We especially appreciate your positive comments on our free breakfast because that is one of our industry's biggest challenges when it comes to people pleasing.  Most hotel brands offer some kind of free breakfast to their guests, but a lot of travelers don't realize that these same hotels don't have actual restaurant facilities.  It's not that easy to put out an appetizing spread each morning when your building was never designed to deliver an amenity like that.    Our breakfast attendants work very hard to provide a wide variety of fresh and healthy options every day, from the hot egg and meat selections, all the way to the fruits, muffins and dairy choices.  We truly appreciate your including recognition for their efforts in the review.

Summary: Simple, clean, great value for Dana Point. Plan for all meals out, including breakfast, which is typical economy hotel fare...   Throwback jacuzzi tub a plus.  Within 10 minutes of multiple surf breaks...
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review and for recognizing the Marina Shores as one of the true values still available when visiting Dana Point.

Summary: Clean quality room, friendly helpful staff, great location all at a great price.  We just walked to the harbor for dinner, and the Beach is walkable too but we drove to Dana Strands which we think is a better beach. The only downside might be the noise, but we were on the side not facing PCH. We still had some noise from the AC, and it doesn't help to turn it off because you will just hear the AC from the unit next door. But I thought it was a minor issue, and this hotel deserved 5 stars

Summary Heading: Amazing location and nice, clean rooms
Summary: My husband and I stayed at Dana Point Marina Shores for a quick kid-free getaway in late October. We booked on Hotwire so we got a pretty good deal, but we were pleasantly pleased with the hotel itself as well as the room and it's location.   The hotel is a block or two from Doheny State Beach, which is an AMAZING beach - calm water, great for swimming and beginning surfing, as well as paddle boarding. Perfect for kids, though we didn't bring our own. We traveled mid-week so the beach was nearly deserted. Walking from the hotel saves on parking, and it's about 5 minutes, very doable even carrying stuff to spend the day there. Another 5 or 10 minute walk will take you to Dana Point Harbor, which has shops and restaurants. We didn't spend too much time down there, but the hotel is

The front desk staff get five stars for being efficient and friendly.  We had a standard king room and I would say that is a perfect title for it. There was a small desk, flat screen tv, refrigerator, and a chair with ottoman, as well as the bed. The bathroom is small with almost no counter space. Although there was a large tub which may be nice for soaking, it made for difficult entries and exiting.  The king bed was not comfortable for us but we are picky.  The view out our window was a brown hill out the back and a sign saying you will get a fine if you try to access the balcony.  The housekeeping staff did a great job keeping the room clean.  The hotel is within walking distance of some decent restaurants. The marina and park with beach are a short drive across the highway.

Summary Heading: They had a comfy bed to lay your head....
Summary: Overall, this hotel was OK. It is your standard/nothing fancy room to lay your head after a long day of walking and exploring Dana Point. We found the hallways to be quite noisy, particularly at night which can be a downside when trying to catch a good nights sleep after a long day of travel. We also found that our door let in too much light from the hall (needs to be replaced),  the drapes in our room were also too short as it let in the light from the balcony (that we had no access to) and the AC unit was also quite loud (needs to be relocated or made smaller).   The breakfast is standard/not the best (i.e. coffee, cereal, toast, yogurt, etc) however we found it quite odd that we had to use plastic utensils, paper plates, cups & bowls considering the hotel was trying to be

Strong spray smell in halls.  Room had ionizer air cleaner mid room plus spray smell  I find BW plus just average.   Stayed elsewhere. Yes reasonable price but right on Highway. You need binoculars to see a tiny slice of ocean

Summary Heading: Extremely friendly and well maintained... great location!
Summary: During our trip to California, our family planned to visit the beach, Disneyland and Sea World. This Hotel was in a great location and within reasonable distance to both Sea World and Disneyland. The beach at Dana Point was within walking distance from the Hotel and was so family friendly and beautiful. There were a few restaurants that were within walking distance to Hotel and the Breakfast was great! I would definitely consider returning to this Hotel in the future.

We stayed here based on the location.  It is very well situated for access to the beach and all of the beach cities along the coast.  Although this is not a new facility, it was well cared for and clean.  Getting into and out of the jetted tub to shower in the bathroom might not be everyone's cup of tea, especially if mobility or balance is an issue. Not sure if there are stand-up showers in other rooms. The carpeting in the hallway was a bit tired, but the carpeting, furniture and bedding in the room appeared to be new.  We selected a room on the back side of the building to avoid the noise on PCH, and it was very quiet.  The parking under the hotel is an extra fee, but it beats hunting for parking at the beach.  My only complaint would be that the breakfast room (the breakfast

Summary Heading: Overrated Hotel.  We will hesitate to stay here again.
Summary: I booked the hotel based on the rating and the location. The room was very noisy due to the room facing Pacific Coast Hwy. I had hard time sleeping. The sink in the bathroom was smelly every time I ran the water down.

This was a great hotel that we used for one night before getting the ferry over to Catalina island. It was very conveniently located just down the road. The room was nice and big with a nice comfy bed and we even had a double bath. We were even given a complementary breakfast before leaving. Would quite happily stay here again.

We needed a place to stay before and after going to Catalina Island. We made the resrvation based on location in Dana Point so we could get the ferry eary the next morning. The hotel turned out to be very nice. It had the most comfortable bed! That is so important. They let us leave our car there for the 2 nights we were gone for only $10 per night much safer than the big parking lot at the ferry terminal. When we returned we had a beautiful room with jucuzzi tub. The staff were great.

Well, checked in after booking the room through 3rd party, booked a king online and was told the only room left with a king bed was a suite.  Well they forgot to mention that it was an accessible room.  The worse thing for me!  The bed is lower, the chairs are lower and so is the shower head.   Not good for someone who 6'3".  The shower had NO water pressure, and the second spray head valve wouldn'the even work.  It was OK being next to PCH highway, the room was quiet.  The bed was hard, but the room was clean.

This is a lovely dog-friendly hotel that is less than five minutes by car to the Dana Point Harbor. We stayed in the king room with the whirpool bath - loved it! Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful. Breakfast offered a variety of choices and was nice to have so we didn't have to schlep offsite to eat.

It started when I called the hotel the week before our reservation since we had to add a guest.  Diane at the front desk could not have been nicer.  This was the smoothest  change to a reservation I have ever had.  Everyone at the hotel was as pleasant as could be and very helpful.  I wish all hotels were run this way.

This hotel was very good.  The bed was comfortable and the room quiet.  The first morning we noticed a broken shower head and the TV wasn't working.  While we were away that day, it was all fixed.  They responded very promptly.  We would stay there again.

Our room was wonderful - particularly the jetted tub. However, there were no curtains on the window and it was really hard to sleep late in the morning due to the light. The breakfast offerings are abysmal and should be skipped in favor of most any other options.

Everything was great about the hotel, the location, the rooms, the service. We went to watch a soccer tournament but we wanted to be closer to the ocean. Breakfast was nice, veggie egg whites was a nice and healthy choice to add to the menu. Like the decoration also.  Thank you!

Excellent hotel. This is the 2nd time that I have stayed at this hotel and it definitely worth it. Rooms are very clean and breakfast is well done. Also a very close walk to the beach. Definitely recommend

We arrived at the hotel and booking.com messed up our reservations, we had just drove in from Vegas, and Chis Frazier wasted no time making sure we were taken care of. She was very pleasant and Inviting. So thank you so much Chris F for taking good care of us...  The room was clean and comfortable modern and the breakfast exceeded our expectations. Definitely will be back..

Dana Point is a lovely upscale area about an hour and a half south of LA.  The hotel is within walking distance of the marina which is really stunning with some great restaurants and shops as well as lots of fabulous boats to admire.  Our room was more than comfortable, breakfast was great and there is a nice pool area at the side of the building.  We also used the laundry facilities.  The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and when there was an error made regarding the points we were using for a free night, the manager e-mailed me directly and rectified the situation immediately.  Would definitely recommend both this hotel and this little town!!

Summary Heading: Our 5th Trip to Dana Point C.A
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel for 4 visits over the years. Every time we stay here we really enjoy it . The location is great, close to the harbor and 7 miles to Laguna Beach. We walk or drive to the harbor at least twice a day., it is super mellow althouhgh this year was a bit more crowded. The staff at the hotel is always great. Diane made my reservation and was very nice to us and made us feel special. I walked at  least5 miles a day and the walking around the hotel is both safe and scenic. The women who cleaned our room as well as maintance staff were all very nice and professional. I highly recommend this hotel to any one who would like a great location,friendly and helpful staff at an extremely reasonable price for the area.

Great Hotel we will definitely will stay here again. A perfect location right at center of every attraction. We liked it so much that we came back for a second visit and stay 2 nights. The rooms are very presentable. The granite in the bathrooms brings a nice quality touch to it. Nice flat screen TVs nice furniture. I can‚Äôt even explain how the location made it so easy to travel all over Dana Point to Laguna Beach and San Clemente. Great Hotel highly recommend.

Located in Dana Point this is a great location to enjoy the little beach towns south of LA.  We attended the Pageant of the Masters and  enjoyed wonderful scenery, beaches and delicious food. This is our second stay in this comfortable hotel.  Friendly staff, very clean.

The service was excellent from the front desk who found our reservations (my name was misspelled) to the Manager who helped us out with our luggage when we left.  The rooms were very comfortable and the beds were awesome (not too soft/hard and a good height).  It's an excellent location, close to the Dana Point Harbor and easy on and off from I5. I would definitely recommend this hotel and the staff.

Rented two suites for an extended family vacation.  We had four adults and six kids with other members coming and going.  The hotel was very clean, it's location to the beach is great and several decent restaurants are nearby.  The bedrooms had two queens in each and the living room had a pull out sofa.  Perfect for what we needed.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Orange County
Summary: Great location and fantastic staff. Stayed there in Feb 2016 and will definitely be back. We had to book 2 extra nights in addition to those booked on line. They only had suites available but gave is the same rate at the same price. On one occasion we heard banging coming from the next door room. We called reception to ask the guests next down to pipe down. Within two minutes the noise stopped and we got a phone call from the manager who personally apologized for the inconvenience. Turns out that the noise was due to maintenance works being carried out next door.  They only did the work when we were out which I thought was a nice touch. But then customer service in the US is miles better than anything one comes across on Europe

Summary Heading: Noise from Pacific Coast Highway, inadequate air conditioning
Summary: All rooms face Pacific Coast Highway (PCH). We reserved 2 nights in a suite (living room and bedroom) @ $250+ per night.  First clues that this was a mistake: standing fan in the living room, only air conditioning was in the bedroom-which faced PCH, pairs of earplugs in bedroom, info about keeping the drapes drawn, how to use air conditioner.  Traffic noise went all night, earplugs didn't help, air conditioner was noisy. We left the next morning after a miserable night! Hotel is clean, staff was very nice but....impossible to relax here!

Everything about our stay here has been effortless. Every member of staff has been helpful from directions to getting us to late night milk for a cup of  tea.   The hotel is spotless, from rooms  to  open areas. Breakfast is just what is needed for a day at  the beach. The beach is practically a stone throw away.  For what we paid. I couldn't have asked for more

We stayed at this hotel with friends and family.  For the area, it was very reasonable, clean and great value for money.  Don't expect anything fancy, this is for all intents a motel, but the rooms were large and we stayed in a 2 room "suite" with 2 queens and a pullout in the seating area. It had a microwave, coffee maker and a small wetbar and refrigerator. Room had a balcony and a large whirlpool tub in the bathroom, all for under $200. Our stay included breakfast, but it is really basic, with some cooked food not was not really appealing, They do have fresh juice, cereal, fruit and yogurt which was nice. A small pool that wasn't really worth using, but overall friendly service and clean! I would recommend it to families, and with the money you save you can splurge at the

My experience at the Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel was wonderful from the start. Trinity was on duty at the front desk. She greeted me warmly, expressed interest in my visit and went the extra mile to put me in the perfect room. That room was terrific. Not fancy, but clean, modern and well appointed. The hotel is located close to the Dana Point Marina (where I walked each day), as well as restaurants and other attractions. Parking was convenient, too. Breakfast was a little crowded, but well-stocked and perfectly adequate.  Before my stay, some of the reviews here had me a little worried. But, what I discovered was that the negatives noted by others were super minor. The noise from PCH was not an issue. The posts in the parking lot were easy to maneuver around (that's

I stayed there with my family in one of the double queen suites.  The room was clean and the service was fantastic.  Short drive to any of the local beaches.  I would strongly recommend, especially for families.

I selected Best Western as they accommodated me travelling with my pet. The room was nice and spacious which was nice for the little furry one to run around. I would deodorize the room better. You can definitely tell pets had stayed there. I have stayed in other pet friendly hotels which did not smell like pets. The bed was comfortable and the overall place was what I expected.

Small room with super loud AC. They even offer free earplugs in the room, maybe received lots of customer complaints. Breakfast was good but dining area was small with limited seating. The front desk lady was rude with a careless attitude. Good location which is close to the harbor. Nothing fancy about this place.

Checked in here a little early with no problems and were only staying one night before heading on down to San Diego.  The reception staff were very welcoming and most helpful when we were asking for advice on things to do, places to eat etc.  They recommended a restaurant in San Clemente and we had a really good meal here and also suggested a nearby bar for a drink later that evening.  The room was clean and comfortable and the included breakfast was more than adequate.

Dana Point might not be the liveliest or most charming town along PCH, and this hotel's location is a little bit awkward, squeezed in between a steep hill/cliff and the Pacific Coast Highway (on the ¬´wrong¬ª side of the road from the ocean), but it still has some good vantage points. Rooms are fairly up to date, clean and spacious, and the noise from the highway surprisingly was not bad at all (I became somewhat worried when there were ear-plugs laid out on the nightstand!). Breakfast is included and the selection is decent for a Best Western. There is a nice little pool, although the pool area surrounding the actual water is tiny tiny, and the sun disappears from the pool at around 4 pm. The Doheny State Beach and Dana Point Harbor is literally just a short walk away, and we

This is a good hotel in a good location within walking distance to the beach. Upon check in, the front desk clerk was very helpful and friendly, which gave us a nice first impression. Our room was clean and had everything we needed, including a decent-sized mini-fridge with a small freezer. We liked that breakfast was included, though it was pretty basic and the seating area is too small to accommodate even a fraction of the guests. Overall, this was a positive experience, and I would certainly consider returning here.

We stayed for four nights, during 4th of July holiday this year.  The hotel staff and management really work hard to make sure that the guest has a thoroughly enjoyable stay!  We had the King Suite with Whirlpool room.  We could see the ocean from our window!  I felt like I had walked into a "high end" hotel room.  We were celebrating our 10 year wedding anniversary, and there was even a bottle of champagne, waiting for us in the room with a congratulatory card!  The management and staff knows how to take care of their guests.  The breakfast buffet was delicious, and the staff kept the dining room clean, and supplied at all times.  This hotel is where we will stay on future trips to Dana Point!

We had a wonderful time together as a family for our 1st family vacation.  We have 3 year old twins and a 6 year old and our stay was wonderful.  The rooms were nice and the pool was always kept clean.  The staff delivered extra items we requested promptly and we are very excited to visit again.  Thanks Again

All of the staff, from the front desk to housekeeping were friendly.  One of the female workers in the breakfast room was really helpful and hardworking.  Kept all items refilled and helped guests when needed.  Rooms were clean and updated.Amenities were nice. Air conditioning unit was loud.

We stayed for two nights while in town for a wedding. Great location and easy to get around from the hotel. Staff was friendly. Breakfast was ok, nothing fancy. The room was clean but had some small issues like a constantly running toilet, large hole in the screen near the handle. We were right on the street, which didn't bother us, but it is definitely noisy at night and could easily be an issue. Not sure if the free earplugs are for the street noise or the loud air conditioning unit. Overall, the stay was a success but we would look to stay somewhere else if we returned again.

This was a great place..awesome pool/workout area..The breakfast buffet was one of the best...very clean.Also they individual box cereal instead of the big containers..lived that .The beds were nice and room was very clean..Great staff...especially the guy who's running the breakfast buffet!!

This was an excellent stay for us.  Very relaxing. I used to live above this hotel as a kid so it was great revisiting the area 30 years later...This Best Western was the best of 3 that we stayed in during our trip. We stayed in Sacramento and in Santa Rosa, and this by far was the best!  The rooms are big, the amenities are great, even the breakfast was good!  I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again...

a/c unit is so loud this motel provides free ear plugs. bed was very uncomfortable and should be replaced. tiny fitness facility and pool area had 5 chairs. breakfast was goof and the staff is very friendly

Very helpful reception staff.  Second visit to this hotel and would choose it again.  Doheny State Park is within walking distance and this was the main reason for our trip.    Easy access for So. Cal travel.

We had an exceptionally pleasent stay here in Dana Point. The staff and manager were a joy to work with and so kind. This hotel is across the street from a beautiful beach. The hotel was more than we expected and the staff was amazing! Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Terrific location and service with a smile
Summary: As a traveler on a budget, I wasn't expecting a resort when I booked this place, so I wasn't too disappointed when it turned out not to be one. For my needs, however, it was the perfect home base for a quick tour of Dana Point and surroundings. It's wonderfully located, within walking distance of Doheny/Capistrano, the Lantern District and the marina. Our room was a nice-size space on the third floor that was well-appointed if nothing fancy. Had a balcony with a semi-obstructed beach view and a single chair, but we didn't spend any time out there, anyway. The weirdest thing for us (being from Phoenix) was that the room was not centrally air-conditioned. There was a small window-type unit in the bedroom and a hotel-provided tower fan in the living room. Between the two, we were

We travel a lot and I wanted to really like this hotel, but it was very average. The hotel is on Pacific Coast Highway...very busy with lots of noise from motorcycles and trucks. Nice that they actually leave ear plugs on your nightstand. Staff was friendly. The room was average. The balcony only had one chair (they all had one chair). Breakfast was awful...the food was super cheap (cereal, an apple wrapped tight in celophane, cheap bread and English muffins). The "eggs", were some sort of fake imitation eggs. Yuck! Our second day we went to the marina for coffee and a muffin....much better choice.  Overall, just a very average hotel on a busy street with an icky breakfast.

We booked here for a family function and because we were late other hotels in the area were booked.  I know why this one was still open.  The room smelled, the bathtub had chips in it that looked like bugs, the parking was AWFUL.  We got back late and had to park in an electric vehicle parking spot because no other parking was available, but they charge you $10 to park.  One morning their was even a truck parked sideways blocking cars in because of the lack of parking.

Very cordial friendly staff. Great location. Easy to find. Nice balcony where you get some water view. Small nice clean pool. Clean lobby. Fresh breakfast. Ok internet.  Reserved at $157/night, signed for $157, somehow was charged for almost $190/night and didn't notice till home. They fixed it after I phoned a few times, but the mistake was unsettling. I almost never have to check those things nowadays everything is so up and up. So they could improve things so that didn't recur.  The parking is pretty ample but a bit tight with poles at challenging spots. A little tough to maneuver. The king suite had two rooms, worked well, clean bath, but the second room wasn't so useful - warm, a little couch, more like a luggage room. Did have a fridge and microwave, which was great.

Hotel was within walking distance from the beach and from restaurants. The room was average. The breakfast was fair- thought it would be a little better since it stated that it was a full breakfast but seemed more like a continental breakfast. The pool was a heated pool but was small & there was not a restroom close by the pool, so had to walk to restroom or headback to hotel room. I didn't like that we were charged an extra $10 a night for parking since this was not included in our total price.

Summary Heading: Hotel is good but not the best for dogs
Summary: Hotel was clean, great service, friendly staff. Would stay here again but not with our pet. Incovenient area for pet to "go." Not on property although adjacent. Not the grassy area as promised when we called - unless you want to go across the street to another property.

while not perfect results from previous stays, the staff, location and features of the hotel made it our first choice.  Not disappointed once again and enjoyed our stay.  However this time the charge for parking bothered me; I see no need other than greed and it is enough to make me reconsider before another stay there.

We spent 4 nights here and it was just what we had hoped for. We wanted a nice, clean room with free breakfast at a reasonable price in a good location. We got all of that and more. Very nice people at the desk. Parking is a little tricky as the spaces are tight. Would definitely return to this location.

We took a leisure 3 day get away down the coast. This Best Western Plus was close to our Dana Point activities and a lovely well equipped guest room for us. My husband especially appreciated the the large handicap bathroom for his cripple disability. The double pane windows kept out the traffic sounds below on the blvd.
Manager Response: Hi Diana!  Thank you so much for the kind words and we're glad we were a part of your coastal getaway.  We do our best to make our handicapped facilities as comfortable and accessible as possible and are especially happy that your hubby was pleased with them.  Hope to see you both again in the future.

Summary: We checked in on Tuesday, June 14 and the front desk clerk raved about the beautiful view we would have.  UGH!  We requested an ocean view room.  In order to see the ocean, we had to stand on the balcony, lean over and look way to the left.  In addition, the balcony was solid block so if we sat the wood block was our view.  The door in the front of our our room faced a concrete wall.  Lovely view (not)!  We decided to stay just that night and go elsewhere.  In the morning when we took our luggage to the car, there was a group of men (6 to 8) standing around my car.  When we informed the front desk clerk she was very snotty and said she knew about it.  There was no other explanation.  A guard did offer to walk us to the car which we declined as she didn't indicate a problem.   I
Manager Response: Part of the training for all new hires at the front desk of the Marina Shores is a discussion on how the guest's perception is our reality.  This review is a perfect example of how a guest can see or hear things to be a certain way and we owe it to them to validate their concerns and offer our apologies for what they perceive as failings in service no matter what we think actually transpired.  This I did directly with the guest in several private email exchanges.  I also refunded all of her money because nothing I could have said to her would change her perception of what she believed happened during her stay.  I had hoped she would accept my apology and refund as a gesture of good faith, but apparently this was not the case and for that, I am also sorry.  We never tell our guests that they will have a "beautiful ocean view."  On our websites and in all our literature it states that we are located a block and a half from Doheny State Beach.  There are tall trees across the street between us and the beach so only our suites on the third floor get any view of the water and we tell people they will have an ocean "peek," not an ocean view.  Yes, this guest did request a view of the water when she made her reservation online, so we assigned her a room at the end of the building closest to beach, but no one "raved" about any beautiful view.  This guest had reserved a two room suite and yes, the entrance to the living room portion does face a large, concrete retaining wall on the back of our property.  It is the bedroom balcony that faces the Pacific Coast Highway and provides the view.  The group of people this guest encountered when she left the lobby and headed toward her car were simply a bunch of rude and inconsiderate young guys waiting for a friend of theirs to come down from his room.  Since being rude isn't a crime, all we could do was tell them to wait for him outside  Our security guard asked them to move away from the doors as a courtesy to the guests who were entering and exiting the building.  While there was no need for concern - they weren't approaching anyone or bothering anyone - we did call the local authorities and ask them to do a drive by, just as a precaution.  When the reviewer returned to the front desk to check out, she expressed her concerns to the clerk on duty.  Apparently when the clerk offered her assurances that everything was fine and there was nothing to worry about, the guest took that as being "snotty."  If we had done what the guest suggested in her review and have everyone wait inside, that would have caused a needless panic and upset alot of people.  Lastly, regarding the concrete dust this guest claims was on her car when she returned home, she also said that she spent her last two days in Dana Point at another hotel, so we can't be sure if the debris even came from here.  I asked her to send me a photo that I could pass on to the painting contractor that had been working here the day she stayed but she never sent one.  Yes, travelers, perception IS reality, so please take both this review and my response with a grain of salt.  All I can tell you for certain is that our guests' safety, security and comfort are our highest priorities at the Marina Shores Hotel.  While we may live in troubled times, it is very important not to let our imaginations run wild.  The Marina Shores serves customers from all walks of life, business people and vacationers from all over the world.  It is the diversity of our clients that makes this job so exciting and rewarding.  We may not score a "5" with everyone on Trip Advisor, but we try our hardest to provide the best value, the cleanest rooms and the friendliest staff of all the hotels in the Dana Point area.

Summary: We came here on accident when we were going to another Best Western location at Dana Point that they were so friendly we decided to come back.   It gets booked up quick so book early! They are so friendly here. Kid friendly too! Room is clean. Great breakfast selection. Nice small pool area.   Close enough drive to Disneyland for us.
Manager Response: Guess this was a very fortunate "accident" for all of us!  We're glad you decided to come back and thank you for sharing one special point with your fellow travelers ... our location.  So often we talk about the beach area right here without noting that we are conveniently located between Disneyland and San Diego too.  Everyone knows that hotel prices are incredibly high the closer you get to major attractions and metropolitan areas.  You can get to almost every southern California attraction from here in an hour or less and your hotel stay will be a fraction of what you would pay by Disney or San Diego.  Great call, Sabena and thank you for the great review.

Summary: This property is outstanding in every way. The staff is personable, professional and since I have stayed here a number of times, I am regarded as 'family.' The rooms are always fastidious and tended to immediately. Any occasional problem is taken care of immediately. This is a lovely property and I hope it is there for many years to come.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words and we look forward to welcoming everyone to the Marina Shores "family."  Whether you're a business traveler, a family on vacation or someone just stopping over for the night on a coastal road trip, we want you to feel comfortable and cared for.  See you the next time!

Summary: Great hotel. After driving 9 hours I was greeted by Kenia at the front desk. Friendly, very helpful and patient. From the manager on down, everybody at the hotel wants to make you welcome. Excellent free breakfast in the morning, big clean rooms and excellent location. Plus, the hotel is quiet. I'll be staying here again for my next vacation.
Manager Response: Dave, so glad you enjoyed your stay.  I know you and I had several one-on-one discussions about the hospitality industry and it was great to hear that someone noticed and appreciated all we do to make the Marina Shores feel like a home away from home.  We all look forward to having you back later this summer.

Summary: my girlfriend came from riverside county and i came from LA County to meet for an overnight visit in dana point.   from the beginning, starting w/ getting/re-scheduling  a reservation, the customer service was comforting and friendly as we made and  last-minute changed our plans.   they were all about ‚Äúno worries;  we can make it happen.‚Äù  room was clean and quiet.  the attention to our needs (directions to places we wanted to go;  recommendations on where to eat;  when we wanted to stay in, "who delivers"; etc. (including menus) was exceptional.     we usually pick Best Western when we have our overnights, but feel this one will be a  go-back-again spot for sure.
Manager Response: Being the shameless Marina Shores Hotel promoter that I am, I'd like to mention to our readers that Betty and Judith actually stayed here back in April and I think it's awesome that we made such a great impression on them that even after two months, the memory of our service is so strong that she wanted to post this review.    It was a pleasure having the both of you here and we look forward to the next time you can escape the smog and traffic of home and come see us again!

Summary: This place is well located to catch the ferry to Catalina Island.  The exterior and the lobby  look great, however, once you are inside of the room you can well see that they are tired and old.  There were pieces of wood (e.g., the size of one's hand) and paint missing from the outdoor balcony, and you could see daylight around the entire perimeter of the door when it was closed (so much for enjoying the A/C).  The mattress was imply horrible.  I do not have ANY back problems and my upper back ached after each night's sleep there ... my aching back immediately ceased upon our departure.  The parking lot exit ramp that takes you back out to the street appears to only be able to  accommodate a vehicle about no larger than a (e.g.) Toyota Highlander (e.g., forget a Chevy Suburban,
Manager Response: Dear MB,  Thank you for the honest review and I want you to know that all the room issues you mentioned have been taken care of.  Even though the entire hotel was renovated in 2012, we just replaced 10 of the beds so we can keep everyone's comfort at top level.  We also took care of the repairs to the trim on the balcony that you mentioned.  I'm extremely sorry that we weren't more proactive - none of those issues should have been present when you stayed.

Summary: a very nice and clean hotel. the staff is efficient and welcoming. the hotel is pet-friendly. we recommend this hotel. the room to the back are quiet. the twin room is big and very comfortable. /////////////////////
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review and we are thrilled that you enjoyed your time at the Marina Shores Hotel.  As one of the few pet friendly hotels in our area, it is always our pleasure to open our doors to four-legged guests and their families!

Summary: So, we stayed here for two nights. Overall, it was a nice stay. We paid close to $200 a night, which may be competitive for the area, but I thought it was a bit pricey for this hotel, which I thought was a bit dated. The photos on its website and TripAdvisor make the property look nicer than it actually is. The elevator was super slow so many were just using the stairwell. Breakfast was free, but I was somewhat grossed out that they had rotting fruit mixed in with the fresh stuff. I threw away a rotten orange that was in the bin. It made me wonder how bad the other food potentially was.
Manager Response: Please accept my deepest apologies for the issues you experienced with the fruit in our breakfast room.  There is absolutely no excuse for your finding anything spoiled in our food offerings.  Although many of our items are purchased through a distribution company, we also make several trips a week to local markets just to make sure our fruit is fresh.  I was appalled by your discovery and have reminded all of our breakfast room attendants to be more vigilant and to examine each piece of fruit before adding it to the display baskets.    Regarding the "dated" appearance of the hotel, we actually underwent a complete renovation just four years ago.  While preferences in color schemes and design are up to each individual, I just wanted to assure you that we do everything possible to keep the Marina Shores looking her best at all times.

Summary Heading: Best Western Plus Marina Shores - Dana Point, CA
Summary: The BW Plus Marina Shores was an excellent hotel.  Even better, it was a good price especially for the area.  The service, value, beds, location, rooms, and cleanliness were very good.  I would definitely stay in the Dana Point, CA hotel again.

Clean, easy to access and good price. The front desk was helpful and quick. Check in and out process was quick and efficient. Al areas of the hotel were well maintained and clean. Parking is tight but the location is perfect for access to Dana Point, San Clemente, Mission San Jaun Capistrano and Doheny Beach. I have stayed there several times business and find it meets all my needs.

Summary Heading: Best Value on my recent Cali Trip
Summary: I spent a week traveling Cali, first Yosemite then traveling south from San Fran down the Pacific Coast HWY.  This was my final stop before heading back to the PHX, AZ area the next day.  This hotel cost only a touch more than the other 2 places I had stayed along CA 1 PCH, but this was by FAR my best value.  Room had a balcony, very nice comfy bed, and it was HUGE.  Loved everything, pretty good bfast in the morning too, but the only thing I didnt like here was the coffee. I wasnt staying long in the area, but if I were, this hotel was so close to all kinds of restaurants, shopping, beaches, and it is literally ON the PCH.  Great location, value, and friendly staff.  If I ever return to the area, this is my choice!

My husband and I stayed there for a little weekend getaway. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We had a room with the jetted tub and when we tried to use it, the water smelled like human waste or rotting eggs...either way it was disgusting. The staff were OK, the only person at the front desk that wasn't hiding behind a computer and actually approached us before we had to approach her was a woman named Chris. She was very energetic and positive. Even though we were already being helped and she was helping someone else, she made sure to let us know she would be with us briefly.  The location of this Best Western is great. It is close to the beach and harbor. Both were within walking distance. We had amazing views as well. We will most definitely stay here again in

We usually stay at Best Western hotels because of the reasonable price and closeness to whatever our activity is for the day.  The Dana Pt. Marina Shores Hotel is great.  Very helpful employees, great location and accommodations. It is near restaurants, boat docks and shopping.

When I stay the Staff is always kind and care about their guest. I feel at home when I stay at this Hotel mostly for the staff from the front desk to the breakfast staff and the staff that cleans and fix what needs to be fix. The Caring Staff always have smiles and ask if everything is fine.

I had to stay one night for a business trip and arrived mid week in the winter in the rain, so this is an off review for this property. I assume in season the area bustles. For me, it was dark and quiet. The front desk was repeatedly helpful. Upon check in I was upgraded to a nicer room - great view, fresh air with good circulation, small balcony, whirlpool tub. Gal at the desk recommended a couple of local restaurants with different scenes/price points until she understood my needs. When I returned from dinner I had to do some work and the desk in the room was great. It seems like a small thing, but I was able to really spread out and get things done. At one point I realized I needed copy paper and the manager at the front offered me an entire ream at 11pm so I could finish my

This place was great!  I was skeptical when I found out the price to stay at this hotel but  it was wonderful.  The people were great.  The room was huge and had a fireplace (which we didn't need but it was nice to have) and there was a restaurant attached that had excellent food.  You could walk a short distance to the beach.  We were leaving LA the next night so we just rented an additional day for the money and still came out cheaper than when we stayed one night in Santa Monica.  Definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Summary Heading: Staff & Facilities were more than adequate
Summary: We attended a wedding in Laguna Beach - so we stayed up the street in Dana Point at this Best Western. We used LYFT/UBER for travel to the event. It was close to everything - grocery store to get extra water, great coffee shop/bike shop up the street! Right on PCH - so you can travel up one way or the other to several beach areas or into the LA (if you dare) - LAX is a distance, so I'd suggest LB airport as an alternative.

Summary Heading: I enjoyed this hotel location and room
Summary: This was a work provided room for me.  I really liked the room.  It was a suite with a small balcony.  Very comfortable and clean.  Tv cable was good.  Modern amenities.  Even a spa tub in bathroom.  Some ocean view from balcony.  Good location.  Beach and park right across the street.  PCH runs out front, but after 9:00pm, very quiet.  I would stay here again and on my own dime.   I'm writing this as I chill on the balcony of my room.

wow the spa rooms are really nice,  the breakfast easy good and well placed   the location has the best access to beaches harbor or north or south fun   if you are caught between San Diego fun or LA  you cant go wrong with Dana Point   right in the middle of both and pretty as can be

Our middle school came to stay at this hotel for an academic competition. I had 17 rooms booked and about 40 people staying there. All the parents were impressed with this hotel from the clean and tidy condition of the rooms and lobbies, to their fantastic service. Krista who books the large groups was exceptional at her job and the whole staff was very friendly and made us feel very welcome. When you look at location, price, quality of the hotel and the impeccable service, this place is such a great value that is it a no brainer.

I was pleasantly surprised at this hotel.  We decided to stay at this hotel based on price for one night while travelling to our next destination.  The room was adequate and clean.  Staff was friendly and the breakfast sufficed.  Overall a good experience.

Great staff, who did some magic to let us check in early, after a frazzled and tiring traveling day.  Nice breakfast and nice kitchen host greeted and interacted with guests. We had an ocean view, which is on the noisy Pacific Coast Highway, but fortunately, the hotel had earplugs in the room and it proved not be a problem with our fan running on low.  Fabulous location, only ten minutes walk from Doheny State Park, which is a beautifully tended and relaxed beach.  No fees to enter if you walk in.  The Pacific is expansive here and lots of great relaxing spots to hang out.  Just another ten minute walk away is a little "village" with the yacht club, several restaurants, ice cream shops, etc.  Paddle boarding and kayaking are available, or just meander the rows and rows of boats

Summary Heading: Convenient, Clean & Comfortable Rooms but Noisy Location
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights on a recent trip to Dana Point. The location is excellent, within easy walking distance to the marina and harbor area. The rooms were well kept and very clean. The staff were especially helpful too. Parking is a little limited in the garage behind the hotel and it took us two drive-bys to figure out the entrance was on a side street. Lots of traffic noise from the PCH here so be fore warned and ask for a room facing the back.

After reading reviews, my expectations were definitely too high. This is an average hotel that is both dated and updated, fairly clean & uninspiring. It has a tiny pool not worth visiting, a crappy hotel chain type of breakfast and it's located right on a busy street in beautiful Dana Point. Not really any views and no restaurants or bars nearby if you come in late and hungry like I did. All in all, nothing special.

8 of us descended on Dana Point as a stop-over place on our way to catch a ship at Long Beach.   None of us had ever stayed at this BW, but I took a chance and recommended it to the rest of the group...great recommendation in my opinion!!  The place is really nice and in a good location.  The staff was professional, friendly, and helpful (front desk clerk recommended eating establishments for us out-of-owners).  Nice room and an acceptable breakfast (I'm not much of a breakfast eater anyway).  Glad we stayed here!

Great location with easy access to restaurants, beaches and the harbor, extremely friendly and helpful staff.  Clean rooms, comfortable beds, even though it is right on Pacific Coast Highway it is still quiet in the rooms when trying to sleep. Sometimes weekend prices can be a little high but overall great place to stay!

Second time coming to the Best Western Marina Shores and have never been disappointed.   Staff is friendly, always saying good morning or have a nice day.  We returned to the hotel to celebrate my mom's birthday and was given a bottle of champagne and card.  Hotel is clean, roomy and has comfortable beds.

Good value for money, clean, large rooms, good basic amenities.  Extremely helpful staff, arrived early in the morning  from New Zealand, very tired but they found us a clean room immediately, brought in a microwave at our request.

This Best Western was the economy option for the wedding we attended in the area.  It turned out to be clean, well served by the front desk, and close to the Dana Point Harbor.  The room we had was on the first floor, ours had an in room Jacuzzi tub which we used and was very relaxing.  Breakfast was included in our rate and was quite good with a large variety of fruit, healthy main course options such as egg white only eggs, with a highlight being the automatic pancake machine - all you needed to do was push a single button for a pancake. The eating area for breakfast was relatively small and therefore crowded, a possible downside.  Hotel parking was free but was at times crowded also, we were fortunate to have an easily parked compact car. I did not find road noise to be a

Summary Heading: A welcome surprise and good bargain
Summary: We liked this place.  It had a nice third floor hall with book shelf for readers. Staff very very helpful in giving directions.  The breakfasts are excellent.  They even have a pancake machine that makes its own without any of those messy make your own waffles in motels. There is free wifi.  The price is reasonable for the location.  It looks small facing the highway, but it holds many guests. It is a little difficult to find on a busy highway.

Great hotel and clean but a bad location.   If you are not use to freeway noise or traffic noise, you would not like this hotel.  I am a light sleeper and had trouble sleeping at night despite the ear plugs the hotel supplied.

In the area looking for a stop for the night and happened on this BW Plus.   We have stayed in many Best Westerns but this one I would rate as my number one.   First, the front desk crew on duty, Tiffany and Peter (Manager) were so friendly, I felt we were friends.   We had an online rate but the Manager's special gave us a better, and very reasonable rate, for not only the area but for BW in general!   Our room was good size and nicely appointed.   While we did not use it, there was a jacuzzi tub.   This hotel sits right on the road so road noise could be an issue although the hotel is outside the very touristy area.  We had a room in the back and slept well.  Another in our party had a room on the street and said ear plugs were provided just in case but we're not needed.
Manager Response: Awww ... for all the wonderful things you said it your review, reading that you "felt like friends" was the highlight for all of us.  There's no rule that staying in a hotel shouldn't be fun and we try to exploit that right at check-in.  Whether it's playful jokes about tourists or an impromptu sing-along with the oldies music we have piped into the lobby, we really try to make everyone feel more than welcome.  Like the signs posted throughout the building say, "May all who enter as guests, leave as friends."  As much as this makes for an exceptional stay for our customers, it makes for a fun day for the staff as well.  We enjoyed having you as guests and hope you can come over to play again soon.

Summary: I always feel at home when My Hubby & I stay for whatever reason, My Hubby always tells his co-workers & whoever about the Hotel & offers to pay just so we can stay! The staff, rooms & breakfast are Awesome too!
Manager Response: Hi Joanne!  For all the time and money businesses spend on advertising, it is still customers like you that keep our reputation as solid as it is.  We so appreciate you (and your hubby) promoting the Marina Shores, not only here on Trip Advisor, but to all your friends and associates.  We enjoy having you as members of our family and look forward to welcoming you back the next time you come to town.

Summary: well run hotel.   clean, friendly staff, great location for our traveling Southern California.    Good value for the money.  Very adequate breakfast, well organized.   tight parking, but close. was not aware of modest charge for parking until we checked out.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review, Stephen and we appreciate your choosing the Marina Shores while you were in town.  I apologize for your not being aware of the parking charge.  Many of the online booking sites don't make that fee evident, although we have repeated asked them to place it more prominently on the web pages.  While we don't charge the "resort fees" or any of the other hidden charges some hotels like to use, no one likes surprises of this nature, no matter what it's for.  We do have a large sign at the front desk to remind people at check-in of the parking fee (although Diamond and Platinum level Best Western Rewards members receive free parking!) and it is also noted on the parking pass we issue when guests register, but I fully understand that in the rush to register and settle in, not everyone notices ... and I'm sorry that we did not make the added charge clearer.

Summary Heading: Noisy guests and rat dogs whose owners don't make them stop barking
Summary: Good price for a last-minute check-in. The walls are paper thin and the guests who stayed during my stay, for some reason were loud and discourteous. Someone's dog barked for hours during the middle of the night. SERIOUSLY? Leave your freakin' dog at home if you're not in your room.
Manager Response: While we take pride in being one of the few pet friendly hotels in the area, it is sad that there are some pet owners who don't take responsibility for their four-legged family members.  These animals are important enough to them that they want to include them in their family travels, but will then leave them alone and scared in a strange hotel room.  It is not only sad for the animal, but as you pointed out, it shows no concern for other guests that might be disturbed.  We do our best to work with these customers.  They are advised of the rules for bringing a pet into the hotel and are required to leave a cell phone number with us so if there is an issue, we can get ahold of them quickly.  I'm very sorry that your stay was disturbed.  It is very disheartening to know that some people who travel just don't think to extend the same consideration and courtesy to other travelers that they would expect for themselves.  Fortunately, this is the exception, rather than the rule.

Summary Heading: Great Stay - Breakfast Could Be Improved
Summary: Check in was good - we arrived around 1400 which was before check in time and had to wait for a room but, as BW Diamond Select, they placed us in a suite.  The team at the front desk was really friendly and welcoming and the suite was well worth waiting for.  The hotels sits right off of PCH with nice balcony (I think for all the rooms).  They have a chair on the balcony but the traffic noise makes sitting out less than pleasant.  The room had a separate sitting room and bedroom (with a door) separated by the bathroom and a wet bar.  Each room had a TV and the tub was a whirlpool.  There was a great internet and convenient outlets.  I loved that there was a recycle container in the room.  The room was clean and very nicely appointed.  It was a very good stay.   I also really
Manager Response: We appreciate the kind words and objective review of your stay.  The good news is we are reappointing our breakfast room in April to provide more food options and to help cut down on some of the congestion at the buffet line.

Summary: Staff was very friendly and helpful.  They knew the area and were helpful making dining suggestions and places to see. Rooms were good and we didn't spend much time there anyway because we were out and about.  I would stay again if I were passing through.
Manager Response: Hi Joanne!  Thank you for taking a few moments to remember us on Trip Advisor.  The Marina Shores makes a great central point for exploring the SoCal coast - there is so much to see and do to the north AND the south as well as right here in Dana Point.  The staff stays on top of all the local events ... and if we can't make a recommendation for something, we will go above and beyond to find someone who can.

Summary: We stayed there for 4 nights and used it as a base point. Very clean and good breakfast. When they found out we came on motorcycles they gave us free parking. Great staff and great view from the swimming pool area.
Manager Response: Cruising the Pacific Coast Highway on a motorcycle is one of the remaining images of the American open road.  Glad you made us your stop in Dana Point.  Best Western has had a great partnership with Harley-Davidson for many years (though I don't mean to offend the non-Harley riders) and we welcome ALL the two-wheeled coast explorers!

Summary: Had a large group stay here for a local fund raising event. The hotel and staff were great and everyone enjoyed their stay. Second year here and we will be back next year. By the way, we raised over $31,000 for Laura's House, a local domestic violence shelter.
Manager Response: It is always our pleasure to work with Laura's House.  You provide an incredibly valuable service to the community and it has been an honor serving the needs of the staff and attendees each year.  Thank you for the kind words and we look forward to welcoming you back next year.

Summary Heading: Front Desk Great Service by Steve
Summary: The front desk is the face of any hotel and Steve is a great one. His service went over and above expectations to find me a room that was ready and met my unfortunately, exacting requirements.... and all done with a smile. The hotel is well situated as well as clean, well maintained and a hot breakfast is included. The only disappointment is the pool is quite tiny so no real laps are available and if there are any kids there is absolutely no possibility of actually swimming. In the rooms, the one thing missing is lamps with power outlets in them. Most business travelers (and others) use their cell phones for alarm clocks and they need to be plugged in over night preferably on the nightstand by the bed.
Manager Response: Hi Laurie!  Thank you for sharing this review and I will make sure to pass on your compliments to Steve.  First impressions are also lasting impressions in our industry so it's wonderful that Steve became "the face" of the Marina Shores for you.  It's true that our pool is small, but as the weather warms up, the Pacific beaches will call out to most of our guests anyway.  I was confused by your comment regarding the lack of auxiliary outlets on our lamps.  All the lamps in our guest rooms, both on the desk and the nightstands, have the power outlets for cell phones or other devices.  This was one of the many upgrades when we renovated the hotel back in 2012.  If you happen to see this reply and can call me at the hotel, I will look up the record of your stay and check the room personally.  If one odd lamp came in without the outlets, I would want to replace it right away.

Summary Heading: Great for the price but you get what you pay for
Summary: Stayed here on business.  Wanted to stay near the beach instead of the usual Irvine and couldn't believe the price.  This met everything I needed.  I got a great rate on a King Suite with balcony and ocean view.  I was super excited.  I spend so little time in the room on these trips that I hate to spend a lot of money.  I had heard about parking being a nightmare, and if you have a big car, it will be "fun".  You'll have to maneuver a little.  I drive a Cadillac ATS (small car) and it was no biggie at all really.  You are haggling with big parking garage beams.  I didn't realize the first night that if you continue driving to the end of the parking garage, it will take you around to the front (PCH side) of the hotel and there is a lot of parking and no one hardly parked there.
Manager Response: Hello "Ms. Bing" and thank you for providing an in depth review of your stay with us.  You brought out quite a few good points that will serve as an excellent guide to future travelers.  I wanted to let you know that we have replaced the bed in the room you used and I'm terribly sorry for your discomfort during your stay.  As I have said to many of the reviewers in the past, Dana Point has grown tremendously, both in population and as a tourism draw, since the Marina Shores Hotel was built almost 30 years ago.  The traffic along the Pacific Coast Highway is one of the prices of prosperity.  We installed double-paned, sound dampening windows and balcony doors several years ago in an effort to combat the noise from the world outside, our alarm clock radios have "white noise" settings, like falling rain and ocean waves to try and drown out the traffic and we recently started providing earplugs as an amenity in our rooms for the light sleepers.  The pricier five-star resorts may offer the more isolated locations, but we still believe that the Marina Shores offers the best value for its location ... and like you said, the service is fantastic!  Thank you again for sharing your comments.

Summary Heading: Great service by Tom & Trinity | Front Desk
Summary: With hotels in Laguna Beach and Dana Point fully booked and not any room available in a radius of 1,5 hours drive from here we arrived at Best Western Plus Marina Shores to ask for some help. Both Tom and Trinity of the front desk did all they could to help us out.  After several attempts to find something using the hotels computers, without success, Tom made it happen that we could stay at the Best Western Marina Shores after all by "juggling" with the booking system. A very lucky chance! Both Tom and Trinity kept a very high level of service during peak times (lots of people calling in to ask for a room and customers at the front desk). We spent a good night at the hotel, with great location nearby the beach and boats to go whale & dolphin watching. Thank you Tom & Trinity;
Manager Response: Hi Annemarie and thank you for the wonderful review of the Marina Shores and ESPECIALLY Tom & Trinity.  You have no idea how much it means to the staff members to be remembered by our guests.  You experienced first-hand the level of service we try to provide.  For other readers, these poor folks arrived in town with no reservations and all the hotels for about 30 miles were sold out, including us.  At any other hotel, they might have just received a cold, "sorry, no vacancies" and be sent on their way.  Tom and Trinity took the time to call everywhere and helped them search online for accommodations.  Finally, we had a last minute cancellation so we were able to check them in and give them their happy ending.  THAT is what hospitality is all about.  I am extremely proud of both Tom and Trinity and are glad they were able to make your trip to Dana Point memorable for all the right reasons.
