Summary: This was one of the best hotel experiences my family has ever had. Everything was just perfect. Clean, well maintained, staff helpful and friendly...All that you could ever ask for in a hotel. Should be rated a 4 Star!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words, Jon and we're glad your family was so happy with our family.  The staff of the Marina Shores is dedicated to making every aspect of your stay special and memorable.  The front desk is an over-the-top welcoming committee, our housekeeping staff goes the extra mile to make sure every inch of your room is spotless and the maintenance team stays on top of every service issue that arises.

Summary: Nice place close to everything you need to go Whale watching or visiting the beach. Have stayed at other locations in Dana Point but this was the first time at this location. Very pleased with the room and service. Nice breakfast in the morning too.

Excellent. We needed a local hotel that gave us access to local area shopping, relaxing and to complete arrangements of our move in. The hosts and staff gave us super recommendations on where to shop and the local environment.

Dana Point is home to some incredibly posh resorts and while this place is not in that league, it has three things going for it (1) a great location with decent views of the ocean and Dana Point Harbor (2) large rooms with nice furnishings and a comfortable bed and (3) outstanding price point. The folks who run the place are friendly and helpful. Parking is easy and on site and there is laundry. Also the place is spotlessly clean.

Summary Heading: Mix of good and less good
Summary: The staff was very polite and professional, but did not help us to sufficiently solve two noise issues during our 21 day stay. The first was on arrival night when fire alarm was beeping whole night from midnight. Receptionist informed us that service will come in the morning - they compensated us with 60 USD, but 4 people could not sleep that night! Second noise experience lasted for four nights when people above were gettin up at 5 a.m. and taking showers etc. Hotel staff did not provide info upon numerous questions about the noise, so I finally discovered a company working crew occupynig room above us. They should move us after the first night!! They gave us Best Western Points as compensation, but we did not sleep well these 4 nights due to bad staff consideration. Peter

The breakfast was very good every day.  Al, who appeared to be in charge, was always happy with a smile on his face, helpful and remembered our names every morning.  It was nice being greeted each morning by name.  All the other staff in the breakfast area were also friendly and helpful; we didn't get their names.  The only complaint with the area is that it isn't very large (crowded).  The majority of the desk staff were friendly and very helpful.  We enjoyed our room and waking up each morning to see the sun shining off the ocean (there were no leaves on the trees-December).  The only complaint was the hot water in the shower.  If a room has very hot water at the faucet and in the hot tub then why can't there be hot water in the shower.  I don't know if this was just a problem

Hotel was very nice in a nice location.  The Staff was very helpful.  My son who is stationed in San Diego met up with us for dinner and stayed one of the two nights with us.  When I asked for a rollaway, the nice Desk clerk offered us a free upgrade giving him a couch bed to sleep on.  I was impressed with the service of the staff the options for the breakfast and overall quality of The Hotel.  I would recommend this Hotel.

This is a pleasant hotel if you are traveling to Dana Point.  Covered parking since it is under the hotel for  $10.00 per day. BW always gives you your money's worth but never exceeds your expectations. The staff was very friendly and helpful, breakfast was as usual.  Wish there were more healthful items. The room was comfortable, but noisy overnight since it is on the Pacific Coast Hwy.

Very nice hotel.  Everything was at our finger tips.  The staff was great.  The room was nice.  The only thing I would do different is I would go out for breakfast.  It is right by the Marina.  Not far from the beach.

Great staff, typical of good consistent Best Western quality, while affordable.  PCH side of hotel can be noisy, traffic is almost constant, parking is tight, but where in CA is it not?  Breakfast area is small for the number of guests, but it was a free hot breakfast.

Summary Heading: On our way to San Diego
Summary: Little gem in Dana Point. The overall experience was spectacular The staff members were attentive and prompt, but not overbearing. The room clean and sunny. We will be back and we will send our friends.

Summary Heading: Great value and walking distance to marina
Summary: My husband and I booked a king suite room for 3 nights at this Best Western.  Although the furnishings are a little dated, I was very pleased with our choice.  This hotel is a good value compared to the hotels in the area.  Some of my reasons are that It is located within walking distance of the  Dana Point Marina, is right on the Pacific Coast Highway, and has parking for a reasonable $10 per night fee.  The suite was perfect for the two of us.  It had a comfortable king-sized bed in the master with a slider to the balcony.  From our 3rd floor room, we had a nice view of the distant ocean and a lovely sunset each night.  In the living area of the suite, there was a pull-out couch that proved to be useful when our son stayed one night.   Both rooms were equipped with t.vs.  The

the staff is the best always carful to suit all your needs the horse shoe parking cn be trcky but drop your luggage at the door and then there really is no bad space to park  easy to access restaraunts and a store all walking distance   gotta love Dana  point and a best western to make it all feel likek home

Large room, well cleaned with comfortable beds and a whirlpool in the room. Friendly staff, complementary hot breakfast. Easy to find parking, close to the highway. A good night sleep. I would stay there again.

A wonderful property.  Service was excellent.  Their two room suites are perfect for families as the kids can use the sleeper couch in the living room.  Definately would stay again.  Their self service breakfast included a wide variety of items including a number of hot items.

Summary Heading: Best Western PLUS Marina Shores Hotel, Dana Point, CA
Summary: Very, very satisfied with out stay at this hotel.  I would highly recommend this hotel to others. It is a high quality hotel, great breakfast and has a great location. Do not hesitate booking a stay here.

We stayed in a 2 queen bed suite with our 10 year old granddaughter.  This hotel was clean and very comfortable.  The seating area and second TV was great.  The beds were comfortable.  We really enjoyed the pool.  This time of year the pools are often to cool for swimming but this one was almost bath tub temperature.  The pool was a nice size for family play-up to 5 foot.   We had a balcony with a view of the marina a couple blocks away. The hotel serviced a good breakfast with pancakes and egg/bacon along with the normal cereal and yogurt.  The staff was friendly and helpful. If in the area, we would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Best Lodging Value in Dana Point
Summary: First time staying at this hotel.  Won't stay anywhere else in Dana Point in the future.  Fantastic accommodations and service.  The room was excellent, the breakfast variety for a Best Western was top notch.  The staff could not have been any more friendly and professional.  Great job Peter (the manager)!

Summary Heading: Great customer service for a great price!
Summary: I was in Dana Point for a business dinner but decided last minute to bring my husband and son. This was my son's first hotel stay and he was very excited!!  We had chosen the room based on the giant Jacuzzi tub that we'd seen  on the website, but when we got to our room it was a suite with a separate living space but a small jetted bath tub.  I went back downstairs and Krista and Kenia were AMAZING!  They found us the perfect room on the first floor with the giant Jacuzzi that my son had hoped for!  The staff all around were amazing and accommodating.  Super family and business travel friendly!

Summary Heading: Quality and consistently good place to stay
Summary: This is a great hotel for the price.( Price is higher during the summer.) Staff is professional and accommodating. Breakfast is the usual stuff but always plentiful and fresh. Rooms are always clean. Location is centralized in Dana Point.

HVAC in room was noisy. Maid service was very good with no complaints. I want happy when they tried to charge me ten dollars a day for parking.  I told then that the Hilton doesn't charge guests extra for parking, and they waived my parking fee. Overall, it's a very good place to stay, but they do have some quirky issues. I normally would never consider a Best Western, but this place is an exception. I recommend it, but read the fine print.
Manager Response: Dear "Armchair,"    Thank you for the review and we appreciate your objectivity - even though there were some issues with your stay, you still endorsed the hotel overall, which was extremely fair.  Our goal is for every guest to enjoy a clean, trouble free room and to receive warm, friendly service ... obviously there will be occasions where something will go wrong - in this case a noisy air conditioner - then the important thing is that the hotel (any decent hotel, anyway) leaps to correct the issue as soon as they become aware.    Now, regarding the parking fee ... most of the hotels in our area charge for parking.  Of these hotels, our $10/night fee is the lowest.  Many of the hotels charge a mysterious "resort fee" (I don't think anyone has actually figured out what that fee covers) and some hotels actually charge that in addition to the parking.  We stress that, even if you add the nightly parking to our room rate, you still come out paying less than you would at any mid-tier hotel in our market.  I have to assume that the Hilton you were referring to wasn't the one in Dana Point because they actually DO charge for parking; $22.00/night.  The GOOD new is that all Best Western Rewards members who achieve Diamond or Platinum status receive free parking at the Marina Shores ... one of the many reasons that it pays to be a member of the Best Western loyalty program.

Summary: The Best Western Dana Point : Perfect location! The hotel was clean, nice,  quiet and in walking distance to restaurants and Harbor.  I'd recommend it to friends and families a they are kid and dog friendly

Classic property with nice upgrades. Close to everything, right on PCH. Rooms were large, clean, and all amenities worked well. Jacuzzi tub was great my wife says. Convenient location for good food, fast food, sightseeing, and area travel. Our room overlooked highway and ocean. Noise was never a problem when closing drapes at night. Parking spaces are a bit snug.  Recommend: 1)Stacks restaurant for great breakfast (just across the street) 2) Watermans for fresh, reasonably priced seafood (Don't miss happy hour prices). 3)Dana Wharf whalewatching tours (very reasonably priced and customer friendly). 4) Mission San Juan Capistrano (quick drive and fascinating).

When checking in the girls at the front desk where very nice & helpful. The room was very clean and the internet was good. My husband & I enjoyed our stay and was close to everything we wanted to see and do. I would stay again if in the area.

Just okay.  Little problems with doors, TV, key cards.  Great location.  Looks good on the surface, but needs some remodeling...the staff was efficient, but just doing their job. We will probably look for another facility when we visit this area in the future.

Overall the hotel was nice and you can't beat the location. I was a little worried after reading the reviews about the traffic noise, but we didn't have any problems and slept great. The manager was accommodating when I requested a quiet room, he even called me the night before our stay just to make sure I got what I requested (which I thought was great!). I would definitely stay there again if needed.

Summary Heading: Best hotel in Dana Point CA (in our opinion)
Summary: Very friendly staff, very comfortable bed and room, excellent breakfast (even a pancake machine!) quiet area, short walk to beach, good value for a very pleasant stay. The desk clerk willingly made copies for my husband. We will stay here again if in the area.

All staff was friendly. Room was nice- living room with couch & TV in front, smaller bathroom, then bedroom with TV & a balcony. Noise was never an issue, air conditioner unit outside was louder than traffic. Had a peek-a-boo view of the water between the trees. Room was clean & decorated well. Parking can be a little tight & it is $10. Only complaint was the shower head is not moveable & shoots to the opposite shower wall, but no problem with water pressure. We will stay again.

Overall a very nice Hotel. Comfortable beds, clean restrooms, big shower, balcony, pool, and gym. The free breakfast was very good. Well lit parking structure and overall a very good location to stay while visiting the area.

My last 4 overnight getaways have all been at Best Westerns in different states.  I usually decide on a King Suite with a sleeper because I travel with another couple.  This time, I got creative and used the second mattress in the one bedroom on my sleeper and had a better night's sleep with privacy.

Stayed here last minute and couldn't have been happier..great location (we took the train down so we just walked everywhere), wonderful breakfast, spacious room, friendly staff.  All for $113/nt!! Can't beat that!   Make sure to try Stillwaters down the street for a great Happy Hour!

Great hotel in an area with varying hotel quality. Staff are very friendly and do all they can to make you feel welcome.  Walking distance to Doheny Beach and a few minutes drive to plenty of other beaches.   Breakfast is OK, usual BW fare.  Plenty of good restaurants nearby.  Only thing is that it feels like the hotel is in need of a refresh.  Bathroom fittings are a bit old, etc... But overall, nothing major.

The Best Western PLUS at Marine Shores in Dana Point, CA is a gem!  Our stay was very pleasant and we had no negative issues whatsoever.  The breakfast was delicious and presented very well.  Staff at the hotel were quite friendly and helpful.  Our room was clean and spacious.  I would highly recommend this hotel!

Summary Heading: Best Western PLUS Marina Shores Hotel
Summary: Our stay went well ... other than the last morning and the time to leave  for the airport...the hot water was not working...they got it repaired before we left the hotel but we missed out on it. The hotel promised to reimburse us through Expedia.  We enjoyed the location, and walked to everything in Dana Point. Every day we went to the harbor...we used the bus 1 time and that worked well.

Nothing fancy but very clean and a great location! Visited several times when my son was in the Marine corps. Good price for the area and has everything you need close also right next to the 5.I would use this hotel again!

‚ÄúBest Western Stay‚Äù  5 of 5 starsReviewed 2 days ago  NEW    I was in the process of relocating to Dana Point CA for my job. One day Leslie La Berge- Sales Manager @ Best Western Marina Shores Hotel in Dana Point CA had stopped by my work and dropped off some Best Western Marina Shores Hotel promo info and a business card and said she could give me a great rate if I ever needed to stay at the hotel. A few weeks later I gave her a call and she took care of everything. I would have never had thought of staying at the Best Western Marina Shores Hotel if not for her efforts. At check in, Diana at the front desk was also very helpful. She even had an extra razor so I could shave that night. The entire staff was caring and professional. I know now where to stay if I am ever In need of

The wife and I were travelling from Santa Monica to San Diego and decided to make a stop to see some old friends in Dana Point. This hotel is walking distance to the harbor which offers numerous dining and shopping locations. We arrived early and the front desk was able to get us in at 1:30pm even though check-in time isn't until 3pm. All of the staff was absolutely wonderful and extremely accomodating to all our requests ( my wife requires a dozen pillows!). Breakfast was complementary, nothing spectacular but filled you up for the day. We didn't even use the pool because the beach is right down the road! For almost a quarter of the price of surrounding hotels, this place has extremely clean rooms, great service and perfect location making it the best value in town, hands down.
Manager Response: Hi Mike!  We're glad you and your wife enjoyed your time in Dana Point and had the opportunity to get together with old friends.  There are always wonderful stories behind why travelers stop in and it's an honor to be that home-away-from-home no matter what brings people to town.  I think you hit on every selling point of what makes a stay at the Marina Shores special.  We have won awards from Best Western all three years we have been with the brand for our room cleanliness - a glowing tribute to the incredible housekeeping and maintenance staff we have on board.  The friendliness of the staff is no accident ... you may have noticed throughout the building we have signs that say "May all who enter as guests, leave as friends."  That is our mantra.  Friendly service and the best value near the beach.  Hope to see you on your next trip through!

Summary: First Time we ever stayed in a Best Western.  We found it clean and comfortable.  Great dollar value!!  Paying for parking was the only thing we didn't like about the place.  Good location in a very cute town.
Manager Response: Dear Jim,  Thank you for the kind review and we're glad you enjoyed your time at the Marina Shores.  We are proud we had the chance to be your first time with Best Western.  Our goal is always to provide the best value to visitors to the Dana Point area.  Even with the parking charge, we usually end up the lowest priced mid-tier hotel in town.

Summary Heading: Noisy PCH traffic in your hotel room
Summary: Requested a quiet room - Got a noisy room on PCH side. Could not sleep the first night due to poor mattress, pillow, and noise. Construction noise from room re-models going on all day long too. Water pressure so low you cannot get the shampoo out of your hair. Self parking costs $10 extra per day, when there is street parking available on the side street. Stay Elsewhere - this place is not good value. ** Hey Mr Hotel Manager Dude - instead of spending your time making lame excuses on TA, how about addressing your hotels problems?
Manager Response: I'm sorry for the issues you experienced during your stay.  You kind of have me on the ropes here because anything I might say beyond apologizing could be taken as an excuse and I don't want to give that impression.  There are many reviews that mention the traffic noise from the Pacific Coast Highway so when people ask for a quiet room we make every effort to pre-assign a room on the back side of the building whenever possible.  The only time we can't do anything about this is when a guest reserves a whirlpool suite or a two-room suite - all those are on the front side of the building.  When this happens, we try to contact the guests ahead of time to let them know so they can make an informed decision on their stay.  I don't know what room type you had, but if we dropped the ball on this, that was clearly our fault and I am sorry.  If you don't mind contacting me directly at the hotel to let me know what room you were in, I can make sure the mattress is replaced.  All our beds were replaced in 2012 as part of a property-wide renovation so usually any negative comment about the bed is just a matter of personal opinion - all our beds are the same make and model, yet a few people will find them too hard, others too soft.  If yours needs to be replaced, I would want to take care of it immediately so no other guests experience the same discomfort.  I'm truly sorry that you find my responses "lame."  Trip Advisor affords travelers the unique opportunity to read about the hotel experience from both sides of the counter.  Personally, I think that I owe my guests more than a generic apology.  Sometimes an explanation is in order and I do my best to offer that.  It's not a coincidence that the majority of the negative reviews come from people who reserved rooms through third party websites like Expedia and Priceline.  The information they provide cannot match the details available when you contact a hotel directly ... even if you book through these other sites, it's always advisable to call the hotel afterward to clarify your special requests or if you have any questions.  I'm not offering this as any more than a travel tip.  It doesn't excuse noise, low water pressure or an uncomfortable bed.  I will again offer to have you contact me directly so I can get the details we need to take care of the issues and so I can apologize to you personally.

Summary: Accommodations not adequate for disabled person, needed to walk past 17 rooms to get to our destination.  Bed and bathroom sink not correct height.  Room air conditioning only cooled an alcove of the room, not the entire space, therefore sleeping was not comfortable since the room was always warm and couldn't  be controlled.
Manager Response: As we discussed on the phone when you were staying here, there were other room options available that would have allowed you to be much more comfortable.  The staff volunteered to move all your belongings for you, so you would be free to enjoy your time at the wedding with no worries.  I'm sorry that you opted to remain in the room that you weren't happy with.  I have reached out to you by phone message and by email to find out why you chose not to accept our offer of assistance.  Travelers with disabilities deserve to be comfortable, which is why we offer two types of handicapped access rooms; those with railings for guests who are 100% self-sufficient and wheelchair access rooms for those with limited mobility and who need the extra space and a roll-in shower.  All of these rooms meet or exceed the federal ADA requirements.  As I assured you on the phone, your comfort was very important to us.  Your review has me at a loss ... when we concluded our conversation on the phone, you said you were happy and appreciated our solutions.  Your review sounds just the opposite and I'm not sure why you rejected our offer to help.

Summary: Five stars for the front desk guy, very nice. But looks and reviews can be deceiving. Room was clean enough, had ant issues and bathroom was a bit disgusting. Flipped over the shower drain and it had a thick gross film on it. The pool was dirty, cold and small. Elevators and hallways were about 120 degrees and the room ac wasn't much better.  If you like Motel 6 then you'll love this place.
Manager Response: I was extremely saddened to read your review and if personal apologies are in order, I would welcome you to contact me directly at the hotel so I can make amends.  I've checked with the company who takes care of all our pool maintenance and they said there have been no issues with the heater or the filtration system - they are out twice a week to service the pool and it has been at a constant 80 degrees and their cleaning has been routine so I am at a loss for your observations.  I am extremely sorry for the heat in the public areas of the hotel.  The past few weeks have been unseasonably hot and humid - temperatures on the beach of 100 degrees are almost unheard of here.  Many of the local homeowners and businesses have been suffering from the oppressive heat, but you have every right to expect to be comfortable when you step indoors.  Your room concerns have been shared with our housekeeping staff - there is no excuse for any residue on a tub drain and for that, I do extend my deepest apologies.

Summary: very clean and a good location.  good mexican restaurant up the street called Carlo's.  Not right on the beach but you can walk to it.  It is $10 for parking.  I don't know why they charge for parking though since it isn't in a big city.  there is a small pool and a small gym.

BW is a extremely convenient hotel to stay at when you are there to surf and play in the ocean.  Great parking, shops and restaurants nearby to take care of your needs.  A 5 minute walk gets you to Doheny beach where all the fun is.   Room was spacious and the amenities nice, the standard breakfast is enough to get you started for the day. Staff was very nice, check in and out very quick and easy. My only suggestion...more comfortable pillows!

The hotel is one of the few mid-range priced hotels in the Laguna Beach area.  For the price as a no-frills hotel, the amenities were excellent.  The wi-fi was fast and included in the nightly rate.  Breakfast was well-stocked.  Additionally, the bed and sheets were new, clean, and comfortable.  I would recommend this hotel for budget-minded travelers in this notoriously expensive destinatio.

We booked two nights here for a wedding and could not have been happier.  Our room was fantastic, extremely clean and staff was super.  Also, our bed was extremely comfortable!  We would book this hotel again when traveling close to San Diego.  Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Going the extra mile for customer service - NICE!
Summary: My partner and I had the pleasure of staying at the Best Western Plus Marina Shores in Dana Point for a special weekend during the summer. It was really nice. And we ended up getting to go back as a small glitch with the fireplace and my inquiry afterward prompted the manager, Peter Callan, to invite us back at no charge. We had an equally super time!!! We both appreciate the attention given to making sure guests are happy. Thank you, Peter and Best Western!

Summary Heading: Quiet for being on PCH; good value for the location; exceeded expectations
Summary: We stayed here for a couple day visit to local beaches. Clean, comfortable, good breakfast, good value for the price for this area ( compare against the Ritz down the road ). I was a little concerned about it being loud with the location on PCH but it was very quiet - and we had a room on the highway side.  We will stay here again next time we are in the area.

Summary Heading: This is really a nice Best Western
Summary: This is really a nice Best Western Hotel.  The staff are friendly, and helpful.  We visited during our wedding anniversary, and the manager sent us a comp'ed bottle of bubbly to celebrate with.  The breakfast is included ... however, it is your typical high carb continental breakfast.  It does include small omelets, which I assume are probably prepared in a microwave.

We stayed in this hotel for a whole week with my family of 5, they gave us a free upgrade and our kids had a bed (sofa) and a couch. A little tight but we want just the hotel to sleep. The parking is in the back and it super safe. From the hotel you can walk to the beach, restaurants, shops, etc... traveling in a car was easy and you are like 10 minutes from Laguna Beach and other places. The service in the hotel was great. The pool was fun for the kids.

Very pleasantly surprised! This is a beautiful hotel; beautiful room but I wish that the wifi had worked!  Was never able to use this one amenity. Great bathroom with giant whirlpool tub. I would recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: best place to on the pch and close to harbor
Summary: the whole experience is a must   the stairway is a fun way to get to pch even though the elevator takes you anywhere the front steps with dolp[in stauties is a must  beds are amazing as well as the tvs all lgs with perfect pictures  i was amazed at the quality of everything about the pklace   staff is over the top perfect well placed and professional with a touch of best western friendly

Great customer service from Tom!  He goes over and beyond his duties to be helpful. We stayed in a one bedroom suite with two queen beds.  The beds where very comfortable!  Very clean and the balcony had views of the oceans. Very clean.

The hotel was very clean, well maintained.  The staff was always friendly.  We felt that the hotel used high quality fixtures in the room.  We stayed in the suite, with a living room, bathroom and bedroom.  When I wanted to watch something different that my husband, he went into the bedroom and watched that tv.  The breakfast was good.  I especially enjoyed the egg whites with herbs.  I will definately stay here again.

We found this hotel to be very friendly and clean.  It was walking distance to Doheney Beach and Dana Point Marina. Lots of nice restaurants plus McDonalds and Denny's are nearby.  We had the hotel breakfast and ate out for the other meals. Our only small complainit was the breakfast room was too crowded. The staff couldn't have been nicer. A stroller for the baby and the other kids walked to the beach, no problem.

This is a great place to say with or without your fur children.   if you're looking for a hotel with a great location, clean and easy access, this is your place.  The staff is helpful and kind alway making sure you were taken care of and you get a breakfast included in the price to stay.

Summary Heading: Can't wait to stay at this hotel again, my stay could not have been better!
Summary: An absolutely awesome hotel to stay at. Everything was GREAT, staff were awesome, breakfast was fantastic, the room was super clean and quiet, bed and pillows really comfy. Everyone that runs and works at this hotel deserve a big pat on the back, congratulations to all staff on making this an awesome place to stay. Thankyou to you all. I will Definately be staying here again. Thanks for helping to make my vacation awesome :) See you next time

Summary Heading: Great hotel close to laguna beach for Pageant of the Masters.
Summary: We had a King suite with a small balcony. Room was well appointed and updated.we were on 3rd floor. Very quiet even though we were facing Pacific Coast HWY. Had small refrigerator which we always appreciate. Only negative was insufficient air conditioning for the size of the suite. Really need another AC in the sitting area.

Outstanding service from staff.  Had quiet room on top floor back side of hotel.  Clean.  Modest, but adequate breakfast. Great location with short (0.4 mi) walk to beach, and access to very nice biking/running path (i.e. San Juan Creek Trail).  Parking was convenient and covered.

Chose this hotel for several reasons and we were surprised by the quality of the hotel. We needed to be close to the marina and so many hotels in the area were twice the price for the room and parking charges. We had a newly remodeled room with a huge bathroom that was nicely appointed for this level of a hotel. Parking was $10 per night compared to $25+ at many others. Breakfast was typical but well maintained by the staff and free!  Beds were comfortable and the pillows were a welcome change from some of the awful pillows we've had at other chains.   I would recommend for staying in this area as it is easily accessible to the highway and coastal towns

A gentleman in the dining room (Al) always started our day off right with a smile and pleasant conversation. It was obvious that he loves being around people and is willing to serve others when he can. You are lucky to have him, as are your guests. The staff make this a better than average hotel.

all employees were very nice room was clean and quite bed was very comfortable breakfast was nice with egg whites and stuff coffee tasted good very close to resturants and beach parking was not really available outside the hotel so you have to pay for it

The location was why we choose it. The staff and amenities is why we'll come back!  We had made a mistake on our reservation that wasn't realized until we went to check in. The staff were amazing to accommodate us in such a timely fashion, and even checked us in early. So friendly and knowledgeable.  Rooms were spacious and comfy. So bummed we didn't have time to enjoy the jacuzzi tub, I bet it was great! Balcony with view of the water was lovely.  Thank you and highly recommended!

Traveling with my two daughters (12 and 13) and booked the suite with two beds. Perfect!! They each had their own bed and I had the sofa bed in the other room  (with TV). The bathroom is in the middle. Great staff and location. Decent breakfast.

Everyone was friendly and courteous.  The room was perfect as was the comfy mattress.  Parking is tight and high at $10.00 a day.   Good location across the street from Doheny State Beach and just 10 miles from Laguna for the Pageant.

I have stayed at lots of Best Western's that were the same room, for much less.  It's all about the dates, I get it, but for Seniors, forget this one, because it's not on the Beach, for the money.  It was CLEAN, Friendly Staff, Good Breakfast, but not worth  454.00 for 2 nights.

Summary Heading: Great, affordable choice in South Orange County
Summary: Our family has stayed at this hotel at least twice over the last few years.  The location is close to clean, picturesque beaches and the service is friendly and helpful.  Parking can be a bit tight, but it's free, which will save you money because the beach towns to the north tend to charge for their parking.  This hotel is a go-to choice because the rates are so reasonable.

The only hotel in Dana Point with 3 adjoining rooms @ a terrific price! - called the Doheny Suites - named after the State Park/Beach...  Very clean, modern decor and great for families and friends who want to stay and play together! Walk to the harbor, Ocean Institute, playground, Dana's famous beginners surfing beach, Dana Point's baby beach, tons of restaurants, Ralph's market, Rita's Italian Ice for dessert, and fast food. Quality and value at its best! Thank you!

Hotel was very comfortable, check in and advice from night manager was excellent.  Shower was great, and breakfast included eggs, ham and do-it-yourself pancake machine instead of the usual cereal, rolls, and drinks of other hotels.  Dana Point is just a block or two down the street.  We would recommend this hotel highly.

A smart hotel with attractive rooms in an excellent location within 10-15 minutes walk to the beach. My main point of critical comment I can make is that the breakfasts are poor. My kids described them as plastic tasting and refused to eat them.

I just want you guys at BWP Marina Shores to know that Leslie La Berge has made it so easy for me to get my travel arrangements handled. It is so difficult sometimes to make arrangements for people in our law firm that are traveling back and forth across the state. Thank you so Much Leslie for making it so easy on me!

We booked the Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel 8/1-8/3/15 and really enjoyed our stay. They allowed us to check in early after our 9 hour drive, and that was nice because it allowed us to spend some quality time on one of the beautiful beaches. The rooms were very clean and spacious which was great considering we were a party of 5. Our room had an extra pullout couch in an adjoining room. The hotel is conveniently located close to I-5 on the PCH next to Dana Point Harbor. It is within walking distance to many nice restaurants and a local beach. I look forward to our next stay at the Marina Shores Hotel. Thanks! Mark

We really liked our stay at the Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel.  They were able to accommodate an early check in so we could get ready for a wedding rehearsal and a late check out so the kids could go to the beach. ( Doheny beach is a short 10 minute walk from the hotel)  Our queen suite looked updated with tasteful decor and furniture, and was comfortable for our large family.  The sink in the kitchenette area and the seperate bedroom made it easier for our group to get ready.  The balcony has a peek-a boo view of the ocean and is a good spot for wet beach items.  While the air conditioning unit is in the bedroom, a column fan keep the living room area comfortable.  The pool was small but warm, and the kids enjoyed it.  The exercise room, open 24 hours, was really nice

We stayed in this hotel because we just had to use our accumulated points for being Best Western customers/members for a long time. The rooms are clean and OK. Breakfast... we nearly skipped because there were Not enough space to seat in at the time. There was an elderly we saw who got food and was going to take it to his room to eat there instead. The poor guy accidentally dropped his food onto the hallway floor...probably from being fidgety. That shouldn't have happened but we learned a lesson from him though,.... we took our breakfast to our room. Overall, our stay is OK.

Good Value hotel. Clean and spacious rooms, friendly staff, good location if you enjoy Dana Point.  Breakfast is pretty decent and the internet works well.  Went with my wife and 2 kids and heard no complaints from them.

Summary Heading: The Loudest Room I've Ever Stayed In
Summary: The air conditioning unit was so loud you couldn't hear the t.v. over it.  Also, the room was considered a suite, but the air didn't reach into the attached room with the sofa bed.  They had a small fan in there.  The pool had no lounge chairs and was tiny.  It was clean, but even considering the area, it was overpriced.  The parking, which was $10 per day extra, was ok if you were driving a volkswagon.  We were in a small car and it was difficult not to hit the poles that were between every space.  Very tight fit.

The staff was friendly and efficient in our check-in.  The room was bigger than we expected but the bathroom is a normal size, good for only one person at a time.  The parking is available at a cost, probably normal for this area.  The breakfast was good and it was nice not to have to pay for three of us to go somewhere else.

Excellent service by all associates. Room was clean and comfortable, good selection of foods @ breakfast, Short walk to the beach area and short drive to Laguna Beach. About 5 fast food restaurants across street (For Kids). Hotel did have a small pool for the size of the hotel. Overall an excellent stay.

Having slept in just a best western the night before which was quite frankly awful, this was a fantastic unbelievable comparison! Clearly the best western PLUS is of a brilliant standard. The hotel is beautiful, the staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are spacious and clean, and considering that we paid the same price for this as we did for the previous best western, it's of fantastic value for money!

Stayed at this hotel for a wedding and had a wonderful stay.  The hotel had a modern look, was easily accessible, and the staff was super helpful and enthusiastic.  We had a wonderful time!  I would definitely stay again!

Summary Heading: Not great - won't stay here again
Summary: Average hotel, mediocre customer service, beds are too over used and dented inward, the air conditioners don't really work and the room smells like mildew.  Great location except that our view from our suite's balcony was of McDonald's which seems to be where the homeless congregate day and night.  Sad for them but not a pleasant view.

My family of four (2 adults, 2 kids) stayed in room 321 which is a king suite with a balcony.  It is a spacious room with a private bedroom and a living room/sofa bed area.  It does have 2 tv's with a good viewing selection.  While we went to a different beach, there is a beach within walking distance across the street (maybe 5 minute walk).  The staff was friendly and professional and the room was clean.  Only minor complaints is the air conditioner is adequate for the king bed area, but a fan is in the living/sofa bed area.  In other words ventilation is not the best for the layout of the room.  Also, I would recommend a room on the 3rd or 4th floor due to road noise.  We still could hear the traffic, but was acceptable on the higher floors.  Overall, I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great Value for a very expensive area
Summary: Excellent Location with very friendly staff.  Hotel is across the street from the beach and the marina.  I was nervous when I saw it was on a major road but we couldn't hear any outside noise, it's really well insulated.  Very friendly staff and a surprisingly good breakfast.  Will definitely stay there again!

We opted for a King whirlpool bed which is extremely large in size and slept out family with a rollaway just fine. Very clean and modernized rooms. The breakfast gave us a surprise as it had more than the typical pastries and toast available. Staff was helpful, parking was easy as well. This location is really close to dining/shopping and the beach.

Summary Heading: A good hotel, convenient to the Dana Point area
Summary: Have stayed at this hotel a few times over the years, always a good stay.  It used to be a Holiday Inn until about 3 years ago.  I usually book a king room with whirlpool tub, and have been very satisfied, but thought I would book a suite this time.  That was a mistake.  The suites are older and have no air conditioning in the living room area.  The rooms are small and the bedroom has an air conditioner, but poorly located.  I had to be moved to a king whirlpool tub room that I usually stay in, and that was much better even though there was no couch, just table and chairs.  Parking can be an issue at this hotel, it has parking ($10 per day), but it's very tight and if you get there late can be hard to find a space.  The location is excellent though, just a few minute walk to the

We booked this hotel for a wedding weekend based on reviews. What a mistake. It's old, dirty, and has only a window type air conditioner. We booked a king suite and face the street. It's noisy with the sound of the wall air conditioner and the street traffic. Not the cleanest hotel and the bed is miserably soft. They have the nerve to charge $10 for parking in addition to the steep price for these outdated rooms. The bathroom is tiny and the whirlpool bathtubs look disgusting. I wouldn't even think of running the jets. Yuck, the staff is nice although not terribly bright. We asked where the local Starbuck's was and the manager said 2 blocks away. It was over a mile. This hotel is highly over rated. Clearly, the people who gave it high ratings don't get out much.
Manager Response: When responding to an unfavorable review, it is very difficult for a manager who takes a good deal of pride in his or her establishment not to feel defensive.  There is a reason why the Marina Shores is the top rated hotel in a market that includes three 5-star resorts.  The owners of this property invested over $1.5 million in 2012 to completely renovate the hotel - and with only 87 total rooms, that is a substantial investment.  Yes, the building is "old" ... as are most of the buildings in Dana Point.  This is a beach community with a lot of history.  The town has certainly grown up around the hotel.  The Pacific Coast Highway out front used to be a quiet coastal road, but as tourism grew, so did the traffic.  We replaced all the windows and sliding balcony doors with double-paned, sound dampening glass in an effort to combat the sound of the world growing outside.  Our rooms are clean.  We have won awards all three years we have been with Best Western for our cleanliness and upkeep.  This is one of the reasons you saw all the positive reviews.  The "miserably soft" beds you referred were part of the full renovation I mentioned earlier pillow-top mattresses and deluxe foundations which actually meet the standards for Best Western Premier hotels, far exceeding the specifications for the Best Western Plus we are.  ... and yes, I was the one you spoke to about the Starbucks.  I told you that I thought it was "two blocks up the street," but I also had the desk clerk on duty confirm the distance for you because I was uncertain.  She said it was more than two blocks - although it is less than a mile (we googled it after reading your review.)  When she mentioned that it was past Golden Lantern, I specifically said, "that's really a long way to walk, just for a cup of coffee.  If you want recommendations for breakfast, there are several restaurants closer.  One of the members of your party said, "No, Starbucks is fine."  I'm sorry for the misunderstanding, but think your referring to us as "not terribly bright" is highly unfair.  Lastly, I understand that the staff went above and beyond to help a member of your group when a local dry cleaner did a disastrous job on one of your wedding dresses.  She arranged for last minute service with another establishment and saved the day for the mother of the groom.  In fairness, you could have mentioned that as well.  Spaciousness and elegance come with a very steep price tag.  The Marina Shores is the lowest-priced mid tier hotel in the Dana Point area.  Even still, we provide a level of friendly service that is unsurpassed.  I'm sorry that you found our accommodations so disappointing, but there is a reason you saw all those incredible reviews before making your reservations.  I'm not sure what your expectations were, but I regret that we did not meet them.

Summary: Best Westerns offer up lots of great real estate.  This one, although on a busy stretch of PCH, is just a few minutes walk to the Dana Point Marina, where you can access restaurants and boat rides or just enjoy the vibe. The room was quite nice, clean, comfortable bed, small kitchenette.  The breakfast was good.  The staff was very nice, although was not very knowledgeable about the local area.   Pool area is not that great.  You can swim, but you can't lie on a chair --there are none.

The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean, and the beds were very comfortable. The hotel is within walking distance of the beach at Doheny State Park (1/2 mile) and the Marina (1 mile). The breakfast was good with a nice selection of items.

Summary Heading: Best value for your money in Dana Point!
Summary: We live in Palm Springs and have to leave the hot desert several times each summer to enjoy the cool weather on the coast.  This time, at the last minute, we decided to head to the Orange County coast for July 4th.  I didn't expect to find an affordable room, near the beach in a hotel that would also allow us to bring our 80 pound Airedale Terrier.  Just when I thought that I had exhausted my search - I found the Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel.  Not only did they confirm a King suite with a balcony for a very reasonable AAA price only 3 days before July 4th - but they also allowed us to bring our dog.  Very nice.  For the price, I didn't expect much - but, when we arrived, we found a gem.  The front desk staff were consistently professional, outgoing and fun throughout

Summary Heading: Great Rooms , Reasonable Prices, Great Location
Summary: We stay here several times a year. The staff is friendly and helpful. Free breakfast in the morning, which is nice. Rooms clean and great views if you get on the side of the hotel with the ocean. Parking is easy and lots of restaurants nearby.

The hotel is in a perfect location. Easy to get and out of which is a huge plus in CA traffic. The price was right , the hotel was clean / updated and the staff was nice & friendly. Would stay there again without hesitation!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but what's that smell?
Summary: The hotel itself is in good repair. There was a $10 parking fee, Customer service is top notch, but our room 328, had a terrible smell. There was even an airwick air freshener plugged in, which I'm not a fan of. We unplugged it to make sure that wasn't the smell but it was soon evident it was there to mask whatever the smell was. The room was a good size and had an air conditioner in the bedroom area and a fan in the main area. There was a mini fridge, coffee maker and microwave. Our patio looked out onto PCH and had partial ocean views, as well as views of McDonalds, Del Taco, Jack in the Box and Subway. The bathroom was a little small, it did have a large jetted tub, which we did not use because of the dirt surrounding and in the jets, yuck! The walls also had hair painted on
Manager Response: Hi Katie!  Thank you for the review and I'm sorry about the smell you experienced in your room.  You may have noticed the restaurant next door to us.  On RARE occasions, when the breeze from the ocean blows north instead of east, directly in from the harbor as it usually does, we will get the air from the kitchen exhaust at the restaurant.  As I said, this is a rarity and it usually passes in a couple of hours.  The tub jets, on the other hand, there is no excuse for.  We have a very strict cleaning policy for all our jetted tubs and the heads are flushed with bleach on a monthly schedule.  This room must have been missed and all I can offer is my sincerest apologies for it.  At the Marina Shores we take great pride in our award winning housekeeping and maintenance teams.  We set the bar a bit higher here so when small things like this happen we take it very, very seriously.  Thank you for the feedback and I'm glad you enjoyed the rest of your stay.

Summary: We stayed in Dana Point because we wanted a stop between San Diego and LA.  We really liked this hotel.  We were immediately greeted kindly and were offered maps and given an overview of the area.  The hotel is a short walk from the marina with a lot of shops and restaurants and is also a short walk from a State beach.  There are plenty of fast food options within walking distance--Jack in the Box, Del Taco, McDs, and Subway.  We also enjoyed walking by the million dollar houses surrounding the hotel.  We stayed in a king room with jacuzzi tub, which was very relaxing after several days at Disney.  The room was large and clean, and we liked that our window opened to let in the beautiful cool breeze.

I got this hotel on hotwire and didn't know what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised when we checked in and the staff was so helpful. They recommended several restaurants and told us how to get to the beach and how to get to the harbor. I was especially impressed with Leslie LaBerge she went above and beyond to make or stay wonderful. There was a sign in the hotel that said come as guests and leave his friends and that is exactly how Leslie made us feel. The location was excellent we could park our car and walk to everything the breakfast was hot in there was enough variety to satisfy every member of our family. We enjoyed the view and look forward to returning often

Great hotel for family of all ages.Breakfast included is awesome. The Pull out bed was just as comfortable as the beds in the room. Close to the beach, marina and restaurants. Walking distance to all.

The staff was very polite.  Very clean room with updated d√©cor.  Good breakfast.  Extremely grateful this hotel had coin laundry on the premises.  Only minor disappointment was we were told at check in that we had a harbor view but all we could see was McDonalds and other buildings out our window.

Summary Heading: Sorry we only had one night
Summary: Very nice hotel, location excellent - walking distance to park and beach. Changed our res. from Torrance to Dana Point to see a concert in San Juan Capistrano and saved $30 despite $10 parking fee, which is fair due to location. Got the quiet room we requested and were pleasantly surprised to find a hot tub in the room (desk says all rooms have them). Room was large and comfortable; rest of bathroom was nice, too. A/C pretty quiet. Good breakfast included. Will definitely stay again should we be near the area.

Good facility with better than average rooms. Location on Pacific Coast highway good but ask for a room away from the highway. Although hotel has a non smoking policy we could smell cigarette smoke in the public areas.

The stay was okay for the short amount of time we were in town.  I would consider staying again.  It was a bit crowded waiting for the elevator with the cleaning staff coming in and out also with their cleaning carts.  I am not able to take steps since I am in a wheelchair which made some waits rather long.

Nice Rooms, Great Staff, Very nice breakfast..... We had a slab leak and needed to move out for 3 nights... Found this jewel close to home and all the amenities...  Rooms were nicely appointed... Extremely good value for the quality received.. Thank You!!

overall was a great stay, hotel was nice & clean, staff was friendly and the hotel was walking distance to a variety of restaurants. i would definitely stay again and recommend this location to a friend. Nice & affordable!

We had a nice big room with 2 qns and a sofa sleeper, enough to fit our 2 teens and pre-teen comfortably.  Breakfast was so-so, but good enough.  We could see a bit of ocean from our balcony, and though located right on the main drag, it was quiet in the room at night.  We had a blast at Doheny State Beach, which we could see from the hotel.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  We really enjoyed our stay here!

We've stayed here the last 3 years for an event & have not been disappointed yet! Staff & cleanliness are awesome! The location is easy to find & close to where we needed to go. The front desk has menu's from local restaurants that deliver making it very easy when we didn't want to go out

I love how this hotel is conveniently located within 10 to 15 minutes away from wonderful spots. In my 3-night visit, I've visited Ladera Ranch, San Clemente, San Juan Capistrano and Dana Point all conveniently. I especially enjoy driving through CA 1 and get a glimpse of the ocean. Best Western is also no entirely expensive plus it's dog-friendly!

We liked this area and room so much we decided to stay another evening.  The room was quiet, large and two TV's! Walking distance to many shops and even a nice view even though on the PCH.  The morning breakfast had a nice selection of hot choices including egg white patties and an automatic pancake maker, which I had never seen before.  Very friendly staff.   Prices were very reasonable during the Sun-Thurs.

We are very pleased with the comfort, peace and quiet of this hotel. Hotel staff could not have been nicer. The hotel offers free Wi-Fi, free breakfast, a nice pool.  The beds were very comfortable. Parking is $10/day with free in/out (i.e., do not charge you every time you leave), and a relatively nominal charge for presumptive incidentals. Overall, very good value but wish the bedding was of a little heavier weight. We will definitely stay at this hotel again. Very pleasant experience!

Friendly staff, Convenient location, Healthy Breakfast choices, and a Good Price all made our stay a pleasant experience. Our room was very clean and quiet. We walked to restaurants and the Harbor. We have stayed here previously and would return again.

We missed the boat going over to Catalina Island and had to stay on the main land once we got to the San Diego area. We checked with a few hotels and decided to go with B.W... The hotel was very clean and the room had nice beds. The hotel staff was very helpful in finding our preferred seafood dining in the area. All in all a grat place to stay.

What an amazing place!!! The leadership and staff are very rare.  They are always extremely helpful, the rooms are exceptionally clean and the staff is amazing!  The location is close to the harbor and beach, incredibly beautiful.  I stay here every time I go to the Dana Point area.  Thank you!

Small but very comfortable room, excellent hot breakfast (including eggs and ham).  Located on busy highway, so traffic noise was audible in the room but not disruptive.  Beach is a 10 minute walk away.  Not much to do at the hotel -- pool area is very small, minimal pool deck, no jacuzzi.  But a good place to sleep!

We stayed in room 126. The traffic is noisy, the air conditioner is noisy, the jets in the Jacuzzi tub are noisy, the people walking down the hall are noisy.  If you're looking to stay somewhere quiet, look elsewhere.  The king bed is also really uncomfortable and hard.

Yes, the location is perfect - across the street from Doheny Beach. The marina is within walking distance. The weather is ideal most of the year. But what sets this hotel apart is the service. From the manager and front desk staff to the housekeeping staff - all very friendly, going out of the way to be helpful and accommodating. Yes the rooms are petite but very clean. Dual pane windows block any noise from rooms facing PCH. There's nothing not to like about this place. Highly recommend it.

Summary Heading: No Blues Saturday night at the Blues Festival
Summary: This is my second review of this hotel, our first stay was last Christmas. This time I was driving North on PCH the Friday before the Doheny Blues Festival and I stopped in, assuming I had 0% chance of getting a room for Saturday night. The Doheny Blues Festival was starting the next day and usually many hotels sell out weeks in advance. The staff was very friendly and in full Blues Brothers regalia, I discovered later that the two dolphins at the foot of the front stairways were both also Blues Brothers including the signature sideburns. I was pleasantly surprised that I wasn't laughed out of the Lobby when I asked if they had a room for the next night, and amazed when they told me that they had same type of King/Whirlpool room that we had stayed in before on the first floor.

I stayed at this hotel several times over the years, as well as lately, during my relocating back to California.  The rooms are really nice, clean and comfy. The staff is under the direction of "Mr. Peter", the Manager of the hotel, and he is a superior individual who strives to make the guest comfortable.  The staff is courteous, helpful, kind and diligent - they are a great group of people.  The location is absolutely lovely as the beach is a skip away and Dana Point is a delightful and safe town.  Overall, the hotel is super.

This hotel was a good value for the location and amenities that this Best Western hotel offers.  I drove to Dana Point for a quick one night get away and was extremely pleased with what I found.  I would certainly come back again.

This is a great affordable hotel in a great location. The rooms are standard chain hotel rooms but everything appeared to be very clean and well maintained. The staff was very friendly and the parking was affordable at $10/night. We stayed in an end room facing PCH so we didn't hear our neighbors. The hotel is within walking distance to Doheny State Beach, Lantern Bay Park and the Dana Point Harbor. If you want something more than the standard fair free breakfast there is a great breakfast place just up the street within walking distance called Stacks; it's to die for.

This hotel is the best location for the Doheny Blues Festival or if you have a need to be near the harbor. The staff was so cheerful and happy it made dealing with them at check in and departure delightful.  The rooms and bed were what someone would expect from this brand.  The breakfast was very nice. Overall stay was good and we plan to stay here next year for the festival.

Located between Laguna Beach and San Clemente, this Dana Point hotel is located within easy walking distance of Doheny beach. The marina has a good variety of restaurants to choose from. The hotel staff provided excellent customer service.

My son was part of a school group that was staying at the Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel in Dana Point, California.  I needed to wire some money to my son for his trip.  Leslie LaBerge was extremely helpful with options for getting money to my son.  She went to the Western Union location and picked up the cash and made sure that my twelve year old son received it.  Although I have never stayed in this hotel, I would just because Leslie helped me out when I was in a predicatment.  Thank you for going the extra mile for this mom living in Utah!

Summary Heading: STILL A Very Good Place to Stay!
Summary: We have stayed here for years and still enjoy staying here, it's friendly, clean, and the BEST place for the Doheny Blues Festival! The second floor offers two rooms with double queen beds, with refrigerator, try to get as close to the opposite end of the lobby, by the pool, you will have a view of the ocean, and it's a bit quietter, usually. The rooms offer two large flat screen TVs, sometimes I find that you need to get the master remote and adjust the sound, if you know how. There's a nice patio, with a view of the ocean. And the great Dana Point park is just across the street! Restaurants and shopping are all nearby. Beach is right across the street, although it is still a couple of blocks.  I really don't think this place "plays" tricks!

We could walk to the festival without dealing with all the hassle of finding parking. We checked out on Sunday, but the hotel allowed us to leave our vehicle parked at hotel until after festival. This made our trip much more enjoyable as we didn't have to deal with all the crowd and lines to find a parking space. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a good place to stay.

I have never seen anywhere with this fast of internet service nor a place that has the best location to everything you could ask or want. The rooms have to be the cleanest rooms I have ever stayed in and that is saying a lot considering I go in each hotel room and re-clean everything and this hotel has the cleanest rooms I've ever stayed in from other Best Westerns to the Ritz. The staff is so enjoyable helpful and friendly. I can not wait for our time again to be able to spend there. Another home run Best Western

Love this hotel üíô   ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê+ in my book! This newly renovated hotel is Awesome. It has Nice clean comfortable rooms, a friendly helpful Staff & a great Complimentary breakfast üçµüç≥  We stay here every year in May for the Doheny Blues Festivalüé∏üé∂ & we just booked our rooms for next year's event. The Rooms are almost booked up for next year's event, so book now !!  It's Very convenient and a nice short walk to the event.  I also stay here several time a year when I have Business meetings in town.  My go to girl is  Leslie La Berge in the sales dept. She's Awesome! Very customer service oriented and follows up with email and calls.  She's a real asset to this Hotelüëç

Former Army Security Agency Special Identification Technique operators and analyst held their reunion at the BW Plus Marina Shores Hotel in Dana Point, CA with about 60+ attendees.  The hotel was excellent, rooms were spacious and clean and the cleaning staff almost invisible.  The front desk personnel were helpful and accommodating to our requests.   Breakfast was typical but varied a little over our stay.  You can chose a room facing the Pacific our facing the opposite direction overlooking the neighborhood.  While you face the Pacific it is behind the tree line when you try to see it from a third floor room - don't count on sunset photos from ocean facing rooms.  This is a resort area - translation "high dollar" area and this hotel is an excellent value even with the extra

Not far from the house, with access to all of my needs. Great meals nearby , small but warm and clean pool. Wish I could have a better midweek rate. The opportunity for local affordable transportation was great. Uber, trains, buses all ran smoothly. Avoid taxi's if possible.

Summary Heading: Best Western Plus Marina Shores is FANTASTIC!
Summary: This is the place you want to be in Dana Point.  Service is excellent.  Rooms Large. Extremely clean.  Breakfast is the bonus.  I bring my business to this hotel very frequently.  My experience has been wonderful.  Leslie, in business office, has made the difference for me.  Her professionalism, knowledge & consideration are top notch.  Location is great for restaurants, shopping and immediate frwy access. The price is very reasonable and  I recommend this hotel strongly.

Loved this hotel! Great location, the amenities were outstanding. My dog was able to stay with us too. Breakfast was great and had lots of choices. The view was spectacular. This was a wonderful find, we will return.

Room was lovely, staff was excellent, sufficient parking, great location!  After having had 2 very disappointing stays at other BW properties prior to this stay, if they didn't wow me it was going to be my last.  Let me just say, this restored my faith in the brand.

Hlhotel is great. Look really clean and stsff was great. Everyone,was friendly we only could stay one night so we didn't get a full experience but it was excellent well we were there. Breakfast in the morning was great as well. Will be back and recommend to our friends and family.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Dana Point
Summary: Best Western Marina Shores was very accommodating for our group of 40 veterans having an Army reunion in southern CA this April.  Friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms, awesome location walking distance to the harbor, all exceeded our expectations. Manager Leslie La Berge made sure we had everything we needed to make our stay memorable. We started planning the event a year in advance, checked out 10+ hotels in the area and BW Marina Shores offered best bang for the buck. Leslie was quick to respond to all the questions and concerns. We were not disappointed one bit! I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an affordable place to stay in a terrific location.

I recently stayed here for 2 nights with a group of 9 women. We were offered the Doheny suites by the general manager of the hotel. I think his name was peter. He was very helpful and accommodating. He went above and beyond helping us with the details. The rooms were very clean and the staff we interacted with were friendly and helpful. Location was great! 7 minute stroll the the beach. 15 minute stroll to the harbor with a ton of restaurants and shops. I would definitely recommend this place to others. Also, very reasonable price!

Overall nice stay, but since I had to conduct some business while there, the internet gave me problems at this property.  I did not eat breakfast there this trip as I ate out with business associates.  I like the fact that I can open the windows for fresh air and not use the a/c.

The hotel is well positioned to walk to Dana Harbour, town and Doheny beach. The reception staff are exemplary in their friendliness, efficiency and welcome. The room we had was a mini suite, which was well appointed and spacious. It had a small kitchen too, which would appeal to a family. It also had the added bonus of insulating the bedroom from corridor/car park noise. Breakfast was very good, well presented, and the various stations were always immaculately clean. This is the fourth time I have stayed here over a number of years, and it has always been a good choice. The only downside is the PCH running along the front of the hotel, where the bedrooms are. Inevitably, sleep is disturbed, but for most of the night, the road is reasonably quiet. This is a very good, well run

The Staff was outstanding thru the check-in,stay, and checkout. The breakfast was plentiful and well stocked. The rooms were clean and well appointed, very comfortable. Parking was adequate and ingress and egress were very accessable.

Best Western botique hotel.   Just stopped for night and stayed 3 days.  Surprised at quality of hotel, walking distance to marina, restaurants and shops.   Great value!  Parking under hotel and great staff.  AAA

Everyone at the hotel was very friendly.  We had a queen suite it was very roomy.  This hotel was very clean. If we were in the area I would stay there again.  This hotel is on the main street traffic a little nosey but OK, I use ear plugs.

I have stayed at this hotel on numerous occasions and the staff is very courteous, professional, and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying for business or pleasure.  It is close to the harbor area and restaurants, etc.

Summary Heading: Good value and convenient location to Dana Harbor
Summary: We stayed here 2 nights + feel it was a very good value and would return if in the area.  The only thing that we noticed was some street noise from PCH which really wasn't a big deal.  The rooms seemed freshly renovated.

This is just as good as the fanciest hotels which cost much more. Great Location! Super nice staff! Great rooms! We took about 10 rooms and they were all great especially for the price we paid.   We recommend getting the suites with 2 queen beds. or the 1 King room with the jacuzzi.

Never stayed at a best western before, but just needed a place to stay while visiting the in laws.  I am normally a SPG or Marriott guy but was didn't need the extra frills for this stay.  The whole hotel was so clean that my wife even took the time to comment.  Rooms were big and the Jacuzzi tub was a pleasant surprise for my kids.  Staff was great and friendly.  Free breakfast was as expected, but walking distance to McDonalds or Denny's if you need more.  I would recommend this for a place to stay and an excellent value - note not a "destination" so to speak...

Summary Heading: Older Hotel, but they try to keep it up!
Summary: This hotel is an older hotel on a very small piece of property, with everything jammed into a small space.  Parking is tight, rooms are small, bathrooms smaller and breakfast and lobby areas cramped.  It is in a great location and they do their best to make it nice.  Definitely not luxury, but the price is not bad for the location.

On check -in we asked clerk about getting to Dana Wharf. She looked at a map and couldn't find it. Disappointing.  A/C was so noisy we couldn't sleep. Told clerk on check-out. She didn't seem to care. Didn't make a note to have someone look at it.   Comfortable bed, clean room, good breakfast. But overall seemed expensive for a pretty ordinary room. An extra $10. for parking is an insult. Why upset the client needlessly. Won't stay here again.

Great location, rooms are fine, did not feel like a best western.  Two blocks from the beach.  Staff went out of their way to help us with a booking issue.  Breakfast plentiful, they have a cool pancake machine.  Need a few more tables to sit at, but it was fine.  Only problem was noisy AC but otherwise great value hotel.

I stayed for 2 nights with my wife and my son (age 16 and autistic).  We booked a suite room, so my son could use the pullout be and have his own space, complete with a TV.  Great location for getting to a beautiful beach and a great marina area with outstanding restaurants, great parks, and great areas to walk/run.  The only downside in my view is having to cross the PCH to get to these cool things.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with Jaccuzzi in room!
Summary: Love the Best Western Plus hotels.. clean, nicely appointed, and a jaccuzzi right in the room.. SO nice. And a value for the money. We usually stay at the Laguna Brisas Best Western, but they were booked, so we chose Dana Point 7 miles south instead, and it was quite nice.

The property i within walking distance of Dana Point Harbor, where there are many harbor view restaurants and shops. The employees at this property were uniformly friendly and helpful. Everyone had a smile on their face! The only minor complaint was that the TV in the sitting room could not be heard whenever someone showered next door, as the volume has a low preset maximum, and the plumbing noise in that room is loud.

I do not usually stay at Best Western but because this was a last minute add on to our trip i rolled the dice a bit.  We had a great time and the rooms were VERY clean. About 10 minute walk to the beach (saves you from paying to park). Staff was friendly and the breakfast was good. They even had egg whites available. If your looking for a few day stay, the regular room is spacious enough. If you will be there longer, book a suite. No Jacuzzi though, but the pool was nicely heated.

Outstanding and caring staff, a place I would recommend for its location and great value. This is a hassle to fill out . Figure a way to make it shorter. Thank you.  I have been trying to get out off here and it will not let me.

We picked this hotel because its location allowed us to visit nearby communities like Laguna Beach, San Juan Capistrano and Dana Point without changing hotels.  Also, we got a good rate because we stayed three nights.  The problems we encountered were such that we would not stay again, despite the hotel's location and price.  Our reservation was screwed up and we were pre-billed without being told.Our room was noisy, as are most because the hotel overlooks a busy highway. The drain in the bathroom sink didn't work and water pressure was poor.  The facility has one, slow elevator for both customers and staff which results in long waits and poor  service.  The desk clerks are brusque, sometimes rude.  The breakfast area is too small to handle the volume of guests and, as a result,

I enjoyed my stay with Best Western. Awesome! Next to everything including the beach. Restaurants & shopping stores are right around the corner also. Beautiful location, place, & very affordable. The only thing I had a beef on was the parking area. Very tight. Of course, we are talking about beach front hotels. Space is very expensive.

I have never written a review for any hotel/product, but our experience with this hotel warrants a compliment. When a condo we own in Dana Point had water damage that required our tenant to move out, we needed to find a local hotel for her that would also accept pets. She is an older woman who was understandably very unsettled and unhappy with the inconvenience. The three weeks during which she stayed at the hotel ended up being probably the highlight of her year. The staff and management were so friendly and accommodating to her that she happily enjoyed her new 'friends' and would tell us about her delicious complimentary breakfasts and how wonderful everyone was. I was able to observe the cleanliness and also appreciated the attentiveness of the staff to her needs. It made a

Summary Heading: A VERY nice Best Western Plus...did not disappoint
Summary: We decided to stay at this hotel after reading the reviews right here on Trip Advisor.  It did not disappoint even though we were only there one night.  Diane checked us in and she could not have been nicer and such a great help as we were there to visit friends at the local horse show going on.  She put us in Room 286 on the end as it was very nice & quiet.  While this is an older building, it too is kept very neat & clean. The bathroom while a tad small was very clean and it had a whirlpool tub w/shower.  All very nice.    It sits right on the PCH and the parking is underneath the hotel in the back so there was really no problem finding parking as one might expect being on the PCH.    In any case there is a nice private heated swimming pool too which we did not get to take

Lovely hotel in Dana Point . Wonderful clean decorated suite, with a small patio which will give a small view of  the beach and palm trees!. Enjoyed breakfast with ham, eggs and potatoes, muffins, toast, cereal, juices, fruit, and coffee or tea!  Great beds!  Excellent service - always available at the desk,check in and check was easy, parking a small fee - but worth it. I would stay again because it was a very pleasant! stay!

My husband and I were in Dana point visiting family and stayed at the hotel. We were very happy with our room and the very friendly staff. Our room was very clean! The bathroom had a spa tub and a TV in it. The lamps had outlets in the bedroom so it was easy to charge our phones without looking behind tables to find an outlet. Bed was very comfortable and linens were all white and spotless. There was a free continental breakfast which was very convenient. The hotel had a pool but it was very small which seemed to work because it was not that busy. I would stay here again if we find ourselves in Dana point. Very reasonable rates! Augusta Maine

Staff was wonderful.  Upgraded our room when they learned we were there to celebrate my mom's 79th birthday.  Manager made a card and gave us a bottle of champagne (not the cheap stuff).  Room was comfortable and clean; had a balcony with a little table and chair for you to sit outside and have coffee. Free breakfast and it wasn't just donuts.

My family and I truly enjoyed our stay at the hotel for my wedding. The staff was pleasant and help to resolve any issue with rooms sizes, check in and check out times. The breakfast was a bonus that all my family enjoyed. The d√©cor of each room was very nice. This is one of the better Beast western we have stayed in. all around great time and experience during our stay.

We stayed here last year and enjoyed it.  Just like everyone else has said, the staff is friendly and efficient.  The rooms are clean and well taken care of.  The breakfast is very good for a Best Western.  We got an AARP rate of $109 which was great.  The location is good and the parking is plentiful.  They waive the $10 parking fee if you are a member.

had a 2 bedroom suite for $107, plus $10 parking fee which was waived because I have their gold status, room was not ready at 3 so I received a $10 price reduction,  half covered parking, all rooms face the 101, noisy when balcony door is open, only loud vehicles caused annoying noise when closed, no views except for street, marina in name???, room was fine, no problems, 3 floors with elevator, didn't use any of the facilities, typical free continental breakfast (blah), restaurants nearby, harbor is a 10 minute walk, lots of shops and other beach towns nearby

best stay ..really good service and very very comfortable beds!!!! clean rooms,jacuzzi tubs ..friendly staff ..we stayed there for a wedding and we got rooms close to each other .so it was fun..we met the next day for breakfast .

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Best Western!
Summary: Would absolutely stay there again and use Best Western for all my business and pleasure trips.  We stayed an extra night due to how nice the place was and were very happy with the service, the staff were very accommodating and we were upgraded, so had a lovely trip.

I made this trip to join my sister to accompany her to numerous Dr.'s visits, such a worrisome time made so much easier with the excellent staff. She arrived a few days earlier and had already told me how accommodating the staff had been. Her choice for her staying a loyalty member she said was the beds, I laughed, she was not kidding, these beds are ultra comfortable.Of course it was the staff that made her feel special, which I feel went above and beyond. I have traveled extensively and for the record my first Trip Advisor review was due to this "exceptional experience"! 5 stars is well deserved: Friendly, helpful staff, from check-in to cleaning personnel Room-very clean, maids are detailed oriented. We were in dbl queen , Suite she was graciously given due to loyalty

overall a good experience, but noisy neighbors made it a little difficult to fall a sleep right away. Only reason I did not report the problem to staff was I fell asleep anyway due to extreme exhaustion.
