In town for just a couple days for an event.  Big group stayed here- was just find for our situation.  The location was great.  On the PCH so you hear some noise- but wasn't bad at all.  Free breakfast, coffee etc was just ok.

Summary Heading: Best reasonably priced hotel in the area
Summary: Large room, quiet, clean, modern bathroom, convenient parking (though it was an extra $10 a day). The location was very good--much better than the sister Best Western in Dana Point, which is right next to the railroad tracks. Breakfast is about what you'd expect--nothing great, but there are plenty of good cafes in the area. All in all, a great place to stay for a reasonable price.

This hotel is a nice place to stay.  The parking lot is difficult to maneuver in.   If you had a pick-up truck, you would almost need someone to stand outside of your vehicle and guide you out of the parking spot.  I do love the card key locks on the doors.  All you need to do is swipe the card in front of the card reader.

Thank you to the staff for returning my forgotten item in the room  and calling me to have it mailed to me!!  I would highly recommend this hotel for the location and was very clean.  Staff was also very friendly to us.

Very clean and enjoyable hotel with good value for the location. Entire property is clean and well decorated including lobbies, breakfast area, pool area, exercise room and guest room. Good choice for anyone staying in Dana Point, CA.

So I have been staying here probably 14+ days a year for the past few years.  I'm a biz client but I'm sure it would be great for people visiting the Dana Point/San Clemente area for fun as well.  I work 12-14 hour days when I am here and I want 3 things when I hit a hotel.  Quiet.  A good bed.  And decent wifi.  It is wayyy quiet and it's nice to relax on the balcony with a drink after a long day.  When you wake up you can hit the balcony and see the ocean.  The staff have always been great and super efficient.  I would like to mention Leslie Le Barge (the manager) has gone out of her way to get me great rooms and ensure that my stay was terrific.  She might kill me for saying this but if you have any special requests, give them a call and ask to speak to Leslie. The staff in

We were looking for a reasonably priced, clean hotel that was close to the ocean and this Best Western really fit the bill. In fact it exceeded our expectations. We slept well and each morning there was a nice free breakfast with a lot to choose from, including fresh fruit, yogurt, etc. Great Place!

Summary Heading: Great place, except bit street noise and disappointing breakfast
Summary: Wonderful staff! Gave a free upgrade to a suite. Very nice property, tastefully decorated rooms. However, loud street noise and the "hot" breakfast had a lot of processed foods. Quite a let down for what I was expecting. I also like that they have the Clean tv Remotes.

We stayed just one night on our way to Catalina Island. The room was really nice & larger than I expected. It was a pleasant surprise to find a jacuzzi tub and two TVs in the room. The room was clean & comfortable. The king sized bed was cozy. BEST of all was the great FREE breakfast!  Usually when a hotel has a free breakfast it's just fruit, muffins, bagels and coffee. This one had sausages, eggs, pancakes, omelets and even egg whites in addition to cereal and muffins and fruit. This one night really was the best way to begin our getaway. It's also very close to the Dana Point pier where the Catalina Express docks.

easy location just off the motorway. Very friendly and helpful staff - even sorted out the automatic toll fee i incurred after my 11 hour flight from London. Pool is a little odd overlooking the main road and front rooms can be a little noisy but the back rooms are great. Clean, well serviced and pretty much as you expect from BW. Easy walk to harbour too. Give it a go!

Clean rooms and hotel, in a great location! It's on a main road and is very close to the beach and pier. The bed was firm and comfortable. The pool area was clean and I was able to read outside in January!
Manager Response: It takes someone from Buffalo to notice something that folks around here take for granted ... the comfort of sitting outside and reading in JANUARY (smiling) ... as a native Clevelander, I appreciate the weather here just like you do!  We're glad you enjoyed our little slice of paradise and I'll think of you the next time I read about the northeast snowstorms.

Summary: The whole staff is super friendly and helpful. The room is very comfortable, the breakfast is always good. You are right within walking distance to the beach. The rooms are clean, the cleaning crew is very nice. They have a little sitting area for you to read books. They also have a good selection of things in the vending machines. I would suggest this hotel anytime.
Manager Response: We're happy you enjoyed your time with us, Christine.  I'm always reading and hearing about how friendly our staff is.  The simple truth is that we love our jobs and guests like you just bring out our natural enthusiasm for what we do.  Thank you for spreading the word!

Summary: The location was perfect.  The hotel was within walking distance of the beach and harbor.  There was whale watching tours available and a beautiful harbor.  The hotel was close to many restaurants and walking areas around Dana Point
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review Maura.  The whale watching excursions from Dana Point Harbor can be really breathtaking, so we're glad you had the opportunity to experience one.  There are truly so many things to do here, but that always seems to one of the highlights.

Summary Heading: Very Well Managed -- Great Customer Care
Summary: We stayed here four nights over Thanksgiving break 2014.  We have been making frequent trips to the San Diego area over the last several months staying in a variety of hotels near there with recent stays at four Best Western hotels in the area.  So far, this has been the most well-managed hotel of our many recent stays.  They went out of their way to treat BW Rewards members well (upgraded our room, parking fee was waived‚Ä¶nice surprise).  It was a good location, very clean, easy check-in and check-out, and a very friendly staff.  A great place to stay.
Manager Response: Well Suzanne, it was a pleasure having you and your family as our guests over Thanksgiving and we appreciate all the kind words.  We hope you will remember us the next time you're headed to San Diego (or back home, for that matter) and we'll do our best to make every stay as pleasant as this one was.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, somewhat reasonable prices... recommend
Summary: Basically, for being so close to the ocean this is a great Hotel... really good friendly staff.  Great breakfast i thought with a great little auto pancake maker which was the first time i had seen one of those... good overall hot breakfast in a nice little breakfast area. Parking was good and easy in the back. Got a upper floor suite room... Rooms have interior entrances or entrances out on an outdoor walkway above the parking lot.... in this case the room had a front room with a tv, and a bath in the middle, then the master which had a balcony facing the street...in the distance .. on an angle one could see the ocean... but it was all good and a nice clean room.... would gladly stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and for mentioning all the little nuances that make the Marina Shores the great value that we are.  Thank you also for posting your own photos ... while we have many of our own on our website, it's great when guests take the time to add their own bit of photographic flair.

Summary: We stayed here for two nights during our trip to California.  We liked the location as it was within walking distance to restaurants.  The room, along with the property, were very clean and well maintained.  The complimentary breakfast was also very good.  If we are in this area again, we will definitely stay here.  Loved the small town feel of this coastal community. Our room faced the highway, so we could hear traffic noise.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words and we're glad you enjoyed your time with us.  Our housekeeping team works diligently to keep the Marina Shores looking her best and the greatest reward is when our guests tell us that they noticed.

Summary: Nice room,  very clean, they gave us an upgrade that had a private room and a balcony.  Very nice two t.v.  We were able to take our dogs which was a nice touch. On busy street but if we shut the patio door was able to block the noise from the street.   Loved the breakfast, omelets, meat, pancakes, yogurt etc.  nice to have protein at the breakfast.  We will be back.
Manager Response: Hi Kathy!  We're thrilled that you enjoyed your stay and wanted to thank you for sharing your experience with the Trip Advisor family.  We love offering the free upgrades when occupancy allows us and it makes for a terrific surprise for our guests at check-in.  We want everyone's stay to be memorable and it sounds like we reached our goal with you and your family.  Come back and see us soon!

Summary: Very Clean, and Neat; an excellent location to basically everything in the area. Reasonably priced. Friendly service. Overall, an excellent facility. Can not find fault with anything really. We really enjoyed our stay, and would like to go back some day, and we would not hesitate to stay at that facility. Was very convenient, and certainly did the job.
Manager Response: We love reviewers who take their task so seriously that they feel obligated to find something to criticize ... and come up empty.  "Cannot find fault with anything"  may be a backwards compliment, but it means that we did our jobs and we welcome your praise.  Thank you for the review and I promise, you will not be unwelcome when you return ... (I think I said that right.)

Summary: Great overnight while waiting for the Catalina Ferry.  Easy access to the Ferry Dock.  Great parking and the King Suites are very comfortable.    Breakfast is OK and a nice patio is located next to the pool for enjoying drinks & snacks.
Manager Response: The Marina Shores Hotel makes for a great departure point for folks heading over to Catalina.  We are convenient to the harbor and you are guaranteed a restful night and a good, hot breakfast before you leave.  We're glad you enjoyed our facilites and hope the trip to Catalina was filled with beautiful memories!

Summary: The place was quiet and well maintained.  The parking fee was waived since I'm a Best Western Reward member. WiFi Internet worked no problem. Would definitely return to the property in my next business trip to the area.
Manager Response: Glad you enjoyed your stay and recognized the tremendous value we offer our customers.  Reviews like yours bring out the great point that we are not just a hotel for vacationers - although we try to make our business clients feel like they're ON vacation when they stay at the Marina Shores.  Oh ... and a special note to our Best Western Rewards Member family ... starting in March only the Platinum and Diamond level members will receive complimentary parking.  No worries for the folks who pay though - our goal is to still be the best priced mid-tier hotel in Dana Point.

Summary Heading: Comfortable.  Close to Beach.  Pacific Highway traffic outside.
Summary: We liked staying at this hotel mainly for the comfortable room and beds, cleanliness and friendly staff.  We did not like having Pacific Coast highway traffic right off our balcony.  The access to the beach is about a ten minute walk to the crosswalk and across the highway...the beach is lovely.  There are restaurants in the area, but they are limited.  The pool is tiny (more of a dipping pool). The hotel is well maintained and the breakfast is as good as most of the pre-made breakfast buffets out there...includes hot omelettes and pancakes.and sausages.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review, but I would like to clarify for your readers that we DO have rooms that face away from the Pacific Coast Highway ... there are a limited number of standard rooms on the back side of the building, but all of the two room balcony suites like the one you had, do in fact, face PCH and the beach area.

Summary: I have mixed feelings about reviewing this property, because I'm afraid that if more people stay here it won't be available when we want to. We lived in Dana Point for 7 years and walked by this hotel when it was a Holiday Inn Express, many times.   We stayed here over Christmas this year (2014).First and foremost the Staff was incredible, not just friendly, I don't believe I have ever felt more welcome at a hotel. We initially picked this hotel because it had Jacuzzi tubs in some rooms and it is pet friendly. We stayed in one of the King suites with the Jacuzzi tub on first floor. It felt like we were in an high end Hyatt. The room was huge, the tub was big enough for two, great, great room. I foolishly walked to the front desk and asked for a corkscrew without looking at the
Manager Response: Just doing what we do best, sir.  I'm sure you noticed the signs throughout the building that say, "May all who come as guests, leave as friends."  THAT is the mantra of the Marina Shores Hotel and we're glad the magic rubbed off on you.  I can't promise that we'll have availability EVERY time you want to stay, but I can promise that you'll be treated with the same level of friendliness and enthusiasm whenever you do return.  Thank you for the wonderful review ... reluctant or not!

Summary: Convenient location. Friendly staff. Great value. Easy access to the nearby Marina with very nice places to eat. So many nearby walking trails with stunning views of the coast. The pool, while small, is very nice.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review, Gordon.   Glad we made such a great impression.

Summary: New Years Eve was great there.. Rooms clean great staff.. Not really ocean views but very convenient to where we wanted to be. Careful driving out narrow parking curve on left.. Check in was a breeze and although an older hotel it's been fairly maintained
Manager Response: Happy New Year to you and we're glad you chose to spend yours with us.  Yes, the Marina Shores has been around for a bit, but our property wide renovation in 2012 put new color and life into our rooms.  Come back and see us soon!

Summary Heading: We really like the Marina Shores Hotel, Dana Point
Summary: We have stayed here twice in the last 18 months while visiting relatives. I think we will stay every time from now on. The room is a good size. The kids like the pool. It's clean. The staff is very friendly. The only negative for us is that our family is a good 20 minute drive away, but the value makes it worth it for us. It's also nice to stay by the beach. They also take our dog which is a plus!
Manager Response: Welcome to the family!  We are honored that you have made the Marina Shores your hotel of choice when you come to the area ... and the fact that we're not even that close to the relatives you come to visit is quite a testament to how pleased you are.  Thank you for the wonderful endorsement.

Summary: Room smelled funny. Turn on ac smelled like dog pee. Couch made funny noises when you sat down. No microwave.  One chair on patio. Not the room we requested. Ordered suite with two room. Got a plain room.
Manager Response: There seems to be some confusion over the type of room you reserved with us.  The room you occupied WAS a two room suite - a bedroom with a king bed and a living room.  You did not reserve the two-room wetbar suite, which has the microwave, cabinets and utility sink which sounds like what you were expecting.  If the error was on our part, I am truly sorry.  In reviewing your reservation record, I see that I called you to offer you a free upgrade to one of our whirlpool suites, but you declined.  Did you ask to have an extra chair brought up for the balcony?  Our two room suites with two queen beds have larger balconies and we stock those with two chairs, but we are more than happy to provide an extra chair for the king suites if the customer requests one - it limits the space, but can certainly be accommodated.  Lastly - and this is always a touchy point to discuss - I reviewed the maintenance records of your room after you checked out and see that we did steam clean the carpets.  Our assumption was that the urine smell came from the dog that you had with you for the several days of your stay.  I am a pet owner myself (four dogs actually) and I know we like to think that our dogs could never have an accident, but in truth, most pets are stressed when they travel and even the best trained animal could have a mishap.  I want to assure you - and all readers - that every pet room is deep cleaned after a guest checks out.  In our two full years with Best Western we have won several awards for our room cleanliness and upkeep.  It is because we are so meticulous with our housekeeping and preventative maintenance program that we have received these honors.

Summary: I think we got a good price because we were here during what I assume is low season.  For ~$135/night, we got a huge room w/ a separate sitting area, a king-size bed (w/ plenty of space left in the room), a wet bar, and a large bathroom w/ soaking tub.  We didn't notice a lot of noise from PCH in the evening.  There's a decent amount of traffic noise in the morning, but that's fine because we were out-and-about pretty quickly.  $10/night for parking is also pretty cheap in a resort area....
Manager Response: It may be the off season, but even during peak months we try to position ourselves as the best value of all the hotels in Dana Point.  Don't be so "shocked," it makes good business sense.  We're building our reputation and customer loyalty by delivering great rooms at a great price ... and folks just keep coming back!  Very glad you enjoyed our accommodations.

Summary: good things about this place .. king suite was perfect when we arrived .. the towels and sheets were not the usual hotel scratchy linens .. breakfast rocked, best FREE hotel breakfast ever and that little pancake machine is a hit with my family .. you can go across the street to the number one rated breakfast joint in town and pay $10/person and be crowded in the same space for for pretty much the same food .. we had a small live tree delivered for the holiday and it arrived 4 days ahead of us .. the manager called the company to see if it would be ok in the box, over and above IMHO .. you can see the ocean from the balcony but don't count on hearing the surf .. all of the rooms are on PCH and at times the noise can be rather annoying but the location can't be beat .. walking
Manager Response: Happy New Year and we're glad you were so wowed by your stay.  It was a pleasure having you here for Christmas and hope you enjoyed your holiday-on-the-road.  As a personal aside, while we receive packages for guests on a daily basis, yours was the first "live Christmas tree" we ever signed for ... calling the company you ordered it from to see if we needed to do anything special to care for it just seemed to be common sense.  After all, it did get here a four days before you were due to arrive.  In a hotel where we stress such a high level of service and attention to detail, what you see as "above and beyond" we see as business as usual.  I also need to take a moment to make a small correction to this review.  The free parking was NOT because the guest booked through Trip Advisor but because he was a Best Western Rewards member.  We only waive the parking fee for our loyalty members and for seniors ... but as I always shamelessly point out, most of the other hotels in town tack on "resort fees" and exorbitant parking charges to their room rates.  We are proud to have the lowest parking fee of all the hotels that charge for parking and feel that, with our moderately priced room rates, we are still the best value in Dana Point.

Summary: What a great place! Dana Point is a lovely town and the hotel location puts it close to everything. There is not much of an ocean view, but the facility and service is great! The rooms are clean! The bath tub is large and has jacuzzi jets, which is a nice feature. Besides being next to the Pacific Coast Hwy, the road noise really wasn't very bad at all. The room seemed pretty sound proof. They have a great complimentary breakfast in the mornings. Hot and cold foods. There is a $10 parking charge, be aware of that. The guest service was excellent. They have a pool and a nice, small, but clean fitness room. The machines are in great shape and seem relatively new.  Altogether, I felt really comfortable here and would definitely consider it again. If you wanna stay in Dana Point at
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review, Jeremy and we're glad you were so pleased with our facility.  I appreciate it when reviewers periodically point out that we are not an oceanfront property.  I would never want someone to come here with misinformed expectations and then feel disappointed.  Yes, there are hotels in town where you can get that picture postcard "ocean view," but for alot more money than you will pay at the Marina Shores Hotel.  From our third floor suites, you will get a passable view of the Pacific - after all, we ARE a block and a half off the beach - but we do our best to make up for the missing 5 star resort element by providing exceptionally clean rooms, truly comfortable accommodations and a staff that will make you feel so welcome that you never want to leave.

Summary Heading: What a pleasant surprise!  Best kept secret!
Summary: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel!  From the updated contemporary decor, to the jetted tub, to the great service - what more could you want!  Yes, the location is not the best, but I would definitely stay here again.  For the price, you will be surprised with your experience at this hotel.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Well, Jen, that does it!  You have reaffirmed my conviction that 2015 will be the year the Marina Shores Hotel becomes Dana Point's WORST kept secret (laughing!)  Our goal is to be the hotel of choice for all travelers seeking cleanliness, comfort, a welcoming staff and all at the best value in town.  With that in mind, we shouldn't come as a surprise to anyone.  We are thrilled that YOU were thrilled, but we hope that more and more people will come here expecting to be impressed, rather than surprised.  Thanks for helping us get the word out!

Summary Heading: Superb staff, narrow hotel, top-rate breakfast
Summary: Best Western Marina Shores of Dana Point is a breakfast-focused restaurant with a top-rate, friendly staff. Though my kids, and particularly m high school and college age children, were looking for the hot tub in vain, we liked it and would recommend the hotel. Add that hot tub, and you have a for-sure return family. The breakfast was, perhaps, one of the best complimentary breakfasts I have seen in years. We took walks to the Dana Point Marina, about a 15-minute jaunt, in the cool Christmas-time air, and were glad to have the opportunity. The hotel squeezes itself onto the real estate on a narrow strip of land along Pacific Coast Highway. Parking is good, but a squeeze. Still, having parking right below the hotel rooms works for me. It's close, secure and easy to navigate --
Manager Response: Hey Jim!  Thank you for the very articulate review ... I don't recall anyone seizing on the nuances of the Marina Shores and adding so much color.  We're glad you and your family enjoyed your stay, but I'm sorry we lacked the hot tub you were seeking.  Our heated pool is tucked into a very compact area and if we tried to add a spa, I'm afraid we'd lose the deck where our chaise lounge sunning area is located.  The hot tub is a great idea, but folks need to work on their SoCal tans too.  I'll be sure to pass on your praises to the staff.  It's a pleasure serving families like yours that appreciate the little things we do to add comfort to your stay.

Summary Heading: Select your own room away from any groups.
Summary: Make sure you get a room away from all the other people because they think this is party time and make noise all night. Management did respond and moved us but you could still hear these folks.1234567890!@#$%^&*()
Manager Response: In spite of the noise issues, you rate the Marina Shores very highly and we are super appreciate of that.  It is unfortunate that some folks don't have the consideration for others that you do.  While we hope all our guests enjoy their time with us, we cannot allow any noise or celebration that might disturb others.  While we did manage to get these people to settle down, we especially appreciate your understanding in allowing us to move your room while the situation was being handled.

Summary: The rooms were spacious and very clean with nice linens and pillows. Coming in from out of town it was an easy location to find too. We paid between $80-90 for the room, and for the amenities we got I thought it was a great value
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review and we're glad you had such a comfortable stay at the Marina Shores.  I'm also happy that you noticed some of the little touches we add, like the higher quality linens and the extra plush pillows.  It seems to be the small things that guests notice and appreciate the most.  Thank you as well for mentioning the great value we offer, especially during the holiday season.  We understand that travel during the holidays can be stressful and expensive, so we do our best to provide a little respite from all that ... just one more way the Marina Shores Hotel practices Best Western's "I Care" service philosophy.

Summary: This is a 3.25 to 3.5 star depending on your taste. I got a great deal online and booked it for a night with my family.  The rooms are nice, updated with free Wi-Fi. Free breakfast(continental,  but they had yogurt and egg whites-kudos) in addition to cereal and pancakes. Nice location near the Harbor. This is a good deal. I would go back.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review, Jon.  We're glad you and your family enjoyed your stay and the facilities of the Marina Shores Hotel.  Even though we only scored as "average" in the review, your comments sound like you were more than satisfied and we're happy you plan on coming back.  If and when you return, I would be honored to meet you and listen to any suggestions you might have to ensure we fill in those other two green circles on your next review.

Summary: the laguna coast is so beautful and our stay here was very enjoyable. we had a suite room and enjoyed the area attractions would highy reommend this property for a value consious client. i am a travel agent in san diego
Manager Response: Wow, Annette!  Travel agents are notorious for picking apart every detail of a hotel stay and being merciless in the critiques.  We must be doing something right if a hotel connoisseur rates us five-stars across the board!  Tell ALL your clients about us.

Summary: We had a very good experience at the Marina Shores Hotel. We were there for the Thanksgiving Holiday to visit with our children and grandchildren who live in S. Laguna Beach. The location was great for shopping some of the coastal cities too.Our children were happy to hear we were staying at the Marina Shores becouse they knew it had a good reputation.
Manager Response: I have a confession to make ... although I have made it my mission to personally respond to every review posted about our hotel, sometimes it's difficult to come up with new ways to say "thank you" and "we appreciate your comments."  Then, every once and awhile, something will jump out of someones comments and it reminds me of why we in the hospitality industry do what we do.  Irvin, we are glad that you enjoyed our accommodations, but above that, the fact that your children were happy that you stayed with us because of our "good reputation" ... all I can say is, as the spokesperson for our incredible staff, just knowing that people who LIVE here want their visiting families and friends to stay with us, even with all the hotel options at their disposal, warms my heart and gives me a renewed sense of purpose toward what we do and the people we serve.  With all the sincerity that can be put into the written word, thank you for the wonderful review and we hope we will continue to earn the reputation that your children spoke of.

Summary Heading: The good, the bad, and the ugly
Summary: The Good: The suites are well appointed, clean, spacious, comfortable, have a partial ocean view, have double pane windows, and are pet friendly. Service is excellent. The Bad: This hotel is right on noisy Pacific Coast Highway which means sliders and windows shut, AC on. Also, 87 rooms share one elevator. The Ugly: They charge $10 for parking. The parking garage clearance is 7'0" which means, don't come here with anything on the roof of your SUV or you're gonna leave it in the driveway.
Manager Response: The Man With No Name would appreciate your directness, Mike ... (ten points to anyone who gets the reference).    I always feel bad when someone comments about the traffic noise from the Pacific Coast Highway.  I'm sure that way back when the Marina Shores was built, PCH was a quiet, coastal road, but as our city has grown into a major tourism draw, it brought the cars, motorcycles and all the other life sounds that make Dana Point the place it is today.  At night, you can step out onto one of our balconies and just watch the flow go by ... it can be a very serene experience.  You get the view and the sensation that you are in the heart of what's happening in our town, but you are also correct ... when it's time to turn out the lights and snuggle down with one of our pillow top mattresses and soft comforters, it's best to close the window and the balcony door if you want some peace and quiet.  As far as the parking, our $10.00 fee is the lowest of all the hotels in the area that charge for parking and is also what keeps non-guests from parking in our garage when they don't want to pay $30.00 to park by the beach, which is just two blocks away.  I always stress to our customers, when you look at how low our room rates are when compared to the competition, even with the parking fee we are still the best value in town.

Summary: What a great find - I didn't like the reviews for hotels in San Juan Capistrano, so I'm glad I found this on Trip Advisor!  It's easy to get to, on the Pacific Coast Highway, clean, updated, roomy, with a wonderful staff - Thom is terrific!   An excellent value - will definitely return!
Manager Response: Hey Art!  Thank you for the great review and we're thrilled that discovered us among all the lodging options in the area.  The Marina Shores staff works very hard to provide all our guests with the cleanliness and comfort they'd expect to find at a much more expensive hotel.  Having folks like Thom on our staff is a huge bonus ... warm, friendly and personalized service is just one more feather in our cap and we appreciate your taking the time to share your impressions with the Trip Advisor readers.

Summary: We had our choice between this hotel and the one in Laguna Beach 5 miles away . This was far cheaper and an easy drive to Laguna.   .Clean ,great service and a nice stroll to the park across the street on the ocean.
Manager Response: Thank you for the spot on review.  The Marina Shores is obviously known for our cleanliness, friendly staff and great value, but one of the things we overlook is the convenience of our location.  With Laguna Beach just a couple of miles to our north and San Juan Capistrano to our immediate south, Dana Point and the Marina Shores Hotel are right in the middle of some of the most beautiful beaches and parks in Southern California.  Great call!

Summary: The front desk received us with a warm welcome although it was late at night. We were pleasantly suprised at the value for money what we got. The room was clean and we enjoyed the jacuzzi very much. The check out the next morning was smooth and the staff very friendly. Highly recommend!!
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review Lana and we are glad you enjoyed your evening with us.  I would hope that in your travels you would find the front desk staff in ANY hotel to be warm and welcoming, no matter what the hour.  Traveling days seem extra long and are definately exhausting ... our staff will take that extra moment to let you know that the long journey was worth it.  Thank you again!

Summary: we booked at this hotel because they accept dogs and needed a room just for the night, due to a family reunion. we were pleasantly surprised at the value for what we got. rooms seemed newly refurbished. All was clean and very well done.
Manager Response: The Marina Shores is proud to be a pet friendly hotel.  We welcome all four-legged family members with open arms and, if their owner's are responsible, we welcome them as well.  Not everyone shares our love of pets so we advise everyone who brings an animal with them ... please be considerate of our other guests - don't leave your dog alone in the room, they are in a strange place and scared.  They may not bark or howl when left alone at home, but that's because they know their surroundings.  When staying at a hotel, it's completely different.  We're glad you found our facility to your liking and hope the family reunion was a huge success!

Summary: After a few days in Las Vegas we needed a break so headed for the California coast. Since I am a Best Western employee in Cocoa Beach Florida of course we headed to the nearest Best Western & we were definitely not disappointed. Karen checked me in & went out of her way to make us feel welcome including upgrading us to a suite!! The view was amazing & the jacuzzi tub was an unexpected but great surprise!!  I can honestly say nothing negative about this place...totally awesome!!
Manager Response: Well Anna, after spending time in all the glitz and glamour of Las Vegas, I'm glad to hear that the Marina Shores didn't seem anti-climactic.  Trust me, the service show we put on for you wasn't because you were a Best Western employee - our goal is to wow EVERYONE who comes through our doors.  Glad you enjoyed your stay and that we could be a part of your vacation memories.

Summary: Kenia at the front desk provided outstanding check in and check out service. All requests were cheerfully accomodated. She upgraded us to a king suite and was able to accomodate our request for an additional night on short notice, All the other staff we encountered were helpful and top notch as well. When in the area this hotel will be our first choice. I spoke with other guest and they were as satisfied as we were. THANKS FOR THE GREAT EXPERIENCE!!
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review, Dennis and I will be certain to pass your praises along to Kenia.  We're happy we were able to give you the free upgrade on your room accommodations too ... it's the little surprises that make the Marina Shores something special!

Summary: The staff was really nice and helpful. We received an upgrade to a suite and it was comfortable and clean. This is a convenient location, right on the main street and close to restaurants, the marina, etc. The breakfast is your standard fare, nothing exceptional but satisfactory choices. The only downside is if you are a light sleeper it is right off the main road through town and you can hear the cars especially if your window is street side.  A few years ago we downloaded the "SleepFan" app which helps us enormously when we travel, if it is too noisy we just turn it on and it elevates the problem. Other than that a great stay and recommended.
Manager Response: We are obviously thrilled that you enjoyed your stay and I hope the readers noticed your suggestion about the Sleep Fan app.  I downloaded it myself just to see what you were talking about ... pretty cool! (pun intended)  We installed sound dampening, double-paned windows and sliding balcony doors years ago to help combat the noise from the increasing traffic on the Pacific Coast Highway, but if you're a light sleeper, just request a room on the back side of the building when you make your reservations.

Summary: Booked this last minute and wasn't disappointed. We were upgraded to a suite on arrival, assistant manager checked us in and was very welcoming. Room was really nice, basic buffet breakfast was fine, 10 minute walk to the marina, location on the PCH just into DP is ideal.
Manager Response: We're very glad you enjoyed your stay and appreciate your taking the time to write this review.  We enjoy surprising people with the free room upgrades from time to time.  In an age where we expect corners to be cut, isn't it nice to see something extra tossed in just because we can?  The staff is always looking for opportunities to suprise our guests - just another small way we look to distinguish ourselves from the competition.  Safe travels!

Summary: Staff at front desk (Krista and Tom) were kind and welcoming. Close to trails and beach areas. Great location. Rooms were on the smaller side yet they were clean-kudos to the hotel staff for the upkeep of the rooms!
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review and I will be sure to pass on your praises to Krista and Tom.  They have become the anchor of our evening shift staff and make quite a team.  You're also right about our housekeeping staff - day in and day out they go the extra mile to make sure the Marina Shores is looking her best.  As you meet employees of our hotel, the tremendous pride they take in their jobs becomes apparent.  We are so happy that you noticed the care we take in making sure your stay is comfortable, welcoming and problem free.

Summary: The people at the counter were very helpful. My children used the swimming pool and they had a good time. The hot breakfast was delicious. Although there was constructing by the freeway it was easy to find and the hotel was super clean and the rooms were clean and when we requested extra towels they brought them right away.
Manager Response: It's the little things that make the difference, right?  Being able to ask for extra towels or pillows and not having to wait for half an hour to get them can be all it takes to make someone's stay "a pleasure."  Thank you for sharing the great review and we're glad you enjoyed your time with us.

Summary: I was very pleased with my stay, good location, very nice looking hotel, the room was very clean and of decent size with very comfortable beds. Breakfast is included with very good coffee, the staff was friendly. Totally recommended, the room was better than a very high priced hotel not too far.
Manager Response: We're glad that you and your family enjoyed your stay at the Marina Shores and appreciate your pointing out all the things that added up to a great time.  We love hearing that every piece of the puzzle was in place ... just wish I knew which "very high priced hotel" you were comparing us to.  What a great talking point THAT would be!  (smiling)

Summary Heading: A Must Stay! Best Secret inTown!
Summary: This hotel got our vacation off on the right foot.  Excellent staff, beautiful area and clean hotel.  Would HIGHLY recommend this hotel! I We've stayed here before when it was a different hotel. What the Best Western has done is unbelievable.  Staff goes out of their way for you.  It's right near everything.  Great breakfast.  Beautiful facility.  We'll be back.  have alerted all family and friends.  Thanks Diane.
Manager Response: Well Dolores, thanks to guests like you the secret's out.  Thank you so much for the wonderful review and it was our pleasure serving you during your vacation.  See you next time and by all means, bring your friends and family.  We'll take care of EVERYONE!

Summary Heading: Best Western PLUS Marina Shores Hotel, Dana Point
Summary: Service was excellent. Location is close to beach and marina. Also close to old town Capistrano and the mission. Staff was very helpful. The price was very good and rooms were very comfortable. Breakfast was very good. Had a good time. Will stay there again the next time we go to Dana Point.
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed exploring some of the historic sites while you were here ... and of course we're thrilled that you thought so highly of the Marina Shores.  See you on your next trip!

Summary: I rarely if ever take the time to give a high praise but this is the time to do so. My sister and her husband were having a birthday/anniversary getaway for the weekend and with work, kids and tight budgets they were limited. I called and spoke to the manager who took care of little things that for comforts made all the difference in their stay. The staff at the desk were attentive, their room was comfortable and the little extra's that the manager tended to made all the difference. This place is definitely hands on and in a world where everything and everyone is disposable, this little gem is a good find. It's also close to beach and shopping, a good fit for a getaway.
Manager Response: I've said it before and I'll say it again ... a clean room and a comfortable bed are expectations of a hotel stay and should never be the highlight.  It's the people who work here - everyone from the desk staff giving you a friendly welcome to the housekeeper who services every detail in your room - that make the experience something special.    When people are here to celebrate a birthday or an anniversary we want them to know how happy were are for them - not just for the event, but for choosing US to be a part of it.  I want to thank YOU for contacting me and letting me know what the occasion was so we could do the little extras to make their stay extra special.

Summary Heading: Perfect stay for our daughter's wedding!
Summary: We stayed 4 nights in a suite and it was perfect. The front desk staff were so friendly and gave us free parking for our stay. The room was clean and had one of the most comfortable beds I have slept on in a hotel! I expected it to be noisy as the suite balcony faced PCH, but it was so quiet in the room and we never heard any one in the rooms next to us. A huge plus!!  We will definitely stay here again!!! Thanks Best Western for making our stay so great!
Manager Response: Please pass on our congratulations to your daughter and her new husband ... we wish them a lifetime of happiness and we're glad we could play even a small part in building this memory for the wedding party.  We also thank you for the wonderful review ... I get chills everytime someone uses the word "perfect" when they talk about a stay at the Marina Shores.  Come see us again for your own little getaway.

Summary: Checked reviews...all good.  Got King Suite.. a little concerned about traffic noise since room faced Pacific Coast Hwy, but balcony door is double paned glass so no noise at all. Room was clean, and bed was very comfortable, also the pillows.  Hotel convenient to restaurants in Dana Pt also to San Juan Capistrano.  Helpful employees and a good value for the money.  Would stay again
Manager Response: Well Gene, it looks like you hit all the key points that make for a great stay at the Marina Shores.  Thank you for the great review and we'll take you up on that offer to stay again.  See you on your next trip!

Summary: My sister & I have stayed at this hotel twice in about two years.  Both times the overall experience has been excellent, from the parking to check-in to the room.  Both times we had a room facing the back of the hotel (not on the street) on the top floor.  The rooms were quiet, with excellent air-conditioning, comfortable beds with lots of pillows, good lighting, especially for reading, and a refrigerator that came in handy for snacks.  The rooms were spotlessly clean; the bathroom had plenty of towels, plus personal care items.  Overall, the hotel was clean and attractively decorated.  The weekend breakfast included eggs, ham, potatoes, pancakes, muffins, yogurt, milk and coffee.  All in all, a great choice for a mini vacation.
Manager Response: Hi Michele and thank you for the wonderful review!  We're glad you and your sister made a return trip and took the time to share your opinons with the folks here.  You brought out a very good point on the room location and I think it's worth stressing again to the readers.  The Marina Shores is located on the historic and scenic Pacific Coast Highway.  On one side of the building, you get the fantastic view  of the excitement on PCH, along with a panoramic view of downtown Dana Point and the beach.  On the other side you have the peace and serenity of the residential part of our community - so depending on what you're looking for, we've got the window.  If you have a preference, make sure to let us know when you make your reservation and we'll do everything we can to accommodate your request.  Thanks again Michele.  See you next year?

Summary: Spent two nights in a great location. A fair stroll to the harbor for eating and shopping. Some good food nearby. Try Thai Dara across the street. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Room was average. Free hot breakfast.
Manager Response: We appreciate your taking the time to give us your review, Bruce.  Even though we didn't appear to "WOW" you, it sounds like you were comfortable and satisfied with the Marina Shores, which is good.  I'm glad you had a chance to explore a little of Dana Point while you were here ... you were right .. there are alot of really fantastic eating establishments close by, most right down on the harbor.

Summary: Great staff. beware that there was a little musty smell in the room but a little air freshener, provided by the staff, cleared that up. Be warned that the floors maybe slippery in the outside halls and the garage when wet. Very clean rooms and great beds to sleep in. The staff was very nice and hospitable.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review Tim.  Please accept my apologies for that "musty smell" and the wet floor in our parking garage ... the two issues were actually connected.  Over the busy summer, our garage took quite a beating ... the hotel was super busy all summer and we had alot of cars here that leaked oil and other fluids.  We degreased and power washed both levels of the garage over the course of a week and apparently that unpleasant "musty" smell came from the ecofriendly solvents we used.  The room air conditioners caught that (ahem) natural fragrance and drew it right up into the building.  Suffice it to say that we now have a clean parking garage and our rooms are sweet smelling again!  Other than that, it sounds like you had a great stay.  Come back soon.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for my wedding weekend with my  bridal party and family. We were all taken care of by the friendly staff. Our wedding venue was across from the hotel so it was extremely convenient to stay there. It was easy to park and check in/out. All the staff members were friendly and even with all my people and pets, everybody enjoyed themselves and had a great time at the hotel.
Manager Response: At the Marina Shores we understand how chaotic these big wedding weekends can be.  Family and friends are coming in from all over the county - people that may not have seen each other in years - everyone wants to check in early so they can get ready, there are so many last minute details to attend to and SOMEWERE in all the hectic preparations, everyone is supposed to have a good time.  We're glad we were able to get you all settled in and moving to your venue smoothly and that we could provide a comfortable place to rest after the celebration finally ended.  All we heard were good things as your party was checking out so it looks like the wedding and reception was a huge success.  We're glad we were able to play even a small part in building this beautiful memory.

Summary: Had a terrific 2 night stay, required a first floor room plus we had our dog along and the entire staff from the initial reservation process to the check out was a first class treatment. We arrived earlier than planned and because our room was available we were allowed to check in and get settled. The room was very clean and the parking was very close to the room. We will definitely plan on a return visit in the near future.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review and we're glad we were able to honor all your requests.  Four-legged family members are always welcome at the Marina Shores and it's always a pleasure when they have responsible owners like yourselves along for the stay.  Hope to see you all again soon.

Summary: This hotel was great! an excellent price for the location and staff. Everyone was very nice and helpful . The gym is small and the pool is outdoor, but they are ok. everything is else is excellent! The breakfast was also good , they had a great variety and Marcela was super sweet, so was her daughter at front desk. The elevator was a bit slow but there are stairs available, I did not mind taking them. There is a McDonalds across the street, a Thai restaurant and plenty of options down PCH. great location!
Manager Response: We appreciate the kind words, Johanna, and we're all happy that you enjoyed your stay, not only at the Marina Shores, but exploring Dana Point as well.  I will be sure to pass on your compliments to Marcella and Kenia.

Summary: Had a great 2 night stay and was treated very well.  There was a mix up in our room and Kenya helped us and got us the room we were suppose to have very quickly.  She was extremely helpful and very nice.  The entire staff is extremely nice and helpful.  The rooms are very nice, good size and very clean.  They have a breakfast in the morning but it is somewhat limited.  They have free parking if you are a Best Western member.  The hotel is very close to the harbor and within walking distance.
Manager Response: Hi Sandy.  Thank you for the review and I will be sure to pass on your kudos to Kenia.  We're all happy that you enjoyed your stay and hope you'll be making a return trip.

Summary: Very nice Best Western.  Very helpful and caring staff.  Everything went right.  Has decent views.  I've stayed there twice before when it was a Holiday Inn.  Rooms are still lovely, parking is great.  I stayed there for a sports event and they were very accommodating.
Manager Response: Jennifer, it was our pleasure providing accommodations for your group and we're glad you choose the Marina Shores every time you return to Dana Point.

Summary Heading: Most Amazing Customer Service I Have Ever Experienced
Summary: My daughter, Jordan Parise, and I stayed here, the night before her wedding. The following night, the night of her wedding, my daughter and her new husband stayed in a suite with a Jacuzzi tub.  The service, and the hospitality we all received was above and beyond.  I have never been treated so well at a hotel, and your staff made my daughter feel like such a princess. She did not have to worry about trying to switch rooms in the middle of getting her hair and makeup done.  The staff allowed us to move into her bridal suite in the morning without hesitation...cleaned up the room for her when she left for the wedding....provided her and her husband a complimentary bottle.....and the list goes on and on.  The staff is extraordinary.  If I ever have the opportunity to return to
Manager Response: It is customers like Kelly and Jordan who turn our jobs from a business experience into a human experience.  On busy days, operating a hotel can almost feel like herding cattle, so many people are flying in and out of our doors ... we see the faces and read the names, but having the time to actually get to know them as people is sadly a luxury neither the guests nor the hotel employees have time for.  Then there are guests like the Parise's ... they worked with us prior to their arrival getting all the details straight, communicating their needs ... and were just so sweet about the whole thing.  While the staff at the Marina Shores will always go above and beyond to take care of its guests, it's folks like Kelly and Jordan that actually make doing so such a pleasure.  We had the honor of playing a big part in helping build a memory that will last them a lifetime and for that we will be eternally grateful.  In turn, we wish Jordan and her new husband all the joy, health and prosperity that a life together can bring.

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel repeatedly over the past year while traveling on business and have always had a good experience.  The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, the facility is kept very clean and the rooms are comfortable.  The only downsides are that, with windows open, the PCH outside can be somewhat noisy, but if they are closed it is not a problem.  Additionally, the breakfast choices are somewhat limited, however, the food provided is good.  The hotel is in a good location; it is close to the harbor and freeway, there are multiple restaurants within walking distance, and there is covered parking.  Standard rooms are comfortable, and suites are a good size and include a pull out couch in a separate room and a small outside deck/sitting area.  All rooms (that I've
Manager Response: Hey Patrick!  As I said in just the last review, it's wonderful when we get input from our regulars - especially business travelers like yourself because Dana Point is much more than a vacation destination.  So glad you like our accommodations and the staff is always happy to see you.  The traffic on PCH may offset the view, but we can always give you a room on the back side where it's quieter.  See you on your next trip!

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel 2-3 times/year for the last 7-years. I've always had very good service and accommodations. I would suggest, however, when booking your room that you request not to be facing the parking garage... it can get a little annoying hearing people talk and their cars 'beeping' when they lock them (it's also not a pretty view). The rooms are clean, beds are comfy, and who can't pass up 'free' breakfast!?
Manager Response: Hearing from our regulars always warms my heart.  We can brag about great prices and comfortable beds all day long, but when folks like you let everyone know that our service and product is consistently above the grade as well, that's the best testimony around.  As you stated, which side of the building can be an important part of our guests' experience.  Even though we have double-paned windows to cut down on noise from the outside, it can sometimes be an issue.  The front side gives you the great view of PCH and downtown Dana Point, while the back side is generally quieter.  While it's true that you will sometimes hear the beeping of people locking their cars and the occasional less-than-considerate guests who insist on talking much louder than is necessary, for the most part, the back side of our building is best suited for light sleepers.  Thanks for bringing your observations to the readers and, as always, we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: We picked this hotel because of the lower price, the location, and the previous reviews.  Turned out to be a good decision. The hotel staff couldn't have been more pleasant or accommodating.  Check in/out was very fast and efficient.  It was convenient to our concert at the Coach House in San Juan Capistrano and also easy to get to Dana Point Harbor, San Clemente, and surrounding beach cities.  The continental breakfast was more than sufficient, although they could do better with the "pre-fab" omelets(would rather just see home scrambled eggs).  The wifi was a little weak-couldn't even watch a soccer game on our computer. But all in all a great hotel-great price-and great location! Would definitely stay here again! Oh, and the mattress is SOOOO comfortable...I peeked underneath
Manager Response: Thank you for the fantastic review and we are so happy that the Marina Shores exceeded all your expectations.  I do want to apologize for the limits on the breakfast while you were here.  Normally we do carry scrambled eggs but there were some issues with our distributor, and they weren't available for a few weeks.  The good news is that they are back on our menu now, along with the cheese and western omelets.

Summary: customer service was great very helpful and made us feel welcome have not had this great of service in a long time from a hotel,  helped us with all the questions we had for dining , fishing great location by the water, fishing and shopping was very close,cant wait to go back soon
Manager Response: Hi Lyle!  Thank you so much for the great review and we are thrilled to welcome you as a new member of our family.  Your words reflect exactly the philosophy we practice at the Marina Shores every day ... a good hotel will offer clean rooms and comfortable beds, that should be the minimum expectation ANYWHERE you stay.  It is the personable and personal service offered by each member of the staff that will set us apart from the competition ... and we are so glad you noticed.  Come back soon!

Summary: Description was exactly as described on their website.   What I didn't like was the $10 parking fee, I feel it should just be included in the price per night.  Not try to nickel and dime it separately, just include it.  Bed was comfortable.
Manager Response: I really appreciate the point you made about the description of the Marina Shores exactly matching our website.  We believe it is important to give potential guests an accurate impression of what we have to offer, both with the photos and the descriptions.  Many hotels will renovate one or two "show rooms" and use those as online representations of their entire property.  Every room in the Marina Shores Hotel was completely renovated in 2012.  All our photos and room descriptions are up to date and show exactly what you get for your money.  I'm sorry you objected to our parking fee.  Most the hotels in the beach area charge for parking and all charge much more than we do.  With the number of tour groups that come to Dana Point, we feel it wouldn't be fair to incorporate the parking fee in the room rates because then people who didn't have cars would be paying it anyway.  The good news is that Best Western Rewards members and senior citizens do not pay for parking with us.  Thank you again for the great review and we hope you'll remember us the next time you head up the coast.

Summary: Clean, large rooms, walk to the beach and restaurants.  You wouldn't necessarily linger in the common areas, but its very good value for the price. Staff very helpful with directions and suggestions.  Go on a whale watch!  And catch that southern California sunset.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review, not only of the hotel but of the Dana Point beach area as well.  So glad you got to go on a whale watching excursion, they can be both awe inspiring, but humbling too ... the absolute majesty of those incredible creatures!  I am a New England native myself and totally agree with you on the SoCal sunsets ... when the sky is clear (as it is most of the time!) it's a breathtaking moment of paradise.  Thank you for sharing!

Summary: We were at a conference at another hotel at Dana Point CA but could not get a reservation for the first evening. And, we really found the Best Western quite nice, an attractive and spacious guest room. Staff was especially nice, cordial, and profession.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words and we're happy that you found the Marina Shores to be perfect on every level.  For readers who comb though hotel reviews, I'd like to point out how many people say that they are in town to attend a meeting or event at another hotel, but choose us for their room accommodations.  I think that says a lot about the value we offer ... it's always more convenient to stay where the event is being held, but to deal with the hassle of driving from one place to another means that we MUST be offering something that the main venue does not ... be it stress free availability, better pricing or just the reputation for clean, comfortable rooms, it doesn't really matter, as long as we are the hotel of choice in Dana Point.  Thank you again!

Summary: Stayed here as a cheaper alternative to the Marriott where we were attending a wedding. A few days before our visit, the manager called to offer us an upgrade to a room with an enormous whirlpool tub. What a nice surprise. Thank you. Our room was spacious and clean and very convenient for walking to the places we needed to be -- Dohany Beach and the Marriott Hotel. The hotel was very crowded when we were there but the front desk staff were efficient and patient as they explained how to get to nearby locations probably for the umpteenth time. The breakfast room was mobbed and people were standing around waiting for tables to open up. I tried to imagine a more efficient traffic flow pattern for reaching the different food stations. I think part of the problem is having the coffee
Manager Response: My staff is constantly on my back when I respond to these reviews because even when the review is positive, like yours, I will still latch on to a word or two like a hungry dog with a bone.  Here we go again (laughing) ... "cheaper" creates an image of low quality and the Marina Shores is anything but.  "Affordable," yes - this is our goal; to be the most affordable hotel in the tri-beach area, yet still providing the best, cleanest and most comfortable accommodations you can find.  It was my pleasure to provide you with the free room upgrade to the whirlpool suite.  This is a practice we offer to all Best Western Rewards members when we have the availability, but I also like to surprise random guests from time to time.  When most people travel, they want hotels to meet their expectations, so when we can exceed them by offering them more than they bargained for ... well, it's just a win-win for everyone.  I'm sorry about the wait in our breakfast room.  When the hotel is very busy, we open up the meeting room which adds about thirty extra seats.  Even though we post a large sign right outside the main breakfast room letting our guests know this, most everyone opts to wait for a table in the main room.  Thank you for the suggestions for the layout of the food stations.  We have tried several different configurations to ease the lines and can certainly look into your.  Thank you for the great review and we're glad you enjoyed your stay.  Hope the wedding was a huge success!

Summary: We had about twenty family members and freinds stay here for a wedding and had an overall good experience. The location was very convenient to planned and unplanned activities and within a short walk of Dohenny Beach. The staff was very courteous and helpful, particularly in working with us in booking rooms over time for the wedding party and guests.  The free parking and breakfasts were a definite help on the wallet for those families with lots of kids and for the younger adults who  are starting their careers and had flown to Clifornina for the wedding.  I would definitely stay here on a return trip.
Manager Response: We're so glad we were able to be a part of this wonderful event.  For all the magic of a wedding, it can be very chaotic and stressful for everyone and the staff of the Marina Shores is proud that we were able to do our part in making all of you as comfortable and relaxed as possible.  Thank you for the great review.

Summary: The staff was very nice. The room air condtioner DID NOT work and we had to downgrade and gave up the suite we originally wanted. The pool only accomodates 15 people and there is no jaquzzi, although the beach is close by. The hotel room wasn't too bad and the price was ok compared to the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review Rachel and again, please accept our apologies for the air conditioning issue during your stay.  This summer has been - and continues to be - unseasonably hot and everyone's units, at home and away, are working overtime.  We put the portable tower fans in all our two room suites this year to help circulate the cool air from the air conditioners through both rooms and urge our guests to keep the sliding glass doors to the balconies closed and the blackout curtains drawn when the sun is on that side of the building.  Sadly, temperatures have been averaging almost 10 degrees above normal the past two months and the humidity that is virtually unknown in Southern California has been oppressive.

Summary: Check in was easy and the desk clerks were very friendly, helpful and efficient.  Parking fee was waived because the person we were traveling with had signed up for BW rewards program.  She was also upgraded to a suite at no extra charge so I plan on becoming a member before my next stay at a Best Western hotel. The room was clean and comfortable.  The only complaint I had was that the room had a Jacuzzi tub, which would have been nice if our stay was longer to have time to use it, but since we didn‚Äôt have the time it was just an inconvenience getting in and out to shower (especially for someone with short legs) The shower head and water pressure was great though once inside.  There was also a flat screen TV in the bathroom which I enjoyed while putting my makeup on. Breakfast
Manager Response: WOW!  Sounds like you really had a fantastic time visiting Dana Point.  The whale watching excursions can be breathtaking.  Thank you for the great rundown on the Marina Shores and our facilities.  While our free breakfast may not be full service restaurant quality (just being honest here ...) for the guest on the go, it is quick and convenient, which is our goal.    Glad to know that you and your family will be back.  There is too much to see and do in the Dana Point area to try and fit it all into one or two days.

Summary: Room was awesome had a separate living room with hideabed .  somewhat view of ocean was fine and the balcony was a big bonus.  Decor was fantastic.  Pool was nice but no hot tub.  Great location close to beach and plenty of restaurants. A great place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review Dana.  We love it when people discover the Marina Shores as the perfect fit for their hotel needs.  Between our two-room suites, whirlpool suites, standard and connecting rooms, we feel we offfer the best value in the tri-beach area!

Summary: Had 2 dogs, no problem for the hotel.  Made all the difference in our frame of mind knowing that we had both dogs with us.  The employees were interested in the animals and saved my dogs toy when she forgot it.   The balcony came in handy and we could see the ocean.  The property is right across the street
Manager Response: In this day and age, animals seem to be just as much a part of our families as brothers and sisters ... and to SOME pet people, even moreso (smiling.)  At the Marina Shores we welcome responsible pet owners and are glad that their four-legged family members get to be a part of the vacation experience too.  We deep clean every room occupied by an animal after they check out because we also understand that we have customers with allergies.    Glad we were able to accommodate you AND your dogs!

Summary: I always enjoy staying at the Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel ‚Äì Dana Point, CA.  It is my hotel of choice because it is a home away from home. I have been staying their for more than 6 months. Because of their excellent customer service and service, I continue to come back.  The hotel really takes the time to get to know me and makes everything so easy and stress free! The rooms and suites are fabulous with amazing general comfort and views are amazing.  I want to give a huge thank you to the Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel ‚Äì Dana Point, CA for their amazing staff.  The hotel staff is so accommodating.  They all are friendly and do an outstanding job to take care of any concerns that may arise. I am very picky where I stay.  I wholeheartedly recommend and have
Manager Response: Matt, as always, it is a pleasure having you as perhaps our most long term and loyal customer and we are glad to have you as a part of our family.  To the readers, while you may be looking for lodging in Dana Point for vacation or other leisure reasons, Matt is a business traveler and we treasure our corporate customers as much as we do you.  We have signs posted throughout our building that say, "May all who enter as guests, leave as friends" ... I don't know where that quote originated, but it represents the true and full business philosophy of the Marina Shores Hotel staff and management.    Matt is what we could call "the perfect customer" and I think you can tell, for his needs, we are the perfect hotel.  It may not be the same fit for everyone who enters our door, but it shows the level of service and comfort we strive for.    Thanks for the kind words Matt ... you made my day!

Summary: The front desk staff both day and night could not have been more helpful and nice.  Great free breakfast . could see the Pacific from our room.  Close walk to great beach/state park.  It was nice to be pleasantly surprised for a change!!!
Manager Response: Isn't it sad that, in a service industry,  being pleasantly surprised is the exception instead of the rule?  We are thrilled that you enjoyed your time at the Marina Shores and that you had a chance to explore the beach and the harbor while you were here.  Of course, when you say, "great first time stay" you're implying that we'll get to see you again soon (smiling).

Summary Heading: 2nd Visit and can't wait to return
Summary: This was our second stay and it was even better than the first. We had a suite with a king bed and a studio couch in the living area for our son. The suite was well maintained and exceptionally clean. The view of the ocean from the third floor balcony was a plus. The staff at the reception desk were very personable but professional and very helpful when our son left his dopp kit behind. We are definitely looking forward to our next visit!
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your time with us and of course we're ALWAYS happy to hear of plans for a return trip!  As the manager, I was especially pleased with how you remembered our staff "personable but professional" ... that is exactly the image we want to leave people with.  No impersonal stuffiness, just an enthusiastic "WELCOME!  How can we help you?"

Summary Heading: Next to Everything but not a Destination Hotel
Summary: We stayed here the night before our daughter's wedding for convenience. As such it was perfect. But let's be candid. Unless you are a starving college student, this is certainly not a destination hotel.  The rooms are clean and large. We had a "suite" that had a separate room with a fold out sofa bed as well as our main bedroom. The sofa bed room was immediately next to the outside service walkway and was typical of all such suites at this hotel. We didn't use that room so it wasn't a problem. But I think most people desiring privacy would find it problematic.  The BW+ is on Pacific Coast Highway, which provides both convenience and noise. We were on the 3rd floor and kept the balcony slider closed ... which helped ... but you could still hear traffic.  Each balcony has an
Manager Response: We thank you for the candid review and I think you shared some really great observations with the readers.  Yes, the lights on our balcony suites are controlled automatically for security reasons, but the heavy blackout curtain over the sliding glass door takes care of almost all the light that would pass through.  I'm not sure what you meant by a "destination hotel," but if you were comparing the Marina Shores to the offerings of a resort or convention center, then you are 100% correct.  We are a mid-tier family and business traveller focused hotel.  We do have a few frills - recently renovated rooms, heated outdoor pool, fitness center, free WiFi and free hot breakfast buffet, but "destination hotel" brings to mind the image of an all inclusive luxury resort, which we are not and certain hope you weren't expecting that.  We seem to draw alot more than starving college students - as the reviews show - but you definitely offered an interesting take on your stay.  Thanks for the review.

Summary: Great location for attending the Laguna Pageant of the Masters.  Very clean, some road noise.  Will certainly try to stay here again.  Very reasonable rates.  Parking charge is the usual gouge for guests but we booked thru Costco and so the charge was removed since it was not previously disclosed.
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your time with us and hope you found the Pageant of the Masters as incredible as we did!  You are one of those smart shoppers -  stay a few minutes outside of Laguna Beach and save yourself a pretty penny on the hotel rates.  Definitely worth the 10 minute drive.

Summary: Our experience was fine. There was nothing exceptional or outstanding about the experience.  The crib I asked for when making reservations was not in my room, but when I called the front desk they were quick to have one delivered.  I understand prices are based on the market, but the price seemed high for rather average accommodations.  The room was safe, comfortable and clean.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review Aubree.  As I said in our other correspondence, we were sorry that the crib was not in the room waiting for you when you checked in.  Your family arrived about an hour before our check-in time of 3:00pm so we gave you the first suite that was ready and got the crib to you within 15 minutes of your arrival.  As much as we work to take care of every special request before a guest arrives, sometimes - especially with folks who get here early - it just isn't possible.  You are right, our prices are based on the market and during the peak of the tourism season, everyone's rates may seem high.  We monitor all the rates for our competition to make sure that we present ourselves as the best value in Dana Point.

Summary: This hotel and staff, particularly Diane, made for a great experience.  It was in a convenient location. We are a very picky family, the hotel was clean from the lobby, the rooms and the common areas. It was a great value as well.  The parking fee was waived in exchange for sharing our email address.  The breakfast is included in the cost which was another appreciated feature. We will definitely return and recommend this hotel to others.
Manager Response: Hey John!  Thank you for the great review and I have already passed on your praises to Diane.  We LOOOVE "picky families," especially when they come away with a fantastic impression of the Marina Shores.  Glad you enjoyed your stay and we look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: We spent 7 nights in Dana Point in July at Best Western Marina Shores.  From the moment we booked directly with the property, the staff was as pleasant and accommodating as possible.  It is  obvious each takes great pride in their work.  Rooms were clean, continental breakfast was good, location was a 10-minute walk from the beach - we would stay there again.  Special thanks to Thom, Dianne and Leslie - all of whom went above and beyond to make our week fantastic.
Manager Response: When a guest stays for an entire week, they can't help but get an inside look at how good (or bad) a hotel really is.  We are honored by your praises and I will make sure to pass them on to Thom, Diane and Leslie .. and of course our housekeeping staff.  So glad you enjoyed your time with us.

Summary: We only made reservations one night at this property in order to get a little closer to LAX. Nice location right across the street from a clean beach, marina, and shopping.  The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. It was the best continental breakfast we'd had in ten days and four hotels. Clean property that was overall, obliviously well managed.
Manager Response: Hey we ALWAYS take care of our Minnechaug allumni!  (For any readers thinking "what??" this guest and I graduated from the same small town high school on the east coast, although years apart.)  Sorry I missed meeting you, but certainly glad you enjoyed your stay and the front desk staff even told me how nice you were.

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay at a reasonable rate!
Summary: Recent stay in Dana Point was made special by the friendly staff at this location. Everyone was extremely helpful and the manager even made an extra effort to mail a small item left in room back to my home address.  I would recommend this hotel and know you will be glad you stayed in this clean conveniet location!
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your stay and even happier that we were able to return your lost and found item to you.

Summary: While the rooms were clean, they were very small. We had a queen suite for 4 of us and felt squished. There is only one sink in a very small bathroom. We ended up hanging out in the bed room when we were in the room as the couch and chairs in the living room were SO uncomfortable. The A/C is very loud and placed in the bedroom, leaving the rest of the suite warm. The hotel is on a very busy street and there is much street noise.
Manager Response: Hi Erin.  I'm sorry if you found our 420 square foot suites too small for your party.  Usually families like them - the sofa bed is great for kids ... but if you were trying to put four adults in a room that size, I can see where it might be a little cramped.  When people have questions about the size of our rooms, we always recommend they go to our website - marinashoreshoteldotcom - and look at the photos.  That is the best way to get a feel for what you're booking.    I also hope you saw the tower fan in the room which works great to draw the cold air from the bedroom into the living room.  We've put these fans in all the two room suites along with a "Keep Cool" list of suggestions to advise our guests on how to make the most out of the room A/C ... so many guests just open the balcony door and leave it open with air conditioner running.

Summary: What a nice clean hotel! We stayed 6 nights and the accommodations, breakfast and overall staff were wonderful.  The beds were comfortable and we saw the care they took to keep the hotel clean. They wiped down banisters, mopped the outside hallways and the rooms were very clean. I hope to come back to this hotel in the future. Great Stay!
Manager Response: Hey Don!  We're glad you enjoyed your stay and it's terrific that you noticed all the little things we do to keep the Marina Shores looking her best.  Thank you for the kind words and we hope to see you all back again soon.

Summary: This best western is top notch, definitely on of the best in the chain of best western hotels. This was our second stay there and the place is very clean, the Jacuzzi room was awesome, it is only a couple of blocks from the Harbor with nightlife and restaurants and the beach.
Manager Response: Best Western International is doing some incredible things with their brands and we are so proud to be a part of it.  When guests like you recognize the time and effort we put in to preparing our rooms for your visit ... well, it just makes for an incredible experience for both the customers AND the staff.
