It is our pleasure to serve you ... thank you for the glowing words and we look forward to your next stay at the Marina Shores Hotel.

Summary: Doing our best to organize all the details that go into traveling, my husband and I decided to book our reservations into the Best Western Plus Marina Shores six plus weeeks prior to our trip. Our main request was to have a room in the back away from PCH [Pacific Coast Highway]. The hotel was informed that we would be late as we flew coast to coast and there were flight delays. Our arrival was late and we were given a room facing PCH. Our trip was not for sight-seeing but to visit an ill friend so very little time was spent around the Hotel. A wake up call was not necessary as the outside traffic was noisy and when the trucks started at five thirty AM one might as well have been sleeping at the curb. Our purpose for the visit was stressful but lost of sleep and long distance
Manager Response: We're truly sorry that we couldn't honor your request for a room on the back side of the building.  As I told you in our other correspondence, there was no record of you requesting a room away from the street when you made the reservation and our staff makes a special effort to make note of all special requests.  This is not to say that we didn't make an error when taking the reservation and if the oversight was on our part, we are sincerely sorry.

Summary: The service at this hotel was great. The suites we were in were very comfortable. I normally do not sleep well in hotel beds but I had no problem here. I do wish there were more chairs at the pool,very limited seating. Location was close to the beach and harbor.  I would definitely stay here again
Manager Response: Thanks for the input Terri and we are glad you and your family enjoyed your stay with us.  I'm sorry about the limited seating on our pool deck, but as you saw, there really isn't room for much more.  Now be honest ... with the beautiful Pacific just a block and a half from our doorstep, do you REALLY want to spend alot of time sitting around some pool?

Summary: Got this place thru hotwire so we got a good deal, the room is quite large and it has the jacuzzi in it on one corner, room could get a refresh as it kinda looks a bit old with most other hotels going the "chic" way and providing a lot of whites and contrasting colors, the bed was just perfect! The breakfast was bad, the eggs where undercooked, the pastry offering wasn't good at all, so we ate a bit and went to a coffee shop near.
Manager Response: Hi Sam!  Sounds like we came close, but didn't quite light up all your hot spots.  I'm sorry that our free breakfast was less than appetizing for you.  I will check with the breakfast attendants and let them know that have to keep on top of the consistency before bringing the food out from the kitchen.  It is always our goal to provide fresh hot items every morning.  You had an interesting observation on the decor of your room and it just goes to show that everyone has different tastes in color and design.  In my replies, I used to mention the $1.5 million renovation the Marina Shores underwent in 2012, but as time passed, that became old news and readers like to hear about things that are current ... no business can maintain their reputation on what they achieved "yesterday."  Anyway, I invite your readers to view the photos of our rooms here on Trip Advisor or on the Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel website and judge for themselves.  Our hotel has won awards for Best Western in 2013 and 2014 for our room quality and cleanliness so it just goes to show, one guest's "old" is another guest's "chic."  (smiling)  Thanks for the opinion Sam ... we welcome all, both positive and negative.  That's how we know when we're on the mark and how we know where we need to improve.

Summary: The service at this location was very pleasing. Everyone was very friendly and extremely helpful. The location was central to all activities in the area (i.e. beach, water activities). The continental breakfast was very good and everyday we were offered a new option for breakfast.   The only thing we could of maybe wanted was perhaps some more chairs at the pool and a larger breakfast area because people were standing around due to the lack of seating.   Overall it was a very good hotel and we would recommend it to family and friends in the future.
Manager Response: We're happy you enjoyed your stay and it will be my pleasure to pass along your praises to the staff.  Please accept my apologies if the breakfast room was crowded.  We do have a second room that we open up when the hotel is extremely busy, and there is a large sign by the entrance to the main breakfast room advising guests of this, but I guess some folks are just so hungry that they head to the buffet line without even noticing it (smiling).

Summary: Great hotel by the beach. Friendly staff and owner. Mad our anniversary very enjoyable. Great access to eating and shopping. Only negative point was paying for parking separately  from the main hotel fee.
Manager Response: We're so glad you and your wife chose the Marina Shores Hotel for your wedding anniversary stay.  We hope the complementary bottle of champagne and card from the staff helped make the occasion a little more special.    Regarding the parking fee ... most of the hotels in our area charge for parking and some even tack on mysterious "resort fees."  Our parking fee is the lowest and (for other readers) if you are a Best Western Rewards member or a member of AARP, parking is free.

Summary: This was such a nice place to stay. We had a balcony which overlooked PCH, but it was very quiet and we were not disturbed by traffic. Since we were only staying 2 nights, we chose not to have our room cleaned. We had plenty of towels.
Manager Response: Hi Frances!  Thanks for the kind review and we're glad you and your family enjoyed your short stay at the Marina Shores.  Our two room suites are perfect for families on vacation and I'm sure the other Trip Advisor readers will appreciate your endorsement too.

Summary: Very cozy and well located. Nice rooms. Excellent tub with jets. Very friendly staff. The only LITTLE thing I could object is that the pool was a little colder than what I expected from a heated pool. The rest was all superb.
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice review, Pedro and we are thrilled that you and your family enjoyed your stay at the Marina Shores Hotel.  Regarding our heated pool, I will pass your comments on to the professional service company that comes out twice a week to clean, check the chemical levels and all the equipment.  They are supposed to make sure it is always heated to 80 degrees, which is the optimal temperature - anything over that promotes the growth of algae and bacteria.  Our own maintenance staff checks the pool temperature twice a day and if there are ever any issues, we notify the pool company immediately.

Summary: The location of the hotel is marvelous.   The two young ladies at the front desk were very friendly and helpful.  The room was very large with two tv's - one in the bath area.  Jetted tub was heavenly, and they provide bath salts.   The shower stall is separate, which is perfect.  It is surprisingly quiet in the room.  We loved it there and will definitely be back!
Manager Response: "Did not want to leave!" ... That is about the highest compliment we can receive.  We are both honored and appreciative that you found the Marina Shores Hotel to be so comfortable and the staff so friendly.  It sounds like you had one of our whirlpool suites, which are the best accommodations we have to offer - affordable luxury on the Pacific Coast ... who would believe it?

Summary: We stayed here over the 4th of July weekend. The hotel is very clean & nicely decorated. The staff are very friendly. We had a standard king room that was very spacious & also included a refrigerator, coffee maker, whirlpool tub, & free breakfast! This hotel is located within walking distance from just about anything you would want to do in Dana Point. We had a great stay!
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review and for adding some great personal photographs to the Trip Advisor site.  It's a wonderful addition to help travelers see the hotel through the eyes of other travelers.

Summary: You get what you pay for.  The rooms are quiet and relatively spacious. Not as close to the water as it seems. The pool is small and has limited area to lounge. Parking is tight so get in early to make sure you get a parking space. 1 very slow elevator.
Manager Response: Excellent point - the Marina Shores IS an excellent choice for the budget concious traveler, but please, no stigmas of a "budget hotel."  We offer a full, free, hot breakfast every morning, our pool may be small, but it IS heated and from the deck you get a nice view of the Pacific.  Yes we are a block and a half off the ocean, but why pay up to twice as much for a hotel room just to save a couple of minutes on your walk to the beach?  We have the amenities, we have the comforts and still maintain our reputation as the best value in tri-beach area.

Summary: We came down for a baseball tournament and only needed one night. We looked at other hotels but they were really pricey because of the holiday weekend and oddly enough, was told they were all sold out at the military rate?? Really?? Of All weekends....4th of July weekend?? Anyway, we lucked out with this gym! This is in an excellent location, close to the beach (across the street basically), restaurants and access to the freeway. The staff and management were great. My BW platinum status was recognized and I was upgraded and had free parking. The hotel was very clean and presented well from the street. The room was great!! I had the suit so it's was almost like having two rooms. The furnishings were modern and clean, two 37" flat screens, air purifier and a cool balcony with
Manager Response: It is truly an honor to provide accommodations for the men and women who serve our country in the armed forces.  While it's true that most hotels will close out all their discounts (including military) during sellouts, at the Marina Shores, we can almost always make an exception for active military personnel who want to spend their leave with us.  If we can't offer you a discount, we will most certainly offer you a free upgrade if there is one available.  We appreciate your choosing the Marina Shores for your hotel needs.

Summary Heading: Fantastic for an overnight stay and/or budget stay by the water
Summary: Have nothing but positive things to say about the Best Western in Dana Point. Admittedly, only stayed here for about 7 hours after transcontinental travel (prior to a Catalina trip), but the hotel was exceedingly clean, the room was spacious and comfortable enough, decent bathroom, and the property was well-taken-care of. Nice touches, like the better-than-average breakfast buffet, and lend-and-borrow reading library differentiate this property from other budget hotels. Also, the two staff-members we interacted with upon check-in and check-out were overly friendly, helpful and made this a pleasure.   I usually stay at 4+ star hotels, but for 1/2 the price of the nearby 4-stars, this hotel is definitely recommended.
Manager Response: WOW!  Even 4-star travelers like us!  Hope you really enjoyed your trip to Catalina.  Even though we only served you for seven hours, we're glad we made for a nice send off on the next leg of your vacation.  Come back and stay longer!

Summary: We stayed here one night on our drive between LA and San Diego.  The hotel was clean, staff polite and nice, and beds comfortable.  We went whale watching at the state beach marina not far from the hotel and had a nice dinner.  The hotel breakfast was good and the staff provided an excellent route to get to LA while avoiding most traffic.  The PCH was a beautiful drive.
Manager Response: Hi Jana!  Glad you were able to squeeze in the whale watching trip while you were traveling from San Diego to LA.  They are truly amazing and majestic creatures.  We're also glad that you enjoyed your stopover at the Marina Shores.  Thanks for the kind review and give your friends in Tennessee our best.

Summary: I can't say enough great things about Leslie La Berge and her customer service. I recently booked a block of rooms at the hotel for my wedding guests.  From start to finish, Leslie was professional, responsive, and courteous. She went above and beyond her duties to answer all my questions, help my guests reserve extra days, and always do so with a friendly attitude. The guests who spoke with her all commented on what a pleasure she was to work with. Leslie made the booking process so easy, and I am very grateful for that! Kudos to Leslie!
Manager Response: Hi Mary,  I will be sure to pass on your praises to Leslie.  She is extremely dedicated to all her wedding groups so it's always great to hear of her success.

Summary: We enjoyed our stay here. The rooms are standard, but clean. Hallways wide, well lit. Breakfast options were sparse. The pool was small with only one table/4 chairs and 2 lounge chairs as options for those not swimming.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review on us Jaqui.  I'm sorry you found our free breakfast limiting, but we do rotate the menu every day to give our guests some variety.

Summary: All in all a great hotel---and great staff!  Especially Krista who is so bubbly, friendly, and helpful!  Only complaint is that there was airfreshner plug in device which I am allergic to. i took it to the desk. these trigger headache, puffy eyes and asthma. i prefer a clean room with no artificial fragrance for this reason.
Manager Response: Hi Patty.  Since you and I already spoke about the air freshener issue while you were, I'll address this to your readers.  Even though the Marina Shores Hotel has won awards for our cleanliness and ranks in the Top Five of all Best Westerns in that particular catagory, there are times when guests will cook in the microwaves and there is a trace of a food odor after they've checked out.  No matter how clean the room is, sometimes it just takes a day or two for the odor to disappear on its own.  Some hotels will use those industrial deoderizers that make a guest room smell like a hospital ... then you walk into a room and BAM!  Your nose tells you that they are trying to cover up something.  Our idea was to use the same type of plug in air fresheners that people use at home ... something that wouldn't appear as an assault on your senses.  Unfortunately - and you are 100% right - none of those solutions will bode well for people who are either allergic or have a hyper-sensitive sense of smell.  We are extremely sorry for your discomfort but are glad you found the rest of your experience here so great.

Summary: I always look for Best Western Plus first when planning a trip. Going to Dana Point I knew the prices would be high which took out the Inn at the Beach. Then I found Marina Shores and all I can say is WOW!! A beautiful view of the ocean, eating close by, the suite far exceeded my expectations the staff was wonderful. This is the best hotel I've stayed in for the price ever. I will go back here often.
Manager Response: Sharon, thank you for that incredible testimony and we all appreciate your recognizing the Marina Shores as THE best hotel value in Dana Point.  Even though we see the same sentiment repeated in so many of our reviews, we never tire of reading them!  It tells us we are doing our jobs right and energizes the entire staff when we see that our contribution to people's vacations keeps them coming back again and again.  Spread the word!

Summary: Great stay, comfortable rooms although a bit outdated.  The location is excellent. Walking distance to beach and restaurants. The hotel staff is extremely accommodating and helpful. Don't forget to visit the Mission San Juan Capistrano. A lovely place and one of the best Missions to see. Avoid Ortega Highway if you don't want to drive curvy roads at a high altitude. You can take the toll roads and they are worth it, but you have to pay for them online.  If you don't take them you will have to add on at least 30 minutes more driving time.
Manager Response: Awww, Mary ... couldn't you have said our rooms have "character" instead of calling them "outdated"?  (smiling)  The truth is that the Marina Shores Hotel is about 30 years old, but it is in keeping with the older style of most of the buildings in the Dana Point / San Juan Capistrano area ... there is a ton of SoCal history here.  The hotel was completely renovated in 2012 so we have done alot for the old girl.  Check out some of our photos on the Trip Advisor site and judge for yourselves.

Summary: We came off a three day overnighter on an old fashioned tall ship with The Ocean Institute with a group of junior high and high school kids. We were dying for food and showers!  Check in was easy and the rooms were clean and beds comfortable. Every room had a fridge and jetted tub. And we were able to get a roll away bed for a couple of rooms.  Perhaps those are normal, expected amenities? The service, however, went beyond my expectations. Based on the front desk's recommendation (Krista was fabulous!), we ordered food from The Asian Kitchen and were able to borrow the hotel breakfast eating area. This made a huge difference to our group! We were able to eat delicious food without going anywhere else. Perfect! Plus, since we weren't able to get two of the roll away beds, Krista
Manager Response: Hey Valerie!  It was an absolute pleasure serving you and all the kids from the George Mueller Academy.  We deal with alot of youth groups at the Marina Shores Hotel - sports teams, field trips and so on - and I have to say that your crew was among the politest, most well-behaved I have ever had the privilege of meeting.  We are all thrilled that the kids enjoyed their trip and we look forward to hosting you all again next year!

Summary: This hotel is very nice and simple. Nothing fancy, but perfectly fine since most of the time in Dana Point we were enjoying the beach and restaurants around the area.  The hotel is very comfortable and simple. It was perfect for us.
Manager Response: Even though I would have loved to have seen "wonderful" or "spectacular" in the review, Alexander DOES bring out a very valuable point for other travelers ... most of the people coming to Dana Point are coming for the beach, the restaurants, the shopping and all the attractions of Southern California so does it really make alot of sense to have a huge piece of your vacation budget tied up in the hotel you stay at?  At the Marina Shores Hotel, we offer comfort, cleanliness and a real value when compared to our competition.  We may not be the fanciest hotel in town, but we will give you the best bang for your buck.  Good point Alexander and thanks for the kind review!

Summary: Good hotel with exception of moldy smell from air condition. I felt terrible the entire week I stayed in this hotel but I am also allergic to mold. My daughter complained of the smell the entire week as well. Other than that the hotel was good; good location and good service.
Manager Response: Hi Rachel.  I know that we corresponded on your issue with the air conditioner after you checked out, so I'm assuming that you posted this review before we spoke.  For other readers, after Rachel's party checked out and reported the odor issue to us, we immediately pulled the air conditioner and there was no trace of mold.  There was a slight odor in the room which we think was caused by the high humidity during the week and the fact that we had just rewallpapered the room two days before her party arrived and there may have been a residual smell from the paste.      This brings out a very good point to share with all travelers.  Whenever you check into a hotel, whether it's just for one night or even a week like Rachel's family, if there is anything about your accommodations that don't completely meet with your expectations, report it to the hotel management immediately so they have an opportunity to correct the matter for you.  Please don't ever accept discomfort.  That's not what you're paying for.  While we make every effort to make sure all of our rooms are in perfect condition before a guest arrives, from time to time there will be unforeseen problems and a good hotelier will leap to the rescue to make sure you are 100% satisfied.

Summary: Good beach hotel. Clean, with good beds. The pool is small , just for kids. Request a room on the back on the hotel not facing PCH if traffic noise bothers you. Try the pancake machine. The pancakes were very good!
Manager Response: Thanks for your review Ellen and your advice to fellow travelers is very good.  With the Marina Shores you get the best of both worlds .. on the front side you get a great view of the activity on the famous Pacific Coast Highway and on the back side you get peace and solitude.  Good call.

Summary: We were a goup of 10 friends and used the conference room for a birthday event.  Hotel was clean, lots of hot water, comfortable bed.  The room had a king-size bed & a jacuzzi tub but felt a little cramped.  Double pane windows kept most of the street noise away.  Many good restaurants / bars close by & McDonald's across the street.  Reasonable prices but $10 a day for parking in the sun with dripping air conditioning units in some places.  Employees friendly but did not necessarily understand what I was asking for--i.e. got big bowls of ice instead of 4 ice buckets for chilled wine in conference room.  Not bad, just not great.  Harbor area very busy & large.  Plan ahead for parking there.
Manager Response: Hi Laura!  I know we went over all your concerns already via personal email so I won't repeat everything here.  I just want to mention how much I appreciate your pointing out the good parts of your visit and not dwelling on the few areas where our service didn't quite match your needs.  We value all of our guests comments and opinions, so on the rare occasion where we drop the ball, it serves as a constructive learning experience and we can come back better than ever.

Summary: This was our third visit to the Best Western Marina Shores and, once again, it was great!  Everything seems to be perfect at this hotel....the location is good, the staff is exceptional, the rooms are nicely furnished and very clean, and the breakfast provided is very good.  The property is maintained beautifully.  This time we had a one-bedroom suite on the 3rd floor which was very nice; lots of room with a balcony and although it is definitely not an ocean front view we could see the ocean and shoreline quite well.  The only drawback is Pacific Coast Highway which can get a little noisey, but in my opinion it's better than the train which you would have at most of the other hotels in the area.  This hotel is also pet friendly, which is appreciated.  There aren't grass areas at
Manager Response: "The Best Choice" ... that almost sounds like a slogan!  We love it and are all so thrilled that you enjoyed your time at the Marina Shores and visiting Dana Point.  It's even better when the praises come from a loyal repeat customer.    Come see us again soon!

Summary: The hotel was much more reasonably priced than those right on the ocean and we still had a great ocean view.   The entire hotel staff was excellent; they were friendly and most helpful in every way possible.  They are very knowledgeable of the area and can suggest some really great activities for you.  The rooms are very clean, well decorated and comfortable. I can't say enough about the awesome showers...lots of pressure and a variable spray head.  I visited the area for 6 days and there was no lack of something to do, was busy everyday and slept like a baby every night.  Woke up to the sounds of the ocean and the sunshine of California....what a great way to vacation!!!
Manager Response: Hi Teri!  Thank you for the wonderful review and we're so glad you had such a great time in Dana Point.  I know we helped you get reservations for the whale watching excursion and you also went on one of the sport fishing trips.  Quite an experience for a desert dweller like yourself (laughing!)  Thanks again for all the praises of the Marina Shores Hotel.  Look forward to seeing you and your family again.

Summary: These guys did it again! We had a fabulous time again!  a wonderful two room suite across from the beach at Dana Point, and the Doheny Blues Festival, just a short walk to the festival. A nice comfortable bed to return to, and a social room in the front living room to party on afterwards. Including a refrigerator and wetbar, because you know after the blues you want to continue on with friends, just a bit more after the festival, not too rowdy but some wine and cheese with friends.
Manager Response: The Doheny Blues Festival is one of the highlights of our year and we were glad you were a part of it!  The clerks have a great time dressing up like the Blues Brothers and posing for pictures with everyone and playing the blues music through the hotel sound system all weekend long ... we hope when you came back from the festival each night, it felt like you were still there!  See you next year.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel early april 2014. Very nice rooms, nice beds and friendly, helpful staff. Good value for money. The hotel is situated nicely in Dana Point - easy to find and some okay dining posibilities nearby.  We were coming from an absolutely horrible stay in San Diego, so that may have affected our judgement, but this hotel can certainly be recommeded.  Something to complain about? Hmmmm.... Not really - Could have been an overview of tv-channels in the room.....
Manager Response: We are so glad you enjoyed your stay although I'm sorry to hear that you had problems in San Diego.  Hopefully we made your trip a little bit better.  Although it doesn't help you now, we do have a complete channel guide for our televisions in the Guest Directory in each room.

Summary: Overall a good experience. You get what you pay for, clean room with a good bed. Parking is abundant and location is not far from the beach. Also has a good free breakfast in the morning. I wished the workout room was bigger and also that the pool had a hot tub. The pch highway is annoying at night as well.
Manager Response: Sometimes you get a little MORE than you pay for.  We hope you enjoyed the free upgrade to the king whirlpool suite.  It was our way of saying "Happy Anniversary!"

Summary: We had a water damage problem T out apts and needed 2 rooms with dogs. Pete the manager sprung into action and made our tenants  comfortable immediety, the staff was great and a big thank you to Peter the manager for making sure my guys were happy, I highly recommend this hotel
Manager Response: Tom, it was our pleasure to take good care of your tenants while the repairs at your units were being done.  Being displaced from a home or apartment is stressful for anyone, but the staff made sure the Marina Shores made a good home-away-from-home for all those affected.  I appreciate the recognition for my part, but the staff of the hotel were the real heros for you.

Summary: Very conferrable hotel site with clean rooms dinning near by and and on Pacific Coast Highway. Good staff and service the Business ore family travelers. Freeway close to interstate 5 and the coastal cities of south Orange County.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review Michael.  We appreciate your bringing up the point that the Marina Shores Hotel is an excellent choice for both families and business travelers.  We've had several guests comment that our two-room suites in particular enables them to use the room as a satellite office.  We're glad you enjoyed your stay and hope your event was productive.

Summary: Very nice and modern hotel, just two blocks from the beach. Our suite was nicely furnished and very comfortable, partial view of the ocean. Service from check in to check out was great. Breakfast was good too. Lots of restaurants in the area, we enjoyed "Jacks" for dinner. Looking forward to our next visit!
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review and we're glad you enjoyed your stay.  It's also wonderful to know that you plan to return to the Marina Shores the next time you come to the south coast.

Summary: The location was perfect in Dana Point off PCH. The hotel is very nice, clean and the rooms were spacious and decorated really nicely. The staff was friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this place, as you can't beat the price.
Manager Response: Hi Ross!  Thank you for all the kind words and we're truly happy you enjoyed your stay at the Marina Shores Hotel and, of course, in Dana Point as well.

Summary: Good Hotel  Best Western PLUS Marina Shores Hotel, Dana Point is Very good hotel Best Western PLUS Marina Shores Hotel, Dana Point is Very good hotel Best Western PLUS Marina Shores Hotel, Dana Point is Very good hotel Best Western PLUS Marina Shores Hotel, Dana Point is Very good hotel
Manager Response: Say it once, say it twice, say it a thousand times if you dare     and accept our thanks from the "people who care."

Summary: Great location in Dana Point.  Friendly, helpful staff. Close to restaurants and excellent place to stay before catching the  ferry to Catalina.  Good breakfast.  Great beds!  Have stayed here before and we'll be back again.
Manager Response: Our three favorite words are "we'll be back!"  So glad you enjoyed your stay.  Tell your friends about our beautiful little getaway community, the convenience of the ferry to Catalina ... and of course about the value and comfort of the Marina Shores Hotel.

Summary: As a hospitality service consultant for over 30 years, my expectations are high.  This property continues to provide 5 star service across the board.  The staff is phenomenal; Housekeeping does a first class job; The rooms from suites to regular are all comfortable and a good nights sleep is guaranteed - No noise from the room next door and a quality mattress!  The complimentary breakfast is a great way to start the day.  I have stayed at the property for business as well as personal travel, and I will continue to make the Marina Shores my first choice!
Manager Response: It's always such a joy to have you here and knowing that we consistently exceed your expectations across the board tells the staff and me that we are certainly doing something right.  Thank you so much for the glowing review and we really look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Nicely Appointed Rooms; Good Value for Location
Summary: I traveled to Dana Pt to attend a family event and was very pleased with the hotel.  Nice location, close to the beach, large nicely-appointed rooms with comfortable beds and linens, nice bath products, quick internet, friendly staff and a good selection of breakfast items.  Note that there is a $10/night parking fee; however we easily found near-by street parking.  I would definitely return.
Manager Response: Kathleen, we are all so happy that you enjoyed your stay - not only at the Marina Shores, but in Dana Point as well.  It's folks like you who are quickly exposing our beautiful harbor community as one of the best kept secrets on the Southern California coast.  Spread the word and come back soon!

Summary: Great hotel - clean - even the standard room is above standard! Warm, helpful staff.  Great location.  Great value for the price.  Also, they do not discriminate against people traveling with small, well behaved, and clean pets.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review, Esther.  We would never think of separating our guests from their four-legged family members.  Even though the hotel doesn't have a tremendous amount of outdoor space for pets to explore, there is a beautiful public park that is pet friendly at the top of the hill just behind us.

Summary Heading: Reasonable and clean and a great location
Summary: We had a family event near Dana Point. This Best Western was reasonably priced, clean, and provided a great value. All of this at a prime location.  Loved the pool, morning breakfast, and proximity to everything Dana Point has to offer.   Management and housekeeping were friendly and attentive.   The property was well maintained, clean, and recently updated.   Parking was free and plentiful.  This hotel was a perfect fit as a base for our family events, visiting friends in Los Angeles, a day trip to Sea World in San Diego, and everything else the area has to offer.   We'll be back!
Manager Response: Hey Andy!  Thank you for the great review and moreso, thank you for bringing out an excellent point for families vacationing in southern California.  Many people come to SoCal and stay in the LA or Anaheim area for a few days to see all the attractions, then move to a hotel around San Diego to do some sightseeing there.  By staying in Dana Point they would save the headache of moving from place to place - a perfect base as you put it - PLUS they would save alot of money over the hotels that are in the attractions backyard.  Yes, there's a little bit of driving to hit all the points of interest, but the value and convenience of staying in one, centrally located area should outweigh all the extra money they would have to spend.  FANTASTIC idea and thank you for sharing it with all your fellow travelers.

Summary Heading: Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel Dana Point CA
Summary: The hotel has the perfect location off Highway 1 in Dana Point.  The beach is just a few blocks away, within walking distance of the hotel.  All the guest rooms have Wi-Fi access, refrigerator, coffee maker, and flat screen cable TV.  There's also a jacuzzi tub. There is also a complimentary breakfast each morning.  The view of the Pacific ocean is great.  There is also a business center with fax and photocopying service.  The rooms were very clean and the d√©cor was great.  I will stay again on my next trip to Dana Point.  It is highly recommended.
Manager Response: John, it sounds like you covered all our bases with your review.  We're so glad to hear that you thought so highly of our hotel and that we contributed to a wonderful stay in Dana Point.  Come back soon!

Summary: Close to Dana Point Harbor, restaurants, shops, etc. Reasonably priced for location. Very nice hotel, clean and comfortable. Located on Pacific Coast Highway. Had a room with a view on highway, yet surprisingly quiet. Good breakfast, covered fee parking on site. Staff friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: We're glad you enjoyed your stay at the Marina Shores and hope you had time to explore the harbor ... the food is incredbile and the little shops make for a unique afternoon.

Summary: The hotel was good value for the location especially with no resort nor parking fee (wAARP). Quiet. Secure. Clean. Could barely see the ocean but could walk to it. Many restaurants at Dana Point. Easy drive to San Diego and Huntington Beach/NewportBeach/LagunaBeach. Not a resort to spend time there but our plans were to explore Calilfornia.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review.  We DO love our seniors here and are thrilled that you included us in your exploration of the California coast.

Summary: beautiful property, well maintained ,exceptional cleanliness.Redecorated rooms, comfy beds, plenty of space. overall great accommodations, good location. Hot breakfast with many selections, lobby and public areas spotless and inviting. Great place to stay!
Manager Response: Hi Barbara and thank you for the wonderful reveiw.  In just a few words, I think you captured the essence of everything we try to offer here at the Marina Shores Hotel.  Thank you for spreading the word!

Summary: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary and were not disappointed.  Our 1st floor king room was good-sized, the bed and pillows were comfy, and the Jacuzzi tub was great.  The hotel itself is right on the PCH, and even though our room faced the road the traffic noise was not bad.  The beach and marina with all the wonderful shops and restaurants are within walking distance.  The free hotel breakfast leaves a lot to be desired, but there are many, many restaurants across the street and nearby.  I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to my friends and family.
Manager Response: Hi Mark!  On behalf of the staff of the Marina Shores, let me congratulate you and your wife in celebrating your anniversary - and of course, for choosing our hotel for your getaway stay.  For you and other travelers who may read this, I would like to clear up some misconceptions about our breakfast.  The Marina Shores Hotel does not have a full-service restaurant.  The concept is a quick, free, limited hot breakfast for people on the go.  Our guests are usually rushing off to meetings, weddings or to take in some of the excitement of the SoCal beaches and attractions.  With the eggs, breakfast meats and roasted potatoes, along with fresh fruits, muffins and yogurts, we provide much more than the traditional "continental breakfast" (coffee and doughnuts) offered by some other hotels.  We strive to provide the best breakfast selections possible at no additional cost to our guests.

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for one night because of all the great reviews and somewhat reasonable price (140) for the area. It was even better than we expected!!!  Very nice decor, very clean (even carpets), and a very comfy bed. The jacuzzi tub with TV was an AWESOME addition!  Although this hotel doesn't offer the amenities of other hotels, it's still a wonderful hotel! We'd definitely stay here again! My ONLY complaint is that we could hear foot-traffic somewhere.  It didn't seem to appear to be above us, so it had to be next door... yet we didn't hear anything else. It was strange.  But, otherwise, an excellent stay in an excellent hotel for a reasonable price!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the review Stacy and we're glad you and your husband were pleasantly surprised by our accommodations.  I will keep an eye out for that elephant in the hallway, but please accept my apologies for the noise disturbing you.

Summary: Easy to get to very comfortable room bed has pillow top mattress a huge tub/spa.  The pet friendly room is clean with no odor located on the ground floor.  The staff will help you with any concerns at this property.  The breakfast has many options not just a roll and coffee.  This is my second stay at this property it is a good south orange county location the price is very reasonable,no linens to wash or beds to make just relax and enjoy.
Manager Response: Hi Linda.  We're so happy you enjoyed your time with us and thanks for recognizing the staff for all they do.  It's the people, not just the place that make for a great hotel stay and we are glad we were able to be a part of yours.  Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Everything was perfect.  Beautifully remodeled hotel.  Jacuzzi tub was a big plus.  The room was beautifully appointed and the size of the room was more than adequate.  Location is close to the Marina and the beach.
Manager Response: Well Michael, "perfect" is always our goal and it sounds like we hit it out of the park for you.  Thank you for the kind words and hope you remember us the next time you are in the SoCal beach area.

Summary: Excellent value for price for a 2-queen suite with wetbar. We received an upgrade as Best Western members The male receptionist at checkin was excellent directing my husband as he parked his Suburban with a Thule box on top into the enclosed parkade. We barely made clearance. The room was spotless with a lovely Jacuzzi tub and all amenities.
Manager Response: Truly glad you enjoyed your stay.  We appreciate your loyalty as a Best Western Rewards member and are happy you're a part of the Best Western family.

Summary: Stayed three nights so was able to take advantage of the internet three-night stay rate. The hotel is clean, staff is friendly and efficient, breakfast is standard but filling, and rooms are comfortable.
Manager Response: Hi Paula!  Glad you were able to take advantage of the three-night special offered by Best Western.  Thank you for the great review and for spreading the word about Best Western's fantastic deals.

Summary Heading: Wow!  More like a 5 star resort than a Best Western
Summary: Very clean - cleanest, nicest Best Western I've ever been to.  We had a two room suite, which is a great value. Most hotels claim a two room suite, but this is an actual two room suite, with a real door and separate room, which is so convenient if you have a baby or toddler that still naps, etc. State beach is just a short walk from hotel.  Beach has surfboards, boogie boards, etc. for rent for about $4/hour or something like that.  Also, there are many restaurants and a few shops across the street or within walking distance.  I would highly recommend this area and this hotel for family vacations.
Manager Response: I'm humbled by your praises, but don't change a word! (smiling)  Thank you for the great assessment of the Marina Shores.  We take pride in the beautiful, clean accommodations we offer and there is no greater reward than when guests like you take notice.  Thank you so much.

Summary: We stayed here the night prior to taking ferry to Catalina.  The location was perfect and the staff was very nice and helpful.  They upgraded our family of 4 to a very comfortable suite. Since our ferry departure was at 9:50 it gave us time to enjoy a light breakfast.  We will stay here again for our next Dana Point trip
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your stay and hope you had a wonderful time on Catalina.  We love giving people the free upgrades when we can, especially folks staying with us for the first time.  It sounds like we were part of a great vacation memory and we look forward to seeing you all again.

Summary Heading: Dana Point BW my choice every time.
Summary: I travel to regularly from New Zealand and have stayed at many hotels in SoCal. I always come back to the Dana Point Best Western though because it has such a great mix of what I look for in a hotel experience . . . quiet location, comfortable beds, great staff who always make you feel special, and good value. The location is great, right off the freeway, yet far enough away that you cannot hear it. Right across from the beach and close to a great array of nice restaurants. Top value, top marks.
Manager Response: It's so wonderful to see a review from one of our regular corporate business travelers.  We're glad you've made the Marina Shores Hotel your location of choice whenever you come to Dana Point ... and hope to be serving you for many years to come.  The whole front desk staff sends their best too!

Summary: I typically stay at very nice 4-5 star hotels, but at 2-4 times the cost of this Best Western. This hotel is great for the value and worth sacrificing 4-5 star quality. It's not a resort, but great for keeping costs down for business or if on a budget for family vacations.
Manager Response: Hi Richard and thank you for the great review.  Y'know ... four and five star hotels may be able to offer amenities that more reasonably priced hotels can't, but great service, a friendly staff and a clean comfortable room should be available at any hotel, at any level.  We are so happy that you recognized the value of the Marina Shores Hotel and appreciate your testimony.  Come back and see us soon!

Summary: One night stay in a great location in a very average Best Western. I assumed the PLUS meant that it would be better than the average Best Western's I have stayed across the U.S. It felt like a typical BW in a beautiful area and a great location. I guess the Plus simply meant "Location, location". I was "upgraded" to a suite, upon arrival....not sure why, but I took it. However, my room key didn't work 3 x and the kids at the front desk could have cared less that I had to shlep my luggage up and down 3 times to switch out the key. Nor did they come with me to try and make sure I actually got into my room. They were to busy talking about their "plans for a concert" to seem concerned about me. My bedspread and decorative pillow had white stains on it (yuk), bulbs burned out in lamp
Manager Response: I was really dismayed to hear that the desk staff was less than helpful when you had issues with the room key.  If you read through our other reviews, most people mention how helpful and friendly the clerks are so this was very uncharacteristic of them and I sincerely apologize.  The white stains on the pillow and bed scarf were from a issue with the bleaching additive in our laundry and they have been discarded.  Sadly, they never should have been placed in the room in the first place.    We try to upgrade guests whenever possible to make their stay a little more special, but I agree that we could have done much better on the service end.  I have addressed your experience with the staff members involved and they asked that I pass on their regrets as well.

Summary: We decided to extend our trip to Catalina Island with a night in Dana Point. We were delighted to discover this BW Plus hotel just minutes from Dana Point Harbor. The room was great and we enjoyed the jacuzzi tub in our room. Our hotel room on the Island was cramped with a queen bed. The BW+ had a king bed, desk and two tvs (one in the bathroom).
Manager Response: Hi Joe!  To hear that our accommodations were more impressive than those on Catalina Island was high praise indeed.  We're glad to have been a part of your vacation and hope that a return trip to Dana Point and the Marina Shores Hotel will be on your calendar in the future

Summary: Very caring staff, great location, the room had new flat screen TV, new bed, new carpet. The room was new and clean, there was an ocean view. It was a little small but it didn't bother me. Great value!!
Manager Response: We appreciate all your kind words and are glad you enjoyed your time with us.  Even though it has been almost two years since our floor-to-ceiling renovation, our housekeeping and maintenance staff work extra hard to keep that "like new" feeling throughout the hotel.  Judging by your comments, they're doing a terrific job.  Thanks again!

Summary: Overall very accommodating.  Staff very helpful.  Wireless internet very slow.  Bedroom smell needs to be addressed.  Great location, great breakfast.  Parking garage easy to get in and out of.  Clean sheets/towels.  Television sound (we had two TV's) was poor on both TV's.  Although hotel seemed full of guests, there was never a cramped feeling.
Manager Response: Hi Edgar!  Thank you for the great review in spite of the issues with your room.  Normally there is never an issue with odors in our rooms.  You may have noticed that we even use those air fresheners that plug into the wall just to make sure the air is fresh and pleasantly scented for our guests, so I'm not sure where the odor came from.  I believe the sound issue was with our cable service.  We use commercial grade LG televisions so if the sound was bad with both TVs I'm guessing it must have been on the cable service supplier's end.  We've checked the room and both issues seem to have resolved themselves.  Thank you again for the great review.

Summary: Best Western is a well known midlevel hotel chain. You expect a decent non-frills accomodation, but not much more.  But the Marina Shores hotel definitely exceeded our modest expectation and I have to repeat one of the previous reviewers that it is the BEST Best Western hotel I have seen so far.  Everythiing is extremely clean, the staff is friendly and efficient, the rooms are spacious, comfortable and nicely furnished. We stayed only one night and could not check all facilities of the hotel (i.e. we can not say anything about the breakfast because we had to leave at 6 am), but what we saw was either excellent or very good. The only thing that could be improved are AC units in the rooms: they are a bit too loud which affects sleep quality.  In winter time you can sleep with
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful review.  It's great to see what an impression we can make in only one night!  Tell all your friends in Jersey to look us up if their vacation plans ever bring them to southern California.

Summary: We had an great stay at Marina Shores! From the moment we walked in, Brian at the front desk did everything possible to make our family's stay wonderful! The property is in wonderful condition, the rooms are very nicely appointed, and the entire staff was friendly and concerned for our comfort. We had a suite on the second floor and the balcony was a great place to enjoy the sun and a decent ocean view. I would say a lot of other Hotels could take a lesson in hospitality from Marina Shores! Highly recommend!!
Manager Response: Hi Dave!  So glad you enjoyed your stay and I'll make sure to pass on your praises to the entire staff, especially Brian.  We are proud to be the example of what hospitality is all about and appreciate folks like you who recognize the efforts we make.  Hope to see you back.

Summary: Found the room to be very clean with comfortable beds and nice linens.  The staff was very friendly.  The refridgerator in the room really chilled drinks quickly.  The whirlpool tub was a nice treat.  Overall we were very pleased with our room and the price was affordable.
Manager Response: Paul, we really appreciate the kind words.  You pretty much hit all the highlights of what we offer.  Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We often stay in Best Western hotels while traveling with our child's club soccer team. They are usually just fine. This Best Western was the best: warm helpful staff, recently updated rooms with new everything, including carpet, new flat-screen TVs, parking, across the street from the beach for a room just over $100, breakfast, and decent coffee.
Manager Response: The staff voted your review title as the best THEY had ever seen.  Thank you for the glowing words.  We love it when the soccer teams come to town.  The kids' laughter and excitement fills the hotel.  Hope to see you back for the next competition.

Summary: Good location in Dana Point. Close to all points of interest. Clean. Friendly staff. Super easy check in and out. Room had a little patio where you could sit out on in the room. We were on 3rd floor and could almost see Dana Harbor from the patio.
Manager Response: Carol.  Thank you for the great review of both the hotel and Dana Point.  People like you help keep our area from remaining the best kept secret on the southern coast.

Summary Heading: GOOD HOTEL FOR 3 NIGHTS OR LESS ONLY
Summary: This is not a bad hotel to stay at for only a couple of nights.  The location is good, you need a car though to drive you to the restaurants near the water with views.  The parking is only $10 per night which is a lot cheaper than most 4 to 5 star hotels in the area.  I do feel that the parking fee should be waived.  Some Best Western hotels offer free parking, others do not.  The Best Western brand should keep it consistent.  Breakfast was okay.  I don't think real eggs were used or sausages either.  They did not taste like the real stuff you eat from at your local weekend diner.  Given the price paid for our stay here, breakfast was included in the rate, having said that, if you feel that a really good breakfast should be the most important start to your day, there are a few
Manager Response: Thank you for the review.  I just want to clarify for you - and other readers - that all Best Westerns are independently owned and operated.  Some have full service restaurants, some serve the "breakfast on the go" type like we do.  The parking is a resort area thing.  Many of the hotels charge for parking (and much more than we do,) plus they have resort fees or other service charges on top of the room rate.  We strive to be competitive - to provide the cleanest and most comfortable accommodations at the best price in the area.  We charge only for the room and parking ... although I will add that seniors staying on the AARP rate get their parking for free.

Summary: I would stay again.  Very nice and quiet hotel.  very clean, good decor. Front desk offered a free upgrade to a suite.   hotel was very open.  Pool was heated and clean.  Lots of places to eat within walking distance.  Great Hotel at a Great price.
Manager Response: Hi David!  Thanks for making the Marina Shores your choice in Dana Point.  Hope we see you back soon.

Summary: I recently spent 2 nights here and enjoyed it.  Some of the rooms in the back of the hotel have more of a motel feel to them with exterior entrances.  My room was in an interior corridor and was fairly quiet.  The room furnishings are nice and the bed was comfortable.  The breakfast offerings were good and the front desk people were friendly and helpful.  I would stay here again when I'm in the area.
Manager Response: Glad you enjoyed your stay.  Thanks for the great review.

Summary: My husband & I just had a mini-vacation, at the end of my husband's business trip in the area. The hotel is great! Absolutely the best value for the money. I can honestly say that the beds (and pillows) are some of the most comfortable I've ever slept on!!  I would not hesitate to stay there again, if I'm lucky enough to travel to the area again.
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your stay.  Isn't it wonderful when a business trip can turn into a vacation too?  We're happy that we were able to be a part of your Southern California experience.  I noticed you're from Canada.  Don't wait for the next Artic Vortex to pay us a visit, eh?  (smiling!)

Summary: If your 5 5ay work week seems like a 10 day work week, then this hotel has exactly what you need when you are looking for a place to "decompress" or you need an "Adult Timeout". The property lends itself to an florida type setting with palms lining the front wall and spiraling staircase that is a photoshot attraction by itself! and the views on the ther floor of the pacific ocean which are just 3 minutes driving distance and blend perfectly together when it comes to beautiful sunsets and gentle breezes that help us forget how long it took us to get to this hotel.  Absolutely the best suites i have been it so far! they had everything, i was trying to find a reason to extend my stay, and my timeout was over, but We will be back it is on our regular list of places to go throughout
Manager Response: Hi Don!  With all the reviews people see posted here, you brought out a point that is very often overlooked.  Aside from the standard things people talk about - a comfortable bed, a hot breakfast, friendly staff, etc - there is a psychological comfort that you don't always find when traveling.  I'm talking about that "home away from home" feel.  When all the elements of a really good hotel experience come together and you find yourself thinking "I don't want to leave" ... well that's the highest compliment a guest could ever pay us.  Thank you for noticing and sharing the insight with your fellow travelers.  We look forward to having you back!

Summary Heading: Great hotel not easy walk to beach or harbor
Summary: This was the nicest best western I have ever been in. Great value for your money,  extremely clean and nice.  Located on a very busy street and not an easy walk to beach or harbor.  We walked a few times but wound up having to get a taxi.  Traffic was crazy and not easy to navigate.  If you have a car this is an awesome place to be but if you are on foot or bicycle you might want to stay at a different location.
Manager Response: Hi James and Happy New Year to you!  Wow!  "The nicest Best Western you've ever been in."   That is quite an honor and we're very proud to have earned your recognition.  Walking distance to the harbor is a very subjective term.  It's about 10 or 15 minutes depending on your pace and the traffic.  It also depends on the time of year.  It's alot more pleasant to take that walk during the summer.  Even if our guests choose to take a taxi, you still get the convenience of being close to everything without paying an on-the-beach price.  Thanks for the kind words.

Summary: We went for New Years. The hotel was very conveniently located to Dana Point Harbor. It was an easy walk to the harbor. The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The rooms were clean.  The beds were very comfortable.  Did hear some traffic from PCH but was not disturbing.
Manager Response: It was a pleasure to serve as your getaway for New Year's Eve and we're happy you found the accommodations and staff of the Marina Shores to your liking.  The Pacific Coast Highway (PCH to the locals) is noted for it's "colorful" traffic - sometimes the noise of the nightlife and excitement gets a little loud, but to most people, that's all part of the charm.  Please accept our best wishes for a wonderful new year and we hope to see you back next New Year's Eve.

Summary: My favorite California coast hotel - easy to get to Anaheim for Disney, San Diego for Sea World/Zoo/Museums.  Nice interiors. great morning breakfasts, superior employees, comfortable rooms for families or cozy couples retreat.
Manager Response: Hi Jill!  Thank you so much for your great comments and we are very happy you enjoyed your stay at the Marina Shores Hotel.  You happened to mention one thing that I think is very important when people are traveling to south Orange County and that's our central location to Disney and San Diego.  Vacationers have no idea how much money they can save by staying in Dana Point (at the Marina Shores of course!) and then making the short 45 minute drive to all the attractions.  They would spend at least twice as much to stay in Anaheim and San Diego, plus all the hassle of checking out of one city and checking in at the other if they plan on seeing the sights at both.  Dana Point truly has it all when you look at our location in relation to the attractions in Orange County and then add in our beautiful beaches, the marina and all the great restaurants.  Great call Jill and we hope to see you back again soon.

Summary: Terrific place in Dana Point, close to everything.  Staff gave us excellent recommendations for restaurants....where the locals go for good food, service and fun ...Check out Salt Creek Grille.  Will definitely be back! A sharp Best Western Plus that is very well maintained.
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your stay - not only here but exploring all the jewels of Dana Point.  Look forward to having you back.

Summary: Celebrated our 45th wedding anniversary with a four day stay in Dana Point . Received an upgraded room that included a living room, wet bar and whirlpool tub with a partial ocean view in a lovely hotel. The hotel was clean and comfortable. Staff was very pleasant - always a smile on their face. Breakfast hot entree was different each day - a nice change from other hotels. Nicely located with excellent restaurants of all price ranges nearby. The Harbor Grill is one of our favorites. Thank you BW Plus Marina Shores for making our anniversary trip pleasant and problem free. We'll defintely stay again!
Manager Response: It was our pleasure to be a part of your landmark anniversary celebration.  Whenever a hotel becomes part of someone's beautiful memories it reminds all of us on staff why we got into this business in the first place.  Just don't wait another 45 years to pay us a visit!  Congratulations!

Summary: We recently spent two nights at this lovely Best Western while visiting family in the area. The hotel is very nice and in a good location.  We were in a studio suite on the second floor which had a balcony.  Although it isn't considered an ocean view room by any means, I thought the view was very nice as we could see a pretty good glimpse of the shoreline from our balcony.  Many of the rooms have interior entrance, but the room type we had has an outside entrance.  The staff is great at this hotel and the breakfast was far above average.  As mentioned the parking fee is waived if you are an AARP member.  They are pet friendly, although it isn't real convenient for walking your pet...there isn't any grass area but most of the hotels in this area would be the same.    We had a
Manager Response: We love our pets and we love our seniors ... you are all part of the Marina Shores family.  So glad you enjoyed your stay and look forward to your return.

Summary: This past week we had the opportunity to experience first class treatment from Leslie and the staff at best western marina shores in Dana point. They were attentive and always had a smile. The hotel had been renovated and upgraded in the past year. It shows in the rooms bathrooms everywhere.   The hotel rate is reasonable and comes with breakfast. Its also very close to the beach and surrounded with restaurants. I know where I will be staying the next time around. The Best Western Marina Shores for sure.
Manager Response: Like I said to Harshal in the earlier review, it was the committed involvement and communication during the planning and coordinating stages that allowed us to service your wedding group so flawlessly.  You were wonderful people to work with and it was truly a pleasure to be a part of your wedding experience.

Summary: First it is pet friendly but there is a $20 fee per night for your pet. There is a $10 nightly parking fee but if you are a senior and a member of AARP it is waived. In a great location on Pacific Coast Highway and near the marina. Breakfast buffet was a step up from the norm with eggs and potatos and a meat. Hotel was very clean and the rooms were very nice. Had a coffee maker and a college size refrigerator. Bathroom is a little tight but everything was clean and appeared new A year ago this was the Holiday Express and it appears a lot has been upgraded. Bed was great and climate control was good. If you are going to stay in the Dana Point area I would highly recommend staying here. They even have a lower level for parking and an elevator to take you to your floor.
Manager Response: We're glad you enjoyed your stay and thank you for pointing out the improvements since our property-wide renovations.  We love our senior citizen visitors and are happy to pass on the savings of discounted room rates and free parking.  Hope to see you again!

Summary: Where to even begin?? My (now) wife and I just had our destination wedding at the Ritz-Carlton in Dana Point this past Saturday and we setup a block of rooms there and at the Best Western to allow our guests to choose whichever place they wished to stay. Though the Best Western was obviously a cheaper option, it was no less fantastic in every way! I came into town on Wednesday along with most of my immediate family and so we stayed at the Best Western until the day before the wedding. Leslie (the Sales & Marketing Director) graciously allowed us to use one of the hotels business conference rooms for a religious ceremony which took place on Thursday afternoon. The breakfast (included with our rate) was delicious, the rooms were impeccably clean, the maids were attentive and came
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the glowing review!  We're so glad that your wedding was such a huge success and that the Marina Shores Hotel played such a key part.  Giving credit where credit is due, the secret to servicing a group as large as yours lies in communication and we appreciate how closely you worked with us in setting everything up in advance.  Even before you posted this review, Leslie raved about how wonderful you were to work with.  Congratulations on your marriage and we all wish you and your bride many years of happiness ... and of course great memories of this once in a lifetime event and the role we had the honor of playing.

Summary Heading: Do not pay a low rate or your room will not be serviced every day.
Summary: Stayed here in October.  Got a great room rate as we booked way in advance.  Could not get our room serviced every day even though we put the sign on the door.  When we asked about it, Alex M. at the front desk said that the reason was because we got such a great room rate, our room would not get serviced every day.  We were lucky if we had the room cleaned every other day, most of the time it was every third day.  We had to make a bar of soap last for a week.
Manager Response: Please accept my deepest apologies for the service issues you experienced during your stay.  Due to a clerical error, your room was listed as a weekly rate which allowed for housekeeping service every other day.  The issue has been reviewed with the desk staff and they wanted me to pass along their regrets for the mistake.  The Marina Shores has built our reputation on having extremely clean rooms in addition to a very friendly and accommodating staff, so an oversight like this hits to the core of our service philosophy.

Summary: We stayed here for one night last month and found the hotel and the room to be more than we had anticipated.  The bathroom was unbelievable with steps up to the tub and a separate make-up area complete with lighted mirror and a television.  The front desk staff was friendly and helpful and suggested a restaurant within walking distance that was fabulous.  We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Sounds like we upgraded you to one of our King Whirlpool Suites ... a little piece of affordable heaven in the midst of an expensive tourism area, wouldn't you say?  Glad you enjoyed your stay.  Make sure to tell your friends - the Marina Shores is a great value and a great facility for anyone traveling to Dana Point.

Summary Heading: Great bang for the buck plus some
Summary: Stay here on my business trips. The staff is kind and professional. The room is great for the amount I paid. The hotel is busy on the weekend because it's close to Dana Point Harbor, but during weekdays, it's perfect for business travel.
Manager Response: Hi Jin!  Glad to have you as a regular.  Yes, you hit it right on the head - we are a great hotel for business travelers during the week as well as the leisure folks on the weekends.  Our large rooms, desk area and free WiFi makes it so our guest rooms can double as a private office.  Thanks for the feed back and look forward to seeing you again!

Summary Heading: Be sure to call to request ocean view
Summary: We just had a whirlwind 3-night trip to California, staying in this hotel. It is very nice, though right off of a main street. We kept the fan on all night so were not disturbed by the traffic noise. The room was nice, with a partial ocean view. There are rooms on the third floor with better ocean views - I wish I had called to ask to get one of those rooms.  The walk to the ocean takes about 5-10 minutes depending on how fast you walk. To the marina, it's more like 10-15 minutes walk.  Not bad.  I agree with other reviewers that there is not nearly enough seating for breakfast. Clearly, they need more tables!  The free breakfast was excellent, though. There were eggs, potatoes and meat everyday, plus the usual muffins, toast, yogurt, etc.  We would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: We're glad you enjoyed your time with us, but I would like to clarify the "ocean view" idea for other readers.  There are other, much more expensive hotels down on the marina with real ocean views.  In fairness to our customers, we don't want to give anyone the impression that we have the view they do - even from the third floor, it is more of an ocean "peek" through the palm trees across the street.  We do stress our convenience to the harbor and the beach ... five to ten minutes of walking will save guests plenty of money if they stay with us.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for price and location!
Summary: This was the first time my husband and I stayed at this hotel, we were a little worried, but everything turned out better than expected. Loved location, nice little hotel, great breakfast. Staff was very courteous and went out of their way to make our stay very pleasant. We hope to come back again.
Manager Response: Whatever your worries were, I'm glad we put them to rest.  Hope you come back to see us again!

Summary: Decent hotel right across the street from the Dana Point Harbor where there are several good restaurants, and of course the views of the ocean.  Staff was very helpful and beds comfortable.  I like the convenience of the location and thought the rooms were well done.  I didn't get to use the pool, but noticed a lot of families taking advantage.
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your stay.  You hit just about all of the key features of what makes the Marina Shores Hotel and Dana Point a great destination.

Summary: Nice Hotel, but nothing special. It's old and well taken care of, but it's old. Bathrooms are small.Hideaway bed is old and creaky. Regular beds are nice. A fan in the living room would be nice. Would probably save on air conditioning. It's old!
Manager Response: When we renovated the hotel in 2012 we made a very focused effort to maintain the historical integrity and feel of the building - from refinishing the travertine and marble floors in the public areas to installing crown moldings in every hallway and guest room.  It is strictly a matter of personal taste so I am in no way challenging your opinion.  Every item in our guest rooms was replaced (including the sofa beds) as part of the renovation and we truly believe that for comfort and value we hold our own with any hotel in Dana Point.

Summary: The location is great; close to the beach and a few small bars and some restaurants.  We had room 101, which was fabulous!  The bathroom had 2 vanities, 1 Jacuzzi tub, a standing shower and the toilet... this was the size of some hotel rooms!  The bed and pillows were comfortable too.  The pool is incredibly small, only 4 chairs for people to relax, and overlooking the busy main street so that was a disappointment.  If you go out at night, it's hard to find parking too.  Breakfast was good, and the staff was friendly.  All in all, a good hotel except for the pool area.
Manager Response: Thank you for pointing out all the plusses to our whirlpool suites.  They certainly do add a touch of luxury to an affordable stay.  Those and our two room suites with balconies overlooking the bustle of PCH are our most popular offerings.  We admit that our pool is somewhat smaller than what some travelers expect, but with Doheny State Beach just two blocks away, it seems that most of our guests spend their time in the sand and surf.

Summary: This is our second trip to this hotel since 2011. It used to be a Holiday Inn Express, now a Best Western premier. Diane, Alex and the rest of the staff from the ladies who made up the rooms, to the ladies serving the free breakfast made our stay GREAT. The staff was always helpful and the location is beautiful a few minutes from the harbor. close to several nice restaurants and shops. The change in ownership also freshened the d√©cor and added a whirpool as well. Price is reasonable and I would definitely stay there again. If your going to D.P. please do yourself a favor and stay with the Wonderful people at the B.W.M.P.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review ... Diane, Alex and the rest of the staff really appreciate the kudos.  Because so many people make their travel decisions based on these reviews, I have to clarify a couple of things you wrote, just so no one gets the wrong impression of the hotel.  We are a Best Western Plus, not a Premier, but it's great that we made such an impression that you assumed we were the highest tier in the Best Western family.  Also, there was no change in ownership.  The owners of the hotel invested a million and a half dollars in renovating the property last year and rebranded with Best Western.  Lastly, I assume you reserved one of our whirlpool suites - yes they are beautiful and ohhh so comfortable!  There is no whirlpool that is open to all our guests and I'm only saying that because the review might be interpreted by some readers to sound like we do.  We have eight gorgeous suites with two-person whirlpool tubs.

Summary: We stayed here for 8 days at the beginning of September and were very pleased with it. The staff were friendly and helpful - particularly Krista! The breakfast was always well stocked and there was a great variety of food to choose from ( I must get one of those pancake making machines!!) It was an ideal location within walking distance to Dana Point harbour and Doheny Beach. Would definitely recommend it!
Manager Response: Krista asked me to pass on her thanks and we are all thrilled that you enjoyed your stay with us.  Thank you for the wonderful review.

Summary: we have done a lot of traveling in the US and we had an absolutely great experience at this hotel.  Room was excellent, service was top-notch and overall experience was very, very pleasant. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review.  We do our best to provide the exceptional service you mentioned to everyone who passes through our doors.  It's a beautiful property in a great location.  Thank you again for passing on the word.

Summary: The room was comfortable, clean and well maintained.  The hotel was within walking distance to the event I was participating in as a vendor (Brown's English Toffee).  The rooms were quiet, the breakfast was good.  I would stay in this hotel again.
Manager Response: Glad you enjoyed your stay and look forward to having you back again!

Summary: Best Western Plus Marina Shores...you guys/gals are the BEST!  I will MOST DEFINITELY stay again!  To any traveler thinking twice about staying anywhere else in Dana Point (next to Doheny Beach)...think again!  [Lunch time food tip:  looking for a SUPER fresh fish lunch?...head to Jon's Fish Market for the best fish-and-chips EVER...and it's so close to this hotel)!  To Alex, Peter Sr., Diane, and the ENTIRE staff:  THANK YOU for taking such good care of us (including our dog)!  To say that you were all simply "friendly and professional" would be an understatement.  You were EXCEPTIONAL. The room was beautiful, the peek-a-boo ocean view was simply STUNNING during both sunset and sunrise, and my little Maltese [Niko] loved sitting with me in the lobby while I enjoyed my YUMMY
Manager Response: WOW!  I'm getting a little misty here ... we are so happy you liked the hotel and it was our pleasure having you here.  It is such a joy seeing our Best Western family grow and we look forward to your next visit.  Give Niko a big hug from all of us.

Summary: While attending the Dana Point Tall Ships Festival we chose the Best Western PLUS Marina Shores Hotel.  The hotel is very nicely appointed.  Our room had a living room and bedroom with partial view of the ocean.  The hotel was very quiet.  The hotel staff were very friendly and professional.  The entire check in and check out processes were well handled.  This is one of the better Best Western hotels.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words and remember us if you plan to return for the Tall Ships Festival next year!

Summary Heading: Totally renovated at great price in great location with very good breakfast!
Summary: Great find after looking at dozens of hotels in nearby Laguna Beach that were more than double in price and not as nice.  This is the nicest Best Western I have seen with large rooms with 2 queens and separate room with very comfortable sofa bed and second television.  Everything is updated and there are public bathrooms on every floor which is almost like having an extra bathroom in your room.  The microwave and refrigerator and coffee pot add to the comforts, and the beds are wonderful!  The pancake machine in the breakfast room made delicious, fresh pancakes and egg omelets were really good as was the bacon.  There were lots of choices of muffins, sweet breads, yogurts and fresh fruit.  The picante sauce was very good but is in a drawer; they need to put that out where the
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful endorsement and we're glad you enjoyed your visit to the Dana Point/Laguna Beach area.  For anyone reading your review, I want to clarify I couple of things, just so no one has the wrong expectations if they choose our hotel.  You had one of our Double Queen, Two-Room Wetbar Suites so you had the best and biggest of what we offer.  Our standard rooms and standard suites do not have the microwave ovens and are priced somewhat lower.  We also have a $10/day parking fee which is only waived for Diamond or Platinum level Best Western Rewards members.

Summary: During a short vacation with my 85-year-old mother to Laguna Beach, California, she became ill just as we were about to drive back to Arizona. I checked out of our expensive and disappointing hotel in Laguna and checked into The Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel, which was closer to the hospital and more reasonably priced. What a wonderful experience! It was a clean, lovely room with all the amenities we had missed in our overpriced Laguna Beach hotel with friendly and accommodating staff. I would definitely stay in this hotel in the future.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review and we all hope your mom is doing alot better.  I will pass on your appreciation to Lizette and Kenia, the two clerks who worked with you.

Summary Heading: Great value! Clean and updated decor, excellent staff!
Summary: Excellent affordable place to stay....very comfortable bed, and friendly, helpful staff.  The only downside is the breakfast. Although a full breakfast, the eggs were not the greatest, and the layout of the serving area was poor and inefficient.  With their improvement with this one factor, I would call this place excellent!  I would definitely return and recommend to others.
Manager Response: We appreciate the great review and we are working on the breakfast issues.  On weekends, we have started opeing up our meeting room as a secondary dining room and hope that will help relieve some of the morning traffic problems.

Summary Heading: Don't count on a fresh breakfast or speedy repairs!
Summary: Breakfast consists of processed eggs, pancakes with little fresh items.  Even the juice is reconstituted and strong.  If there's something wrong with your plumbing, don't expect it to be fixed - should just ask for another room.
Manager Response: Unfortunately I didn't get to speak to you directly until after you posted this review.  We want all Trip Advisor readers to know that we apologized to you personally for our maintenance dept dropping the ball on your service request and that we compensated you to your satisfaction for the inconvenience.

Summary: Was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Was not sure what to expect because it was very reasonably priced where most were much higher. When we tried to book our family vacation so late, we could not find any hotels to stay in the area but we stumbled upon this one.  Located perfectly and newly renovated rooms made this a big hit with the family!
Manager Response: I guess we can say that sometimes things AREN'T too good to be true!  Thank you for the testimonial that proves the Marina Shores Hotel is the best value on the beach.  Spread the word!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel in a Great Location
Summary: This is the last hotel we stayed in on our Pacific Coast trip. I love Dana Point and this hotel was really great. The room was huge.
