Living room with TV, bedroom with TV, ocean view from our room. We got breakfast at a local restaurant the next morning and decided to check the "morning breakfast" the hotel offers thinking it was the typical coffee and muffins. We were surprised to see they had eggs, ham, pancakes, bagels, juices, coffees, fresh fruit. The next day we ended up eating at the hotel, so this is another bonus here. The room was very reasonable and you get alot for what you pay for!
Manager Response: We're so glad you enjoyed your stay and hope you remember us the next time you decide to visit the coast.

Summary: Stayed her for 2 nights.  Was a great suite as 3 of us traveled together was nice to have the living room to retreat to while others slept.  The jet tub was a dream after a long day at the San Diego Wild Safari Park.  This room was very comfortable and the people at the desk were very friendly and informative. Also liked that the breakfast changes what they server for the meat and eggs each morning.
Manager Response: Our jetted tubs are just one of the pleasant surprises our guests discover the first time they stay with us.  Even though San Diego is 60 miles away, many people find us such an exceptional value that staying here is worth the drive.  Glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: Very clean hotel with  a very helpful staff. The beach is close by adjacent to a beautiful park.  It is right on the highway so if you want to not hear cars at all just request the back side of the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review.  We hope to see you back soon.

Summary Heading: Happy staff, immaculate rooms, and an excellent value
Summary: We arrived very late from LAX and were happily greeted by energetic staff members, claiming they were "waiting for us"  -- a lovely welcome after a 5 hour flight and 1 1/2 hour drive!   We chose this hotel due to its proximity to Captain Dave's Whale Watch, as well as the online photographs of the room and hotel exterior, which appeared to be quite nice for the quoted price. We certainly were not disappointed. Our two room suite was immaculate with a nice balcony overlooking the town from which we were able to see a bit of the ocean vista. We were in Dana Point less than 15 hours, however, we loved the area and wished we had stayed longer.   Tip for families visiting SoCal -- Ocean County is simply gorgeous, it's residents are friendly and helpful, and our experience there was
Manager Response: Of COURSE we were waiting for you!  Wonderful travelers' tip by the way.  Navigating the traffic between LA and Orange County might be a bit of a challenge but the more relaxing pace of the OC makes it worthwhile.  So glad you enjoyed your time with us.

Summary: A hop, skip and jump from Doheny beach. Great fast food restaurants close for three hungry teenagers. Great lounge areas on each floor to go and read or just sit and reflect. Delicious hot breakfasts free with room. Wonderful staff! Value, value, value.
Manager Response: You said it all.  Thank you!

Summary: I stay at Best Western hotels all the time and this hotel was to the standard of others that I have resided in for business. They went out of their way to make my family comfortable. Although, we had key card difficulties a couple of times, they immediately took care of the problem. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: We're glad you and your family enjoyed your stay.  Sorry about the key card issues but it sounds like everything else went great.

Summary: We recently stayed here for a friend's wedding which also happened to be our anniversary. My parents surprised us with champagne, food, and dessert. The manager Peter went above and beyond to arrange this special gift and made our stay very memorable. The rooms are really nice and couldn't be a better location. We had an amazing time and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area.
Manager Response: It was our pleasure to work with your mom to make your stay extra memorable.  Please accept our congratulations on your wedding anniversary and we wish you both many happy years ahead.

Summary Heading: Nice property near Dana Point harbor
Summary: My wife and I stayed at this hotel which is a few blocks away from Dana Point harbor.  It is one of the nicer Best Western properties we've stayed at.  The rooms seem newly decorated, clean and the bed was very comfortable.  Our only complaint about the room is the spa tub in the bathroom  is so high, it is dangerous to climb in to take a shower.  Designers need to look at function rather than appearance.  The complimentary breakfast had more than just the usual pastries, juice and coffee. But the extras were very mixed in quality.  They had scrambled eggs, (quite good) potatoes (gray and unedible) and a pancake making machine that made very chewy pancakes.  All in all while not perfect, it offered a clean comfortable stay at a reasonable price.
Manager Response: Thank you for the comments and suggestions about the spa tubs and we will see if there is anything we can do make the tub access a little easier.

Summary Heading: Nothing too fancy but nice & clean
Summary: It's always so hard to choose a hotel based on these reviews! Most people seem to only write reviews when they have complaints. We just stayed at this hotel for a quick getaway for my birthday. We have two small sons, 4 & almost 6. It's a nice place, clean and well kept up. Staff was nice. No cleanliness issues at all that we saw. It's just what you would expect from a Best Western if not a step above, nice but not fancy and clean. Pool was on the smaller side but was well heated. View was fine, mostly of fast food places but you could see the ocean in the distance. Breakfast was the typical highly processed stuff but they had hard boiled eggs and some bananas/apples. Coffee was above average! Staff was very nice at check in and in the eating area. Room was large and there was a
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and for recognizing the value the Marina Shores Hotel offers.  We may not be perfect, but as you said, "a step above."

Summary Heading: Hotel is very clean. Staff is terrible.
Summary: Hotel is in excellent condition and very clean. Staff is terrible/ lack of customer service. Loud hotel guests. Breakfast is barely edible. You decide if you want to stay in a clean hotel and just not get any sleep and eat a horrible breakfast.
Manager Response: I'm sincerely sorry to hear how unpleasant your stay was.  I cannot apologize enough for the staff issues although you didn't specify which department you had problems with.  Our goal is always to provide friendly and efficient service.  The breakfast selections will always be somewhat limited because we don't have a full service restaurant, but what we offer is prepared fresh every day.

Summary: I really enjoyed my stay there. The people all were extremely nice and accommodating.We were there for the Laguna Arts Festival which we go to every year. Dana Point is a great location and the Best Western Hotel there couldn't have been a greater place to stay for a few days.
Manager Response: "Tina"  Thank you so much for the kind words and we're so glad you enjoyed your stay at the Marina Shores Hotel.  Hope to see you back next year for the Arts Festival.

Summary: Room was clean but A/C was useless-it blew under the desk so the entire Jr. Suite was hot. We arrived early and waited close to an hour to check in. It wasn't until a Spanish speaking cleark spoke to the maids that we got checked in, the other lady just kept saying she didn't know what the hold up was. The bed was comfortable but the room was hot.
Manager Response: I'm sincerely sorry that you weren't able to get an early check-in.  During the summer months when the hotel is running full, it is challenging to get rooms ready before our posted 3:00pm check-in time.  It all depends on whether or not we have guests that leave well before check-out time.  We admit that this summer has been unseasonably hot and it has been difficult to get the rooms to a comfortable temperature.  I'm sorry for your discomfort during your stay.

Summary Heading: Best Western is a excellent place to stay
Summary: Best Western is a excellent place to stay. In this hotel you should expect friendly personal, Quiet environment, knowledgeable desk officers, nice choice of TV programs, convenient location, high quality of breakfast. Thank you excellent service providers.
Manager Response: You are QUITE welcome ... this is just what we're looking to offer!

Summary Heading: Good customer service but smelly rooms.
Summary: It wasn't a "bad" place to stay but I expected more.  The service was friendly. The location was ok yet noisy being right on PCH.  The room was spacious and had a mini fridge which I do appreciate but there was an old musty smell  which I can't get past.  For the price, I expected a little more.
Manager Response: I'm very surprised to hear this ... we just underwent a full renovation just last year so there is no reason you should have picked up any kind of a musty smell.  I'm not questioning your senses, I'm just surprised.  The Marina Shores Hotel even won an award this year for our outstanding housekeeping and room cleanliness.  For whatever the reason, please accept my apologies.  This was a very surprising comment.

Summary Heading: super clean hotel in great location
Summary: Great clean accommodations in lovely area near Dana Point Harbor and State Beach.  Small bathroom, pool,  and fitness center. Free Breakfast was served and there was plenty of food but not enough tables. I defintely would go back again.
Manager Response: So glad to know you enjoyed your stay.  You'll be happy to hear that we have begun using our meeting room as a secondary breakfast area which has greatly reduced the morning traffic jams.

Summary: My honey and I booked this room through hotwire.com. We were very pleased with the upgraded/modern king bed room. Our room had nice furniture, big jacuzzi tub with a tv in the bathroom! We walked down to the shoreline for dinner. lots of great restaurants within walking distance. Parking is $10 per day, free wireless. Upgraded continental breakfast is served till 9:30, Get there early!  Overall this place was awesome for the price. payed $160 for a Saturday night in July! not to bad!   Cant wait to go back!
Manager Response: We're happy you enjoyed your stay and it was our pleasure to offer you the free upgrade to one of our King Whirlpool Suites.

Summary Heading: Great location at a fair price!
Summary: We were in town for a wedding near Dana Point and this hotel was nicely priced and excellently located.  We could walk to everything- beach, shops, restaurants.  They also offered a free breakfast which is always a nice plus.  The room was large, quiet and fairly clean.  I thought the beds were super comfortable (and I'm pretty particular about that!)  The one negative was that the housekeeping staff forgot to clean our room one day.

I booked this hotel through Hotwire and was initially disappointed by what I got. I have not stayed in a 3 star and only searched since there were no 4 stars available for my dates by the beach. When we arrived the location was perfect.. right on PCH and across from many food options. The room was nice and clean. Check in was smooth, but $10 for parking a night seemed odd considering it was not really even covered and this is a BW. I would recommend it and think that for a beach hotel it is a good option. The pool is a joke however and desperately needs a cleaning. Also, the beds were kinda hard. Other than that it was an overall good experience.

The location was great and the room was oversized. Perfect for a family with little ones. The hotel was quiet and the room was clean. I went to use the Jacuzzi tub and found it smelled like old eggs. I did not continue the bath. Seems like house keeping needs to flush some bleach through the jets?  The free breakfast was mediorcre as it was standard hotel fair. Cold everything but included in room charge.  Will stay again when in area
Manager Response: Very sorry to hear about your experience with the jetted tub.  We try to flush all the jets at least three times a year, so this was quite a surprise.  The hotel has a very rigorous preventative maintenance program in place - partially because of the hard water issues here in Dana Point and it's something we strive to keep on top of.

Summary: The hotel was very clean and the staff was very nice.  I stayed here 18 nights rather than at the resorts and was very happy with my stay.  Close to everything and free breakfast.  I will stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great New Remodel at this Hotel by the Bay!
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel several times before when it was a Holiday Inn Express, and the Remodel of this property has been GREAT! The staff are very friendly and accomodating, they even dressed up especially for the weekend event going on which was the annual Doheny Blues Festival, so all the staff were wearing "Blues Brothers-style" attire and playing blues music to get everyone in the mood, which we all thought was very cool!  As for negative comments about the parking...Every Hotel in the area charges for parking that much or more, that's life! So this is not a surprise.  The hotel is right across the street from the beach, a short stroll, but there are huge trees in the viewing way, some rooms have somewhat of a view, some don't, I don't think the hotel even advertises
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your stay.  The Doheny Blues Festival is always one of the highlights of our summer.  Jake and Elwood send their best and hope to see you again next year!

Summary: I am really disappointed in the service my girlfriend and I got when we stayed in this hotel.  Everything seemed fine when we got there, front desk was friendly but then we got to our room and it smelled like someone was SMOKING in the room! (non smoking hotel) we went to the front desk to tell them so they can take care of it and they said they will send a machine to take out the smell.... (they didn't even offer to move us to a new room) we waited and waited and it never showed up. We didn't want to deal with talking to them  anymore so we dealt with the smell. We stayed two nights and not once did they ask us about it or bring the dam machine to take out the smell!!! Even the next morning we can still smell the smoke!!! Not staying here again!!!!  also if you check in on yelp
Manager Response: Very sorry to hear about the service failing at the hotel and I assure you I will look into why the ozone machine was never brought up for you.  The desk couldn't offer to move your room because we were sold out the two nights you were here, but we certainly should have been able to take care of the smoke smell.  Yes, we are a smoke free property and we do have the equipment to remove almost any odor in a room.  Regarding the parking charge, I contacted Orbitz and asked them to get ahold of you and advise that the charge has been refunded.  I hope you will reconsider staying with us again and giving us a chance to show you what a REAL Marina Shores Hotel stay is like.

Summary: No view from the 2nd floor (except of McDonalds across PCH). Didn't use the hotel's internet, because our computers connected automatically to McDonald's. Room keys didn't work most of the time (put it in and take it out at least 5 times before the door unlocks). Parking was $10; I wish hotels would just raise the room rate instead of adding fees.  Don't plan on sleeping late because of traffic noise from the Pacific Coast Highway. No microwave in room.  On the plus side: Bed was comfortable. Breakfast was good and the attendant didn't rush us out.  Dana Point Harbor is nearby, so be sure to walk around the docks at the Ocean Institute, see the tall ships, and watch the ocean waves from benches high above the spray.

We stayed 1 night at the hotel on our way to San Diego. The location was fabulous, a short walk to the beach and harbor as well as nearby many restaurant options. The free breakfast was more than a traditional continental and very good. The room was clean and comfortable and included a jacuzzi bath tub. We enjoyed everything about this hotel!

Summary Heading: Good Motel for Visiting Dana Point
Summary: This is a very nice motel but I would not call it a hotel.  The doors of the suite room all open to the outside.  That being said, this motel is nicely located right on the PCH in Dana Point not far off the I-5 but far enough away to not here the I-5 noise.  It is right on the PCH so if road noise bother you, this is not your motel.  The parking is around back and is pretty tight.  Maneuvering a big car all the way around to the exit in the front is similar to a Disney ride but can be done if you drive slowly.  They charge you $10 a night for this experience.  I understand urban environment hotels charging but not here.  This is simply another fee that you must add into the rate to find the true rate.    The lobby is small and a walk thru from front to back of the motel.  There

I mistakingly reserved a room for the wrong date and obviously didnt have a reservation when i arrived. However, the staff put us in an upgraded room for the same price i made the reservation for. Kudos to the front desk staff. Also, the room and overall hotel is great. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: So glad we were able to rescue you from the reservation dilemma.  Thank you for the wonderful review and we hope to see you back again.

Summary: We stayed here for 7 nights on a family vacation. We were extremely happy with this hotel. The location is great, very close to the harbor and beach. The room was very clean. the beds were very comfortable. The hotel itself is very attractive inside and out. The staff was very helpful. I would definitely stay again! I am very picky with hotels and this one met my standards! The city of Dana Point is a beautiful city!
Manager Response: Sounds like we were everything you were looking for and more!  As much as we love the praise, it's great to know that we helped make for a great vacation for your family.  Memories are what it's all about.  Hope we get the chance to serve you again.

Summary: The hotel was close to the beach and easy access to San Diego and Los Angeles. The room was modern and clean. The breakfast was outstanding. We enjoyed the jet bath tub. We had a suite and this gave us a home type feeling.
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed your stay.  Make sure all your friends know about this little spark of convenience and comfort right on the coast of Southern California.  Dana Point is no longer the best kept vacation spot secret!

Summary: It is always a challenge for s to find hotels that are pet friendly. This hotel takes pet friendly to a whole new level. It's been our experience with other hotels that they dedicate certain rooms for pets. The rooms that are tucked away in a back corner someplace. This hotel gave us a 3 floor suite without segregating us. The staff was went out of their way to welcome us and our little dog. Te facility and room must have been either recently remodeled or just built because everything was immaculate. The price was the same as some of the less desirable places in the area.
Manager Response: Glad you enjoyed your stay and yes, we recognize that a pet is family too.  There is a great old joke in our industry ...  A man calls a hotel to make reservations and tells the manager, " I would very much like to bring my dog with me.  He is well-groomed and very well behaved.  Would you be willing to permit me to keep him in my room with me at night?"  The manager smiles and says, "Sir, I've been operating this hotel for many years. In all that time, I've never had a dog steal towels, bedclothes, televisions or pictures off the walls.  I've never had to evict a dog in the middle of the night for being drunk and disorderly and I've never had a dog run out on a hotel bill.  Yes, indeed, your dog is welcome at my hotel ... and, if your dog will vouch for you, you're welcome to stay here, too."  Hope that added an extra smile to your day!

Summary: Location: 4.5 - Staff/Service: 3.5 - Amenities: 3 I love the location of this hotel - close to the 5 freeway and 2 blocks from a beautiful state beach.  The hotel itself is nice enough - lobby is beautiful.  Parking was $10/day and space was very limited.  Breakfast area gets crowded quickly and food is really generic...but the kids were happy, plus McDonald's is across the street and Denny's is next door.  Lots of dining options in walking distance up the street.  My balcony had a partial view of ocean; I loved that they put a little furniture out there to sit and enjoy, but it's right on PCH and you hear more of the traffic than the waves.  The beds were nice sized, reasonably comfortable, and I heard no complaints from my kids about the sofabed.  The kids enjoyed the pool, I
Manager Response: While our goal is to always be a "solid great" it was still nice that you noticed the little touches we add to make our guests' stays nicer - like the furniture out on the balconies and the jetted tubs in the guest rooms.  We appreciate the constructive suggestions too as we are always looking for ways to improve our product and services.

Summary: We received this booking through Hotwire as a hotel chosen for us in our category (3 star). The hotel was recently renovated and the rooms are comfortable and fairly quiet, despite our room fronting Pacific Coast Highway. The beds are WONDERFUL, by the way.  When we checked in, the front desk clerk told us that we should have called the hotel to book adn we would have received a better rate. WHAT? I don't know if he was punishing us :), but we found out that night that our A/C didn't work at all. I called the desk and was told that maintenance had gone home. So, we had a less-than-restful night's sleep in a stuffy room with a window we couldn't leave open, due to easy access from the outside. Had it not been for the poor maintenance on a recent renovation leaving us with a
Manager Response: Please accept my apologies for the confusion when you checked in.  It's not our habit to steer people away from the online booking sites.  They save guests a lot of shopping around for rates, but for detailed information on a particular hotel, it's always a good idea to check with the hotel directly, just to make sure of the accommodations.    I was also very sorry to hear about your troubles with the a/c.  We should have at least offered to move you to another room if maintenance was gone for the night.  Most of the units here are less than three years old and we service them routinely, so I can at least assure you that this is not a regular occurrence.  I'm glad you enjoyed the rest of your stay and hope you will be back for a visit that's 100% perfect!

Summary Heading: Simple, easy, and checked in without a reservation!
Summary: I was wandering around California in search of adventure, weirdness, employment, the meaning of life, and a new surf board. Infinity Surf is right up the street from this Best Western, so I decided to stay here.  Called as I was driving around, found the room rate of $112 for the night to be spot on, and they had a vacancy. I was a happy camper.   Checked in without hassle. Parking is a little tight, so if you drive something bigger than my FJ, you might be SOL for parking here. However, my little red beach wagon fit right into one of the spots by the door, so I was able to unload my new board and my bag without hassle.  Got up to my room, very happy with what it was. Great jacuzzi tub in this place, so if you're sore after a day of driving like was, you can just jump right in
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review and we're happy that we made you and your new surfboard so comfortable.  Hang loose!

Summary Heading: Very Nice Hotel / Very Bad Breakfast
Summary: This hotel uses to be a Holiday Inn Express and is now a Best Western PLUS. It is a very Nice & Clean hotel and we enjoyed a King Suite with Balcony facing the ocean. Beautiful view! The only issue I had with this hotel was their Breakfast. I hated the fact that they used such cheap plastic eating utensils. It very much dismisses the fact that they are even offering you a breakfast. Recommendations:  If you are going to eat Breakfast somewhere other than the hotel, then this would be a very nice place to stay. If Breakfast at a hotel is important to you, find another hotel because this breakfast is very disappointing.
Manager Response: I'm very glad you enjoyed the accommodations here at the Marina Shores hotel and please accept my apologies for the plasticware in the breakfast room.  We had actually upgraded it about two months ago and then had an order that was late so we had to bring out the old stock we had leftover.  It just goes to show how important items like these are to our guests.  We now have the new utensils back in place, so please don't feel you need to stay or eat elsewhere the next time you're in Dana Point.

Summary: We truly enjoyed our three restful nights at this hotel. We were just coming off of a five day Disneyland adventure and we were able to recharge and enjoy Dana Point from this very centralized location.  Here, you are just around the corner from Doeheny Beach and the marina. The kids had a great time beachcombing and surfing (rental shop right there). The free breakfast is typical for a nice hotel and the pancake machine looked like fun. (Wish they offered sugar-free syrup and I may have tried them).  The view from our patio was awesome...could see the ocean peeking from behind giant palm trees. Even though we were on the Pacific Coast Highway, the noise was not noticeable from our room at all. Housekeeping did a fantastic job and the beds were awesome. We even enjoyed the warm
Manager Response: Thank you  so much for the great comments and we are happy that you enjoyed your stay - not only with us, but in beautiful Dana Point.  We will certainly look into the possibility of a sugar free syrup for our pancakes at breakfast.  Great Idea!

Summary Heading: I love this hotel and we will stay again and again!
Summary: This was our second time staying here. When we arrived this time we had a slight hiccup with our reservation but Lizzette came through and totally made our nights! Beautiful, clean, spacious rooms! You can see the ocean from most rooms and you can't beat the location! We will be staying here again!
Manager Response: We're so glad you enjoyed your stay and even happier that you intend to become a regular.  Our family will never be TOO big!  I'll make sure to pass on your praises to Lizette.  We believe that the people who work here are just as important as a comfortable bed and a clean room.  It's all part of the same guest experience and it sounds like we hit a home run for you.

Summary: Wonderful experience, the staff was very helful.  They did everything possible to make our stay as pleasant a possible.  The location is great base of operations.  Breakfast was right on the money, free, and tasty.
Manager Response: Larry,  Glad you enjoyed your stay and we hope you'll be back to see us again soon!

Summary Heading: Great location, clean room, just needs a few improvements...
Summary: My mom and I took the kids for a leisurely overnight trip for my birthday.  We called at 1:30pm and were told our room would be ready at 2:30pm.  We arrived at 3pm and still waited 20 minutes while it was cleaned.  We also requested a crib at check in and when it wasn't in our room by 6pm, had to call again for it. The heated pool was one of our main reasons for going and it was not AT ALL heated. This was almost a dealbreaker because swimming is one of the kids favorite activities, However, the location is pretty awesome.  It's near the marina, grocery stores, and fast food.  The balconies on the second floor have high walls which is a wonderful safety feature with little kids.  Our suite was clean and spacious and the kids had fun in the whirlpool bathtub as an alternative to
Manager Response: I'm terribly sorry to hear about the problems you had checking in and with the pool.  As soon as I read your comments I called the pool service company so I am definitely thankful you brought it to our attention.  If you call me at the hotel directly we can arrange a refund for part of your stay.  We want everyone to be 100% satisfied with the Marina Shores Hotel, so on those rare occassions where we drop the ball, I want to make sure to make it right.

Summary: We have always found that Best Western facilities can be counted on to provide a good level of service overall.  In our view this facility is definitely a cut above the norm.  The facility appears to be quite new and our room was large and absolutely spotless which would indicate that management takes considerable pride in the care and upkeep of the facility and customer follow up concerning the quality of the stay confirms that.  The bed was very comfortable and perhaps the only negative is that our room faced on the Pacific Highway side and there was some degree of traffic noise but not to the point where it affected sleep.  Those bothered by noise might want ask for a room on the opposite side of the building.  The reception desk was variable - check in was less than
Manager Response: I know that we already followed up with you from your survey with Best Western, but I wanted to tell you again how much we appreciate the feedback which gives us the ability to focus on constant improvement.  You were right in your observations about the condition of the Marina Shores Hotel.  We underwent a $1.5 million renovation last year and are working hard to keep the hotel as pristine as it was when we had our ribbon cutting ceremony so many months ago.  Our goal is to provide our guests with comfort and cleanliness at a very affordable price.  I'm glad you feel we are meeting that goal.

Summary: Clean, fresh looking, large suites, nice bathroom and showers. It's beautiful. The best part is the price. Breakfast...it's ok. McDonald's across the street if you want something quick. Very comfortable.
Manager Response: We're glad you enjoyed your stay at the Marina Shores Hotel and recognized the value when staying with us.

Summary Heading: Great Stay for a Weekend Getaway
Summary: We traveled to Dana Point for a wedding at the end of December and had a wonderful stay at the Best Western Marina Shores. Free parking and complimentary WiFi and breakfast each morning were hugely helpful with the schedule we had to keep that weekend.   The hotel is walking distance from a few cute shops and restaurants and a very close drive to Laguna Beach if you're interested in heading up that way for a fancier meal.   The staff was very friendly and helpful and our room was spacious and very clean. I would highly recommend and would definitely stay again if we ever travel back to that area.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review and please pass on our best wishes to the bride and groom.  While we appreciate your kind words and are happy that you enjoyed your stay, you REALLY hit it on the head when you talked about our location and the convenience to all the sites, shops and restaurants along the beach.  This is the perfect recommendation to all the folks using TripAdvisor when looking for a great hotel and a great value in our area.  Thanks again!

Summary Heading: alls well but for location of handicap parking
Summary: excellent facility - but they need to put handicap parking on the first level - same level for entrance to parking .  By the time I arrived - without handicap parking on level - we ended up near an elevator that required a room key.  We had not checked in - so no card...meant walking up steps to get the room key.  Rest of stay was pretty good - comfort, clean, and we never made it to breakfast - slept until the kids ran down the hall screaming.
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing the handicapped parking issue to our attention and we'll see what we can do about re-designating other spaces closer to the door on the main level.  Yours was an important observation and we appreciate the suggestion.  Even though we are fully ADA compliant it is our goal to provide service and convenience that satisfies everyone.  Other than the parking issue, I'm glad that you enjoyed your stay.

Summary Heading: A Great Stay in the Heart of Dana Point
Summary: We have stayed here three times, and intend to stay here when we need a hotel in Dana Point.  (We just purchased a house here, so after March 1 we are unlikely to need a hotel, so my "very likely" rating reflects the probability that we will direct our visitors from the East Coast here).  We will also recommend it to family and friends.  Dana Point is beautiful, and the hotel is conveniently located.  There is a great breakfast restaurant across the street, and plenty of delicious dining in Dana Point.  We had one minor glitch this time.  We were in Dana Point for our anniversary, and to inspect the house we purchased.  The first room assigned smelled of tobacco smoke.  The desk clerk immediately moved us to a clean room with a large Jacuzzi tub and separate shower.  We truly
Manager Response: Congratulations on buying your home here in Dana Point ... it is truly and incredible place to live and work.  While we're sorry to "lose" you as a customer, I can't think of any better circumstances to have it happen ... and of course, our sincerest appreciation for your desire to recommend us to your family and friends when they come to visit in south Orange County.  Please accept my apologies for the smell of tobacco smoke in your room.  Even though we are a 100% smoke free hotel, not all our customers abide by the rules.  We have special equipment to disinfect and deoderize a guest room on the rare occassion that someone does smoke in the room, but nothing beats opening up the windows and letting the fresh air take care of the problem ... sadly, even in southern California, it still gets pretty cold in January, so that wasn't an option.  We're glad you enjoyed your stay and welcome to the neighborhood!

Summary: We stayed ten days through Christmas and New Year holidays.  The location is great for us to be near our family.  The room was comfortable and very clean.  We normally rent a small condo or house for our visits but recently had a bad experience with cleanliness in a local condo and did not want to deal with that on this trip.  We were not disappointed.  Housekeeping did a great job every day.  If we had to name one area for improvement, it would be breakfast.  Get rid of the pancake machine.  It caused traffic jams and extra work for the employees.  Provide an easy/cheap oatmeal option...instant or already cooked.  We will definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Donna,  We're glad to hear that the Marina Shores was a great part of your holiday experience and hope you'll remember us when you return for family visits to Dana Point.  I'm sorry about your issues with our breakfast, but if you let me know the next time you're coming, I'll make sure we have a supply of oatmeal just for you ;-)    The pancake machine won't be going anywhere anytime soon.  The traffic jam is a tribute to its popularity.  I'll make sure to pass on your praises to our housekeeping staff.  It's always wonderful to know their extra efforts are noticed.  Hope you and your family have a wonderful new year too!

Summary: The staff at this Best Western always goes out of their way to make us comfortable- Karen is excellent! we stay at this location 10 to 12 times a year and will continue!  only complaints are: occasional trouble with key cards and there are no longer microwaves in all rooms...
Manager Response: Dear Darron,  We're glad you enjoyed your stay and it's good to know that you're a returning member of our family.  Since the microwave ovens are a concern, the next time you come by, ask to see one of our two room "wetbar" suites.  They have the microwaves and might fit the bill better for you.  Thanks again for the kind words.

Summary: Our family planned a quick getaway for New Years to Dana Point or so we though, actually I forgot to make the reservation! After finding out the hotel we normally stay at was booked I started looking around and found this hotel. We‚Äôve seen this location before but always remembered it as a Holiday Inn Express. Happily my search found rooms available so our trip was saved!  When we arrived the first thing we noticed was how clean the exterior of property was. The parking area was a little cramped but manageable. The receptionist was very pleasant and attentive, within minutes we had our room keys.  The room was nicely appointed with 2 LCD TV‚Äôs, a setting area, two very comfortable queen beds; it was nice to find a small refrigerator for guest use. The room was quiet with very
Manager Response: Dear Doug,  I'm glad your search for a last minute New Years getaway brought you to our doors and even happier that you're now considering the Marina Shores Hotel as your "go-to" location when you return to Dana Point.  Our resolution for 2013 is to stop being the best kept secret on the beach and become the best known value ... and letters like yours really drive the point home to all Trip Advisor shoppers.  Thanks again for the kind words and please accept our best wishes for a wonderful new year to you and your family.

Summary: This renovated Best Western has lovely rooms with whirlpool tubs, comfortable beds and free Wifi.  A hot breakfast is also included.  I found the front, facing PCH a bit noisy and the bright lights outside weren't quite blocked by the blackout curtain but the location in Dana Point really can't be beat.  The hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays and staff were very pleasant.  If you are partially disabled, though, you won't be able to get into the very large, deep tub (I couldn't) and so request a disabled room with shower.  The hotel was very good value for money, especially with the three night stay internet and manager's discounts added in.
Manager Response: Dear Marilyn,  In this day and age, isn't it great to find something you can still call a "good value"?  We're really glad you enjoyed your time with us and truly appreciate your using Trip Advisor to spread the word.

Summary: I wanted to do an overnight get away and didn't know anything about this area so after a quick search I found this place. It was inexpensive and in a very good location, close to the beach and marina and just a stones throw away from Laguna Beach. Restaurants are everywhere around it and an easy walk to get to. Or just a short hop in the car. The hotel looks like it has recently been re-done so everything was nice and new looking.  I was in a suite and it was very nice. The bedroom was in the back with a desk/work station and comfy bed, and a balcony with a chair. The room out front was the living room area that doubled as a second bedroom with the sofa bed. Both rooms had televisions and a door that could be closed between them. There also was a mini-fridge. The wireless
Manager Response: Dear Debbie,  Glad you enjoyed your getaway at the Marina Shores Hotel.  We are just introducing a fantastic new package deal that includes the room, a bottle of chilled champagne when you check in, dinner for two at one of the areal restaurants and a wine tasting tour at a local winery.  The next time you want to get away from it all, just give us a call for more details.

Summary: Our stay at the Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel was great!  The staff was very helpful, the room very nice and the location was excellent!  So many complaints we read about for hotels along the Coast Hwy was noise from the train - this hotel is not near the train tracks so there was not noise from it & while there was traffic noise it wasn't bad.  It was within walking distance to the marina.  It was very easy to get to and close to everyplace we needed to be.  The parking was very close to the front door, making it nice for unloading.  The breakfast was alright, but nothing to write home about.  We have no complaints and would stay there again.
Manager Response: Hi Elizabeth,  We thank you for your wonderful endorsement and are glad you enjoyed your stay.  You're 100% correct, our location just a block off the beach and so close to all the great restaurants makes the Marina Shores best value in Dana Point.  Hope we see you back soon.

Summary: We didn't have high expectations for this place but were incredibly surprised.  The room was lovely, well appointed, and had a gorgeous jacuzzi tub with bath salts provided. There was also a tv to watch while in the tub.  A refrigerator in the room, with a large screen tv completed the surprise.  Breakfast was fine and free, along with a coffee pot in the room for late night beverages.I would return anytime to this hotel.  It was great!
Manager Response: Dear Florence,  Thank you for the great review.  Hopefully the next time you stay with us you WILL have high expectations.  :-)  Glad you enjoyed your time with us and we hope you have a great New Year!

Summary: We got to the hotel around noon and were allowed to check in early without a problem.  Our large dog was able to stay with us for a small and VERY reasonable fee.  The staff was friendly but not so friendly as to be a nuisance, and there was a convenient side entrance that allowed us to come and go without awkward interactions with the front desk every time.  The room was clean and spacious.  All in all, this was exactly what we have come to expect from Best Western Hotels...a guaranteed comfortable stay for a decent price in a convenient area.
Manager Response: Dear Sarah,  We're so glad you enjoyed your stay here.  Thank you for the great review and we hope to see you back with us again!

Summary Heading: Best Place to stay in Dana Point
Summary: Very nicely remodeled/first class accomodations! Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Karen Mitchell was most helpful with suggestions for local attractions and added a lot to our stay!! She was very knowledgable and passionate about her position and wanting to insure that you had the best experience possible! Breakfast was very good and a nice selection of foods/fruits. Rooms/beds comfortable and a nice view of the ocean. A great value!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the great review and we are all thrilled that you enjoyed your stay.  Karen will be happy to hear that her help really enhanced your experience.  Dana Point has alot to offer for entertainment and dining ... we're so glad to be a part of this wonderful community.

Summary: Arrived mid evening just as it was raining..   The Receptionist was very chatty and pleasant.  The room was nice and was clean. Later in the evening there was some shouting down the corridor and sounded like high spirits.   Probably watching a game on TV. About midnight we had a call from reception advising that one of the car windows was part open and rain might be getting in.   Went to the car park with the Receptionist and met the Security Guard.   Thanked them for preventing what could have been a wet car seat. The people in the next room arrived late, about 1:30 am and did not settle down to sleep until about 3:30.  The walls did not prevent the noise penetrating our room. Breakfast was sparse and in a small room. The staff were friendly and helpful, but the accommodation
Manager Response: I'm glad we were able to save you waking up in the morning to a soaked car seat, but am very sorry to hear about the noise from your neighbors.  Our security staff keeps a constant vigil on the property, so I am concerned that it took two hours to quiet them down.  Wedding groups often come back from their receptions very late at night and want to continue their celebrations here.  Our belief is that all guests deserve comfort and quiet, so I am extremely disappointed that it took that long to get the latecomers to settle in.  Please accept my apologies for your less than stellar stay, but I do appreciate your comments and will discuss with the security stay so it won't happen again.

Summary Heading: The Place To Stay In Dana Point,Ca.
Summary: I needed several rooms for a family reunion this past Sept. All were very pleased with the location and service. Thank you Karen (Sales Director) for your superior service in making this happen! The property is close to all the major attractions Dana Point has to offer. Harbor, dining, San Juan Mission, shopping and easy freeway access. The hotel is newly redecorated and the rooms are very clean and spacious. I recommend this property to all that are in search of a comfortable, friendly, just like home hotel.  .
Manager Response: We're glad you enjoyed your stay and hope the reunion was an event that brought everyone in your family even closer.  It's great that we were able to take care of everyone and I will pass on your kind words to Karen.  Naming us as "THE place to stay in Dana Point" is about the highest compliment we could ever be paid.  Thank you so very much.

Summary: Stayed at this hotel on October 18.  Last time I was in this area, this hotel was a Holiday Inn Express.  It's now a Best Western hotel.  I had a little trouble finding it on line, because I was looking for Holiday Inn Express!  However, the hotel was much nicer than my last visit just over a year ago.  Best Western has remodeled the rooms with new furniture and very comfortable beds.  The room was spotless!  The hotel still offers a free eggs and bacon breakfast in the morning.  The front desk lady, (Lisette?) was very nice and helpful and helped me sign up for the Best Western Rewards program and was even able to initiate my membership at a higher level than normal because of my Platinum level in the Holiday Inn points program.  That was nice.  I recommend this hotel, but look
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words about the hotel and our staff.  Lizette was thrilled to know you remembered her.  We are all very proud of the great remodel we have to offer and are just as proud of our new association with Best Western.  The "Status Match ... No Catch" perk of Best Western Rewards, the one that brought you in as a Platinum member because you were already at that level with Holiday Inn, is just one of the many wows Best Western offers their guests.  Welcome to our family and we're glad you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: We LOVE this property!!  So glad we stayed here and to find that it is as nice on the inside as it is on the outside.  We had an early soccer game at the nearby Ranch Soccer Complex in San Juan Capistrano and we lived in the San Fernando Valley.  LOOOONNGGG Drive to do and we are not early birds!  We went through Karen Mitchell and she was so easy to work with and truly extended herself for our group;  she even thought to arrange for an earlier breakfast for our group, even though the breakfast area did not open until 6:30 a.m.!  The hotel was clean and was truly renovated!  The rooms were as represented on the website, breakfast was good, the front desk (Lissette) and staff was customer service oriented and very convenient to freeway access.  With two boys on two Teams in a
Manager Response: As hectic as these soccer tournaments are, we really appreciate your taking the time to write about your experience here.  Karen did a great job coordinating all the rooms and she wanted me to pass on her gratitude for your recognizing our efforts.  Lizette and the rest of the staff are happy you enjoyed your stay and our service.  We look forward to having you all back.

Summary Heading: Close to the beach, good breakfast, comfortable accommodations
Summary: We stayed here 3 nights for our son's wedding.  The recent remodel on the hotel was done tastefully - granite tops in the bathrooms, flat screen TV's in the rooms, tile in the corridors, and new paint and carpet throughout. The beds were good and the window HVAC unit was adequate, but appeared to raise the humidity in the room. The staff was pleasant.  The breakfast was hot with eggs, pancakes, muffins, cereal, and sausage or bacon. The pool was small with 2 lounge chairs, a table, and 4 chairs-but the beach is a short walk away.  Parking was tight under the Hotel and once the spots were filled causing us to double park for the night. There are several fast food places across the street and restaurants just up the street. We were happy with the Hotel and would stay here again
Manager Response: We're glad you enjoyed your stay at the Marina Shores Hotel and would like to pass along our contgratulations to your son and his bride.  We hope their wedding was a huge success and we wish them a lifetime of happiness ... and of course, we're glad that we were able to play even a small part in building the memories.

Summary: We recently booked our wedding party at the Best Western Plus Marina Shores. Approx. 12 rooms in total.  Overall, the remodel at the hotel was done pretty well.  As a previous review pointed out, it is silly that there is no central air conditioning in the rooms (only a wall unit).  Normally, I am guessing this is not a problem by the beach but this week it happened to be 90 degrees out.  The rooms were clean and nicely appointed.  I would say very comfortable for a property in this 3 star range.  My biggest complaint is the staff.  I will give them the benefit of the doubt for all the problems with booking our wedding party here since they were transferring ownership.  Nonetheless, the front desk staff had no personality, was generally rude, and had very little knowledge of the
Manager Response: Thank you for the comments on your stay at the Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel and I sincerely apologize for the less than stellar service you received from our front desk staff.  This is definitely not the type of service we aspire to.  If you have the time and would like to contact me directly at the hotel, I can get more information and go back to the clerks involved and impart some extra training.  We have several new faces on our staff, so it is very helpful to know where we are lacking.  Our goal is to be the best hotel value in Dana Point, but value is not just limited to the accommodations; it's the service you receive as well.  Peter Callan General Manager

Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel for a wedding we attended in the area.  We originally booked with this hotel when they were a Holiday Inn Express and then our reservations were changed over when they switched companies. Originally, we were happy that the switch occurred because we often prefer Best Western, but this wasn't what I expected from a Best Western.  To start with the good, it is a decent, clean hotel in a convenient location.  Yes, you're right on PCH, but we really had no noise that we could complain about.  Check in was easy enough, there's always ice water in the lobby and the rooms were clean.  The beds were comfortable.  The free breakfast was tasty and had good variety (oatmeal, boiled eggs, breads and pastries, a pancake machine, juices, coffee, fruit,
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing these issues to my attention.  Please contact me directly at the hotel and I will see what I can do about the Rewards points for you.  As we are brand new to the Best Western family, the clerk who assisted you may not have known what options (if any) were available, but I promise to make some calls and do everything I can to get the Reward points you want.  Peter Callan General Manager

Summary: Excellent staff, very friendly and accommodating. Room was clean and comfortable. Great parking and nice amenities. Good location. Stayed and then extended! Very reasonably priced. Close to the beach. Complimentary breakfast and more than just continental.
Manager Response: Thank you for the comments about your stay at the Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel.  With our recent renovations, we are trying to establish ourselves as the best hotel value in the Dana Point Beach area and from what you've expressed, it sounds like we're headed in the right direction.  Hope to see you back.  Peter Callan General Manager

Summary: Spent only a few days here but enjoyed my stay. The property is small but very clean and nice. Located walking distance to the beach it's very convenient and is a great value for the area. There is covered, self parking with easy access.  Free breakfast available. It was pretty good and it was free! Free internet available! Big plus!  The gym was a little disappointing but it was okay. There aren't any weights, just 2 treadmills and a bike. The pool is about medium size, located on the 2nd floor. It's not very big but it has charm and still fun.  My room was average. The room included 2 full size beds, mini bar, reading couch, external a/c unit, small un-enclosed closet, and small bathroom with tub.  Cleanliness was the main theme here at the Holiday Inn Express. Everything was
Manager Response: Glad you enjoyed your stay with us and thank you for all the great comments and observations about the hotel.  I need to point out that we are not a Holiday Inn Express anymore, we are the Best Western Plus Marina Shores Hotel.  I promise to get the photos on TripAdvisor updated as soon as we get our permanent signs up and the professional photograhper up here.  I'm sorry that you found our fitness room less than expected.  Space there is limited and, to keep it ADA compliant, we could only install a few multi-purpose machines.  There IS a weight machine in the back corner, so perhaps you missed it when walking by.  Thank you again for your feedback and you are 100% correct, we are trying to establish ourself as the best value in the Dana Point beach area!
